Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Shokanman
Reviews.Content: While this hotel and casino is not as opulent as the ones on the strip, it has alot going for it. First, the room rate is less than what you pay on the strip, sometimes alot less, depending on how you book your room. Second, the rooms are all huge. They have either a king or two doubles, a large sitting area with a pull-out couch, an easy chair, and a coffee table. There is plenty of room for entertaining. Finally, there is a little kitchen area with a refrigerator, a sink, and a table. One of our group requested and received a microwave. There is also a safe (don't forget your combination!). The bathroom has a tub and a separate shower stall and two sinks. They are in the process of refreshing the rooms. Ours was freshly painted, and we saw the staff doing other rooms (new paint, carpet, and furniture). The only disappointment was the TV- it was an old CRT type and the channel selection was sparse. Normally, this wouldn't be a problem since I do not go to Vegas to watch TV, but we were there for the basketball tournament. The property is laid out as a number of separate buildings. Each is all smoking or non-smoking. There is a nice pool area (not huge). One of the things we really enjoyed about this hotel is there are plenty of places to site outside in peace. It is not as hectic as other Vegas hotels. If you want hectic, you are a good walk from the center of the strip. We walked down and back many times. If you want to take a cab, its less than ten dolars. There are three restaurants-Marilyn's Cafe, good diner type food. nothing special, but consistently dependable, and relatively cheap. The Cantina-Mexican fare- not good, don't eat there. Tuscany Gardens- Dinner Restaurant with an Italian theme. We all enjoyed it. If you are a foodie and in Vegas, there are obviously better choices, but food here is well prepared and presented. I recommend the Antipasto appetizer (enough for two) and the chicken and eggplant dish. Entrees run mostly from twenty to thirty-five dollars. Join the Players club and get the discount. Now for the gambling: The good- the table games offer low minimums, even during peak times. The Craps table had a three dollar minimum during the day, and five in the evening. Blackjck was almost always five dollars- and it still pays 3 to 2 for blackjack. It is now 6 to 5 on the strip. There are plenty of slots with a good selection, video poker with average payouts, and a sportsbook. The bad- one craps table, three blackjack tables and one roulette wheel. We couldn't get a seat at times. Its not the Bellagio or Aria, but is a good value. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem...”
Reviews.Author: SoaringDiva
Reviews.Content: Location is on E Flamingo... walk up the street and you are at the busiest and most entertaining part of the strip. The suites were large, the most comfortable king size bed and linen. Fridge and coffee maker and sink with 2 person dining table. Lush gardens, exceptional service. Front check in and check out took maybe 5 - 7 minutes at max. Marilyns cafe steak and eggs breakfast from midnight to 5 am is excellent and costs only $4.00. This does not include coffee. Had coffee in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: KCLUZEL
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I had doubts at the last minute before my trip and tried to change hotels, but thankfully wasn't able to. It is a very nice property, rooms are very large and clean. Clientele seems to be catered more towards the 30+ crowd and families. There are three (?) restaurants onsite as well as a casino, so it is a nice break from the chaos of the strip, and a nice retreat if you are not into the party scene. The pool area is very nice and peaceful, no swim up bars, or party crowd. It is not as opulent as some of the more popular places on the Strip, but it is a good, quality hotel for a reasonable price. My only complaints - in the "kitchenette" area - there was no microwave or way to reheat food, and there was a coffeemaker, but no pot (??). Also, the ice machine on my floor did not work, so I had to go down a floor to find one. The grounds are huge, and beautiful, but it is easy to get lost. I will definitely keep this on my places to stay in Vegas list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: sewfancy4
Reviews.Content: Although our stay was brief, we enjoyed the ambiance of this great old hotel off the strip. With multistory units around the pool,it pays to pay attention to where you are, but dropping bread crumbs to find your way is not necessary in order to find your way to your room--units are clearly marked. The rooms and lobby are large and comfortable, with satisfactory service, although the pool wait person forgot our order. The dining room food and service were good, but we did not visit the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jfeil
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. I like parking near my room. The rooms are spacious and clean, walking distance from Ballys and across the street from several great places such as Lawry. The price is the best in Las Vegas, always clean rooms and the pool and casino are very nice aswel

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nelly17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this property, which is perfect in every way. Not on strip but close enough, huge room with more than adequate facilities, and great casino - next door, no walking through to get to your room. 3 fab restaurants and bars. a lovely pool, some used it but it was not quite hot enough 3rd week in March, looked peaceful and clean just like the whole resort, groundsman tending to perfectly kept gardens every morning and doormen and front of house staff friendly and helpful, Best Margaritas in Vegas I was told could be found in the Mexican restaurant, I wouldnt know to compare but I tried one, now Im hooked and wouldnt argue. Breakfasts huge choice in Marilyns cafe not to mention portion size too, and the ribs were immense at supper time, best sauce ever, our waiter James was a darling, he has the unenviable job of working 11pm till 6 yet I think hes kept busy, this place never sleeps, well it is part of the casino after all. We didnt get to try the Italian so must return for that, also highly recommended. If its your first time visiting Vegas you probably want to stay on the strip, I did but never again, this was our 3rd visit to Vegas and it just gets better, this place is one of the reasons why and its less than 10mins stroll to Ballys where you can get the shutlle, this currently costs $5 for a single trip we went up to MGM and spent a few hours in the surrounding area, when we decided to come back we went to the door at the MGM and got ourselves a taxi, right back to the door of the Tuscany $6.70 so maybe better deal sometimes to travel by taxi, or even limo, the Tuscany has a limo so just negotiate with the driver a price, we paid $20 to the Bellagio. Opposite the hotel is Lawrys a very good steak house, not cheap. Further down Flamingo if you go in the other direction there are plently other places of interest to eat, we liked the Brazilian place Bahama Breeze, also there is a PF Chang and the Hard Rock Hotel is also a 10 min stroll, no hustle like on the strip if you feel like a bit of peace. Do yourself a favour and give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure who's writing the high reviews”
Reviews.Author: Travel_To_Travel
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cheap, off strip, but walkable. Pool pretty good, workouts room very good. Restaurant coupons at check-in for fare that's passable. Cons: Decidedly low-end clientele. Pretty mundane on the scene activities. Rooms quality varies. Towels substandard. Casino, you wouldn't want to gamble here. Reserve a room during a busy period and you'll get what they have, not what you reserved. Resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jeff W
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this resort during a two day getaway in Las Vegas. This is a beautiful property and offers large (600 square feet) suites, which include a separate tub and shower. The room was appointed with lovely accented detail and I felt as if I was staying at a five diamond establishment. The room was immaculate, comfortably furnished and the staff is wonderful. Specifically, the front desk employees and housekeeping staff were very helpful. I enjoyed my time in the Casino and ate at the restaurant inside the casino. Great food, service and prices. The best part of my trip was the low discounted mid week price, but I can recommend paying the higher rates on the weekends, still well below a lot of the higher end hotels and well worth it. Just a short walk to the strip. I am a former flight attendant, as well as a former owner of a bed and breakfast, and know what I want when I am looking for a nice getaway. The Tuscany Resort and Casino is just that, as these reviews attest!

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you book a handicapped room”
Reviews.Author: E&CinReno
Reviews.Content: We reserved and paid for a handicapped room a month before going to Las Vegas which was confirmed in an e-mail. We arrived at the Tuscany early. Confirmed we had reserved a handicapped room, and were told our room would be ready at 1:30 p.m. We returned at 2:30, and were surprised to find we had been given a regular room. Again stated we booked a handicapped room, and a rush was put on to clean one for us. At 3:30 our room was finally ready. We asked to speak to the manager about the confusion with our reservation. We couldn't believe our ears, when she told us she didn't have to give us a handicapped room. Due to her rudeness and unprofessionalism, we will not return to the Tuscany. Our room was spacious, and clean with a comfortable bed. Were surprised there was no microwave. The bathroom had a separate bathtub and shower. There was a a pull down seat for showering in the bathtub. However, there was no shower curtain making it difficult to shower without getting water all over the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Great location Just off the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: cheerfulgal78
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very close to the strip. We actually had a suite and it was very large comparted to what you would expect to receive. We did have a few problems with a toilet not working properly and our refrigerator kept freezing all of our food. It would have been nice to have a mircrowave to reheat the food, but it was great for keeping our Cokes super cold (when they weren't frozen). Very limited interaction with the staff, but they seemed pleasant when we did need something. the building we stayed in "J" seemed to smell of maijuana almost the entire time we were there (1 full week), not sure if this is the cleaning products they use, or if there is something else going on there... You can get a shuttle (cheap) from the airport from Showtime, and they hotel even kept my bags after I checked out, so I could have one final day in Vegas. the food at the mexican restaurant wasn't as good as it sounded, but the food at the Marilyn's Cafe was AMAZING! If i returned to Vegas, I would most definitely return to the Tuscany!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home..”
Reviews.Author: Chismchick
Reviews.Content: My husband n I first stayed here as a gift for sitting thru an hr n half timeshare pitch.. That was the best that coulda ever happened to us that day-cause goodness knows 90mins off blah blah timeshare blah blah whaa can really drive u nuts.we NEEDED a vacation just for sitting thru that crap! Anyhow, the staff is great, rooms r huge!,very clean, grounds r beautiful. The best thing is that the rooms r in buildings separate from the casino,I always bring my quilt n pillow wherever I go (a little bit of home) n it's nice to not have to trump thru a casino carrying all of our belongings to reach an elevator or have to tip someone to do it for me. We park right in front of the bldg. This is the only place we'll ever stay while in Vegas. It's a few blocks from the strip,which we walk to,no having to pay for parking. The resort fee is minimal, and comes with coupons for marylins cafe n the cantina..which r both great. Our room even had an elec stove n fridge for extended stays- the stove didn't work, but with a little tampering while I was in the bathroom, my husband fixed that!- prob while cleaning, housekeepers didn't align top properly so there was no connection. Whatever! I live this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: keyeslaw
Reviews.Content: My second time at the Tuscany. The rooms are huge. Couch/sofa, king bed, coffee maker (unheard of in vegas), shower and bath tub, fridge. The resort itself is quite, nice pool, small casino, great food at low prices. 800 meters to the strip. Overall a nice place to stay unless you want the hustle, bustle, crowds and the addtional costs of the stip.

Reviews.Title: “I can see the Strip from my Balcony”
Reviews.Author: stoutbrewer
Reviews.Content: A group of us decided to have a get together in Vegas. After reading some reviews and looking where the property is located I decided to stay. My only negative comment is about checking in. My friend (who was from out of the US) and I decided to see if we could check in early. The Check In Agent said it would cost me around $12 extra for early check in. I didn't need to get into my room immediately so I declined. However my friend next to me in line was allowed to check in early without the charge? I knew about the "Resort Fee" of $14 plus $1.68 tax on top of the booked room charge. Other people in the line didn't and were a bit irate. It would be nice for everyone to be told up front about all charges prior to booking a room. My King Bed room was clean & large with a balcony overlooking the pool. I couldn't ask for a better room for the price in Vegas. Elevators are in every building with plenty of parking outside. Easy access from the Airport, near a group of top notch restaurants. Las Vegas Blvd. is a ten minute walk which we did after dark and felt safe. I'm sure a cab ride from the Strip wouldn't be much if you prefer. In the future I would have no problem booking the Tuscany Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “LIVE IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: wowthanku
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is not a five star hotel, but for us it was better than that. I loved walking outside to my HUGE room. The new fitness center and quiet lap pool were just perfect. Reasonably priced food and friendly service at all times a plus. Wifi readily available and eating out on the terrace in the sun. Couldn't have asked for more... well.... maybe... a GOOD VEGAS casino win would have been fun! :)))

Reviews.Title: “More like an apartment complex than a hotel- and a great value.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4703
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany Suites turned out to be much larger than I expected- about 15 buildings in all, but the landscaping and design gave the feeling of being in a very nice apartment complex rather than a large casino/hotel. Very large rooms, lots of amenities, and several good restaurants. The hotel lobby is not on the edge of the casino, so checking in and out is not like many other Las Vegas hotels I’ve been at- dodging Keno runners while maneuvering luggage toward the elevators under a barrage of noise and lights. The prices (rooms, meals) were very low- this is where I stay on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip Value”
Reviews.Author: Canada_eh64
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying "off" the Strip. I was impressed by the size of the the room. The check in process was very good. However, they wanted to charge a fee if you wanted to check in early. I'm from Canada, so they "waived" my fee to check in early. They did want to charge my buddy from California and did not offer to waive it. Seems like they are picking on the "locals". This was the first time EVER in all of my travels that they wanted to charge an early check in fee. I was not impressed by this. Room was extremely nice. Bed was a little hard, but then again most hotel beds are the first night till you get to used to them. Very large room which was nice. They charge a "resort fee" which includes wi-fi and parking. No big deal. Most places in Vegas do. However, they charge for internet in the business center. Not impressed with that. Makes it hard for airline travelers to check in for their flight and print out boarding passes. Overall, it was a nice stay. And, yes, I would stay there again in the future. Just beware of the fees they want to try and charge you for convience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_the_Pitt
Reviews.Content: Tuscany Suites offers good value for your money. Our suite was large, with a good size bathroom and separate toilet room. The beds were very good. My wife still raves about how comfortable they were. The suite came with a 4 burner stove but no oven, kitchen utensils, plates, etc. The pool and hot tub area is very nice. It is located a few blocks behind Bally on the strip, a short walk away. It is therefore away from the crowds and is quiet. I recommend it as a peaceful alternative to the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomAZ777
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tuscany before..but my review did not upload. On this stay I have to admit I was a little (very little) less impressed that when I stayed here in Sept 2011. Some important things to note. There is NO free WiFi or WiFi in the general area. I was going to pay for the 3 day access pass but it was $35.00 which is more than I pay for a whole month at home. They also charge a fairly expensive "hotel fee" at $15.00 a day which includes parking. For that kind of money..they should include WiFi. Now about the room...it was beautiful and very, very clean. I love the fact that every room is almost 700 sq ft with a little kitchenette, a couch and loveseat and a flat screen TV. The pool area was always clean with plenty of towels...the pool however is not heated. The staff was nice and helpful and exceeded my expectations (except for the women in the gift shop. Very crabby both times I have stayed here) The food at Marilyn's cafe has outstanding coffee, is very good for the price and I highly recommend the steak and eggs breakfast special. A 6 oz steak grilled to order, two eggs any style, hashbrowns and two huge and delicious pankcakes! For $6.99 it was WAY more food that I could eat. There is also full time security on site and they patrol the parking lot at night. I was very impressed. I recommend this hotel for travelers without children, older travelers, and travelers who would like the peace and quiet of being off the strip yet close enough for a short drive or shuttle ride.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip, but gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: islandon
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet and beautiful property. Rooms are beautiful, staff is great and food is top notch and everything is reasonable. Property is rambling, so you might get lost the first day...but it is worth it. The room prices are so cheap that it's hard to believe. Jose at front desk was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous accomodation, peaceful location.”
Reviews.Author: greengem8
Reviews.Content: My main concern staying here was getting to and from the strip, I didnt have to worry! The buses stopped right outside the apartments. The suites were huge and very comfortable. Being suites they have a kitchen area which consists of a small sink, a coffee machine, a fridge and a microwave on request, there is however NO cutlery or crockery. The beds are big and very comfortable. The bathroom is big, with a seperate bath and shower. There was also a sofa, an armchair and a desk. The flat screen television was nice. I felt thoroughly safe staying here. You needed your key card to gain access to each building which added to the security. The restaraunts were all nice, my favourite being Marilyns Cafe. Fantastic service and great prices. And the food was amazing! The pool is adequate but at the time it was too cold to swim. Now onto the bad bits, the windows are very thin and let in quite a bit of noise from the airport. There is a sickly sweet perfume pumped into the lifts that really is too overpowering. I did have a couple of tiny rips in my bed linen, however this didnt affect my comfort. But despite all this I would stay here again, its a great little place to escape to after the hustle and bustle of the strip. Be wise and make the most of the buses!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action, still quiet enough to maintain your sanity.”
Reviews.Author: sincityrider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for an overnight getaway from the kids. Everyone we encountered was extremely friendly. The room was very spacious and clean. The food at the Mexican restaurant was very good and reasonably priced. Our favorite part of the hotel was the casino being totally separate. You did not have to trudge through 20 acres of casino space looking for the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “good value - bring a hot plate”
Reviews.Author: auntchrissy
Reviews.Content: we were in vegas for 4 days & nights and stayed here - my guy stayed here on previous trips and had a good experience. the good: casino was removed from the rooms and so gambling noise was not an issue, the room was Large and nicely furnished, the bathroom was huge (we had an ada accessible suite) and having the hairdryer already in suite made more room in our suitcase. the cons: some sorta maintenance and/or upkeep was going on at 8:30am RIGHT OUTSIDE THE ROOM. we were given NO NOTICE that any construction activities were going to take place. it sounded like drills, saws, hammers etc.,. ugh. i know maintenance and upkeep needs to happen for properties, but at 8 in the morning in VEGAS?? WITHOUT A HEADS UP, that was the part that felt particularly rude. also, the bottom sheets DO NOT secure over the mattress. we had a king sized bed and when turning over to get comfy my feet were rubbing over the mattress. GROSS. requiring that the mattress be covered is a BASIC ... ie., my feet don't touch where other people's skin has touched (and seriously - if all i did was roll over in bed and my feet rubbed over mattress you KNOW that happened for people sleeping on that bed before you ever got there). outside of that, the suites come with a mini fridge but no way to heatup the leftovers you bring to your room (no microwave or stovetop or hotplate etc.,.). i'd recommend you bring a hotplate of some kind to make the savings of renting a 'suite' a reality. but remember: the hotel is a quick 15 minute walk to being on the strip and it's close enough to the center of the strip to get to LOTS of fun. overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: 1connienbob
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best deal in Las Vegas. The location is within walking distance to the strip and major shows and attractions. The rooms are large with plenty of space for guests to visit. There is no smoking smell in the rooms. The rooms are clean, with a nice pool and fitness center. There was no noise at all--away from casino and traffic. The restaurants served good food. We will stay again whenever we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, spacious rooms, we will return”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo50
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Tuscany Suites. Due to the comps we have earned, our stay here was free. However, we have comp offers for free rooms from other hotels, not those at the upper end, but comparable ones, like the Rio and the downtown hotels. Anyway, it is difficult to find fault with the room, since we received it at no cost. The room was spacious and clean, we even inspected under the mattress and bed (we usually do this inspection to look for signs of bed bugs). The bathroom had an updated, separate shower and tub and a separate smaller room for the toilet. The bathroom was clean and the toiletry amenities were of high quality. There was a small refrigerator in the room and we asked the front desk for a microwave oven and they sent us one at no cost. We weren’t charged for the daily resort fee. I think if you ask the front desk for a reduction or to waive the resort fee, they will work with you. We asked if they could waive the fee for internet use in our room and they said that they could not. Interestingly, they told us that any hotel with a casino on the property had to charge the fee. This was due to some contract agreement with the local internet service provider who had a monopoly over ISP in Las Vegas. I don’t know if this is true, but when I have stayed at a hotel that did not have a casino on the premises, I received free WiFi in my room. The exercise room is very spacious and has six treadmills, extensive universal and free weights and an outdoor lap pool. The food at Marilyn’s Cafe (on-site 24 hour restaurant) is inexpensive (especially if you use the coupons) and very good. We had several of our best meals there. On the weekend we stayed, a live band was playing at the bar and it was packed with many people dancing. Looked like fun. The crowd was older (40+) and the hotel does cater to a mature clientele, which contributes to the low noise level at the hotel. We didn’t play much at their casino, but never had any real luck there. We did hit it big on a slot machine, but that was about 5 years ago. The strip is about 2 ½ blocks away. We rented a car because we wanted to visit downtown and other off-the-strip casinos. Overall, it is hard to think of a reason not to return to the Tuscany Hotel, even though we have received offers for free rooms from other hotels. The rooms are quiet, comfortable, clean and spacious, it is great to park your car close to your hotel room and not walk miles to your room and there is a great restaurant within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: tepaea07
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend staued here for 9 nights and we found the room to be quite spacious and tidy. It was our first time in Vegas and we enjoyed every moment staying here at Tuscany. The service was unsatisfactory. And we did have to walk outside to another section to get to our room which was on the 3rd floor as well. But, other than that the place was beautiful and we enjoyed the fact that we weren't too far from all the action on the strip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: therev68
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for 6 nights, part business conference, part pleasure First, let me state the good:*service was poor and for that reason, I will never stay at Tuscany again *room was spacious, and bathroom was well laid out with separate toilet, tub and shower stall *the on site casino restaurants were very good, service, food, and prices (thank you, Victor! - our waiter) *while not on the strip, it is only a 10 min. walk to corner at Bally's and Bellagio fountains Second, the bad: *the TV had terrible picture on several channels *the bathroom had no ventilation (fans) - well, the fan fixtures were there but there was no way to switch them on *wifi access was $14/day - ridiculous!!! Especially since it was only at one bar signal strength. There was free internet in the lobby only, but our room was too far away to pick it up. Thankfully our room was close enough to get FREE internet from a neighbouring hotel! *what is with the useless $14/night resort fee??? It's robbery, plain and simple. *our room was listed as a king suite with kitchenette, but the stove top elements were disconnected for fire regulations, and there was no microwave. Nobody said anything to us when we checked in and there wasn't even a sign in room about the stove not being functional.We even went to get some breakfast groceries and dishes to be able to eat in room in the mornings, only to find out on our first morning that the appliance was not useable! Finally, the ugly: *after discovering the kitchenette problems, I called the desk and they were willing to comp me the money spent on groceries and dishes (they offered to remove the resort fees for 3 nights). When I went to the desk, the woman asked to see my receipts. I complied politely. Then she had the nerve to tell me what she would and would not refund me based on what type of food it was because there were items that we could still possibly eat. I was made to look like I had deceived them and was simply looking to get free stuff. I was disgusted and I told them so. What she forgot was that I reserved a room with kitchen, but had to settle for none - very poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...regardless of length of stay!”
Reviews.Author: sexy1979
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...this was my first time staying here, we were only there for one night, but it was awesome...free Valet, amazing price and the suite was huge! 1/2 a block from the Strip and the room was amazingly clean. Won't look very far for another hotel next time. Thanks guys! See you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: taminay
Reviews.Content: While not on the strip this hotel was a very nice choice. A little too far to walk to the strip but great value, great service, HUGE rooms, and good restaurants to eat at. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First impression was FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: ranles76
Reviews.Content: Room 214. (we asked for 3rd floor, but it was unavailable in K. The room is good size. Kitchen area, with frig (no utensils, micro, dishes) cubbards, drawers. Good for long stays. The bathroom rivals some decent homes! The first area is sink comples, then a separate shower, and accross a separate tub. The toilet is in a separate room off this one. Nicely layed out and towelled. 3 drawer driessor and modern flat screen TV. Coupons given at check in for discount food. We did not even enter the casino or use their eateries. Large enclosed closet w/in room safe. Desk, chair, couch, comfy chair. Resort fee REQUIRED. Price was really good, before resort fee (still good). One or two blocks from strip. Can hear the planes and the music from the casino (lounge?). the music lasts all night. Pool is empty of users, but would probably add to the noise level. Also can hear people in the hall most of the night and in the early morning hours. Nice balcony, for a warmer time. if you are a good sleeper, this place is a definate one to try. If not, think about it. Our first view was unbeliveable for the price. parking is good. Elevator. No included breakfast. Definately would consider to give another try. Rating of Very good, includes price consideration. Noise is really the only issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gigi88t
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extremely reasonable for what you get. We had 2 beds, sitting area, dining area, and kitchenette. The bathroom had shower and separate tub. Iloved the italian theme. Everyone was nice and helpful. Cab ride to strip wasn't a fortune! I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Big, basic rooms at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: jennobrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights for a conference. The room was big with 2 full sized beds (too bad they were not queen sized), large bathroom with tub and separate shower, couch, desk, small table to sit and eat at, and a "wet bar" small counter with sink and a few dishes, and refrigerator. Space was adequate for sleeping. The furnishing could use some updating but the price was right for what we got. Did not use the pool. The fitness center was medium in size and had several treadmills, bikes, free weights, etc. Close enough to walk to the strip. We felt safe walking to and from the strip late at night. Conference rooms are horrible!! The room itself was fine, however, the smoke smell and ventilation were AWFUL! We had an 8 hour conference there and left early due to headache and nausea from the smoke. Smoking wasn't even allowed in the conference area but I suspect it was all coming from the casino downstairs. I know...we were in Vegas where smokers are everywhere, but this was the worst we experienced out of all of the hotels/casinos we went through on our entire 4 day trip!!!! The rooms were not connected to the main building with the casino, so we did not experience a problem with smoke in our room just the lobby, casino, restaurants, and conference areas.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl181747
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is a nice property about a 10 minute walk from the Flamingo on the Strip. The casino itself is essentially lifeless - not very much energy at all. The dealers were pleasant enough but there was no excitement. This casino is NOT typical of others in Las Vegas. We preferred to go elsewhere to gamble. The rooms are enormous. Twice the size of any where else I have ever stayed in Vegas and we have been there at least a dozen times.

Reviews.Title: “Still good but starting to feel a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Andrew86____91_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany for three nights attending a trade show. Good points are huge rooms, pretty quiet and comfy beds. The whole place is starting to feel a little tired with bathrooms needing an upgrade. In europe all hotels offer free wifi - hotels in the US should start this. the Tuscany does have free wifi in the lobby area - so this is something..... Overall the place is good value and if you want "off strip" at reasonable prices then this plave is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: SusanJAshbrook
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the hotel they told me there would be an additional "resort charge" each day of $13.00. I think this is deceptive. I booked my stay through Expedia and paid in advance and was surprized to see this additional charge. I spoke to the manager and she said it was for "refrigerator, wireless (which is not free), pool, etc...all things I did not use when I stayed. The lobby of the hotel smells like smoke, but the room was comfortable and clean. I would not stay here again though due to the extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “Sense of calm but close to the action”
Reviews.Author: dipex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week in February. I was impressed with the relative calm this hotel complex offers but still only two blocks from the tourist traffic on the Las Vegas Strip. The hotel is not so large and is made up of several 3-story buldings located in very attractive landscaping. This gives the hotel a sense of calmness in almost a rural atmosphere. The main lobby is separated from the casino, so one could stay here without even approaching the girating noise of the casino. The room was extremely large and my building was a 3-5minute walk from the main building housing the restaurants. It had a sofa bed and armchair in the sitting area and a small kitchenette. But the latter was not very practical since, although they provide a electric cooker there are no cooking utensils! I mentioned this drawback to the reception and they will provide a microwave on request. However, there is really no need to bother with self catering. Marilyn's restaurant serves an expansive choice of menues 24 hrs. But I did find the ambience of this restaurant rather downbeat and more like a cafeteria/canteen. The Italian restaurant is open evenings and I found that very good, in quiet and sophisticated surroundings. There is a good fitness center with an exercise pool. Unfortunately the main pool and garden were closed for maintenance works. But this would be a delightful spot when it reopens. I found the ubiquitous 'resort fee' a bit unnecessary - just a way of these hotels making an extra buck but prividing little for it. They did say that it goes towards the provision of the fitness center and free wifi in the public areas of the hotel (lobby, Piazza Lounge, cafe, upstairs banqueting areas). But the price I paid was extremely good value. A car is useful buat not essential, as it is a bit of a walk to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: brella64
Reviews.Content: We had 11 rooms and a wedding reception at the Tuscany. Everyone was very happy with the accommodations, the rooms are huge and newly remodeled. The lobby has lots of seating for visiting with family. We had a private room between Marilyn's Cafe and The Cantina for a wedding reception, George from Marilyn's cafe did a great job taking care of everything, the wait staff was super! We will definitely stay at the Tuscany again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Comfort.”
Reviews.Author: lily_99654
Reviews.Content: Our second time staying at the Tuscany. Couldnt think of a reason to stay elsewhere. Rooms are huge, grounds are nice, has 3 restaurants, snack/espresso bar, and casino. An oasis just a couple of blocks from center strip. They hosted a free Superbowl party and there was plenty of seating, 5-for-$10 beer buckets, and moderately priced food. I WISH they had in room WIFI, but it is available in the main building so I took my laptop to the snack bar or lobby. Our room had a few minor issues, missing towel hook, missing leg on fridge, leaky shower faucet, sticky shower door, which we informed them of when we left. The beds are super comfortable. Overall, very satisfied. We would stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan
Reviews.Content: Third stay, Nice Place love the decor and landscapeing. All carpet was new in our hallway and our room. One of the rear buildings about 5 minute walk to casino. Casino is still nice and restrants. Slots payed out a little. Haveing a mini frig and kitchenette in room is so nice and the huge bathroom. Loved the bedding and pillows. Ac and heat worked perfect as did the safe. Love Tuscany. We rent a car so walking to the strip is just too far for us..

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: lynnelubec
Reviews.Content: Great staff!! Clean & quiet. Tuesdays:$2 Margaritas!! 3 blocks from the strip, easy walk. Very good Italium restaurant ( get coupon for 2 for 1)

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jwhitfield71
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at Tuscany two years ago for a business trip, and decided then that if I ever came back to Vegas, this would be the place to stay. You're an easy 10-minute walk from the hustle & bustle of The Strip, but that short walk puts you worlds away from the noise. Tuscany is a laid-back and quiet place to stay. We were in town this weekend for a pleasure trip, and couldn't have been more pleased. The only drawback we found while there was the pool area was closed for some renovations. That didn't negatively affect our stay, but it would have been nice to relax outdoors. From the looks of things, the renovations were nearly complete though. Check-in was a breeze, and our room was in great condition. We were in the "A" building, which is right next to The Platinum, so there was occasional late-night noise from their parking area, but nothing major. We ate at Marilyn's Cafe - excellent pizza, and the two-for-one coupon makes the deal even sweeter. If you're looking for a quiet place that's close to The Strip, without paying premium prices, look here. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: LadyFromTheMidwest
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went out to Vegas for a wedding. My niece had her reception at the Tuscany. They did a great job with her reception. The food and service was excellent. This was the 1st time I have stayed off the strip in Vegas. I really enjoyed coming back to our room at the end of each day to some quiet down time. The hotel was very richly decorated in the Tuscan theme. The gardens were beautiful. The casino was a bit smaller than those you find on the strip, which made it more enjoyable for me. The rooms were very nice and spacious. Most importantly, the rooms were exceptionally clean. This place is an exceptional value for the money. I would visit the Tuscany again.

Reviews.Title: “Soooooo Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne K
Reviews.Content: Only 3 blocks from the strip!! Great rates. Week days we paid $45 per night, Spottless. Comfortable beds. Tropical feefing & quiet Piano bar. $2 Margaritas on Tuesdays. We will return. Lovely staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful option just off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: kge97
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third time staying at the Tuscany in the last 18 months, and once again, it did not disappoint. We spent three nights there for my husband's birthday. Ate at all three restaurants, and think the flan at The Cantina is one of the best we've ever had. Staff was once again friendly, helpful and courteous. Grounds were well-manicured and clean. Room was also clean and well-maintained, and everything worked well. Used the small in-room fridge to hold our breakfast and lunch items we purchased at Albertson's down the street. We did notice the TV had been upgraded to a flat-screen since our last stay about 9 months ago. (Not a big deal for us, but one previous reviewer didn't like the outdated TV, so I thought it important to mention this.) It's about a .75 mile walk to The Strip. With three restaurants, the casino, nightly entertainment, two pools, a Jacuzzi, fitness center and newly added spa, we found ourselves spending most of the three days at the resort. You won't find too many young 20-something clubbers here, so if that's your scene, maybe better to choose another hotel. This is a plus for us, so we'll continue to come back. We stayed Friday-Sunday, and including resort fees and tax, our average nightly rate was about $90. Thanks again for a great Vegas getaway, Tuscany!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AbuExpat
Reviews.Content: I was truly amazed by how great this place was, considering that it was not at all expensive to stay. The rooms were massive including lounge and kitchen facilities. Huge gym, plenty of parking, 24hr security, great and affordable room service plus and added extra that we found useful was you don't need to walk through a casino to get to your room. Morning breakfast was very nice and cheap plus the location was fantastic as it was in walking distance to everything you want to see plus far enough away where you could get some piece and quiet. We will be staying there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Liked It More Than I Thought I Would”
Reviews.Author: ehall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 for two nights. We wanted someplace specifically off the strip for 2 nights over Thanksgiving, as we were just in Las Vegas before heading to Death Valley and didn't want to deal with holiday crowds on the strip. The hotel is in a converted apartment complex, so there are a few buildings with the hotel rooms scattered about the property. They are all connected via sidewalks. The main complex has the casino, check in, a bar/lounge, an Italian restaurant, a Mexican restaurant, a coffee shop, and a small coffee bar and small gift shop. The rooms are good sized. We just had one of the basic rooms, and it had a kitchenette with a mini-fridge, a coffee maker, a table and chairs, a kitchen sink. There was not a microwave, nor any type of dishes. These are not advertised as being in the room, so not a problem - just letting people know what is / is not there. There was a couch, chair, and coffee table. A dresser with a TV that could be swivelled towards the sitting area or the bed. We had a king room. The bathroom was good sized, but a little dark. There's a tub and separate walk in shower. The shower did not have a light, and looked like it may have been built into what was once a closet, so it was a bit dark in the shower. I did not find the walk from the casino to the hotel rooms to be bad. It only took a few minutes. If you have any mobility issues - you may want to ask for a building close to the casino. However, you can park right outside your building, which is nice. The casino is decent sized - not huge, but large enough, with a good selection of table games, slots, and video poker. The walk up Flamingo to the strip, while not far, seems a bit dicey, so I would not recommend that, especially at night. We did not use the fitness center or the pool, but took a look for reference. The fitness center is pretty nice. It was roomy and had good quality machines. There is also an exercise pool for swimming laps separate from the recreational pool. The hotel does charge a service fee, in addition to the room rate. The fee included (among other things) coupons $20 off the Italian restaurant, and a buy one-get one free for the Mexican restaurant or coffee shop. If you use these, it compensates for the service fee. The Italian restaurant (Think it was called Tuscany Gardens) was really good. We stayed here because we just wanted somewhere inexpensive, as we flew in Wednesday before Thanksgiving, did a Turkey Trot 14K run on Thursday, then left early Friday to go to Death Valley. It met the needs for that perfectly. If your vacation is meant to center around the strip and casino hopping - I would not choose to stay here. But, if you are in town for some other purpose, but want to have a casino resort type place to stay - it was definately good for that. Had all the perks of one of the strip casino resorts, without the hassle of parking garage/really long walk to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Luvsviolet
Reviews.Content: One of the aspects I liked of my stay was how close the hotel was to a lot of places, including walking distance to the Strip. The rooms were comfortable, the bed and bathroom was clean and the service at the hotel restaurant was prompt and courteous. I will definitely go back to this hotel on a future trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “who knew?”
Reviews.Author: valeria s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, after coming to play slots a few times, and was very pleased, The building was newly renovated and very spacious. The suite was nicely done and very clean. The staff was very nice, professional and helpful. Very nice for the price. Will tell all my friends about this hidden gem. Close to the airport and the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.....what a place!”
Reviews.Author: Kentman4632
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this place. It is beautiful, clean, accomodating, and close enough to everything. I didn't know what to expect since I had never stayed there. It was everything the reviews promised....and more! Loved my room. It was clean and not far from the front lobby and restaurant. I stayed in Bldg I. I couldn't believe how great Marilyn's Restaurant was. The food was delicious and very affordable. I had the breakfast special.....NY strip steak, eggs, hash browns and pancakes for $6.99. You can't beat that! It was a 15 minute walk to the strip. I paid $8.50 for a taxi one day to Planet Hollywood. The pool and lap pool was open, even though it was January. Yes, there were people swimming since the sun was out and it was only 61 degrees. The outdoor hot tub was also being used. The pool area is beautiful! Yes, I would absolutely recommend this place. I loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms with nothing in them. No HD TV out digital cable.”
Reviews.Author: bchipman
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a disappointment. Large rooms but are in need of an update. No digital cable or HD TVs in the rooms or any of the hotel bar or restaurants. Restaurants onsite were not good.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Helle04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany with friends to celebrate NYE 2011. We chose the Tuscany over the hotels on the Strip because of the price. I was very surprised over the nice, spacious rooms which can be a little dark. We especially enjoyed the sitting area and fridge - and remember to ask for a microwave if wanted. Try to get a room on the top floor as there can be some noise from upstairs rooms. The distance to/from the Strip can easily be walked and I (a girl) even walked there and back by myself after sunset and I still felt safe. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We left the hotel 3 days early to move to the Strip as the hotels there were now cheaper after NYE because some of them don't charge a resort fee as the Tuscany does.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book a room with Tuscany Suites & Casino”
Reviews.Author: TraciCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by their low room rates. You will be charged an additional $15 "resort fee" per day. This is mandatory regardless of whether or not use use the "resort" and doesn't cover internet charges, which are another $14 a day. I stayed here a few years ago and they didn't have a "resort fee", but their was a spot of dried blood on the sheets. So, I guess the resort fee pays for the clean sheets and new carpet as well. Still, you can get better deals with internet access for the $30 + $15 resort fee + $14 WiFi charges at Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: leannieivy
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I got married in Las Vegas we had a brilliant experience staying at Tuscany Suite hotel was very clean, our room was fantastic size, staff were excellent, grounds were lovely and we had one of the best meals of the trip in the restaurant. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will be using it on our next trip to celebrate our anniversary. I would have preferred to have had the resort fees included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great value!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlycochrane709
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las vegas with my friend for 5 days. We stayed at Tuscany suites and really enjoyed the atmosphere there! It was very clean and the rooms were huge. We had our own living area and kitchenette. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed Marilyn's Cafe very much. It was cheap and the portion sizes were phenomenal. The food was great too! The service was amazing and we liked seeing the same servers there day after day! The doormen at the main entrance were excellent. Very helpful and very friendly to us Newfoundlanders that like to chat! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! It is within walking distance to all the main attractions on the strip. Took us less than 10 minutes to walk to the strip by caesars palace. We also enjoyed coming back to the Tuscany after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. Very quiet and relaxing after many hours in the hustle and bustle of the strip. Loved it all!! Oh and try the spa! had an amazing swedish massage there which was greatly needed after walking up and down the strip! Simply excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: skymouse
Reviews.Content: We booked online ,got very good price of 30 $ per night It was a nice suite , very clean , spacious Grounds are very well kept, nicely landscaped Sits couple blocks from main drag, not a big deal Staff very friendly, you have to pay for internet something like 9.99 per night Small business center in casino building Not a place to splurge,considering what we paid for, but clean quiet comfortable place to spend a night or two

Reviews.Title: “Great room rate + huge Resort Fee $14.00”
Reviews.Author: Mokell
Reviews.Content: Nice and very large room, very large bathroom with shower and small tub, separate restroom. King size bed was comfortable, but was in one room. My husband loves to get up early and in this room can't watch TV due to the TV is in the same room with the bed. Be aware of the room rates, they have a very odd way to charging you. I paid for the room on line via Amex. Then I checked in they again charged me another $100.00 and then for the resort fee of $14.00 per day. I paid $29 a day plus $14 a day, please all the taxes they charge. By the time we were done with paying all the fees it was over $55 per night. Dont really know what the Resort fee was but felt we were ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off-Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilliTheKid
Reviews.Content: Lots to recommend this property. Friendly staff, decent restaurants, small casino, clean & good-sized rooms. Only about 1 1/2 blocks from mid-strip, I will definately stay here again! A couple of minor issues: The dreaded RESORT FEE; not much value received for $12/day and not even including in-room WiFi! Come on, Man....this is a pretty much standard amenity these days but to pay a RF and not get in-room wireless? Instead, one of the listed "benefits "of the RF is your Coupon Book. Really? The why do I pay $12/day and still only get 1 book for my entuire stay? The onther issue is no in-room wi-fi (see above) Otherwise, I really liked the property. Clean, well-maintained and good value. The pool area and the bar scene rocked!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: FoodSnob1
Reviews.Content: Great location, newly refurbished rooms, friendly staff. Casino is small, but Marilyn's cafe served up decent food. Small pool (open year round), very clean and well manicured grounds. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and accommodation for the price!”
Reviews.Author: VegasGrl94
Reviews.Content: I have always been "posh" and wanted to stay within the glitz and glam of the strip, so when the prices were outrageous for this most recent trip (because of a boxing match), we were forced to look for less expensive options. At first I was waiting for the 'catch' with Tuscany. Surely there was a reason why they were inexpensive compared to the strip hotels. But once we arrived, I realized the only reason is because it's not on the strip! But just a couple blocks away, it was a steal. The rooms are so much bigger than all standard rooms I've ever stayed in, and everyone who came to visit me vowed they would be staying at the Tuscany from now on. The staff was very friendly, the hotel is beautiful, and the cafe food was great! My sister and best friend also stayed there and the front desk were awesome as they went out of their way to place us in rooms in the same building. We were there for two weeks and I felt like I was at home the whole time. Great experience. For the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: donna295
Reviews.Content: My husband and i travelled to Las Vegas for christmas and stayed at the tuscany suites, we had a large king room, and was immaculate from top to bottom, the staff are so friendly, and the grounds are immaculate. The restaurants were fantastic especially Marilyns, the service was fast and friendly and the prices were excellent for the amount of food you received either for breakfast and supper. We got a deal on line and stayed at the hotel for 7 days and paid over $200.00 plus $101.00 resort fee, so for over $300.00 for a week in Las Vegas was amazing. We are already planning to visit next year. It is a ten minute walk to the strip, we were in Building K right near the restaurants, gift shop. Outstanding thats all we can say

Reviews.Title: “Great Off-Strip Value”
Reviews.Author: ABusinessGuy
Reviews.Content: GREAT PRICES GREAT ROOM GREAT LOCATION A short one block walk to the strip full kitchenette...quiet...clean... couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany comes through with another winning visit”
Reviews.Author: OceanLoverInDesert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here before, and when we planned to come to Las Vegas for Christmas, we decided to come back and enjoy their great hospitality and location. Check in was a breeze. Be mindful of the added resort fee per night (13 dollars) and the 100 dollar deposit you must give upon arrival. It is very much worth it as you can use the deposit for food and drinks in any of the restaurants, which is exactly what we did, and everything was tasty (see review for Marilyn's Cafe). The room is huge. Large king size bed, sink and fridge, sofa, desk, dining table, nice full length mirror, and the bathroom is great. The toilet has its own room, and the shower is a walk in. Everything is pristine and done correctly. Did I mention the 30 inch flat screen TV that you can point to the bed to watch? Awesome! No problems with the key card. There was one issue. The day after Christmas, we left early to do some laundry in their laundromat (1.50 per wash, 1.00 per dry, soap not provided). When we came back, the room had not been cleaned yet. No problem, I thought, I will just call and ask for it to be cleaned, and then go out for a coffee. When we returned 45 minutes later, the room still had not been cleaned. I called a second time and told them to send someone over immediately, as we wanted to rest before we went out and we couldn't until the room was done. I waited for someone to come, and the room was done in 20 minutes. It should not take 2 phone calls to get the room cleaned. I understand it was busy for the holidays, but when a customer calls and asks, the response should be immediate. Incidentally, the next day, housekeeping called our room and said they had a message that we wanted our room cleaned. I told them that the message was for YESTERDAY. LOL. Other than that one hiccup, all was perfect. We will come back for the great room and discounts. Keep up the good work, Tuscany! We will see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Auf Wiedersehen
Reviews.Content: Results from our third stay over many years: Positives: Carpets and furniture were new and newly painted. Suites ar estill huge Grounds are still beautifully maintained. You must be able to walk a couple of desolate but safe blocks to enjoy the Strip, as we did. Marilyn's Cafe is very good east-coast style dinner. Fine Italian food and service at Tuscany Gardens. Casino has lots of low-cost options. Negatives: Soundproofing is poor from hallways, and there were several loud folks all hours of the night (par for Vegas?). Summary: I would recommend this place as an excellent low cost choice, and because of the large comfortable rooms and well-maintained areas. Note: The resort fee was more than totally reimbursed by using the dining coupons, and like I said, the restaurants are good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nscott6
Reviews.Content: All the pros: NO-SMOKIING in the restaurants!! Need I say more? free internet in the lobby. kitchen suites. large rooms with big beds and lots of pillows! Lots of areas that are non-smoking. Really cheap even with the resort fee..usually around $13 a night. Lots of coupons for half off or 2 for 1 upon check in at the local restaurants. Friendly atmosphere and staff. Not really and bad things to say about this room although was only here for 7 hours. We booked this room due to a late night flight back home and was cheaper than most other hotels and close enough to the strip. Would definitely stay again! Great Mexican restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: Angela W
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very large and comfortable. We booked online with a flight and got a fantastic deal for 6 nights! Short walk from the strip - which was tough on the hotter days but it was nice not to be away from the hubbub. Gas station on the corner and liquor store just down the road to buy cheap booze to fill your fridge with! The staff was friendly and the food was decent. Also, it's just around the corner from Koval Lane where we found Ellis Island - a daily bbq with fantastic food and a great price, as well as $1.50 drafts. Lovely pool area with free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MDA62
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time 12/3/11-12/6/11 at the Tuscany Suites in the "M" building. It was a great suite with kitchen & very clean with down comforters on the beds. Very cozy. My negatives for the stay are the very long walk to this building. The door to enter the building 4 different times would not let me in....so back the long walk to the check-in desk. Last check the door still was not working & every other person I met going & coming had the same problem.The kitchen has not one utensil for cooking or eating. Odd. My "to go" meal from Tuscany Gardens was not something I would make a recommendation to go back to & neither was Marilyn's cafe. Great personnel & attention to detail at the Tuscany Gardens but the food was just not good. Marilyn's cafe less than a Denny's quality & the server was just not present. Lack of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Not as flashy as The Strip, but it's kind of nice that way”
Reviews.Author: countstrade
Reviews.Content: First off, the rooms here are quite bigger than your average hotel room. No HDTVs, but when you are in Vegas, do you really come to watch the TV in your room? The place is nice and laid back, a welcome respite from the craziness on The Strip. It's close enough that you don't feel like you are far from the action, but it is far enough to be enjoyable. The price is always far cheaper than those other places as well. There's a monorail stop less than 1mi away that can get you virtually anwhere on The Strip. The casino is relatively small, but it does the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent off the Strip Option”
Reviews.Author: garlicmike
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for us, but then we don't like the noise and bustle of the Strip. We want to be able to come home to a pleasant, quiet, homy, smoke free place to sleep after a day and evening on the town. This place fits the bill but is close enough to the center of the action, two blocks. The walk from the car to the room is short, unlike the huge mega-complexes on the strip. The rooms are large, comfortable, and homy. The location seems to be totally safe. Everything was clean, smelled nice and was comfortable. Our room had a wet bar, refrigerator, coffee maker, living room and a very spacious bathroom. The bed was comfortable and really I have nothing negative to say. The casino is separate and the lobby spaces are smoke free. If you want to, you never even need to see a casino at this location. As far as the "resort fee" goes, just get yourself a good deal on the room and add the extra $13 a night to the cost of your room and you should still have a great deal. It's just a way for them to appear to be offering a better deal. Keep the room price super low and tack on extras. They are all doing it now, and I was not taken by surprise because I read the information before I booked. We paid around $60 a night including the resort fee and I think it was one of the best travel bargains I have ever gotten. The health club is very nice, spacious and includes free weigths. Find some time to use it. If you want to be on the strip, do that. This is my kind of alternative to all that. I was pleasantly surprised and my wife loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany for training seminar November 2011”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: We paid pennies to stay at Tuscany while I attended a training course which was held in one of the rooms on the meeting floor. The meeting room was well mnaged. The staff was in the room preparing the food and drinks well in advance and was friendly and greatious. They were in the meeting room immediately after it cleared out cleaning each night. The room I stayed in was in building B on the second floor. The room was spacious with a nice table and chairs, pull out couch and a kithenette. The only issue for me was that I like a softer bed and pillows but these were quite hard. The showerhead was understated but all the necessities were there for a great rate. Walking distance to the strip for a fit person. The staff was very friendly and responsive although I was hit with a $100 deposit that wasn't covered by the fees paid by my company for the room. The casino is small but decent. Bar was good and my experience at the restaurant called marilyn's was fantastic! I ate chicken parmesian and it was a large portion and the service was fantastic. Over-all I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could wish for”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPhotographer
Reviews.Content: Perfect off-strip stay. Quiet at night, while only 2 blocks from the action. Taxis to the strip for around $10 or less! Parking right at the room. Heated swimming pool - open in November until 10pm. Marilyn's Cafe serves amazing food - great quality for great value. Check their daily specials! Free wifi in the lobby. Check in and check out was a breeze. When weary from the excitement in town, Tuscany was like going "home" to rest. Sunday to Thursday rates from $19 per room per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Stew99
Reviews.Content: Huge room excellent value. The room we had had two full size beds, a sofa that would seat 3, coffee table , small "dinner table to seat 4, refrigerator the size of a small dishwasher, small sink, separate tub and shower. Only 10 to 15 min walk to Cesar's Palace on the strip. There is a 7-11 right around the corner. Only down side was the service in the coffee shop was slow and lacked attentiveness. Used the Wi-Fi in the public areas and it was easy to connect and the speed was good. This hotel has a resort fee which I don't like.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in a tropical resort”
Reviews.Author: bossone
Reviews.Content: What a suprise this place looks even better than the pictures. so close to the strip yet so far away. must be the tropical gardens that give it serenity as opposed to the sleazy madness on the strip. Nice spacious suite, good food in the restaurants with reasonable prices. Enjoyed staying there, would rate it higher but room service was scarce, we where out of our room everyday between 9 am to 2 pm and our oom was the same as we left it. It also did not have a microwave, I could have asked for one but sort off expected it in the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been 4 star, just one thing...but great again”
Reviews.Author: Fusebuddy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times over the past 7-8 years. I love the off strip location and the convenience of a nice hotel with easy in/out access. Tuscany is a great alternative to the mega-resorts in LV and the rooms are very very big. Getting on/off the strip, well, you can face gridlock real fast. If you plan to remain at your hotel the whole time, go ahead & stay on the strip. Otherwise, if you like to get out of the hotel zone and see other things, you'll appreciate the freedom being off-strip. Or, if you're staying in LV on business carrying items to and from the convention center, for example, its hard to beat. Strip is a stones throw away. This time I wanted to focus on Tuscany's upkeep of the property. On the first morning at 6:30 am, I saw three painters waiting outside my building. This property is definately being maintained well, its still in great shape. Tuscany deserves some credit for this. Compared to last year's stay there, I think my room had new carpet too. Otherwise, my room was very clean, I even wiped some of the ledges and such, no dust. Each day, my room was maintained very well, they get 5 stars here. Otherwise, my group ate at Tuscany Gardens 2 out of the 4 nights. Tuscany Gardens restaurant is a gem. Seriously, over the past 7 years, I've had the Sea Bass there probably 6 times, incredible, melts in your mouth. This visit, I had a piece of Halibut, might have been the best Halibut I've ever had. I don't know if the typical guest just walks past this restaurant, but if they do, their missing a great meal. In this area, Tuscany deserves more credit. In my group, we have the same 4 people returning there, every November. We all agreed that Tuscany Gardens is a fantastic restaurant and they deserve credit for maintaining the integrity of the dishes and service. In the casino, I hate to say, the table games seem very difficult. If you're a gambler, I don't know what's going on there, but I've never had good luck. After so many years staying/gambling, the dealers/pit boss' seem crabby, so we like to go elsewhere most of the time. Lastly, I usually give 4 stars to Tuscany because of the value, great convenience off/strip, good condition of the property and good food. But I can't this time because my assistant saw a bug in her room. In the 10 or 11 times I've stayed here, I've never seen a bug. And Tuscany is maintaining the property very well. So, I think if there was ever a problem, they would take care of it. Anyways, these days I will reserve 5 stars for the truly luxurious and incredible properties. I would give 4, but have to ding them for the bug. Tuscany over the long haul always has great rates, in my book they're a consistent 4 star. YES, I will take my crew back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic off-strip resort!”
Reviews.Author: craigger20
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt more like a carribean resort than a Las Vegas Hotel. Very relaxed and very quiet. Check in was fast and easy, they did not have a King room as we had requested but they were able to move us the next day. The rooms are very large with nice amenities, comfy bed, big bathroom, beer fridge, kitchen table, couch, char, desk, coffee table. Very clean. The grounds are well kept and very safe feeling. You need a room key to get into each of the buildings, as well as the pool. Well kept pathways that wind throughout. The pool was heated and the hot tub was very nice. We were able to bring our own drinks and nobody seemed to mind. The buildings bring the shade pretty early, so get your sunning in early in the afternoon. The casino is small and quiet. We were there on 11-11-11 which was supposed to be one of the busiest days of the year in Vegas and the Casino was still very quiet, only half the tables open. So, it's good if you want a seat at a table (including $3 Blackjack) right away, but if you are looking for a party vibe or some electricity, you'll have to go elsewhere. We ate at two of the restaurants (Cantina and Marilyns) and the food was excellent and very reasonably priced, as were drinks throughout the property. The staff was pretty minimal, so don't expect someone there to open every door or take care of your every need, but everyone was very friendly and eager to help out. It was a bit of a jaunt to the strip, about 10 minutes, which is not a huge deal except for those in high heels, they packed a pair of light flats to wear for the walk. Overall it was a great place to stay if you don't care about staying on the strip and are looking for a nice quiet place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiggles C
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Las Vegas and we stayed at this hotel. This hotel was very very nice and clean. When we arrived in the room it was like a suite. A small kitchen, dinning room, living room a king size bed and a very nice bathroom. I would recommend this Hotel to couples and to families. Very Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, Great Room. Nice amenities. Incredibly Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: praxees
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room in the J building and our traveling partners stayed in a king room in the L building. Both rooms were absolutely huge. Each room comes with its own kitchenette, dining table, living area, bath with separate shower/tub - all rooms tastefully decorated and up-to-date. Hotel has a small casino with a handful of tables and a fair number of slot machines. There is a beautiful pool and hot tub and a separate lap pool, 2 fitness centers. There are 2 restaurants - Marilyn's has the perfect hangover breakfast special that is one of the least expensive meals I've had anywhere; I had an excellent salmon dish at Tuscany Gardens. I was in a wedding held in the chapel - the chapel is quaint, Rebecca (the wedding planner,) was very helpful and accommodating, the minister and photographer were great too. The location is ideal if you want to experience Vegas, but not be surrounded by craziness all the time. The location is convenient to get to the strip by car/taxi/shuttle; I would not say that it is walkable for most people. My only complaint was that free wifi is only in public areas - if you want wifi in your room you have to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Low key, great rates, big rooms and easy to get to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: UtahFamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: Ditto to all the other reviews before me. I was pleasantly surprised with the rooms size and furnishings. The room rate was excellent considering everything that was happening that weekend. The couple of meals we ate at the hotel were very good. The casino has plenty of table games and slots. Really my only comlaint is the cab line. It could be a long wait or a short wait. Most cabbies don't pull in unless they are dropping someone off. So you're pretty much at their mercy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm definitely a mega resort kind of gal but when they aren't at the right price I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Vegas close to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: P P
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip in May and didn't have a lot of options for accommodations. I have to admit that I was a little skeptical of the Tuscany based on the VERY inexpensive price per night. I honestly thought it might be a dive. I was very pleasantly surprised when I checked in. Friendly lobby staff, great location and my room was super clean and very large with a small kitchenette, sofa and comfortable king-sized bed. I stayed in building "L" which is one of the furthest from the casino and restaurants. I couldn't believe I was in Las Vegas - the entire place is very quiet overall (noisy upstairs neighbor one night) and I enjoyed the walk to the strip which about 10-12 minutes away. There are two gas stations nearby which were perfect for picking up inexpensive snacks and bottles of soda and water - something that's hard to come by when you stay on the strip. I did travel by myself that trip and I was a LITTLE bit uncomfortable making the walk from the strip back to the Tuscany after dark. I recommend taking a cab from the strip after dark. The only drawback of the Tuscany was the fact that cabs are not always sitting out front - the bell captain often has to call one which can take some time. I stayed there again this month - this time I happily booked it and was rewarded with an upgraded newly renovated room that overlooked the pool. Furnishings were all new including a perfectly sized flat screen TV and a very comfortable sofa and chair. I was a happy camper. The casino is small but adequate. The restaurants are great - Marilyn's Cafe is open 24/7 and food is served quickly. They have daily breakfast specials ($6.99 for a steak/egg/pancake/home fries or $3.99 for unlimited pancakes) and nightly dinner specials that were pretty decent. The Italian restaurant was also pretty good but a little more expensive. If you're up for something a little more upscale, Lawry's Steakhouse is right across the street - a 2 minute walk. Tip: Use your coupons that they give you at check-in. I saved quite a bit of money on already well-priced food. Overall, I give the Tuscany 5 stars - I am in Vegas at least 4 times a year and plan on staying here often!

Reviews.Title: “awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: PEGGY H
Reviews.Content: rooms are newly remodeled and they are beautiful and large inside. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Andrea13
Reviews.Content: Tuscany Suites and Casino I am really impressed by this suites-hotel. It is a huge place. With lots of buildings, and lots of plants and small gardens. The main building – hotel lobby, restaurants and Casino with outside gardens and fountains is built along Flamingo Road. Behind these buildings are the hotel buildings, 3 floors high and with inside corridors. It is a bit difficult in the dark, when you just arrived, to find the right building, the map I got was a bit confusing for me. They have valet parking and self parking in front of the hotel for casino and hotel guests. And there is spacious parking behind the main building for the hotel guests as well, closer to their rooms. If you are looking for a quiet room, ask for 3rd floor rooms, in the middle of the corridor, cause on the one side is the elevator and on the other the stairs with door, that might be slammed. Right in the middle it was perfect. The Suites-room is spacious, no dividing walls. When you walk in you have the kitchen right on the one side of the entrance door. In my room I had a fridge but nothing else, no oven or microwave. Perhaps you have to rent it extra? There is a big dining table and 4 chairs. Adjacent to a huge sofa and sofachair. TV was no flat one. Kingbed was very comfortable with good matrasses and down blanket. Besides the bed is a built-in-cabinet for the clothes, with a safe inside. And a big mirror. In the bathroom shower and tub is extra, toilet is in an extra room. You will find fine italian toiletries provide, and lots of towels. 3 of 4 days my telephoneline was dead... I mentioned that the phones (you get 2 per room) were dead right when I arrived. Staff promised to repair it the next day, but it took a longer time to get it fixed. This should make me take one star off the review... The pool area of Tuscany Hotel is beautiful nice garden setting, with heated pool and deckchairs, and a jaccuzzi of course. Right beside the pool is the back entrance to the lobby and a cafe. You can sit outside when the weather is permitting, and sip your coffee. This area around the pool was very inviting and I liked that part of the hotel so much. Internet is not free in the rooms, but in the lobby. Though it was a bit weak it worked out ok. In the hotel you find 2 very good restaurants. An italian and a mexican one. You even receive 2 for one entree coupons when you arrive. The casino is spacious though not too big. The whole place is not that hectic as hotels on the Strip. Check in had been very fast, you can do self-check-out over the TV. The staff at front desk – especially Greg – was very nice and helpful. But even they did not manage that my phones in the room worked. I will make this place number 1 for my future stays in Vegas. Depending on the rates of course. I had got a very low rate through a booking web site, it was cheaper than the hotels web site. You will find a daily resort fee to be paid, which is around 15 dollars a day extra. It includes some coupons, free local calls. Wel – the room rates were low and the whole place is high quality. I recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: citysprout
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with a friend to meet up with other friends and stayed at Tuscany Suites. We didn't know what to expect, but were nicely surprised at this hotel. The rooms were large with sitting area, kitchen area, super large bathroom w/separate shower and tub. For the two of us there was plenty of room to spread out. The staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the area and very helpful - particularly concierge getting show tickets. We walked to the strip - about 1/2 mile, which was nice during the day. At night cabs were a bit hard to come by, but eventually got there. Pools looked nice, but we didn't use them. Only downside were the coffee makers in the morning. If you want more money to do stuff and spend less on a pricey room you are never in, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stayseeyaa
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay at this hotel again. It was quite and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: venice7_8
