Reviews.Content: we will be going at the end of the month. But forgot to write about my past experience with this great place. Stayed for two nights and completely enjoyed it. Beautiful hotel,and casino. Has a gym and swimming pool , The customer service was excellent., The rooms are very spacious and have a kitchenette. It is at walking distance from the strip, but we actually got better luck playing at this casino. What I really like the most is that having stayed at so many different places in Vegas for the price this is by far a super deal. You are in Vegas, but you are at a clean, super comfortable place that offers entertainment, good food and a break from the super crowds that you always encounter in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with Plus Points....”
Reviews.Author: jettyman
Reviews.Content: After having had the first time in Vegas excitement staying in a large casino hotel many years ago, I came back last year with a first timer and stayed in the Mirage. Why do I mention this? I mention it because it makes you realise how good the Tuscany Suits are. I am a UK visitor so I always rent a car to combine my stay with a road trip and the Tuscany makes a perfect base for an active tourist. The plus points for me are; being 2 minutes from my car because there is no casino, shops and restaurants to walk past. The pool area has sun shades so you can relax and read in comfort. The clean single roomed suites are large and well appointed with fridges that are empty which you can actually use. The steak and egg breakfast with pancakes at Marilyn’s Café for $6.99 is extremely good value. The walk to centre strip is about the same distance and time from my last room in the Mirage on the 24th floor. These plus points coupled with the room rates plus resort fee they charge is why I choose to stay at the Tuscany Suites. I will soon be booking my 4th stay there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, comfortable rooms and a short walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: JazSaz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks break at the Tuscany and were pleasantly surprised by all it has to offer. The hotel is a 10 - 15 minute from the strip depending on how tired you are and how much your feet hurt! The rooms are huge and have everything you would expect. The room was spotlessly clean and tended to everyday, recently updated, the lobby areas were fantastic as well. The staff were generally very helpful and there were some real star players who gave exceptional service throughout the week. The casino and restaurants were great, a smaller casino than in the big strip resorts but it had all the same machines and tables as the strip but obviously in smaller quantities. The comps were excellent and the staff on the players club desk were great. We found the casino a great place to start before moving on to the bright lights of the strip. The restaurants were good, Marilyns was good for breakfasts and lunches, a small cafe also had a good range of breakfast options and sandwiches and salads for lunch. We ate at the garden restaurant one night and found this to be very pleasant and reasonably priced. All in all we found this to be a great resort, it isn't the strip but it would have cost us four or five times the price we paid to stay on the strip and with the amount of time spent in your room when visiting Vegas this seemed like a chance worth taking. Happily this paid off for us and meant we could have more money to spend on fun !

Reviews.Title: “Great 'off strip' place to stay”
Reviews.Author: newlydiate
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in 2007 & 2009. Its a few blocks away from the strip, great resort. Our first time we were really impressed, great sized rooms with a kitchen and eating area. We had just stayed in New York New York prior to that and the room we had there was very small, so this was great. When we returned in 2009 we had just come from Agua Caliente in Rancho Mirage CA, were the room there was very modern, so we felt the room this time around was quite dated (our personal thoughts). We were given a room in block H room 314 which had a small balcony, however this was invaded by pigeons and their mess!! It wasn't safe or hygienic to go out there, we had a member of staff come and take a look, and he agreed, so we were moved to block G room 303 which also had a small clean balcony with a pool view. We enjoyed eating at Marylin's cafe within the hotel, we loved the casino, less crowded then the casino's on the strip. I recommended this hotel to my parents on their first trip to Vegas and they loved it. We have enjoyed staying here, but we wouldn't stay again, because we like to try out new places and we have spoiled ourselves by staying in some luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Equitem
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here in Summer 2010 for a few days (although this review page only lets me enter as far back as December 2010). We were on our way to visit friends in California. I was unsure about booking at a less expensive low-rise hotel instead of the mega resorts, but we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious with two large bed and a sitting area with couch and chairs. There was a table for eating and a small kitchenette. The furnishings were not the latest nor the most expensive but everything worked and was clean. Parking was close to the room. The restaurants were good and there were slips for reductions on some meals. Once great convenience was the kiosk for reduced price tickets to the major productions and shows in the area. There are only two such kiosks on The Strip and one of them is here. The only thing I found a bit unpleasant was that some sections of the public area had the smell of cigarette smoke. It was not overwhelming but evident. Travel is best with a car. Although it is near The Strip, walking distances are considerable. Overall, I don't know if I will ever get back to Las Vegas again, but if I do, I would stay at Tuscany without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: mrswendeler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night in July 2011. It was pretty good, we book online and paid only 20$ for the night (plus resort fee - which is standard). Our room had: 2 queen beds, a huge bathroom, a kitchenette, and a living room area. The location was awesome, it was near everything, 2 blocks from the strip. Overall A++

Reviews.Title: “Very good option”
Reviews.Author: Whitewater49
Reviews.Content: If I ever take a family trip to Las Vegas this will be my hotel of choice hands down. The double queen room we had in the A wing was very spacious and clean. The location of the property being off strip results in a quieter less in your face atmosphere. The service was polite and friendly. I didn't eat here or visit the casino area so I can't speak for those but as far as the rooms go this could not be beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best mid-week”
Reviews.Author: Kolob64
Reviews.Content: The mid-week prices are very low and the rooms are huge. The weight room was very nice and clean. It had all the basics. There is a lap pool free of sunbathers for serious swimmers. I did not bother to eat int he restaurants as my family had prior and they are standard American processed junk. If you like chain restaurants, eat in, otherwise there are far better elsewhere. We got most of our food from a nearby Whole Foods Market. the rooms were very clean. It is too expensive for us on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Year After Year!”
Reviews.Author: Eric34328
Reviews.Content: I like to go to Vegas at least once a year, and when I do I stay at the Tuscany. The grounds are impeccable and the rooms are large suites with full kitchenettes. Since it is 2 blocks south of the strip, you will not have all the noise if you want to sleep. The restaurants on the grounds are all excellent and you will receive coupons upon checkin to use for meals or gaming. If you decide to go to a show or the strip, you are still within walking distance, no hassles trying to park the car. Service is great and everyone is really friendly. You will find that the rooms are all well kept but the bathroom fans are loud because they are high speed. You will need ear plugs if you are one to read. Fitness room was being renovated when we were there. Free WiFi in Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10975WestCoast
Reviews.Content: We (couple in our 30's) stayed in this hotel for 5 days (Fri to Wed). We really enjoyed this property and recommend it to those who want to stay off the strip but still very close. This property is very quiet and I found the grounds to be a sanctuary from the strip. We also enjoyed the on site breakfast place : Marilyn's Cafe - it was fast, good food, great service, and really affordable. I would also recommend renting a car. We rented one on Hotwire for $20 a day and I had no idea how easy it would be to park all over Vegas, even right on the strip. Parking is FREE! We used the car to get off the strip a lot and head out to Hoover Dam, to the big Primm shopping mall 45 minutes away, and to go to the North Vegas outlet malls. All in all this was our best trip out of the 3 that we've taken to Vegas because this hotel was such a nice sanctuary to go back to and because our car provided so much more freedom to explore southern Nevada.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaytew
Reviews.Content: The suite is spacious, clean and easily accessible. If hiring a car you can park near your suite for easy access (unlike other strip hotels where the walk from car to room is long!! Short walk to strip, great value food and drinks. Friendly helpful staff, great amenities. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a hotel in Vegas to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: gwaping
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas for 9 days. from Oct. 5 till the 13th. The reviews were true about the rooms. They are big and well kept except for the tissue rolls that wasn't change in the bathroom. In addition. The room has also a fridge, a coffee maker and a microwave which can be requested with no additional cost. The T.V. was old-fashioned like a tube T.V. I think it's time to buy an LCD t.v. since may people are staying here. For sure they have already earned enough money to buy a t.v. Thirdly, I do not like the couch because when I slept on the couch for a few hours after walking around the strip for the whole day, my skin on my thighs became itchy. I think the couches aren't thoroughly cleaned and disinfected. I felt like there were bugs in the couch. I also love the prompt service of the operator. When I asked for a no disturbed sign, they were able to provide it in a few minutes. However, for the security personnel, I just don't like the way they interrogated me about asking to open the laundry because it's already closed. Come and think of it! the laundry room is small to accommodate hundreds of guests plus one of the machines wasn't working! And please extend the laundry hours to accommodate thousands of guests. Also be considerate I stayed there for 9 days! Anyways, I like the gym, too. Though it's small, it's well-kept. Regarding the pool, it's small. Not the one you see in the website. I was wondering why they don't change the picture of the pool on their website as well as on their brochure when you get to the hotel desk.The crew at the hotel desk were so helpful especially those Filipinos who works there. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay at the hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “oasis in the desert, walkable to the strip”
Reviews.Author: 12feettobend
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews and available information, hotel quality can be evasive. Not so here. I researched this property, based on the guidelines for a group. All information provided ahead of time was right on. Individually and collectively all our group members were very favorably pleased with our stay. I arrived mid/late evening and was warmly greeted and checked in without any problems. I knew in advance about the "security deposit" that would be held - either by cc or cash - for the duration of my stay. I was aware of the "resorts fee" added per night and the additional fee's for wifi. Always ask.... "what else should I know about this (any) property, that I don't know about now? Will there be any unexpected surprises? Informed as a traveller to be enables you to assess whether or not the property is a good match for you. My room was on the ground floor, facing into the pool area, with a small patio, and at the end of the building. The room was spacious, clean, without strange smells, odors, or coverup perfumes. Full closet, with hangers, iron and a small safe - which in order to use requires a $25.00 deposit. It is located near the floor, so anyone with physical constraints or unflexible mobility, will grumble to use if they need it. Bathroom, clean, and appointed with all the right ammenities. Wonderful shampoo here too! There are numerous lamps and wall lighting throughout the room. My room was missing a couple lightbulbs - probably not replaced in a while- but I didn't spend lots of time in my room reading either - so really wouldn't have missed them if I hadn't looked. The a/c unit was louder than I prefer, but certainly worked well and I would have been unhappy without it on those 90 + days. A small bar sink, refrig and coffeemaker also made the room a great bargain. All coffee services provided these days at mid range ish priced properties are awful - a pitiful packet of coffee etc... I plan accordingly and bring my own! Coffee, filters, and sugar and with a refrig, milk or half/half etc. Suits me well and I don't have to race anywhere for my first cup! I was pleased at the relative quietness of the room given its proximity to the pool. I did hear outside noises, but minimal and not invasive. If I left the door/window open - facing the pool area I could certainly hear all the pool activity. Acceptable, even with kids. the layout of the buildings - numerous, 3 level garden style buildings - allows for pleasant walking throughout the property. Parking for cars is convenient too. The public areas, lobby, walkways to restuarants etc were also clean, and well lit. Nothing extravagant, nor shabby either. Upon my arrival, several of us noticed a very pungent unpleasant smell - outside a section of our (G) building and slightly behind the restuarant - it disappeared within a day or so, either the trash not being picked up issue, or perhaps a lawn/plant feeding emulsion..... otherwise the exterior grounds were very nice and well attended. The bar area was lively in the evening, with a decent band and plenty of activity. The restuarants were busy, and the food and service as expected. Pricing seems to be in line with other similar types of locations and the coupons - given at check in from the hotel - allowed for some pricing discounts that we managed to take advantage of and were appreciated. In addition to the large pool area - a smaller lap pool was available thru the fitness center. Clean, towels provided and quiet and tucked away from the road as well. The finess center had numerous machines and equipment just awaiting use. It was also staffed and had a small massage facility. This building also appeared clean, without unwelcome odors. Room key cards required for controlled access. About a 10 -15 minute walk from the strip - depending on the time of day and traffic to cross the streets. IF I have any negative comments here - here they are - the sidewalks as you walk to/from the strip are narrow for 3 or more abreast to walk. The sidewalks and streets are filthy, littered with an amazing assortment of trash and broken glass - and yet when you get adjacent to the strip - clean and almost pristine. Numerous types of folk walking or waiting for the bus along this section, but I walked it in a group during the day and even alone late at night - without personal trepidation or fear. Perhaps this will be addressed by the city - I'm not certain the hotel can specifically do much about it for now. On a closing note, I wouldn't hesitate to stay again - if I were returning to 'vegas: the staff was friendly and helpful and not intrusive. Since I researched the location ahead of time I had the opportunity to talk with hotel personnel, and they too were pleasant and helpful. Others in my group were pleased with their "casino" experience at the hotel. I fully appreciated the quiet and low key atmosphere of the property day and night. There were guests of all ages and with kids, so the appeal for this type of property, close to the strip but not in the midst of it all is a welcome change - even if not especially in Las Vegas! NO regrets here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret In Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times. I usually find the best room rates through Hotels.com. Prices mid-week are fantastic! If you watch you can get rooms for around $30/night. There is a $13/night resort fee. The rooms are very spacious. The largest I've seen in Vegas. They have newly remodeled the rooms and they are very well done. They give you 2 for 1 coupons for entrees in their restaurants, which is a steal! They have great breakfasts in Marilyn's restaurant. You are just a few blocks from the strip. You can walk it, however I prefer to drive and leave my car with a valet. ($1 tip and you're good to go.) The pool and hot tub are nice. Very relaxing. This is a great resort! I'll be back again soon! Don't pass this place up! We love it! Taxi from Airport for 2 of us cost $15.00. (Less going back.)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable base for seeing Vegas at a great value.”
Reviews.Author: mervie357
Reviews.Content: A group of us guys took rooms here while in Vegas for Bikefest. The value for this hotel was excellent and as we wanted to avoid the "walk of shame" back to our rooms through a casino hotel on the Strip this was the perfect option. Tuscany is a large property made up of over 6 buildings with multiple parking lots so you're never parked far from your building. The location of the hotel is convenient to the Strip, though you're not on it; it would take about 10 minutes to walk to the Strip. It's a very clean, well maintained property, so much so that you'll be surprised at the relatively low rates. On site there is a small market that's got a great variety of products including snacks, drinks, collectibles and toiletries. I was really impressed with the gym and lap pool. There are also laundry facilities on site so you don't have to deal with exorbitant hotel laundry charges. The rooms are large. After all, they are suites. If you request it at check-in they will provide you with a microwave free of charge. As some have mentioned, the TVs are the old large boxes (CRTs). In the bathroom you get both a stand-up shower and a bathtub. Just 2 negative comments to make. Wifi in the room is expensive at $14 per day; I just got a prepaid microsim for my iPad from AT&T, which will cost you $15 or $25 for 1 month. Also you will have to pay a resort fee on top of the room charges which covers all the nice surroundings, pools, free wifi in public areas, etc. The resort fee is around $14 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay”
Reviews.Author: The-lady-is-a-pilot
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at Tuscany Oct 11-15th. Great as usual. Marilyns, Cantina and Gardens had very good food at reasonable prices. Room clean and upgraded. Friendly staff. We are purely recreational gamblers so we enjoyed the smaller casino and generous comps. We rent a car because we travel to Red Rock or tour the hills, so distance from strip not an issue. We would not stay anywhere else! Thanks again. Good job! Hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “What's that smell?”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Mingle
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and all seem to be recently remodeled BUT the sewer smell in the parking lot, the shower, and the second floor "hospitality" room (at the end of the hall just before you enter the ballrooms) almost took my breath away! I've gotten used to the newer technology in televisions such as flat panel/high definition and it would be a nice addition to the rooms. I had a wonderful pizza from Marilyns.

Reviews.Title: “clean big room”
Reviews.Author: bobby b
Reviews.Content: very nice room clean, friendly . great location. easy parkng and nice pool. lobby hans nice decore

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: barakdf
Reviews.Content: its a great value for big suites but its not cheap to take a taxi everytime to the strip

Reviews.Title: “Nice but average”
Reviews.Author: katiesparties
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times and I do like it. Clean, nice but this last time I did not have a great experience. They put me in a suite which was great, but everytime someone was walking by the room or in the room upstairs from us it was so loud when I told them the next morning of me not getting any sleep they told me I should have called them last night so they could have security go up and tell them to be quiet. My response was they were not partying it was just them walking to the bathroom was very loud. The room cost me $75 well it was suppose to be found out it was $85 so i have to call them about that. and they gave me a $20 comp on my room....really??? I stayed there for 5 nights they could have done something more. Not to mention the manager was rather rude on the phone with me. I was at this hotel for business for possibly bringing them a large conference next year. This experience with the Manager was the reason I say no.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing change of pace in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: genemean
Reviews.Content: Tuscany was a great choice for me. I don't like 1000-5000 room hotels. This charming spread out complex over multiple acres was nice. You are about 4 blocks from the Strip. Definitely 3 1/2 stars. There have a bunch of 3 story buildings and your car is never far away. No long hikes to and through a parking garage. The room felt as though it was new even though built 9 years ago. The only thing to give it away was the old time TV. Think Embassy Suites but much bigger room with the little kitchen and eating space. Beware though of the "resort fee" of $12.75 per day which is added to your bill when you leave. If you arrive before 2pm there is another $10.00 fee for early arrival.

Reviews.Title: “best comps in vegas”
Reviews.Author: davg35
Reviews.Content: the las vegas review journal has voted this casino as the best slot club in las vegas,it aint wrong,comps are very generous after 4 days play of which i had 2 $200 wins on video poker and slots i got $41 back b4 i left.i also got 3 dips in a tombola 1 prize was $100 cash the next $15 free slot play the last was $10 free slot play.excellent.cocktail service is by far the best i have ever witnessed in a vegas casino and i`ve been in a few,u are hardly finished a drink and the girl is back again and very nice too. to the accomodation,they call it a suite but its really just a big room,with a fridge and sink and nothing else and i mean nothing,no cutlery,plates ,u get an iron a ironing board and in room safe,thats it!rooms were clean ,bathroom was clean and just a nice size,ac unit in my room was very noisy but a necessity.be warned though,there are 3 floors to a block if u get a ground floor u can hear a pin drop and i had people checkin out at 2 am then the next lot checkin in at 4am the next day, just my luck.i would suggest askin for a 3rd floor room.pool was lovely and plenty of room.restaurants-marilyns was very slow for service and i didnt think the food was great,tried the mexican 2 years ago it was good then ,didnt go this time,resort fees?whatever u do dont connect to internet in your room after your $10 daily resort fee they will lump another $13.99 PER DAY onto your bill just for connecting to the net,u can do it for free in any public area,be aware!all in all for what u pay its pretty good value and a good 10 min walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and safe for women”
Reviews.Author: Doris96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little walk from the Strip - but doable and close to the Belagio and other high end hotels. If you take the bus, the 202 will take you back and forth on E Flamingo Rd right to the front door of the hotel. Take any bus on the Strip - they all go up and down as far as you want to go. The prices are reasonable for food at the hotel. Their is security is tops and it is not obvious unless you decide to look for it. They have bike patrol, foot patrol and a vehicle. As two women (50+ yrs) we always felt safe. There is a 7-11 and gas station nearby filled with snacks etc (5 minute walk). The hotel itself is more than a 3 star - it's beautiful and the suites are well decorated and the beds very comfy, the kitchenette portion is not functional. The small stove has been disabled and the cupboards are bare. The cupboard drawers are not useable as they are completely off kilter. There is a small useful fridge and a one cup coffee maker. The coffee is supplied. The pool area is beautiful and the hot tub is blissful. The rooms are very quiet except for a bit of noise on Fri/Sat night which is okay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shaharke
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the room was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: JimN51
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tuscany at least nine times in the last three years. I go there for a business meeting at a location near the Tuscany and there are at least two of us on each trip. The room have always been clean and comfortable. The discount coupons received at check-in have greatly reduced expenses. The meals at the Tuscany restaurants have always been very good and there is a good selection of items. My feelings have been echoed by the others who travel with me. Until our meeting place changes we will continue to stay at the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenquine09
Reviews.Content: An excellent place to stay in Las Vegas, not too far from the strip. The rooms are huge with the biggest bed I have ever seen, well maintained, spotlessly clean and have the added bonus of having a fridge and coffee maker in the room. There is gym, spa, pool and a lap pool which I used for sunbathing as hardly anyone was ever there! It just meant that I had to lie on the ground as opposed to having a sun lounger but it felt like I had the whole area to myself! There are laundry facilities, a mexican restaurant, italian restaurant, piazza bar and the bar and cafe in the casino. The cafe is open 24 hours and the food is really good. The staff were nice (the only problem I had was with the barman in the casino bar who ignored me for about 10 minutes to serve everyone else). Considering it only cost £284 for 10 nights it was amazing value for money. I would recommend Tuscany Suites to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay right off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dort1960
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas stayed at the Tuscany, it is off the strip. It has its own casino and wonderful restaurants. The mexican restaurant makes home made tortillas every day, the american restaurant has a breakfast special that is awesome for the price. A great lap pool separte from the main pool. The bus will pick you up in front of the hotel and will take you to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; good location; will be back!”
Reviews.Author: bobbyrs
Reviews.Content: This is a great find- we timed our first walk to the strip (12 minutes and you come out between Bally's and the Flamingo/Bills) - with nothing like Strip prices. The suites are big, clean and comfortable; great pool area- never too packed; well maintained grounds; a range of decent places to eat. We found the staff to be very helpful and overall the hotel has a really relaxed and friendly feel about it. The only slight issue was the air conditioning unit in the room which was very noisy. This is our fourth trip to vegas and our fourth hotel- we'll definitely stay in the Tuscany again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! NO evidence of bedbugs in my room”
Reviews.Author: Marci L
Reviews.Content: Tuscany suites was a great place to stay. It was clean and the rooms look exactly like what is shown on the website. The lobby is great and checking and out was very easy. It is not on the strip but is an easy walk to Flamingo and LV BLVD. The grounds are really well maintained as well as the hallways. The only negative was that the tv and some of the furniture were outdated but neither of these mattered since I didn't spend much time in the room anyhow and definitely did not need to watch television. Just of particular note, I am very afraid of bed bugs so I took apart both beds in the room down to the bed rails and found absolutely no evidence of bugs in my room. They even have mattresses that have tops that are easily removed which allowed us to look under the mattress top. While we were doing that I took note that the back of the bed, carpeting, baseboards, etc were all immaculately clean and well maintained. The picture frame over the bed and the head board cannot be removed to look for bugs so we just pulled the bed far enough away from the wall so that it was not in contact with the head board. The room was so large that there was plenty of room to move the bed. Great overall stay, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Re: No Response”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: We finally received our $300.00 that we were charged for a chipped mirror, after filling out a claims report. We never heard from a representative from the Hotel, but saw a credit applied to our credit card. Thank goodness! A word of advise, take pictures of your Hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: DanW725
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a whole week for a conference which was at Caesars Palace. Overall, I think the Tuscany is extremely good value for money. It's very clean, the rooms are massive, the beds are comfortable. In addition, due to its off strip location the attached casino is very well priced - drinks are less than half the price they are on the strip, food is cheaper and table minimums are less. If you plonk yourself at the bar and put a small amount of cash into the video poker machine and make a token effort to play, your drinks get comped down to $1.25 each or less - try getting that deal in the Bellagio. Very nice pool, very nice gym (including a separate lap pool). Nice well kept grounds - there really is a lot to like about this place. Downsides - my room was next to the elevator and you can hear a hum when it goes up and down. Not obnoxiously so, but still, I'd advise asking for a room away from the elevator....this being Vegas the thing is up and down all hours of the night. Other slight downside as mentioned by many is that the staff are generally a grumpy old bunch, both in the casino and the front desk. Again nothing to really get hung up about considering the value of the place. I see in these reviews some complaints about the resort fee. It is pretty well advertised on the website, so really people ought to know about it before they go. Even with the fee the room rate is still very competitive. All the big fancy hotels also have resort fees, often much than the $14 here. Another complaint I can see reading these reviews is that some people are complaining about the distance from the strip.....c'mon, really? In this day of google maps you should know exactly how far it is and if you are too lazy/disorganized to walk/use the bus, they pay 4x the price and stay on the strip. A tip - if you walk briskly, it takes about 5 minutes to get to Ballys, you can then go inside and walk rest of the way to the strip inside the casino (i.e. out of the hot sun, in the the air con and with the moving walkways etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaBec
Reviews.Content: We booked our room directly 1/2 hour before arrival. Got a really good price, as it was during the week. Request King non-smoking, since it wasn't available at check in, we were upgraded. Huge giant suite. very clean, w/refrigerator & wet bar. separate shower, bath, & toilet. Off the strip, but within walking distance, which is what we wanted. Don't have to walk through casino to get to room. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never”
Reviews.Author: tfitt1
Reviews.Content: Hi - we stayed at the Tuscany Suites in June this year and I must say for the money we were very impressed. The rooms were large and very clean - the only negative was the kitchen area - not so much as a spoon, only a coffee maker (no good for UK tea drinkers - luckily i took my travel kettle and 2 cups), no hotplate/microwave so not really a kitchen just some cupboads with a sink!! This didnt spoil things as I dont go on holiday to cook but a few basic things like some cutlery, cups and glasses would've been nice. The cafe was great, even the take-outs and the internet access in the business suite was very easy to use and I didnt think it expensive. Only a 10 minute walk to the strip and only 5 to Ellis Island - excellent food & drink at cheap prices you wouldnt believe. I would definately stay here again - excellent value for money and close enough to the strip without being in the thick of it. The staff were all very helpful and polite - overall a great stay

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: nancyang03
Reviews.Content: Room and restroom were HUGE, nice and clean.The entire hotel/property was HUGE. Room came with a kitchenette and living space (couch, coffee table etc), which the boyfriend and I didn't use. The room was so big there was a lot of open space. No complaints though. Good amount of restaurants to choose from. The Mexican restaurant was good and the only one we had the time to try. Quiet hallways. All that room would be great for a larger group, say uh, a bachelorette party? :) Not too long of a walk to the strip. I'd say one street over. I'd stay there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, rubbish front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: snowboardingmatt
Reviews.Content: We checked in late at night after a long flight and the hotel didn't have a record of our reservation. The hotel spent half an hour trying to find the booking before confirming they definitely didn't have it (during this half an hour we sat and observed the lady on front desk being rude to various customers). I then had to call the travel agent (myself) and find out what had gone wrong. They called the hotel straightened it out but we had to prompt the lady on front desk to actually check us in now and give us a room key! Not the kind of service you want after a long flight, followed by a long drive at 3 am! Otherwise the room was nice and spacious, not too far from the strip. Breakfast in the casino was good also.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, great ambiance / design...”
Reviews.Author: DGaige
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and was pleasantly surprised at the value. The entire hotel has a great design and feel to it in terms of exterior and interior decor; everything is done tastefully, devoid of the all-too-common garishness of Vegas. The rooms are spacious and adequate; after all, how often is anyone really in their rooms for any length of time in Vegas, anyway?? The staff was friendly and helpful with all my needs and, in fact, due to needing a late checkout, and due to the days I was staying there, pointed out how charging an extra day actually saved me some money instead of choosing a late checkout option. Pretty awesome they did that, because they certainly didn't have to. I'd happily stay here again and, in fact, plan to.

Reviews.Title: “No Response”
Reviews.Author: Charlene W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel in general was clean, our room average, exactly what you pay for when you don't stay on the strip. The problem; being charged $300.00 for a crack in the mirror which was already their when we checked in to our room. The lesson to be learned; take pictures of your room with the date clearly evident, the day you arrive. The disappointment; after filling out the forms disputing the charge, being told someone would contact us within 24 hours, no one even bothered. One Hotel we will never stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff brings this hotel down”
Reviews.Author: sammartin09
Reviews.Content: Pros: okay location (get a bus pass- best deal in Vegas), pretty hotel, fab landscaping, good restaurants, great sized rooms! Cons: ZERO customer service skills, broken toilet, broken front door, broker shower door, broken hair dryer, broken keycards, small casino with very, very few table games, no poker until the weekend. Very thin floors. Heard every movement and squeak from upstairs. Mikal checked us in and was rude and indifferent and unapologetic when the rooms we booked (and already paid for) were unavailable. Reported the broken toilet to Jose who said, "So? Did you want us to fix it? Now!?" Yes. Yes I did. But it remained broken for all five days. Housekeeping walked in, unannounced, to replenish coffee seconds after I had finished changing clothes and my sister-in-law continually had to get her keycards reprogrammed so she could get into her room. Inconvenient considering our rooms were a quarter of a mile away from the front desk. We will not go back and we will not be recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Inexpensive!”
Reviews.Author: srtreat83
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 4 times and I have always wanted to try this hotel.. but the first 3 times I chose not too. I just couldn't imagine the hotel being as nice as it looked for the price they ask. Finally, we stayed here for 4 nights on my last trip to Vegas and I was not disappointed! First off, we arrived at 8am. I called ahead to ask about early check in. We were able to use early-check-in after 9 am for only 13 dollars. A heck of a deal! The hotel staff at the front desk was very friendly.They answered all questions we had. The restaurant TUSCANY GARDENS was GREAT food and NOT that expensive! Service and atmosphere there was great too. The pool is beautiful and we really enjoyed swimming/sunbathing there. The rooms were gorgeous. The beds were big! and you actually get a SUITE! There is a kitchenette and living/sitting area! Tuscany Suites is located closer to the middle of the strip (where the action is) than many other hotels that are on the north part of the strip. (Riviera, Circus Circus) So even though you aren't on the strip, you are still close the many of the major hotels (MGM, NYNY, etc) The price we paid was well worth what we got.

Reviews.Title: “The Maxim ACES-V Review of Tuscany Suites”
Reviews.Author: Maxim_LV
Reviews.Content: The Maxim ACES-V Review - Accommodations: This is where Tuscany shines. The rooms are wonderful and large and include mini-fridge units, separate sink, stove top and coffee maker. There is a table, a nice couch, end table, coffee table, dresser, television and a/c, of course. (4/5) Cleanliness: Just splendid. (5/5) Extras: Soap, shampoo, conditioner. There's a safe in the room. A coffee maker (no decaf for those who don't like to get wired, though). Wi-Fi only available for free in lobby, otherwise is $13.99/day (insane). There is a fitness center which is quite large but doesn't use much of the space. There are weights up to 50 pounds, a "lap pool" which is only about the size of one lane (outdoors), and some machines that are decent. Only one treadmill works of the two they have, so you may not be able to get your run in during the summer when you want to run indoors, unless you wait a bit. (4/5) Service: The set-up for check-in is a bit cumbersome. The area is small and this place can get quite busy, so you end up standing in an area that is inundated with people and their luggage. (4/5) Value: This place is a tremendous value and is highly suggested to all. Short trip to the Strip if you want to go there, but this place has it all. It isn't a huge casino, but if you just want some slots or a friendly dealer at a table game, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL DEFINITELY GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: Sheishaburger
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Tuscany. Would recommend it to anyone. The Tuscany is about a 5 minute from the LV Strip. We found that the hotels on the strip were always noisy and crouded. There was no where to go to get a break from the crouds. But at the Tuscany we had that piece and quiet. The staff were always smiling and friendly, the restaurants have amazing food. Can not complain about any of the meals. We especially enjoyed the "graveyard" steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $3.99. The rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Several things don't work here anymore.”
Reviews.Author: go4ittttt
Reviews.Content: Remote, blow dryer and room keys did not work at all. Had to get security to let me in each time. Left something important behind and the maids did not turn it in. This used to be a great value, but what a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Just far enough away”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel if you dont want to be too close to the hustle and bustle. It is a comfortable walk to the centre of the activity on LV Boulevard, but just far enough away if you need a bit of quiet. The facilities are good, the room spacious, Particularly for those staying for more than a few days. As it is only three levels high, you did not have the feel of a large hotel. Ther grounds were a pleasure to strole through. Only downside. The Gym did not have enough equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Near enough to be cheap, not near enough to be cool.”
Reviews.Author: tl8153
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a trade show in January and wanted to cut cost so that I could spend a little more on shopping rather than just a bed and luggage storage. Arrived at 3 am and was checked in immediately. The room was gigantic, and I'd recommend it to anyone with small kids who need space. As with most properties in Vegas, it's a bit like being in a time capsule, with most of the hotel's furniture, decor and amenities averaging at least 10-15 years old. That said, it was very well maintained, and the toiletries were of the very decent sort. The casino too was not as smoky as most others on the Strip. If it's a rainy day and you plan to stay indoors, better get some books cause the TV channel selection sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel: mixing Vegas' Strip and paradise”
Reviews.Author: al2cand
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at Tuscany and we couldn't have asked for a better place. We didn't rent a car and were able to go everywhere easily, being only 10min away from main strip center hotels (Bellagio,Caesar,Mirage,NY NY, PH). To reach Downtown one only needs to buy a bus ticket or pay cash directly to the driver's machine, bus passing each 5-10min. The pool area is unmatched even compared to famous beach clubs around the strip. We felt just as if we were in Dominican Republic, 'italian style'. The casino is calm and friendly, with good restaurants. Rooms are spacious, clean and offer refrigerator, sink, desk, sofa, free wifi in lobby If you are looking for a 'wild', 'sexy & glamour' hotel to stay, this is not your best bet. If you are looking to mix your trip with a 'caribbean' atmosphere with the immediate proximity to most famous strip hotels, restaurants, casinos then the odds are with you. good trip, good luck

Reviews.Title: “SNEAKY FEES”
Reviews.Author: Osobad
Reviews.Content: I would advise anyone going to Las Vegas to always read the fine print and better yet call the hotels directly and ask questions. The room rate looked great but the devil was in the details.. After the room rate you have to add another$14.56, resort fee. These fees are very typical in Las Vagas so you have watch closely to see what you get for them. In this case the answer was not much. If you wanted internet access in your room it was another $13.00 per day. Not per stay but per day. The biggest surprise however came at checkout when we discovered that anytime you charged something to your room, which is what my husband does when ever he is on business for record keeping, they added a $3.00 surcharge for the privelage. So each meal was price of food, tip, and then another $3.00. We have literally traveled the world and never have I seen this charge. Understand this was not for room service, simply for charging you resturant meal to your room. Vegas is notorious for these fees. BUYER BEWARE The intenet fees seem to be everywhere but I have now found some where it is included in you Resort Fee. Do your homework.

Reviews.Title: “Always a winner with these rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: With rates the way they are these days - getting a room with 650 Sq. ft that is absolutely spotless - without having to walk 8 miles to the casino - is a real treat. Check-in is always under 8 minutes for us - getting to our room isn't a 3 mile hike - its a pleasure as the grounds are very well kept and its QUIET here! If you haven't checked out the Tuscany in the past - put it on your list of 'must check out' hotels while you're in town Their cafe always has some GREAT food specials that we always take advantage of

Reviews.Title: “It's No Strip Hotel, but For $29, You Can't Beat It!”
Reviews.Author: robd1302
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in August. It was the second time I had stayed here for the same conference. It's not on the strip, and the rooms are a bit tired, but overall, it's really a nice hotel, with good restaurants, a nice pool, and huge rooms. In August, it's only $29 a night on weekdays, which really makes it a no-brainer. It's only a block or two from the strip, but in Vegas, that means a 20-minute walk. If you don't want to walk, a cab to the Flamingo cost me $5, and then you're right in the middle of everything.. The Mexican restaurant in the casino was very good, the conference facilities are nice, and the staff is friendly. I spent most of my free time at the strip hotels, and it's easy to think "I wish my hotel were this fancy", but it's really not worth it to me to spend 2-3 times the price for a smaller room on the strip. If I go back to Vegas for non-business travel, there is a very good chance I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in all the chaos”
Reviews.Author: MontrealGeorge
Reviews.Content: Tropical paradise! Very inexpensive for what you get. Huge room, nice amenities. Suite had sitting area for eating, couch, chair, large tv, large bathroom, fridge. It's quiet, away from the strip but not too far. Approx 10 min walk to all the action. Marilyn's restaurant was awesome. Everything you need is right at the hotel. Really enjoyed the stay here, would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: MUC_PUC
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort-like hotel, 10 min walk from the middle of the strip (Bellagio, Caesars, Paris). Big rooms with nice bathroom, very good beds, enough space to sit and relax. Very nice pool and good food offers in the restaurants. Coffeemashine and big refridgerator in the room. Kitchenette is there, but not in use (no disehes, no Microwave etc.). Internet in Lobby and restaurants for free, but has to be paid in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not sure it should be #53 hotel in Vegas though”
Reviews.Author: stogamom
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here on a Friday night before catching a flight home to Philly on Sat. I needed an inexpensive, large place for my family with a pool. We had already been in Vegas for 3 days earlier in our trip, so we we fine being off the strip. This place was fine for our needs. The front desk staff was good. The lobby was pretty, but filled with smokers (I hate smoke, and have allergies and asthma, and I realize Vegas is not smoke free...) The room was huge, but the furniture was a bit dated (the wood looked like it should have been in a cabin). No sofa bed, no free breakfast. Clean carpet. The bathroom was also huge, clean and new. Very nice. The kitchen is more of a wet bar. Sink and mini fridge and that's it. (We had earlier stayed at the Desert Rose, which had a fully stocked kitchen with a stove, full sized fridge, dishwasher and dinner ware, etc. They also have a big free breakfast). The casino is really depressing (we don't gamble). It's attached to at least 1 of the restaurants and the smoke wafts into the dining area. The food is ok, eating there once with the pizza coupom (BOGO), was fine. The waitress was horrible. The pool is nice and very clean. They provide plenty of towels. A waitress comes by to take drink and food orders. Lots of drinking going on but no one was obnoxious. For me, the crowd was a bit odd in that 80% of the group were smokers and covered in tattoos. I heard one person at the pool say "I've never seen so many people smoking in a pool" that about sums it up. For one night, I'd have been ok with the place. But we soon found out that our flight was cancelled due to Irene. Long story short, we ended up staying until Tuesday, which was not in our plans or budget. We were able to get additional nights on Hotwire for $30 a night, plus the $13 resort fee. A great deal for a huge room and pool access. But... as I got to spend more time here, I got a weird vibe. The place seems abandoned in some way. The lobby is dead. The place has no atmosphere, althought the lobby, pool area, patios, and plantings are beautiful. They have a bar and a band, but again, dead. I think people stay there for the rate, and that's it. There place has no personality. That just struck me as odd. I think the #53 rating is misleading as it's probably based on price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and frankly very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: DrRichARD1969
Reviews.Content: 7 day stay in the August heat, and overall rate this hotel very highly indeed. Probably about 5 minutes walk from the Strip, which makes it convenient enough if you want to see the bright lights, but also means its more peaceful on those nights when you don't. Very large room with wet bar, dining table and good sized living area. Clean and comfortable, with good standards of customer service throughout the stay. Small(ish) pool, and not the place to be if you want lazy rivers or wave machines, but the compensation is (again) peace and quiet and room to breathe. Casino is decent sized and pleasant if thats your thing - dining options include a basid diner type setting, a mexican restaurant, and a more upscale italian. All of them were very good, and, by using the coupons distributed at check-in, amazingly cheap for the quality and portion control on offer. Really, other than not receiving quite the requested room allocation, this is an exceptionally tiday little place which is close to the heart of the action - for the price, I'd say its a steal, and would recommmend it without reservation for those who don't mind being slightly off strip.

Reviews.Title: “If you want A huge, clean room, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: firebird22
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not right on the strip (about three blocks from it), we loved it! The room was huge and very nice. We did have a water drip in the bathtub, but it did not bother us if we shut the door. I loved the huge walk in shower! We ate two meals at the casino, and the food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly. I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jdmrent
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Tuscany based on price and location to strip.We didnt book the hotel to spend time in the room or attached casino. Pro's Location to the strip Large clean room small fridge to store food, snacks and water attached casino small pool onsite Con's small pool not fancy not as many cabs waiting like strip hotels Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: liltippers82
Reviews.Content: Very nice, spacious room. Very comfortable bed! The bathroom had both a shower and a separate bathtub. Also had a soft in the room. About 3-4 blocks from the strip. The two complaints I have are there are so many different buildings and spread so far apart and the front desk is always too busy. At one a.m. when we checked in it took us over 30 minutes to get checked in. Then, the front desk clerk did not get the keys right so we drove all the way to our building, up the very slow elevator to our room, the keys would not work, had to drive all the way back to the lobby, stand in line for another 20 minutes to get new keys and finally get into our room. I understand that electronic keys do not always work, but they could have at least apologized and have a better check-in/check-out system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, off the strip but close enough”
Reviews.Author: chelley_23
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for basketball tournaments in the summer, but traveled here for a weekend getaway. The rooms are large, and clean. The staff was very helpful. We received a coupon book full of items to use during our stay at the hotel. The restaraunt food was great, We chose to stay off the strip, but the location of the hotel is great with a short walk to the strip. The property was nice and live bands were an added pleasure. Just an overall nice stay. The only down side was the business center, we wanted to check in early, and needed to print our boarding passes. Most hotels offer complimentary computer usage, unfortunately it was going to be expensive to use the hotel computers. However, they did make up for it by printing our boarding passes for us at the front desk which was great because it was at the time of check out. I recommend this hotel, we would certainly stay again and more than like will next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Britney C
Reviews.Content: his was my first time in Vegas and I had a ball. The hotel was the best choice made. They took very good care of us and the room were clean. If you plan on coming to Vegas, this is a good bargain and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: lilsorrel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tuscany with two other couples for 4 nights the last weekend of July. It was our first time staying at the Tuscany. It won't be our last. We really enjoyed staying here. The food at both Marilyns and Tuscany gardens was excellent. As was the service at both restaurants and throughout the Tuscany. My wife and I usually stay on the strip or owntown, and I must admit I didn't miss the crowds. We were only a short walk to the strip,and a cab ride away from downtown. I would have liked to see more table games open, nevertheless my wife did well playing the slots. If you choose the Tuscany you won't regret your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: biblthmp
Reviews.Content: Stayed from August 9th to 17th The room is very nice, and nice sized. The air conditioner works very well, in mid-summer. It is an exaggeration to call this room a suite, it is a really large studio. It is also an exaggeration to call the kitchenette a kitchenette. There is a refrigerator, and a small kitchen like sink. But there is no stove, or regular oven. There are no napkins, paper towels, cups, glasses, plates, or silverware. A microwave is available on request. It is a good value for the price, and located .6 miles east of the strip. There are 2 pools, one is clover-shaped, and ranges from 3 to 5 feet deep. There is also one that is rectangle shaped that they call their "lap" pool. There is a hot tub next to the clover-shaped pool, and there is a nice work-out gym next to the lap pool. The building I was in was undergoing remodeling while I was there, so occasionally the paint fumes were kind of strong in the hallway. If you book your room through Expedia, or Hotwire, the price you are charged does not include a $13/day plus tax resort fee, which works out to 14.56/day. If you want to use in-room wireless internet, there is a $14/day/laptop charge for that too.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carmensooki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Tuesday through Friday and it was the perfect location, not to close or far from the strip. Rooms in the H building are clean, spacious and close to the pool. Hotel is perfect for families because rooms are very spacious. Only down fall of this hotel is the resort fees they charge per night ($14.00 per day).

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to stay away from strip”
Reviews.Author: ronniegirl55
Reviews.Content: We took all the kids on this trip so we wanted a place away from strip but not extremely far. We got just what we wanted here. I really liked the apartment feel of it. You dont have to walk through a smokey casino to get to your room. The buildings are sectioned off. So there wasnt really any traffic of people coming and going. The rooms are very spacious almost like a studio. The whole setup was very accomodating. From the living area with the couch, coffee table and desk and chair. Also having the toilet seperate with its own door was a plus when traveling with multiple people. The sink was very much appreciated in the kitchen area. We didnt get to use the pool but it did look nice. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, huge room, right off strip”
Reviews.Author: Travelinpeeps
Reviews.Content: We got a great package deal with this hotel and blue man group. The grounds and hotel itself was very beautifully landscaped and nice looking. The room was spotless with new carpeting and a huge bathroom with a shower and tub. The room had a table with two chairs, a couch and chair with footrest, and a king bed. The bed looked lumpy, but it was very comfortable! It was the comforter that was lumpy. It didn't have that really refined designer look, but it was very nice. One huge bonus for me was that you could park your car right outside the door, then we took the elevator up, and there was our room! Some of the large hotel casinos require a mile walk just to get from your room to your car. The hotel had a very nice casino, and the restaurant, like the room, was clean and had good bones but could use a designer touch. The food was delicious! The service was the best we had anywhere in the three days we were there. They even gave us a 2 for 1 coupon to the restaurant on check-in. Like other reviewers mentioned, it was a nice quiet haven to relax in after the noise and bustle of the casinos. I will definitely go back! The kitchen area only had a coffee maker and a refrigerator, no microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Gymsan12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tuscany Hotel and Casino in June of 2011. We found the Tuscany to be a marvelous Hotel. The Tuscany is a block and a half away from the Strip. Just fine for my wife and me. The whole complex reminded me of a beautiful college campus with easy access to the various buildings. Check-in was a breeze. When we went to our room, we were very pleased to see how spacious it was and how clean as well. Included in the room is a refrigerator and coffee maker, no extra charge. There is also a comfortable couch to sit in while reading and very good lighting to go with that. You can have free wi-fi access in the lobby area of the hotel. While you are there, you are greeted and served by beautiful, professional servers. The casino is rather small but like all casinos, find the right machine at the right time and you can win some money. The restaurants are very good with good service and good food. We especially liked the casual Marilyn’s Café. The only real complaint I have is that, in our room, the AC was somewhat loud which affected my sleep. Other than that, I will definitely stay there again. If you watch the rates, this is a great value for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Casino. Nice and quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: seaexplorer
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and spacious. Their in house coffee shop is actually quite good, reasonably priced, and good portions. The casino is just plain bad. Nobody was winning anything. The machines are programmed very tight. The hotel is fine. The casino is not.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost!”
Reviews.Author: Travelaidy
Reviews.Content: Rates are low for a reason. Hidden fees abound as does bad attitude. One of their managers in particular, Tara Armstrong, aka "Tara-ist Armstronger," has no business in the hospitality business. She redefines its meaning to "hostility."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: f00tballgrrl
Reviews.Content: We booked online and got a great deal on this room, which was really spacious, well-maintained, clean, and nicely furnished. Staff was courteous, the bed was comfortable (great pillows!), and there were nice toiletries to use in the bathroom (none of the crappy tear-open packets of shampoo you sometimes get at other places). Most importantly, the air conditioner worked well and was quiet so we got some relief from the heat but were still able to sleep peacefully. We were actually just passing through rather than staying in Vegas, so I can't comment much on the location, but in terms of a nice, safe, clean place to stay, this was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean place! Much more for your $$!!”
Reviews.Author: Spud_Bud
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in August 2010 and finally getting around to writing this review. A friend mentioned this property to me when they were on their last trip to Vegas. They were actually staying at a different property and happened to be going by the Tuscany and went in to take a look....they were impressed....and so were we. The property is not on the strip, however it's only about 2 blocks from it....not a far walk at all. I couldn't get over the size of the room! Two double beds, a sitting area with sofa, large flat screen TV, a fridge, microwave and sink....the bathroom was big and CLEAN! The property had a nice pool in the back....even tho I'm not a pool person :) This property is well worth it, more than what I was expecting for the price....if you are budget conscious or not...this is the place....you'll definitely get a whole lot more than you pay for!! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay - still good but...”
Reviews.Author: reb2811
Reviews.Content: Three things that would improve my rating of this hotel: 1 Get rid of the 'resort fee' and increase the quoted price if necessary 2 Extend the wireless internet to the rooms and increase price if necessary 3 Make the points (comps) earned on the players club card easy to use/spend and explain how at check in. In spite of these three negatives (and they do annoy) it is a great place to stay, close to the strip, big rooms and good facilities. Good for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Better now except..............”
Reviews.Author: TSExpert
Reviews.Content: Written before and have stayed or dined here many times. They have begun completion of restoration of many of the buildings, and I'm impressed by the improvements, yet the value is still good. I'm afraid the casino is helping them pay for it. Not much fun to play slots here anymore. Food and beverages always good and always a good value, especially if you book on line on their site. They offer lots of goodies that way. One problem was we were expecting free drinks, as this was on our reservation, but they told us it was discontinued. I complained, got a form letter apolgizing, but would still prefer the drink coupons. I'd still go back to stay, and dine, but playing may not be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Fits The Bill Once Again (With A Few Hiccups)”
Reviews.Author: tony5969
Reviews.Content: My lady and I stay at the Tuscany every year for a week-long social convention and almost consider it a second home. Unfortunately the homecoming got off to a bit of a rocky start when my lady, who arrived a couple days early this time, found the bed to sag considerably on one side. After I arrived, we called housekeeping who replaced the bed with a brand new mattress and box spring. A later request to install an optional microwave was handled with enthusiasm if not quite efficiency as it turned out the first micro they brought in did not work. The only other complaint I would have about the room involves the AC unit. When it was on, it took off like a jet as it drowned out the TV and any easy conversation. When it stopped, the cooling effect seemed to disappear almost as quickly as the previous noise. However, we didn’t bring up our concern until the end as we liked our location and figured our options to move during a busy convention would be few. Other than that, the customer service of which we had grown fond continued to be good, especially in the restaurants. The manager at Marilyn’s Café seemed to take a special interest, stopping by each patron’s table to ask how they were enjoying the meal. Our two meals at the Tuscany Gardens were enjoyable and filling. We wish we stopped by the Cantina earlier than our last night as we had *way* too many leftovers! The pool area, while small by Vegas standards, continued to work for us although I think their system might have been overwhelmed by the number of convention guests. It seemed hard to keep the by-product of suntan lotion and such filtered through. It also seemed easy for pools of water to develop along the cement walkway which was a bit of a concern. The servers were friendly. The new cabana is a relatively affordable option although they might do better to add a couple more so it doesn’t stand out as much. We didn’t spend much time in the casino although on one occasion, after receiving $10 in free slot play, my lady spent $5 before winning over $100. As her “accountant”, I advised her to cash out immediately! LOL There are certainly more extravagant, lively and convenient hotels in Vegas. However for purposes of our convention visits, the Tuscany works for us and our fellow convention guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place ! I recommend it !”
Reviews.Author: Siestica
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place, italian style, well decorated, hot swimming pools, spa and fitness center available, the hotel is like a small and really cute village, and it's at less than 10 min walking from the strip, you can find good food, friendly staff, free wifi, clean rooms - very big : 65 sqm with kitchenette, everything is perfect to enjoy your stay in vegas !! It was a good discover, I can't wait to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family's brief trip thru Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: BFGO
Reviews.Content: We flew into Vegas for our big national park family vaca. We wanted to show the kids the strips bright lights, catch a few Z's and get the heck out of sin city! Tuscany Inn was easy to find, affordable (yes there was a $14.50 extra fee for some tax..but stillva good deal). The room was huge and immaculate. The place is very pretty in general. We ate late night at Marilyns in house. Decent breakfast. I would recommend this to anyone unless you really want to be in the heart of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: soonerrph
Reviews.Content: The check-in desk was a bit crowded, but after the process was completed, the rest of our stay was very enjoyable. Room was great - large and comfortable. The staff (especially Victor at Marilyn's Cafe) were very cordial. Will definitely stay there again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place awesome people”
Reviews.Author: wm2slc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and have not reviewed the place yet... so... I have always had a great time staying here and the people working there are always very patient and great to work with. I learned this more this time down as I had a few really minor problems and they were rectified almost immediately. One problem they could not rectify was my fault anyway. That was my plans changed and I tried to stay through the weekend and they were booked. Still the front desk tried and said to check back for cancellations. OK, rooms awesome, most have been upgraded and they are working on the rest. People are great, I do have to give a shout out to Angie the cocktail at the pool. She is very attentive, funny, personable and cute as hell... ha ha Anyway, don't look further, you will be disappointed for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, friendly staff, good food!”
Reviews.Author: lemingreeley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany over a week in July 2011 and it was very nice. the layout of the property is nice, the restaraunts are wonderful and give you huge portions. The casino is nice and not overly crowded. The staff ia amazing as everyone was so gracious and always smiling. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bubble!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeJVB
Reviews.Content: On a road trip from San Francisco down to LA then up to Vegas, we had popped into Vegas for one night before heading to the Grand Canyon, returning later to Sin City a few days later. The first time, we stayed in the Imperial Palace, right on the strip – an experience we were keen not to repeat –on our return, when we planned to stay 6 nights – we were thrilled with the Tuscany Inn and Suites. The suite was a good size, with two queen beds, sofa and arm chair, desk, table and chairs and kitchenette area. We requested a microwave and were sent one right away. The bathroom was a good size, with separate tub and shower cubicle. Fitness centre, good size pools and adjoining casino and restaurants. Feels like a little oasis in the middle of vegas. Free wi-fi in public areas, exorbitant fee if you want it in your room – the only negative I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy72
Reviews.Content: It is rare that I "rave" about a place, but I can't say enough positive things. I had two days in LV before the next leg of a trip. I chose the Tuscany based on the awful reviews of the Strip hotels and the positive reviews of this place. I really wasn't looking to "party" on the Strip, and the reviews of the Tuscany saying it was quiet, etc., sounded appealing. Check in was a breeze. Granted I checked in late at night (11pm) but there was no line and I walked right up to the counter and was treated wonderfully by Juan. Found my room OK in the dark (it's a big resort) and was amazed when I walked in. HUGE ROOM! Bigger than my first studio apt in Chicago. Great kitchenette (that I never used but would be great for extended stay). Comfy King bed. Chair and sofa (that may have been a sleeper). AC worked great (though a bit loud, my only minor gripe). Great big, modern bathroom. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN. Super quiet--thought I was the only person in that building until I actually saw people on the 2nd day in the elevator. Didn't have a car but there was ample parking. Toiletries provided (but no body soap). Alarm clock. Great pool area. Casino was fun and had good staff. Only ate at the cafe and it was good. Poolside drink service from Cheryl was great. Price was great. THE WALK-literally only 10-15 mins to the Strip. Actually took me more time to get from Bally's to the Venetian than it did to get from The Tuscany to Bally's. Safe walk, lots of traffic, other people walking to the hotel, etc. Being "off-strip" was not at all a hinderance to me as it is so close. Free wi-fi in the lobby and business center-had to pay $3 to use their comp to print my boarding pass. When I went to check out there was a HUGE line, but I only waited about 5-10 mins (I'm the most impatient person with this stuff, and it didn't bug me in the least). An aside about front-desk service-I happened to be using the wi-fi in the lobby when an awful, belligerant man was giving the woman a hard time, and thought she handled it magnificently (Tracy maybe?) Bellmen kept my bag until I left for the airport and then got me a cab. Oh--yes, there is a $13/day resort fee. If you somehow missed this when booking the hotel, that is your own fault as it was made very clear numerous times. They charge this at check-out. And for the TV complainers, it's not a flat screen LCD, but if you care about this when you're traveling, I'm not sure what to say. Good service all around, awesome hotel, gorgeous pool area. I will definitely stay here when I go back to Vegas. Great find. Thanks to the other reviewers who steered me here--I hope I can do the same for other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Never felt safe here”
Reviews.Author: VegasSportsGuy
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is a terrific value. You basically get a studio apartment without the oven. There is a living room with sofa and chair, dining room with table and seats, and kitchen. The bathroom has both a shower and a bath. The place is huge, bigger than anywhere else I have stayed in Vegas. The way the Tuscany is laid out concerns me. There are several different buildings with different letters, I believe A through K. All of these buildings are separate and on covered walkways outside. There's no security outside, only security to watch who enters the casino. The crowd here is not your typical vacationing families or couples. I will just say that this isn't an "educated" crowd or a demographic that is known for safety. I was playing craps and wanted to pick up my money and leave because I felt that it would get stolen by other players. There was a shooting here back in April and while I thought it was just an isolated incident because the times I have been here before the grounds have been beautiful, now after staying here and seeing the crowd this casino attracts I don't believe the incident was by chance. While the room has so much space, this isn't a luxurious place. The A/C unit was incredibly loud and kept me up at night. The walls are paper thin, I heard the floor creaking whenever someone above me was walking. Being on the first floor, I heard conversations outside of people walking to their cars or the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas lite”
Reviews.Author: weary_traveller25
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany Suites & Casino offers comfortable accomodates as well as the amenities of a casino hotel, although it scales it back a bit. Located a short distance off the Las Vegas strip, the hotel has a small (compared to Las Vegas standards) casino equipped with slots, table games, and a poker room. I do not gamble, so my experience is only with the features of the hotel. The hotel offers both valet and self parking. Upon arrival, the check in counter is located immediately to your left as you walk in. For some inexplicable reason, it is only a few feet from the Piazza Lounge. Both the hotel clerk and I had to shout to each other to be heard over the band playing in the lounge. This appeared to be a common occurrance when checking in at night. An earlier reviewer commented about additional "resort fees." I have found this to be a fairly common practice in Las Vegas hotels and casinos. It was approximately 15 dollars per night. I had asked for a room with a king bed but they only had a room with two double beds. After the first night, I requested to change rooms and they accomodated my request. The grounds of the hotel are broken into several buildings. The main building houses the lobby, the Piazza Lounge, the gift shop, the Tuscany Gardens restaurant, and the casino. The other buildings comprise the hotel rooms. The buildings are labeled by a letter of the alphabet (A, B, C, etc.). My room was in building B, which is towards the front of the property. There is also a fitness center in the rear of the property. It had two treadmills, some elliptical machines, some other exercise equipment, and a few free weights. The same building also housed the hotel spa. Behind it was a smaller lap pool. There was a larger recreational pool behind the main building. The building I was staying in would've been nicer if the hotel had been more vigilant in repairs and cleaning. The elevator had a broken panel held on with duct tape. Several of the rooms had trashed piled outside the doors, but the cleaning crews did not pick them up until mid-afternoon the next day. The room was nice enough. It had a comfortable bed, an old picture tube television, a pull out sofa, and a bathroom with a separate tub and shower. The dining area of the room had a sink, a refrigerator, and a dining table. Although there were several cabinets and drawers, there were no utensils. They were strictly for people who brought their own supplies. There was no microwave in my room. The one dresser in the room was barely adequate for one person, and would be completely useless to two or more people. There was a steep fee to use the wireless internet in the room, but free wireless internet access was available in the lobby and pool area of the main building. If you are coming to Las Vegas and you want to have the LV experience, I would not recommend this hotel as there are tons of better options. If you are coming to Las Vegas and are on a budget or are travelling for business, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service was slow, but the price was right and the hotel was lovely”
Reviews.Author: CAm0m
Reviews.Content: Spent a few kid free days here. I picked it because the price was right ($35 a night). The $13 a night resort fee was disclosed when I made the reservation, and it's not an uncommon charge at most vacation destinations these days. Our room was very clean. It smelled a little bit like beach when we walked in, but that's not a bad thing. Everything was very clean. Unfortunately, they didn't clean our room the entire time we were there. They take the "Do Not Disturb" sign seriously, and if it's on your door at 9am they aren't coming back to clean your room, even if the sign is gone at 10am. My bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows, and the bathrooms were cleaned and well supplied. My only complaint was there was only one bar of soap, so you constantly had to get the soap to sower or wash your hands. The pool area is very nice. We had no trouble getting a lounge chair when we went out in the morning. The worst problem is that the pool area has no shade and it is far too hot to be out there mid-day. We were back in our room by noon each day because of the heat. They have very nice cocktail waitresses in the pool area and the drinks come quickly and are reasonably priced. The hotel was about a 10 minute walk from the strip. There was a dicey area between the hotel and Bally's, where we saw a homeless encampment, a drunk driver jump the curve and take out a lamppost, and a couple of working girls. If you are going to walk, take the side entrance into Bally's to cut some time off your walk and increase your safety. The casino was fine for killing time. The cocktail waitress at night was VERY slow, to the point where I ordered a drink and she disappeared for so long that I finally just left. I know they are supposed to be slow to keep you gambling while you wait, but this was off the charts ridiculous. Service at Marilyn's cafe was also very slow. We waited a long time for our breakfast to come out, although the food was good when it arrived. The food at the Cantina was very good, and reasonably priced. The portions were HUGE!!! I got a massage at La Riva and it was very good. I called on a holiday and got a same day appointment. There is no "spa", just a treatment room in the fitness center, but the prices were half of those elsewhere and the massage itself was excellent.
