My husband used the fitness center to workout and had no complaints. All in all, I would definitely stay again. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean (I always wear earplugs when I stay in a hotel, so I have no idea whether it was noisy or not), and it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Janneke24
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very big rooms. Everything was clean. We chose this hotel because you can park your car close to the room and it was a fair price. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"BEST KEPT SECRET IN VEGAS"”
Reviews.Author: DogsLuvHotels
Reviews.Content: Wow what a beautiful hotel, this is family owned and top notch service, the cost for a room is $25.00 during the week, a bit more for weekends and hollidays, however totally worth it even if its $100.00 a night. The food is the best quality Ive ever had in Vegas, even better then the bigger more expensive hotels. The rooms are all suites, large and have wonderful beds and fridge. This hotel is a bit off the strip, behind Ballys so its nice and quiet, and if you wanted you can walk to the strip, however you do not need to, all the good food place are right there off Corporate centr drive, PF Changs, Buca, Firefly,sushi,Mortons, etc Most people who stay on strip that want to go to a really good resteraunt end up taking a Taxi to Tuscany because this is where the absolute best food places are in all of Vegas. Tuscany built new buildings recently, building D is brand new, smells of new carpet inside, and the hallways smell great too! Anyone who stays here will be so happy, and next time they will stay again. I still cant believe they are only charging $25.00 a night when they can easily get $75.00 during the week, this is one of the best properties to stay in Vegas. Family owned really matters, all the staff love their job, they tell me that their employers take good care of them, this is why the staff is so happy and helpful, they love their job and their employer. Thats the secret, keep staff happy and they will do a great job for you, everyone wants to help you at this hotel, your not going to get someone at the front such as a Circus Circus or Excalibur person whom doesnt care at all about you. People are comming for fun and entertainment, and vacation, its really a bummer when hotel staff makes you miserable, do your self a favor and take advice from trip advisor people with good reviews, stay at the Tuscany and I promise you will be very happy. Same thing on the phone, try calling a Flamingo or Tropicana, see how you get treated, then call Tuscany and see the difference, you can tell everything over the phone about the facility, never stay anywhere if you have a bad experience over the phone. Some of these hotels do not know how important customer service is, they have recordings and long waits, then when someone does answer she sounds like she doesnt want to help you, or just takes your reservation and thats it, not further help. Here is a list that may help you ( my opinion and experience) ( The worst service and hotels in order ) ( Not including downtown ) 1. Circus Circus ( all the staff are real tired and upset because of the noise and kids all over, this staff does speak a bit english though ) 2. Riviera Hotel ( what a shame, this was the Wynn back in the 70's and 80's, now its the 2nd worst hotel and service on the strip ) This hotel is just plain old and about go out just like the Sahara. 3. Excalibur ( Just a busy low cost hotel, they do not have time for you, get your room key and kiss everything else goodbye ) 4. Imperial Palace ( really bad service, really bad rooms ) however the location is to die for! Have fun here, get drunk and you wont care! Here are the best services hotels in order..notice Tuscany is right up there... 1. Four Seasons 2. Encore 3. Wynn 4. Trump 5. Tuscany 6. Signature at MGM Please give Tuscany a try, email me after your stay so I can hear about your experience. Email me for any further questions, Id be glad to assist you and gladly would help Tuscany, Im really happy to have this hotel right near my home, I recommend it to all friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, certain reception staff could be more pleasant”
Reviews.Author: gem_mcb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 for 10 nights. The hotel itself is nice, rooms are very big and beds very comfy. The fridge was also useful for stocking up with drinks and snacks. The pool got very busy very early and if not there first thing it was near impossible to get a sunbed in the afternoon. Upon check in we came across a very arrogant receptionist, I think his name was Mikhail. Quite possibly the rudest man I have ever met. Very unhelpful and talking to my husband and I as if we were stupid, all the while looking down his nose at us. The other reception staff were pleasant, he must have been the exception. We ate in Marylin's Cafe for breakfast most mornings and the occasional lunch, food was very substantial (we split most meals) and mostly well cooked. We also tried the Cantina which served Mexican food however this was extremely salty and I would not recommend it. The casino was good and joining the player's club proved beneficial as we won a tidy sum on one of the slots with our free play. Location was good too. Only 10 mins walk to the Bellagio and the monorail stops at the Flamingo which is handy for exploring the strip. I liked being away from the hustle and bustle of the strip at night after a long day's sightseeing/exploring. Overall, i would stay at the Tuscany again as it was pleasant, i just hope next time i return the reception staff are alittle more professional!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: lr29
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Tuscany was excellent. The room was spacious, clean, and a great value. The Casino was small but had every offering you need. The restaurants were excellent. The patio servers were not only beautiful but professional. Beautiful pool area. Location is away from the Strip by only a block and a half. Will definitely return. Would have liked free wi-fi in room, but it is available free in Lobby and Patio. AC just a tad loud.

Reviews.Title: “Still Some Glitches”
Reviews.Author: Blase' Jose'
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas. We always have a clean and spacious room (all are suites) and a reasonable rate. The casino is smaller and the restaurants are good. It is 1/2 mile off the strip so if hanging there is your thing, you will need to walk or cab. We like the walk so it is not a problem for us. Make sure to ask for the coupons when you check in (if they aren't automatically offered to you). Free drink, free meal at one of the smaller restaurants. The Italian restaurant is very good also. Parking is free and close to your room so if you drive or rent a car, it can't be beat. Only complaint is the bogus "$10 resort fee" which means any rate you are quoted is really $10 more. (Actually, I think it is now $13). When I mention glitches, it seems their online reservation process is never smooth. Sometimes the promotional rates and the actual rates don't compare but we are always able to straighten it out with a phone call. Just wish they could get it right the first time. Free Wi-Fi in public places (lobby, etc.) but extra $$ from your room which is kind of annoying.

Reviews.Title: “A gem just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Photolady1
Reviews.Content: We found a quiet gem in the busy city of Las Vegas. It is located just off the strip. It was serene and very welcoming. When we arrived there was a band playing " big band style music. It was more like a resort than a hotel. The rooms were lovely and very spacious. The staff were wonderful and very friendly. I highly recommend this resort to anyone who has a vehicle or don't mind a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstryker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not far off the strip if you are interested. We brought the kids so we stayed on the property the entire visit. Nice pool, and plenty of restaurants to keep you fed without ever leaving the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Caution!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marianneO
Reviews.Content: This place is a rip off; made a reservation on a Wednesday night for Friday night by phone, tried to cancel the reservation on Thursday, was unable to do so; was told I had to cancel 72 hours in advance. Credit card was charged on Thursday and was told I still had to pay the first night's stay, regardless. We were never told about this cancellation policy. The Tuscany has no airport shuttle, rates are now up to $130 of which, we've never paid over $50 in the past. Will never, ever stay at the Tuscany again; we've been customers for a number of years; no more!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Steal If You Get the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Good_Apples
Reviews.Content: It's been a long time since I've stayed at the Tuscany and there have been some improvements and some let downs. The improvements have been with the pool and casino. The first time I stayed here way back in 2002 or so, the casino was still under construction and the pool was basically a hole in the ground with some lawn chairs thrown out for good measure. The casino now looks nice and is very clean and spacious. Same with the pool. The landscaping, loungers and pool itself are nice enough that you wouldn't mind laying out in the baking sun for a few hours. I also like that there is another small pool hidden away towards the rear or the property. While it's not as nice as the one closest to the casino and restaurants, there are less people there and you can still relax. The rooms themselves are okay but not as nice as before. The couches still seem like the same ones that were there when I visited 9 years ago and are bit lumpy and run down. The room itself was mostly clean and luckily for us, we didn't run across a nasty bathroom. The biggest disappointment was the bed. While king size, it was in extreme disrepair and the sheets barely covered the mattress. Speaking of the sheets, there was not much to protect you from the mattress and whatever is living in it. Between threadbare sheets coming off the mattress and springs poking through the mattress, I really did not have one good night sleep. Like others have mentioned, the kitchenette does not have much other than a coffee maker, sink and mini frige. Our neighbors had a microwave delivered to their room, so if you need one, I'm sure you could ask. Additionally, the tv is the same one that was there in 2002. It's still an old school tube kind. I personally don't care about those things because I don't spend much time in the room anyway. As long as the thing worked while I needed it, it didn't bother me. We got our room for $28 a night (not including resort fee) for a total of $42 a night or so. Really, it's not a bad place if you can get it for that cheap. Since we had a car, not only could we walk to the strip but we could drive to other places in LV and this is a very convenient location. If you're expecting Bellagio or the Wynn, you will be sorely disappointed, but if you keep an open mind and don't spend a lot of time in your room, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Still a quality hotel, but overall it just doesn't justify their very pricey resort fees.”
Reviews.Author: NYYNO1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for few nights as part of my week-long solo trip to Vegas. I always stay at Tuscany for its nice and quiet environment, away from the bustling strip scene. I also like their small but very nice pool area. I was expecting my stay here would be very peaceful as usual, and it didn't disappoint. Maybe it was too quiet to the point that most of the time while I was here, I felt like I was the only person staying at this property. There were probably only 5 rooms occupied in my building that has 60 rooms, during my entire stay - didn't see anybody, didn't hear anything, dead silent. The room is huge, but the "kitchen" is useless since it only has a sink and no gas or microwave to actually cook anything. The refrigerator is nice though. The bathroom is large with the shower and the tub separated. The toilet is separated as well. The problem is that the bathroom fan is very, very noisy, which makes it ironic since the rest of the property is so dead quiet. The casino is fairly large, and they have blackjack, craps, and roulette tables along with good number of slot machines. But the casino was almost completely empty as well. It was so dead it was depressing. The pool has very nice layout, heated and all, and they also have a hot tub. Since it was so unseasonably cold in Vegas when I was there, I wasn't able to enjoy the pool unfortunately, though the last day I was there the weather warmed up and lots of people came out to the pool. The first time I saw THAT many people while I was at the property.... They really should try to do something to attract more people, like reducing or completely taking out their very pricey "resort fee", perhaps? Or they really need to upgrade or remodel the entire property, especially the rooms (fixing the noisy toilet fan, installing a real kitchen, etc.) to justify the resort fee. In any case, I would still say that the base price of $30 - $40/night is still a decent deal for a good quality hotel like Tuscany, certainly better than some of the overpriced strip hotels. I'd stay again, of course, but from now on I'd probably choose to stay elsewhere if it's not the pool season, since I believe the pool is the only thing at this property that may justify their resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel within 10 minutes (walking) from Las Vegas Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: TubaRJ
Reviews.Content: The presentation is excellent. New, clean and beautiful. The casino is small but I'm not interested in games. The Mexican Restaurant (inside the casino) is excellent. The staff are attentive bastente. I had a problem with the reservation (made by others) and staff are dedicated to addressing it. The internet in the rooms is paid but you can take your laptop to the lobby and restaurants and have free access. Parking is ample and free. Security guards make the rounds. The guest room is huge. Hygiene is perfect. The price is very competitive. I really enjoyed. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Tuscany Suites”
Reviews.Author: shining_star_59
Reviews.Content: Hi, Went to Vegas from May 10 to the 17th and had a fantastic time, We picked the Tuscany because we wanted something off the strip, and was aware that it was about a 10-15 minute walk to the strip, which was fine with us. Front desk staff was friendly and very efficient, no issues with them... check in took about 5 minutes and we were quickly on our way to our room. We were advised by the travel agency that there was a resort charge when we booked our trip, it was also stated on expedia.. At check in, the front desk also confirmed the amount and what the charge covered. Considering what we paid for the trip, we had no issues with this additional charge. The room was huge, our beds were quite comfortable, no complaints from either of us. There was a table/chairs also a fridge and empty cupboards. A microwave would of been great, We had brought drinks from the bar, so we had glasses, which we rinsed and reused... I had brought mugs for our coffee, after reading reviews that had stressed there were no dishes. The bathroom is separated into 3 compartments, one being the toilet area, one the shower (glass door) and the other sink and bathtub. If you want extra coffee or towels ... etc... request it and within 15 minutes and your requested items will be delivered to you. We were just steps away from the lap pool, we went out every morning to sunbathe... jump into the jacuzzi / pool... the pool area only closes at 10:00 pm .. so if you want to use the pool after a long day on the strip, it is still open which was great. When we did eat at the hotel, we ate at Marilyn's and the food was fine... prices were unbelievably cheap... The only complaint that we would of had, was the noise overhead, it started about 11:30 pm... sounded like someone who had a stroller and was trying to put their child to sleep... it was unbelievably loud and there was absolutely no way you could sleep... after about an hour of listening to this, we called the front desk...shortly after, the noise stopped ... this only happened 2 nights... so it was not too much of an annoyance.(2nd night only about 15 minutes) We took a taxi a few nights back from Bally's, the cost was $7.00 plus tip... We did get the 24 hr bus pass... cost $7.00... took the strip bus .to go to old las vegas. and a trip to the north outlet mall.... we wanted to do this so that we could see all the different hotels .. did the express bus back and needless to say it was alot faster... Ask at the front desk and they will explain how/where you can either take the strip bus or the express bus (Howard Hughes street... 5 minute walk from the hotel.. 20 minutes from the outlet mall back to the hotel.) Overall.. If I ever go back to Vegas.. i will stay at the Tuscany... I liked the size of the hotel.. compared to the mega hotels on the strip... I enjoyed returning each night.. to Tuscany... to the quietness and not being part of a mob.. that we found at the mega hotels... If you can live with a clean.. comfortable rooms that could use some updating... Book this hotel..... If you want top of the line rooms/furniture..you will need to go someplace else and pay about triple(Plus) the price .. It is all in what you want to pay and expect. If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: shilee3
Reviews.Content: Awesome stay at the Tuscany! Clean, quiet rooms, would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Elephants above?”
Reviews.Author: vacat7
Reviews.Content: The casino and the rooms are perfectly decent. The noise was off the chart. I could not hear voices/noise between rooms but the stomping was all day and night - and could be heard through my spacious room. Friend stayed on the same hall and had identical problem. He has stayed at Tuscany four times before and never had issue. This was my first time and would never stay again. The place is clean and I enjoyed the walk to the strip, plus free parking. The construction seemed worse than in any other hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to strip that's all!... but will gouge you...”
Reviews.Author: tolenram
Reviews.Content: Pros: Place was clean. Close to the strip, within walking distance. There is a ref which is convenient. Cons: Non-smoking room smelled smoky. Bathroom was skimpy. Sofa was old and clumpy... it's so old it felt like you sat in a quicksand, you can't get out! Bed is so hard you wake up with a back pain. "Kitchenette" is totally useless... drawers are there but empty! They have additional charge for internet access. TV is so old and small... you need to be close to it to watch. And to top it off... you will be totally blindsided when you check-in by an additional "Resort fee + tax". This is after you've pre-paid via internet booking (with service fees included)! I don't mind paying as long as it's fully disclosed before you book it, not when you're checking in! Will NEVER EVER return to this hotel AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay for an Amazing Price”
Reviews.Author: RainyCityGirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived and check-in was a breeze.. The front desk clerk was quick, friendly and very efficient. Knowing ahead of time of the $14 resort fee made it better due to the fact that they give you coupons that basically zeroed the fees, which I was happy about. Upon entering my building, I was pleased to see that the entrance and elevators had nice tiles and had a fresh smell to them. The carpet in the hallways seemed newer and clean. I was very happy entering my suite as I received an updated room, which was very spacious and very clean and I was not expecting much but ended up very pleased. The bathroom was immaculate and very roomy also. The kitchen area had tile countertops and coffee pot. My bed had nice linens and was made up very nicely. The only complaint would be the most uncomfortable hard pillows I had to lay my head on. The dining staff was very friendly as I had breakfast and dinner there 2 out of the 4 days of my stay and the food was not bad at all with good prices. The pool area with a jacuzzi is nice and relaxing but expect more of a family atmosphere here. Every staff member I made contact with was very helpful and very nice. There is public transportation right across the street if you did not want to make that 10 minute walk to the strip, which I took advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay, good value, easy to airport.”
Reviews.Author: rct2trip
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Tuscany and flew out of Las Vegas. I'd recommend it and would stay here again. It is quieter and less populated than the Strip for sure. It is a10-15 min walk to the Strip. The grounds are pretty and well maintained. Security was very attentive. One officer noticed we were having trouble getting our key to open the door to building A and he helped us out. (If pushing down to open doesn't work, try pushing up.) The free parking lot in front of our building was regularly patrolled by security. Drink and food prices were lower at Tuscany than what we bumped into on the Strip for similar quality. The room itself was an excellent value. Very large with clean small kitchen, dining table, 2 beds, couch and chair, sparkling clean bathroom with separate room for toilet. Comfortable, clean beds with soft sheets. There is a service fee. I think it was $12- charged at check in but I was expecting it. The fee provides you with a strip of vouchers for 2 free drinks, 2 for 1 entrees at the restaurants on the grounds and some gambling perks. We took advantage of those savings. Wifi was not free in the rooms - a daily charge. Chicken francaise and the lamb at Tuscany Gardens restaurant was very good, not great. My son ordered calamari appetizer which was good and large enough for a meal or an app for 3-4 people. We also waited a while for water and service and food once we were seated. I wasn't wowed but I wouldn't not go again. The room and rates would make this a repeat place for me if we go back to Vegas. The Cafe was good for casual fare and prices were good too. Service there was excellent at lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest hotel we could find for weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1285
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 2 nights, the hotel is OK but I wish we had spent a bit more and got a hotel right on the strip. The main problem with our room was the smell, it just smelt bad especially the bathroom. The room was really big and the bed was comfortable and clean, the kitchen area was quite dated.

Reviews.Title: “Few frills but great value”
Reviews.Author: sonia530
Reviews.Content: This place was a great value. At first I was dismayed with the $13/night+tax resort fee, but they give you enough coupons to make it worth it (2 for 1 entrees, 2 free drinks, etc.). It also includes access to the pool and jacuzzi, which I never got time for, and free wifi in public spaces. (It's around $13/day in room otherwise). The room itself was large, clean and comfortable. The king size bed was comfortable, and the room had a large living space with couch, dining table, mini fridge and desk. The bathroom was also large, with the toilet behind a second door and a tub separate from shower for comfortable soaking. A couple drawbacks - the shower head was old with uneven spray, and lower than normal so not great for anyone of average height or more. The TV had very few channels for free, but who gets a room in Vegas to lay around and watch TV? It's in a great location - a few blocks off the strip so away from the craziness and noise, but close enough to walk to. It's also close to off-strip shopping so you can get a pizza for cheap if you're on a budget. Overall, a good value. Nothing glamorous but a great place if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A realy nice place, BUT ...”
Reviews.Content: Room was really large, modern, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was immaculate and very attractive with seperate shower and tub, lots tile and stone. King bed was excellent. Liked having the fridge, stove and microwave. TV was adequate, an older picture tube model. Not much selection of channels. But then, who really goes to LV to watch TV. I really liked the layout of the place, with guest rooms in outbuildings linked by tree-lined walkways. The landscaping and grounds are very nice, as is the pool area. Something I really liked was NO SMOKING except in the casino! Check in was a slow process. Staff were not friendly, probably tired of taking the flak for the $12.99 "Resort Fee" that management adds on as a surprise after you've paid in advance for the room, and the $12.99/day fee for Internet (really?) Stuff like that, plus the $1 charge per local phone call, really soured me on what is otherwise a very nice place. Just put the room price up a bit, and don't try and gouge people. They might just come back and might even recommend the place to their friends. Who would have thought of that?

Reviews.Title: “Low key hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Watsonhorse
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany was a pleasant surprise. The grounds are nicely kept and the rooms large and clean. We stayed in building L at the back of the property which was very quiet. Both the Mexican Cantina and Tuscany Gardens were reasonably priced for what we ordered. Check in is a slow process but staff were friendly. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Strip and a nice place to come back to after you've toured that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, nice rooms, casual atmosphere... we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseTappen_BC
Reviews.Content: We made our booking and were quoted a rate for a 3rd floor room with balcony. Upon arriving however, that room was not available so they offered us a ground floor with walkout by the pool but charged us an extra $40 per night. THAT I was not happy about. The first night was great in our room. Comfy beds and quite. That's because no one was above us. However, night 2 it sounded like a herd of elephants was above us and they carried on till 5:30 am. So we got moved to a 3rd floor room which was very quiet... but no balcony and NO REFUND for the two nights left that we paid premium room price for. So this part of the stay was disappointing. However, rooms very clean and comfortable.... beds quite comfortable.. pillows not great but ok. The setting is quite beautiful if you are looking at the pool area... very tropical, lots of birds... they start at 5 am, too. The casino was very casual. Felt safe and comfortable. The mexican restaurant was fantastic with great food and superb service. We found all the service in Vegas to be exceptional with the only exception being the coffee shop one morning in the Tuscany... the guy wasn't friendly. Olive Garden in Henderson... absolutely fantastic! Luxor Hotel.. disgusting.. Planet Hollywood... super sleezy and loud... Bellagio... gorgeous and classy... Freemont Street excellent... Blueberry Hill restaurant... great desserts... crappy hamburgers... would we do Vegas again? No... but it's worth experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was okay”
Reviews.Author: WIBadgergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Vegas for the Con Ag Show and I tagged along for a few nights before the show started. We checked in to the Tuscany Suites late on a Friday night. We were in Building O, we had an end room on the 3rd floor with a king bed. The room looked like it's been recently updated. My husband has a testy back and by the end of the week on that bed he was hurting. Kind of sloped to the center so probably is in need of new mattresses. Otherwise the room was fine. Nice to have a frig in the room and they had a coffee maker but the coffee was HORRID! I don't know where they get their coffee from but if you like your coffee in the morning dont' make it in the room - head out to Marilyn's Cafe or the coffee shop just off the pool area. Agree with others who commented on the mini kitchen area but no pots/pans/dishes or anything in the cupboards. We didn't even have 2 burner stove that others mentioned - just the hole in the countertop - strange.... You do have to walk a little distance to the lobby and the restaurants/casino from your room but hey it's Vegas and you walk and walk and walk anyway. For the price we paid I would say it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!! THE ABSOLUTE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN VEGAS!!”
Reviews.Author: awillia3
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recommend this place to my worst enemy! I am a frequent visitor to Las Vegas and I have never stayed in such a place in this city! The customer service at the Tuscany is absolutely HORRIBLE! I went to Vegas and stayed at this hotel for a conference for 4 days/ 5 nights. The initial room that I was placed in reminded me of the OLD Motel 6/ Ramada Inn! Outdated and SLEEZY! I asked for a King Sized bed and they put me in a room with double beds - with quilted bed spreads, old carpet, an old molded couch in the room - with other people's hairs all over the room - including the bathroom! Luckily I brought my own lysol and was able to clean some. Mind you they have buildings A-O and you might have to walk a country mile to get to your room - OUTSIDE!!! It was horrible! When I asked to change rooms - I wasn't moved until 3 nights later - when I had to ask again! I must admit the second room was UPDATED and NICE. NO IN BETWEEN! When I changed rooms - I left my phone charger in the room - when I realized that I left my charger - I immediately let the hotel know - it was the same day. Long story short - they gave me the run around for a day and a half - needless to say I never got my charger back! I had to go buy a new one! No one at this hotel cares about servicing the customer! People at the front desk are clueless. They can't even explain extra charges on the bill! One good thing about the hotel is their food and their restaurants which are pretty good. Everyone at Marilynn's Cafe - where I ate most of the time were very nice and friendly. If you gamble there - make sure that you can TRULY use your comps or credits. I have over $300 in credits there because of my play - and they tell me AFTER getting the run around again - that I was unable to use them towards my room because I was with a group. If they would have told me this from the beginning - I would have gambled at Bally's where I KNOW that I would be treated decently! The rooms are pretty large and they all have a small kitchenette. You will pay for internet service. I will never stay at this place again!

Reviews.Title: “great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: happymamma
Reviews.Content: Located 2 "vegas" blocks off the strip. We had a car and found it easy to navigate into casino parking lots from the back streets. Because you walk so much in Vegas the 2 blocks is not a big stretch. Got a great rate on their website. They do charge a $13.00/day resort fee. We were told the fee is for the in-room safes and use of the pool. I feel this is lame, but a lot of places are doing it. You can get good free WiFi in the lobby. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in various stages of updating. We stayed in one of the updated units. I would say it is partially updated - new carpet, paint, etc, but old furniture, towels. They have a bar fridge which is great and a 2 burner element. A microwave would be more useful. No cooking supplies to go with the burners. As previously reviewed, the units are very spacious. Beds comfortable. There was an odd chemical smell in the hallways, but not noticable in the rooms. Pool area is nice. Seems like a place you would find families. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay anywhere else;)”
Reviews.Author: msmac63
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Tuscany....we did have some reservation issues that were quite frustrating because we had booked 6 months in advance. Luckily we had saved all emails from Reservation Clerks! We had a patio suite in G Building and we love the spacious clean rooms (no bed bugs in ours). Our only concern was a VERY loud boisterous Bachelor Party in the room above us.We had to call Security 3 times throughout the night. Our fee for that night was deducted from our stay without issue. The best thing about the Tuscany is that it is close enough to walk to all the excitement of the Las Vegas but quiet, comfortable with all the amenities of the larger hotels....casino, restaurants, pool etc. Delicious meals at Marilyn's Cafe!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times. Moving On Now..”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTCPD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Tuscany many, many times. I have stayed here for the past 10 years. However, recently, Tuscany has increased their indirect prices (aka fees) for everything. $2 to print a single page at the business center? $15 a day for Internet. $13 for a resort fee. The value is just not there anymore. I'll stay elsewhere since there is no loyalty program here either.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in LV”
Reviews.Author: dederpt
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, cozy and with a great staff. It's located near enough from the Strip but far enough to enjoy the calm and silence of the hotel's pool

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: arizona0714
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days at the Tuscany in early February while travelling solo on business. I have stayed at many hotels both on and off the strip over the years and would consider the Tuscany the best 3* value option if you don't need to be right on the strip. I have organized the review by topic for ease of reference. Location - 15 minute walk east of the strip on Flamingo in the centre of the strip. If you drive in, there is plenty of parking and you can park in close proximity to your room which is great since this is a sprawling property. Check-in - Checked in after 8:00 P.M., but it was easy and painless. Price - Booked through Expedia and got a great online deal at under $20 per night (due to an online promotion Expedia had saving an additional $10 per night) excluding the dreaded $13 + tax resort fee, which many others have already commented on. While most hotels both on and off the strip now charge the resort fee ($1 at the Palms, to $25 at the Wynn for example), the biggest disappointment for me is that it does not include in-room internet (public areas and restaurants are free), which you must pay seperately directly to Cox business services. As others have mentioned, it can cost up to $13.99 per day, but is slightly cheaper if you need it for at least 3 or 5 days at $11 and change per day. The best revenge on the resort fees is to make use of the facilities (pool and fitness areas are great) as well as the various coupons you get at check-in including the free drinks and the discounts towards the restaurants. Room Quality - Very large rooms. They are more than 50% bigger than most at 625 s.f. and come with a king-sized or two double beds, sitting areas and dining tables, old school televisions, coffee makers, refrigerators, in-room safes and hairdryers. The bathrooms are also large with the standard of a separate tub and shower, although the tubs are nothing special. Service Quality - Good. They have room service and concierge, plus limited business facilities. The Casino: Table Games - Blackjack, craps, roulette. The pit is fairly small and has nothing to recommend it over one closer to where you're staying, or where you want to be. The craps table always appears to be a bit dead. Bet Minimums - blackjack and card games have a $5 minimum, while craps can be $3 with decent 5x odds. The double-zero roulette is usually $1 per chip and $4 minimum per spin. Machines -. There are a ton of penny machines here, and a good selection of nickels and quarters. There is some full-pay video poker machines at the quarter level. Cocktails - Good cocktail service. If you choose to buy your drinks at the bar, its $2.50 for a standard Budweiser. Who Gets Comps? It's a pretty good club for the slot and VP player. There are many decent promotions like double points and rooms. The Food: Marilyn's Cafe - Typical American coffee shop fare with a few decent specials throughout the day and during graveyard. If your there during the week, there is a very good Steak and Eggs special for $6.99 until 11:00 A.M. The Cantina - Standard if uninspired Mexican fare including a range of Tacos, Enchilada's and Burritos. That is, you can get Mexican food like this just about anywhere. Prices are pretty good though, and they have a range of lunch specials. Tuscany Gardens - Tuscany is the upscale Italian restaurant and is the best of the bunch. They have a range of dishes, including seafood, steak and pastas. Prices are reasonable and can be further reduced by using the $20 off coupon you receive with your welcome kit. For even more savings you casn order select appetizers in the Piazza lounge for half price during Happy Hours between 5:00 to 7:00 P.M. Open only for dinner. Overall, the Tuscany more than fits the bill and when considered against other supposed 3* properties on the strip such as Excalibur, Circus Circus and Imperial Palace, the Tuscany is a real diamond.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best value for money in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: emilygraceUK
Reviews.Content: Wow. First of all, a huge thanks to all your tripadvisors for your reviews. My parents (in their 50s) flew over to California from the UK to visit me (early 20s) for a couple of weeks, and during this time we wanted to visit Vegas and the Grand Canyon. I avidly read tons of reviews before booking this trip as I wanted to make it perfect for them. I am SO glad I trusted tripadvisor! Tuscany was absolutely wonderful - everything I'd hoped for and read about, and more. My fave things about this hotel: - Big hotel without feeling big - no endless elevator rides or miles of corridors because the hotel is made up of mulitple low rise buildings, there are 15 3 story hotel room buildings, plus a few more buildings for the casino, lobby, restaurants, health club etc. Doesn't have the huge, impersonal feeling that other Vegas hotels have. - We paid $22 per room, but have seen them for as cheap as $14! Even adding the $13 "resort fee", that's still ridiculously cheap! - SO close to the strip. It's just over a block behind Bally's and Bill's Gamblin' Hall, so a very quick and easy walk up to the Bellagio fountain (our favourite!) and all the action. - HUGE rooms. Huge. Little kitchen area, full size fridge, sink, coffee maker, my room even had a little stove top (my parents' room didn't). Lovely big bathroom, seperate tub and shower and seperate toilet. - Very clean. - We had a yummy and reasonably priced breakfast at Marilyns Cafe. When you check in you get a little booklet with some vouchers for the hotel restaurants too which is really nice. - When booking through expedia I requested 2 King rooms close to each other, non smoking and that's exactly what we got! I think that particular building was non-smoking because it didn't smell at all like smoke. - It's quiet, because it's off the strip. The whole place feels like a little village. The only reason I gave the rooms a 4 is because they could do with more modern bedding. People on here have mentioned the "dated" decor - and I can see why although this didn't bother me. The televisions are "old school" (although in my opinion if you want to stay in watching TV then why are you in Vegas?!). I seriously think if the beds had big fluffy comforters it'd give the whole room a much more up to date feel. But that's me being reeeeeally picky. Over all, if you're umming and aahing about whether to pick this hotel like I was at first - go for it. If you want a 5 star, book a 5 star. But if you want somewhere lovely, clean, comfortable, great location, friendly, quiet and great value for money, then Tuscany is the place for you. I will most definitely be returning, everytime I hit up Vegas from now on.

Reviews.Title: “18 hours from h_ _ _”
Reviews.Author: jjaylandj
Reviews.Content: I like many TripAdvisor users had done plenty of research prior to reserving rooms for this 4 night (2 different hotels) trip and felt pretty comfortable with my selections...WRONG. Now let me preface this review by acknowledging that ALL businesses can have a lapse in service, circumstances that cannot be foreseen or avoided,.Yes we have all experienced these shortcomings...it is how an establishment and management handles these unforeseen situations (especially important in the Hospitality industry) that indicate professionalism and dedication to their guests. This is where my greatest frustration and disappointment with my stay at and the management of Tuscany Suites lies and where I feel the "most attention" is warranted. Ok...on to the 18 hours from h_ _ _ Upon check in (I was quite early 1:00 pm) I was informed that "they were still on early check in fee...$12.00. After 2:00 pm I could check-in" Let us keep in mind that it is a Wed. in Feb. (not overflowing by any stretch) OK, no big deal, I was prepared for this as I had read a previous reviewer mention the "early check-in fee". I walked around the property (very nice), played some Blackjack (very limited 3-4 tables) and basically got familiar with the surroundings. 2:00 pm....18 hours in h_ _ _ begins! Into room, though nice it smells unusual, like "new building syndrome"? Should have been a RED FLAG! After much deliberation I decided on dinner at the Mexican cantina. I ordered an entree and an appetizer that I wanted to go as it was almost closing time for the cantina (9:00pm). I attempted to use my hotel provided coupon but was informed that it could not be honored on "to go" orders?? Ok, again..no big deal. As I waited for my order, I played the slots which were within eye/ear shot of the hostess and cash register. After the advised time (15 mins) I returned to pick up my order and after some hectic scrambling by the hostess I was informed that my order had been given to someone else...ugh! After discussion and wishing for my money to be returned and cancel the order the hostess convinced me to allow them to prepare my order..."less than 10 mins." Ok, I still needed to eat and it was now 9:00 pm. I sat at the cantina so as not to lose my order again...10 mins, it was up, I thanked everyone and returned to my room to relax and indulge in my great diinner...WHAT THE...?? WRONG ORDER...UGH %$#@. Back to the cantina I trudge with an entree that was NOT MINE. Cantina is now darkened, CLOSED sign greats me. I show the nice hostess the "wrong" entree (my entree was correct, the app was missing) and she again convinces me that "5 mins...give us 5 mins". I am SO HAPPY that I did as the app that I had ordered (bacon wrapped prawns) was the best part of the 18 hours from h_ _ _. Chow down and off to ZZZzzzzzzz...ugh. At 5:30 am I awaken and "feel" something down at my feet...I raise the sheets to find a SOCK....and it is NOT MY SOCK! Yes...not mine and it is now painfully clear that I have slept in a bed that was unchanged from the previous guest...UGH!!!!! I went to the front desk and spoke with the hotel Operations Manager and explained the "bed partner" I had just discovered as well as the "grab bag dinner" experience of the previous night. I was met with a "glassy eyed" response of "do you want us to come change the sheets" (remember it is now 6:30 am...NO), an offer to deduct the resort fee ($10) and we apologize. With that I informed the Operations Mgr. that I would be checking out early (I was reserved for the following night as well) and to please refund my card for the prepaid night...agreed. After clearing out of the room, checking out and driving away from the property (9:30 am), I was contacted on my cell phone by the Operations Mgr. and told that they would comp a room for tonight. I informed her that had this offer been made at 6:30 am during our initial discussion I would never have left the property. She then offered a comp meal..again I had already LEFT the property, headed to a the hotel that I stayed the first 2 nights at, and though I appreciated the offer...I was GONE. After all of this...3 hours since initial contact regarding the issues, numerous conversations and contact with the Ops. Mgr. at the front desk during checkout, it was not until I was already driving away from the property was a reasonable offer made "to compensate for the inconveniences" (Tuscany Suites term). Since returning home I have exchanged emails with the Administrative Asst., though they are "sorry for the inconveniences , they feel that my concerns were addressed and proper compensation was offered". My overall impression...though it is a "nice" property, the feel is unwelcoming, the sevice appears to be forced and not genuine. Further compounding this unfortunate experience was managements obvious efforts to employ the "CMA" tactics. As I stated in the opening...I understand that difficulties arise in all aspects of life...it is how one accepts responsibility and ownership of issues that is the true measuring stick.

Reviews.Title: “BEST DEAL IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: pikap272
Reviews.Content: Went to MAGIC fashion convention and was looking for a place to stay. Looked online and found that TUSCANY suites had suites available for $20!! (wednesday)- It was a 1/4 mile from the convention center and about 1/4 mile from the strip. the rooms were MASSIVE... 600 sq ft... staff was friendly, and the hotel provided everything that a normal casino on the strip would. I HIGHLY reccomend this place. It is vegas' best kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Suites is a great non-Vegasy place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EBJ11
Reviews.Content: Every January, I accompany my fiance to Vegas for a yearly trade show (NO- not CES or the porn show- heeheee! ). This year, the partners/employees came with us to work the booths and we needed a block of rooms. The Tuscany offered everything that is perfect for a working trip to Vegas for those NOT looking for the usual Vegas Experience (loud, smoky casinos, endless walk back to your room, 20 minute wait for your car at the valet, etc...). The rooms are HUGE, well appointed and clean. There is a kitchenette, living area and nice, large bathrooms. The rooms are housed in several buildings around the property and parking is just outside your door. They also have a large fitness center with it's own pool. We had breakfast every morning before the show at Marilyn's Cafe and it was good every morning. Large portions and great prices are featured and according to them- they did win an award recently for Best Breakfast. My picky fiance even loved the Steak & Eggs Special and said the steak was "excellent and perfectly cooked"- when do you ever hear that for a Breakfast Special ? LOL. There is also a very nice, upscale Italian restaurant and a small bakery/coffee shop- we did not visit either one but they looked good. You can get free internet in certain areas of this hotel but NOT in your room. As is typical in Vegas, you must pay a daily fee if you want to use the laptop in your room. There is a desk / workspace provided and we did pay to use internet the first night. They use Cox and the speed was decent. They do have a small casino but I do mean SMALL for those that gotta have it. If you want a nice place to stay while in Vegas that doesn't make you feel as though you are in Vegas- try Tuscany. Did I mention that the price per room was truly a GREAT DEAL- that may make you happy too ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marmoe56
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is a very lovely property nothing from anything else you expect in Las Vegas, we loved our stay. The rooms where spacious and clean, great and friendly staff especially in restaurants. Loved the location, a hop and a skip away from the strip? Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: rap29
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and nice. 10 min. walk to strip. Will definitely stay again. Staff at the Casino rewards does not know what she's doing and probably needs more training.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & great for families!”
Reviews.Author: Carebear969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany Suites for the first time this week with my husband and two kids 8 & 12. GREAT value! We spent only $47 per night and I was pleasantly surprised by how happy I was with the accommodations considering the reasonable rates! Our room was a little dated, however it was clean and VERY spacious which is important with kids. Our room was well equipped and provided a great home base for 4 nights in Vegas. Our room had two double beds, couch, coffee table, dresser, dining table & chairs, sink, refrigerator and we had a microwave delivered. The bathroom had a separate tub and shower and toilet room with a door, which is a plus with four people sharing facilities! The two pools are heated and the jacuzzi's are very big. We spent the mornings swimming in January! Needless to say the weather happened to be gorgeous! I highly recommend the Tuscany suites. I really liked the fact that you did not have to go through a smoky casino to get to your room and parking was great. The Cantina Mexican restaurant was my favorite dining experience throughout our whole stay! Marilyn's Cafe was great for breakfast. The kids shared the $6.99 Steak and Eggs and loved it. The location is great as well! Close to everything! I agree with the prior reviews that this is the best kept secret in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay, Would Book Again and Again - Less than $60!”
Reviews.Author: NickBeaufortSC
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel, big, clean, well-appointed rooms. Good linens, suite with mini-kitchen, micro0wave, refrigerator and living room, for less than $60 per night! There was little exceptional, except the value. For discount chain costs, a room that was at least Hampton Inn quality, and good service, inexpensive restaurants and large casino (if that is of any interest to you.)

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: djsunshine99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times over the last five years. Love the lay out and the non Vegas atmosphere much appreciated when you are in LV on business. I was on vacation in LV for 2 days on my way to Hawaii. To our horror, my nephew found bed bugs in his bed. Front desk did not manage very well. They moved us to another building and expressed a small "sorry". We inspected the redecorated room and found no bugs. We decided to spend our second night there, since finding another hotel would have been very time consuming. We did not sleep well thinking that we may be awaken by fleas eating us alive.

Reviews.Title: “Good room...not great, not bad...just good.”
Reviews.Author: geoqwest
Reviews.Content: This was a quick 3 day getaway from our home in Kelowna BC Canada arranged as a Christmas present to me from my wife. It was an Expedia package. I travel alot on business and I'm not fussy when it come to hotels. In reality, they are a bed, a TV and a www link home. I seldom travel for pleasure unless my wife needs a getaway. So this review is based on the cost coming out of my own pocket. In that regard, I judge hotels by quality to value. Any hotel charging + $250 does not deserve to be rated highly as it should be by default that your stay would be perfect. For me, good value hides in the lower end gems to be found in any city or town. The Tuscany is not a gem but nor is it a dump. The immediate outstanding feature is the size of the rooms. They are huge! Now...is that a good thing? I guess it is in our bigger is better consumer crazy lifestyles. But I stood in the center of the room one morning wondering what I was supposed to do with the space. Aerobics classes? Model airplane flying? Invite Cirque de Soleil in for a private performance? You almost could. But we were in the room basically only to sleep. Hmmm, I dunno. It's nice... I guess. Also as I stood in the room, I looked around to try to figure out why the place looked so...well, spartan. All the furniture is average and in decent shape. The bed covering were also average. The bathroom was clean, nicely tiled and as big to match the main room. There was a safe, an ironing board, laundry service, fridge and small kitchen sink. It has all the stuff of any decent hotel room. So why did it seem so vanilla plain? Maybe it was the industrial grade carpet or the stark white semi gloss paint. I dunno. Toning down the hospital white walls with Tuscany style tan shades found on the public spaces of the hotel would go a long way. One thing that was great was the quiet setting away from the zoo that is the strip. It was a wonderful reprive to be back a the hotel at night. The walk to the strip is not that bad. But after walking the strip all day, those two blocks back to the hotel seem to have grown. If you're fat and out of shape, do yourself a favor and stay here to get some excercise. Or kill yourself by staying on the strip with only an elevator ride to the buffet. There is lots to see away from the strip as well. So rent a car from the net (Enterprise, Jan 2011, $13 a day, full size Mitsubishi Galant) and drive around. Do not rent by walking into the storefront as the rates are waaay higher. Book on the net. The Tuscany has lots of parking with bicycle play police patrolling. But it's a rental car. Don't worry. Take your stuff out, lock it and walk away. There is free parking and easy access to all the casino self parkades. So after all this rambling, what do I think about the Tuscany? Um. It's ok. Not dissapointing, sort of forgettable. Would I stay again? No. Not because the place is bad but just because I'd like to have another hotel experince in LV. If you are headed for LV to have a memorable resort experience and you don't mind spending a few hundred bucks more for bragging rights to stay in a name brand LV stirp hotel...stay on the strip. If you are looking for value, a quiet spot away from the strip zoo and maybe a private Cirque show in your own room, stay at the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: agilipuppy
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. The restaurants are expensive, but the food is great! Very convenient, a 20 minute walk to the strip. or a 10$ cab ride. The rooms are HUGE. I loved that. Nice & clean. We did have a few issues. Our toilet kept running. We would have called the front desk about it, but our phone did not work. Beer was very expensive, and was not really available to buy unless you walked down the street. (We stayed in the room for new years) The pool areas looked nice. No microwave in the room. There's a kitchen area, but no microwave. Weird. Stayed on the 2nd floor and had an elephant in the room above us. So, if you do stay, stay on the 3rd. Internet cost $ to use in the Business center.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: bride619
Reviews.Content: I had gone to this chapel and booked my wedding with my fiancé. At the time we were helped by a women named Rebecca, she was so sweet that we decided to book our wedding with her. A few months later I returned to Vegas (from California) to handle all the wedding and reception details with my two sisters. While we were there my sisters wanted to see where the ceremony was going to take place. I called the chapel to make sure it was okay to come by. When we arrived a woman named DOMONIQUE GORDON was there to “help us”. My sisters started looking around and throwing out ideas on how to personalize the chapel, i.e. put up bows, or remove plants, etc. But before I could tell my sisters in my own way, “thanks but no thanks” for their ideas, DOMONIQUE proceeded to talk over them and cut them off and intrude on our personal conversation, and in very rude tones she kept telling us no, we can’t do those things, to make sure we all knew that the ceremony could not be personalized at all. I then told her I knew that, and walked away from her to continue our conversation. She followed us and again very rudely told me “you’re already booked, there’s no real reason for you to be here”. She acted as if we were a waste of her time and was rushing us out…even though there were no events booked for the day. The next morning I was very upset and informed hotel management about what had happened. Later that day DOMONIQUE the “head of the chapel” called and told me “I was told to apologize to you ‘cuz I cut you off or something.” That sent me from just a little bothered, to mad. I was so mad I could not believe I was being treated so poorly. Management told me they could do nothing for me, that as head of the chapel it was DOMONIQUE’s call. Needless to say, she did nothing for me. She wouldn’t even return my phone calls. So since my save the dates have gone out and my guests are already booking I am stuck here. Please don’t let this happen to you, they only care about you until you give them your money.

Reviews.Title: “Just One Big Problem - Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: CUBBZ
Reviews.Content: Well I was prepared to write a favourable review of the Tuscany, i dont like the $10 resort fee daily but at least I knew in advance about it and the $14 per day charge for wifi in your room is ridiculous and the $30 per hour fee to use their outdated PC is just silly. The room was large and very clean with one big exception. Maid service was very good and the beds and pillows were very comfortable EXCEPT I was eaten alive by Bedbugs! And when i reported the bedbugs to the front desk, I was greeted with a yawn So I have about 30 rather nasty red marks to show for my stay. And if you want a very reasonable price buffet breakfast I recommend a stroll to Terribles

Reviews.Title: “nice clean accommodations, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sunshower82
Reviews.Content: The pool area was nice and rooms were very spacious and clean. We had rented a car so the distance to the strip and attractions was not an issue. The food on site was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: Dream_BC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once but been here twice for conferences. Last stay was in Nov. 2009. Its a two block walk to the strip but we did it multiple times and it never interfered with our access. We did not have a vehicle and that didnt matter. Great service - definitely stop in at the Concierge - from check in, to casino, to check out. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “affordable nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bai_lao_su
Reviews.Content: you need to do a little bit of walking if staying at this hotel. it is located is not located at the main attraction of vegas. we prepaid the room charged and due to our late checked in, the front desk take a little bit more time to process our checked in. the hotel surrounding is quiet and so is the room. the room is so huge, even comes with mini dining table, coffee maker and sofa. the toilet is so clean and they have seperated shower room and bath tub. just stayed here for 1 day so cant comment much on the hotel staff and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas,best food great service.”
Reviews.Author: JessieH61
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a new recently renovated room which was beautiful and clean. The Italian dining room Tuscany Gardens was amazing. I also ate at the Cantina, which was the best Mexican food I have ever had.I will stay there every time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, value!”
Reviews.Author: salukisue
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany Suites and Casino is located about two blocks from the Strip. This is great because it is within walking distance, but away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. When we arrived we were upgraded to a large room, with a balcony overlooking the pool area. This was very nice. The hot tub was very nice-large and hot, but pool was cold. Housekeeping cleaned every day. The casino is small, but we signed up for the players club and got free drinks and $ to gamble with. We ate at Marilyn's cafe-great late night steak and eggs for $3.99. If you are driving you are able to park right outside your room. Staff was friendly and welcoming. There is also a fitness center, which we did not use, but is a nice plus. Room had coffee maker and refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “bad mattresses, and bleh staff.”
Reviews.Author: gayokwithme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice on the outside, but is about a 20min walk to the strip. The food at the two restaurants were decent. We enjoyed that they were open 24 hours, as was the smoke filled casino next to the lobby. The staff at the front desk and concierge were adequate, however the hotel operator used the word "ain't, and nah uh" very unprofessional. I didn't enjoy the uncomfortable mattress that felt like it was 10 years old, and had a speed bump in the middle of it. The shower and bathroom were decent, but nothing great. The room was average sized, large for vegas I guess, but the furniture is all out-dated. Spend $20 more and stay at a 4 star property... This one is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Parking Lot”
Reviews.Author: lvnir
Reviews.Content: Every time I stay here they either have have loud people or insensitive people amping up their car speakers at night. Rooms are great but beware of the surrounding noise.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay there”
Reviews.Author: travelacea2z
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms with all amenities. Internet is a little too expensive for this day and age but room service is good. Location is not bad either, especially if you have a car and your business is not on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: AnieQuebec
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe what we got for such a low price. Huge suite, nice and clean. Great place to stay with kids. We nones the pool area and spent a lot of time there. Friendly staff. Walking distance of the Strip and monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Made my birthday!”
Reviews.Author: mylove829
Reviews.Content: I stayed on 11/14 and told them it was my bday and they gave me an upgraded renovated room first I had a rm with 2 double beds but I had asked for a king so they had a bell person come and move me. Great service! The ice machine in the building was out so room service brought us a huge bag of ice! The room was wonderful and quiet! I loved it! I didn't approve of the $10 resort fee since it was 60 degrees and no one was using the pool but we got 2 free drinks and some great coupons. I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: harveyhousehold
Reviews.Content: hi as per the previous English persons reveiw the kitchenett should not be there, there is no cups, no plates, saucepans not even a kettle. i did go to reception to ask about a kettle and unfortuntaley they did not seem to understand what i wanted. i do not drink coffee so had to go out to buy a kettle and cups (not something you would expect to have to do with a room with a kitchen in it). that is my only complaint and comparrison to the previous English persons review. we loved the hotel, staff friendly, hotel very clean, rooms extremely large (compared to anything you can find in the UK), beds were a little hard for me but still slept like a log, pool not as big as the pictures make out but large enough for the kids to have lots of fun in. they were doing maintenance on the hotel area while we were there, a bit of painting and repair work (just to keep it looking good not that it really needed it) the Marilyns resturant was reasonable priced and the food was ok. we were at the hotel for 4 days and yes there are down and outs about but that is life(think we saw maybe one or two each day between the hotel and the strip and they left you alone never asked for anything), we went to New York hotel (kids wanted to do the roller coaster) and there were down and outs sleeping on the walkway bridge above the road by the entrance of New York hotel so no discrimination about where they sleep. if you do not want the expense of a large hotel and you are not there just for the gambling then this hotel is perfect for you. Ballys is a 5 to 10 min walk (depending on how fast you walked), you then have the Paris hotel next door to Ballys across the road is the Bellagio, your have the Flamingo, Mirage, Treasue Island, Ventian all with in walking distance. if you decide to take the mono rail there is a stop at Ballys, from the Tuscany hotel walk upto Ballys and enter at the valet parking entrance turn left and the mono rail is just up from there. i would be more than happy to stay there again and recommend it to my friends and family

Reviews.Title: “dowdy!!! needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: oscar4662
Reviews.Content: this hotel was showing kitchen facilities on the virtual tour but these facilties did not work! and we were told by the manager that the kitchen facilties were being removed!! the coffee maker did not work and although we asked twice for another it took two days we still did not get one that worked! when I asked for a glass instead of a paper cup I was told that I could buy a glass from the gift shop! Good photographs of the bedrooms but bore no resemblance to the room we had!! It is two blocks from the strip but we did not feel safe walking to the strip past down and outs in a very downmarket area! so used taxi's instead! We checked out two days early

Reviews.Title: “In a sea of mediocrity, a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: MicroSmythe
Reviews.Content: If you've ever stayed on the strip in Las Vegas, you know how noisy and tawdry it can sometimes be, so it was a delight to find this quiet, beautifully sheltered hotel only a short walk away from the strip. We discovered it as a one night stay before catching our outgoing flight from the city, and compared to so many of the HUGE "palaces" the Tuscany Suites are a refreshingly pleasant oasis. Our suite was indeed that, a very large room with a king sized bed, a sitting area, a small kitchenette, and a large well appointed bathroom. Everything was spotless, it was very quiet, and the little walk from our room through the beautiful gardens to the dining areas and casino was the capstone of our visit. The dining room offered a complete menu of great choices and the service was excellent. Breakfast the next morning offered anything you could possibly wish. If we ever have to stay in Las Vegas again I would consider ONLY this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: HRGArizona
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel previously about three years ago, and when we took another trip we decided to stay again. This time I wasn't as impressed. The location is nice, right off the strip and easily within walking distance. But the beds were something to be desired. The room is slightly outdated as well, and seemed a little dirty. It would have been better to sleep on the floor. The beds seemed like the springs had broken and the bed was sagging. We did go in the pool a bit, and it was nice, but nothing to write home about. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants nor go into the casino area. The bathrooms were decent and large. If it were not for the bed, I would probably stay here again because it is usually a reasonable price and close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Service is horrible, all else average.”
Reviews.Author: dma4x
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here 3 nights. We selected it based on the price and the location to the Strip (~10min walk). The rooms are huge and clean but not beautiful. The service (maid, front desk, managers, etc.) are average to below quality. We had trouble using some of the coupons that you get for the 'resort fee'. One in particular offered a discount on meals in the hotel restaurants. Our server assured us we could use the coupon for our order but when we paid we were told the coupon would not be honored. We complained to the cashier, the manager, and eventually the manager's boss who just blew us off and never got back to us. I'm surprised that a hotel would risk losing customers over a $6.99 discount. Horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Armando needs to get fired”
Reviews.Author: QuinkaWinka
Reviews.Content: i absolutely love this hotel. this is the hotel i came into the very first time i ever been in Vegas two years ago, and the first hotel I wanted when I came back this May, and Im choosing it again when i come back tomorrow. I work for an airline and have the leisure to travel anytime and anywhere and Tuscany is definitely one of the best hotels for your money. I would suggest to rent a car because Taxi from the airport to the hotel is around $20 bucks one way. To get to the strip, its around $15 one way (rates without tip) ... so you do the math. You can find car rentals cheaper than that and parking is always free on the casinos. Tuscany is clean, quiet, not too far to actually have a 15 min walk from the strip, but far enough to just have a quite and relaxing night after all the madness. HOWEVER, as i saw from another review, ARMAND NEEDS TO GET FIRED. He is NOT THE MANAGER. He makes PERVERTED JOKES, and he was DRUNK DURING THE SHIFT. He made perverted jokes towards me and my new husband because it was our honeymoon and he made perverted jokes to my mother and friends as well. There is one thing to make a joke, but another to just be plain disgusting. My friends and I truly enjoy the $3 blackjack table they have and it will be absolutely wonderful to be in Tuuscany and have that annoying Armand fired. But other than him, everything else about this hotel is amazing and I love it, i will not go to any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect off the strip hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chantelle_enns
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay off the Vegas strip but not too far off this is the perfect hotel for you. The rooms are large and roomy, the gym has everything you need, there is a pool that looked clean though I didn't have time to go in it, and the food, especially Marilyn's Cafe ,was awesome especially at breakfast. They have some options for fit minded people which really helped and the coffee was amazing. The only bad thing I could say is that they need new pillows. But a definite recommendation just the same!

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: HeidiDD
Reviews.Content: For a three star hotel, we really liked this hotel. It is NOT the Bellagio, but they do not claim to be. This is a great place to stay as long as you are not expecting to be staying in a higher star hotel. We booked this hotel on Orbitz for $25 a night. With the $10 resort fee we checked out paying $36!!! What a great deal! You cannot BEAT that! The check in was quick and the staff was very nice. There have been complaints about the staff, but I had no problems. They were nice and professional! The room was huge!!! We had a room with two queen beds. The beds were more like full size than queen, but we didn't mind. The beds were comfortable and suitable for the night. I checked for bed bugs that had been mentioned in another review, but didn't find anything! Not even dirty mattresses. The mattresses were clean and in good condition. We got back from the "O" show at 12, and went right to sleep. The walls of the room are a little thin and I could see that noise might be a problem if you are a light sleeper. I had ear plugs and didn't hear a thing. I slept in until 9 am, and had no problems with noise. Check out is 11am. We did have to wait about 10 minutes to check out. That was a little annoying, and they really should have more staff for checking out guests. That was the only negative of our stay. Overall our stay at the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Tuscany Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: CiliaOttawa
Reviews.Content: This was trip number seven to the Tuscany Hotel and Casino and trip number nine to Vegas. And again we were not disappointed. The Tuscany is like an oasis away from the craziness of the strip. This time we were in “C” building third floor. We always ask for a building near the casino or main building. The buildings are quiet spread out and we just feel more comfortable having a shorter walk to our room later in the evening. We also ask for the third floor so that we cannot hear people walking above us. Our requests have always been accommodated. While we were there this time a lot of the rooms were being renovated on our floor. It seems like there is always some kind of improvements being made. We have never had any major problems with our rooms. They are huge and comfortable. I have noticed that over the years, the staff have become a lot more service oriented. They always gave good service, but now they do it with a lot more enthusiasm. If there is one negative about staying here, it is the walk to the strip. It’s not that it is too long it’s just not very pleasant. There are a few empty lots that have lots of broken bottles and such thrown into them. There are parts where local people sit around and drink and this time we even came across a fight. For the most part they do not bother you, but it’s an uneasy feeling. To end on a positive note, I noticed that the Tuscany is now quoting rates on their website that includes the $10 resort fee. Good for them to set themselves apart from the rest of the hotels that still charge it separately

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, just off the 'Strip'”
Reviews.Author: Jaffacake31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Tuscany Suites this year whilst in Las Vegas, having been in Las Vegas 3 times previously staying at the Luxor, MGM Grand and The Orleans, we where confident that the Tuscany Suites would be well situated for all our needs. The hotel is nice and clean, has very large suites, much larger than the previously mentioned hotels. It is about a two block walk the the strip, you will arrive at Bally's where you can get the monorail. The food Marilyns Cafe is good value for money, with a wide range on the menu. In my opinion why pay more for a bed on a strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany is the place to book your conference!”
Reviews.Author: LeighW
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the Tuscany Sept 22 through Oct 1st. We had 30 rooms there, and we held a large banquet there and has meetings there also. The entire staff loved the nice, large, clean rooms with comfortable beds. The food was fabulous! Thank you Patty for your suggestions for our banquet - it was a huge success. All of the staff at the Tuscany were very friendly and did their jobs well. The location is great, only a short walk to the strip, and yet quiet when you need it to be, as it is not right on the strip. Our group will be staying here again, and I recommend this hotel for anyone needing to book a conference. We have never had everything go so smooth, and our group has stayed at 4 and 5 star resorts. The Tuscany is a true Gem just off the strip. Nice, easy access to the convention center too. Great job Tuscany and thanks for making my job easier!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: hkim1017
Reviews.Content: It was a good deal, but ice machine did not work. TV was not that great, not a flat screen tv, but it was working fine

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tickover2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the Las Vegas experinece in a small and friendly way. We will certainly go back. Rooms excellent and claen with good facilities. Pool small but very good. Stff very helpful. Used all restaurants on site and all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A gem off the Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Carole098
Reviews.Content: I attended a seminar here for the first time and was told by some that this was an older hotel and not to expect much. I was totally surprised as usually stay in 5* and was not disappointed with my stay here! All the staff from the curb side bellman to the front desk,in the restaurants and casino were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and were very large along with a huge bathroom. At check-in you are given coupons to try their many ammenities which wre a great value. It was the first time I stayed off the Strip and was very surprised at the calming atmosphere when you wanted it. It is not too far a walk or cab ride to the strip.The pool,hot tub and other facilities were all in great working order and in every restaurant the food was delicious and a good value for your money. I definately will be staying there again on my next trip to Vegas for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms. Very big! Mini...”
Reviews.Author: LA_editor
Reviews.Content: Really nice rooms. Very big! Mini kitchenette. Separate shower & tub. I didn't go into the casino or eat at the restaurant. The pool looked nice and big. I had a first floor room but would definitely encourage people to get a second floor room as the footsteps of the person above me were REALLY loud & woke me up at 8am. Otherwise, really nice, clean & spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: whitey17
Reviews.Content: great place to stay just off the strip which is in easy walking distance,the suite we had was great with with a good size bathroom and walkin shower,slots played well we even won a few times on them most of the cocktail waitress were very nice and always had a smile for us,pool was lovely and relaxed stayed open till 10pm plus a great lap pool,coffee shop made a great cappucino at a fair price tuscany gardens a good menu and the food was always presented well,the only down fall for us was the poker room had been shut down,we are gamblers and this was a great place for us to do this for value for money,we enjoyed our stay there that much we have already booked again for april next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ipseityuk
Reviews.Content: I've just got back to the UK having spent 2 weeks at the Tuscany Suites. Honestly - I didn't want to come home. It couldn't be better situated - It's walking distance from both the Strip and Paradise Road. There are good restaurants very close by, the casino is well equipped and the pina coladas are nice and toxic! The swimming pools take some getting used to - i.e. they're quite salty! Our room seemed huge, the bed was massive and extremely comfy - Probably too comfy, truth be told, as I never wanted to leave it. Obviously, nothing is perfect, so my only criticisms are that the pictures show a kitchen - We thought "Great, we can eat in" but it's only really possible if you take your own crockery, cutlery, pans etc. as none of it is supplied! We did raise the issue with reception - Just on the off chance you had to ask for such things and the woman wasn't very helpful, she just said "Well, some of the rooms don't even have a kitchen at all" - Yeh, cos that make sense! For the $10 a day resort fee that you're expected to pay at the end of your stay, you get use of the pools, maid service & tea & coffee. They are a bit tight with the tea & coffee though! The $14 for 24 hours of internet in your room is only really worth it if you need to use Skype, otherwise it's best to just sit by the main pool and use the free public access internet - There are power outlets down there too, so you can plug in. Marilyn's Restaurant at the Tuscany Suites is, to be perfectly honest, a bit naff. The service is hit and miss and the food is bordering on poor.
