Maybe it's because I'm English, but I kind of expect some vegetables with my dinner that aren't fried or coated in a sickly glaze. It's not very vegetarian friendly! The Cantina however, is fantastic and the staff are wonderful! We had a meal there for my partners birthday and even though we'd only mentioned it in passing, they brought out a complimentary cake, complete with candle! There is a handy gas station/convenience store at the end of the block which is open 24 hours, and round the corner of Koval is our greatest discovery of the trip - Ellis Island Casino & Brewery - The breakfasts are cheap and amazing, they brew their own beer - The best in Vegas! It's cheap too - $6 for 4 pints. I can't rave enough about the place really! All in all, if you want value for money, no screaming kids, a pool that isn't heaving with people and want a relaxing vacation with easy access to the Strip. Go here. You won't regret it, it's absolutely fantastic. We've only been back home a day, but we've already decided it's the place we'll be going back to next time.

Reviews.Title: “great "space/location"”
Reviews.Author: jnho
Reviews.Content: Tuscany offered ver large rooms with a comfortable seating/work area. Just 3 blocks off the middle of the Strip, it offered easy accessability, but a wonderful retreat from the crowded blvd. There were also bonus coupons for food and drinks. Aso pool, gym and laundry were included......highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Prices”
Reviews.Author: thecookielady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and appreciate the location which is just a block from the Las Vegas Strip. You can park close to your room too. Lobby is nice with WiFi and bar. I also like that you don't have to go through the casino to get to the registration desk. Pool is okay, usually lots of kids. But there is a lap pool and jacuzzi by the fitness center that isn't as crowded. Marilyn's Cafe is 24 hours and pretty decent, especially the Sunday T-bone special for $8.99, you can't beat it...delicous. There always seems to be little maintenance issues with the rooms. But the rooms are large and clean, beds are pretty good. I've had both luxury bedding and crummy old bedding, never know what you'll get I guess. Prices are very reasonable especially on Sunday - Thursday. Keep in mind though that they are going to add a $10 "resort fee" to the rate. Wish they'd just be up front and tell you what the whole price is going to be. All in all, I intend to continue to stay here whenever in Las Vegas which is 3-4 times a year to visit friends.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Vegasbaby29
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tuscany suites many times over the last 5 yrs or so. The first thing that will grab your attention is the size of the rooms. I still don't understand why the are so big. Instead of paying top dollar to stay on the strip, we do up Las Vegas they way it is meant to be done... show every night, out until well after midnight, drunk every day, sightseeing (heli to grand canyon), shopping, etc... with all the savings we get from staying one block away. I don't get why people spend so much to stay at Bellagio's etc., because if you spend that much time in your room in Vegas, you are missing the boat. Marilyn's has daily specials that we always hit before heading out to the strip. As an example last stay, I had spaghetti and meatballs (there must have been 2 pounds of spaghetti... I ate about 1/4 of the plate... and am a big eater) and it was $4.99. How can you beat that??? The place is always clean, people nice... I would and will stay here again... without question.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: diggerdale1
Reviews.Content: liked the look of this hotel from previous visits to vegas & couldnt resist booking when i found a fantastic deal on expedia,but nothing prepared me for the size of the rooms it was like entering doctor whos tardis.pool area was nice & clean as was everywhere,loved the size of the casino.staff were nice & friendly not at all like some of the reviews i read.5min walk to strip & as everybody keeps ranting about,ellis island just round the corner.thankyou tuscany for a great holiday.booked again for next year

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rianne25
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel after doing a lot of research because I just couldn't believe that is was so cheap. After being there, I still don't get it. The rooms were huge and very clean. Because the hotel isn't on the strip, it is very quiet and that was a great plus to come home after the chaos on the strip. But it is a 15 min walk to the strip, and that can be a very long walk when it's a 120 degrees outside. There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel (tried one and it was great) and they have a casino, but we didn't go there. Only downside: you have to pay for the wifi in your room, I think it was 13 dollars or so. I mean come one! But there is free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “My family spent 3 nights here in two...”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: My family spent 3 nights here in two rooms each had microwave and fridge and lots of space. Very comfortable, good pool. About 5 minutes walk to Ballys and the Strip but still quiet. The staff in the casino and restaurants were friendly. I got the rooms through Expedia at a very low rate even over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: paulmz
Reviews.Content: You're always skeptical when you see a "cheap" hotel rate. Every other hotel in Vegas was over $90 per night. I read other reviews about the Tuscany Suites hotel and have exactly all of the same things to say. First, the rooms are cheap- $47.04 for one night with a king bed after casino fee with tax. Second, the rooms are BIG- they are all suites and are about 600 square feet with bed(s), dresser, television, sofa with pull-out bed, chair with ottoman, coffee table, desk, kitchen table and chairs, refrigerator, coffee maker, kitchen cabinets, countertop, and sink, bathroom with separate toilet room and bath tub with separate tiled shower (great water pressure, too), large vanity with large mirrors and medicine cabinet. The room was quiet, and we didn't pay for a "pool view", still got a courtyard view close to the lap pool (and they have a standard pool, too- but they close at 10pm). The location is about three LONG block away from Ceasar's, which is the start of the strip (two of those three blocks is Bally's). We really only stayed at this hotel during a month-long road/camping trip, not really expecting a nice hotel for that price. We had no time to test other amenities, the restaurants, or the casinos in the hotel (sorry). But if you need a place to crash, this place is awesome. NOTE: this hotel, like all others in Vegas, charge "Resort Fees" (I don't understand why) at $10.00 per night as well as a $100 credit/debit card or $200 cash "incidental deposit". I received the refund back from this in about 3 days. Still, I cannot say enough: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT VALUE, GOOD LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I knew about Tuscany sooner”
Reviews.Author: vancouverTraveler59
Reviews.Content: My family lives in Las Vegas so we visit at least once a year and sometimes more. We really are not into the Vegas "thing" so we always stayed at properies out in the Summerlin area. Well, I was looking for a "deal" this time and found the Tuscany on a few sites. The reviews were all above average so I called them to book direct and was offered even lower rates than I found on sites like Expedia, Travelocity, etc. 19 bucks for Sun thru Thur and 50 bucks for Fri and Sat The rooms are wonderful!! EXTREMELY large (over 600 sq ft) with a wet bar, dining table with four chairs and a sitting area that includes a sofa, chair, end tables and coffe tables. The beds are very comfortable with pillow top mattresses. The bathroom is huge with a large counter with sink, bath tub and separate shower. The toilet itself is in a separate room within the bathroom. Just so you know that this is an impartial review, I'll throw in some negatives. The soap dish in the shower is too small to hold a bar of soap, shampoo and conditioner. There is only one towel rack in the bathroom so the towels get folded and left on the counter. Internet is only available for free in the public areas (there is a ten dollar per night "resort fee" that does not include internet in your room) so the public areas are full of people on their laptops. I paid 35 bucks for 3 days of room internet and it was blazing fast. Let's see, another complaint is there is no microwave in the wet bar but then, I never asked for one so they might be available. I will always stay at the Tuscany from this point forward...and not just because the rates are so low. BTW, Marilyns Cafe serves an awesome breakfast, a very good lunch, and very good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: juliethegardener
Reviews.Content: We like this place much better than the madhouses on the strip. Perfect for families who don't want to be bombarded with loads and loads of tourists. Great pool, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you want to stay off of the strip in a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulsharon10
Reviews.Content: We shopped around for some time until we stumbled upon the Tuscany Suites Hotel. A good size but significantly smaller than the goliath hotels of the strip, only two floor is definitely good, no waiting for elevators. Ideal base enabling you to visit the strip (10minute walk) but offering a secluded refuge from the mayhem. Some really good restaurants nearby and in the hotel. The rooms are enormous and very well equipped with a bed the size of our spare room at home. Staff very helpful and attentive. The only issue we had were hotel guests using the ice machine at 3am in the morning. Will definitely return with our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and a good value”
Reviews.Author: Filmwritin
Reviews.Content: It's not the most lavish Vegas hotel, nor is it the most decrepid. The Tuscany is quaint and has character. It's off the Strip but well within walking distance and is conveniently located. A gathering of separate 3-story buildings in a courtyard setting, it is a bit dated and their being only one elevator at the far end of each building is a frustration, but it's a value. The casino is small but friendly. The restaurants are awesome and the main lounge offers great entertainment. The Italian eatery is award winning and will not disappoint you. Okay, so it's not the Ritz and the clientelle may be a tad more casual than other upscale hotels, but it's "ok" by most standards and a good business travel option. The rooms are large by most standards - kind of a Motel 6 on steroids but with pictures on the walls and terrific housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: MaryP8
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel online and we went for the cost of the room. I was really shocked at how new the place was and how nice everything was. I'd go there in a heart beat anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out - Repeat Visitor Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ms33702
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany Suites several years ago and were very pleased. Not so this time. We were very surprised to learn that cleaning only takes place on alternate days now. There also seems to be a recurring problem with the door locks at the hotel. Desk clerks will print you 3 keys when yours fails, but they will suggest that the failure is your fault. ("Did you carry the key close to your cell phone?, we were asked.) After several experiences of waiting for security to open our door, the manager on duty finally admitted that the hotel knows of the key problem, but they seem to be disinterested in doing anything to correct the situation. Be careful of older reviews. This is not the same quality hotel that it was in the past. We will not stay here again...at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany WOWS with great room/service”
Reviews.Author: OceanLoverInDesert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. What a great find! The staff was courteous and helpful. There is a security deposit and a 10 dollar/day resort fee, but it was well worth it. The room was huge and very clean. The cleaning staff was prompt and thorough. The food at the cafe was VERY good, with some of the best coffee I have had. The comps were excellent, with a free drink and double the money on table games with 5 dollar play. The concierge was extremely helpful, allowing me to get some food and drinks to my wife in the room while we were out for our anniversary night. It made our trip that much more memorable. The strip is only about a block away, and it is easy to get there with cabs or just driving, since all of the casinos have free parking. A great visit, and we will return. Thanks Tuscany!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: jason9111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany for a week during a business trip. I read almost all the reviews prior to staying there, good and bad. Listen, for the money, this is the best kept secret in Las Vegas. I can't even rent a low budget under construction hotel at home for this price. The rooms are pretty spacious and they have a separate tub and shower. Choice of 3 restaurants inside, one Mexican, one fine dining Italian, and one that serves just about anything all the time. They also have another small place that serves pizza. I ate at two of the three and found them to be great. The casino is a pretty good size, but not overly done. Plenty of machines for entertainment though. The bar has beers for $3, which for Vegas is pretty good considering most places are $6. The strip is just a few blocks up and you can be on it walking in less than 10 minutes. A cab fare for us back to the hotel was about $8 from the Luxor. They gave us a coupon book when we checked in with 2 free drinks in the casino, 2- buy 1 get 1 free meal coupons for one of their restaurants and a pizza discount voucher. I don't know if this was because we were there on business, or if everyone got those. Listen, I have reviewed hotels, airplanes, cruises, etc., and no matter what you can take 100 people to the same place and get half that they it was great and another half that hates it. If you are a pretty easy going person you will enjoy this hotel. Obviously this is not the MGM or Caesars Palace,so if you want those upscale amenities, then that is where you should book. If you want a very nice hotel with everything there that you need, just a couple blocks from the stip in a pretty good location that is safe and convenient, this is the best value for your buck. Overall, I was very impressed with this hotel for the price. Enough said. The WIFI was availalbe anywhere downstairs near the pool, lobby, etc, so don't pay extra for the internet unless you just have to have it in your room.

Reviews.Title: “a little hidden jewel close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: richee55
Reviews.Content: room were brilliant and spacious, hotel staff friendly and helpfull,the grounds were spacious and calm and serene and all in all we thought this hotel was one of the best me and my wife have stopped at. We will definetly be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value”
Reviews.Author: RoyR
Reviews.Content: I got a huge, comfortable, clean and supplied room for about $25.00 a night. I'm spoiled now!! I almost could not afford to come home, Close to the strip, great pool, good restaurants, I'm a fan!!

Reviews.Title: “I was satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: michelyn318
Reviews.Content: Let me start by telling you that all the reviews had me a bit nervous, but when we arrived there was no line to check in. The front desk staff were very accommodating. We were given two rooms in Building F, 3rd floor and it was perfect! Very quiet,, clean, close to fitness center and pool. The room was huge, and perfect for a family. The decor is a bit dated, but this is NOT the Bellagio! The fridge and microwave worked fine, the TV was OK, the beds were comfy, the shower was hot and good water pressure. No problems what so ever with the room. The fitness center was extremely disappointing. No 10 lb. weights? WTH?? Only three cardio machines in working order. Overall, it sucked. The pool was clean and a bit crowed at peak hours, but we made do. The restaurant, Tuscany Garden, was delightful. Good food, excellent service. The Palazzo Bar was cute and had a good band playing. My biggest complaint was the valet service. We did not rent a car so we took taxis everywhere. The people working outside at the taxi stand barely speak English and they take their sweet time calling a cab because they get a kick-back from the hired cars that are hanging around. I would stay here again, but I'd rent a car. This is my honest review. I've been to Vegas four times. This was far better than the Flamingo last year. FAR BETTER...

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Opanook
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels in Vegas for ages and found Tuscany on an internet search. We were going to be meeting up with friends in Vegas for New Years Eve and our wedding celebrations. We wanted somewhere nice with larger rooms so we could just hang out with our friends but still be close to the strip. The Tuscany certainly delivered. When we booked, we requested rooms near one another and on arrival, even though we arrived on different days, we were all located in rooms next to each other - no problems. The rooms were very spacious and clean. They weren't brand new, but not old either. They were just right. Lounge area, kitchen area, massive bed and bathroom. Nice little toiletries in the bathroom and serviced each day. It was nice on New Years Eve to be close enough to walk to the strip for the celebrations but then a 10 minute (slow) walk away, we were back home - away from the noise and chaos. Our friends left just after New Years and we stayed on in Vegas for a few more days. We didn't really need a bigger room then and we wanted to also experience a "Strip room" so we checked into the Paris Hotel & Casino. Great location - but noisy with the fountains every 15 mins. We actually missed having the room space to move around in. Tuscany is a very nice Vegas alternative. The staff during our stay were friendly and professional. The only negative - we booked nearly 10 months out from our visit. During the year the rates dropped and when I phoned reservations to see if it our rate could be changed, I was told "no, too bad." I canceled the reservations then rebooked on the website for cheaper rates. I was a little frustrated that the lady at reservations couldn't just match the rate and save having to do all the paperwork. Apart from that, Tuscany was lovely and we had a nice relaxing stay. Would stay there again if we needed somewhere with a bit of room to move.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Clean Rooms/Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Arthur W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in June. Was very wary because of the low price. Was very pleasantly surprised. Nice clean rooms, loose slots, very friendly staff especially in the restaurants. Walking to the strip in the heat of the day is a bit of a chore but in the morning it is very easy. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Suites - Superb quality & location...”
Reviews.Author: viper302
Reviews.Content: If you do not want to stay on the strip then this is the place for you - it's quiet, has a lovely pool & sun lounging facilities (they even provide towels) and is very secure - you need your room key to get in, the surroundings are are also very pleasent & tranquil, they have a casino, bar, pizza place, gift shop, restaurant, cafe bar etc etc, the rooms are very spacious with kitchenette, two big beds, table & chairs, sofa, chair & coffee table, work table, television, spacious bathroom with shower cubicle, the list goes on. There are amenities near by - bar/coffee shop and a great eating place called 'Ellis Island' (well recommended) the food & price cannot be beaten, they even have their own micro brewery!...

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: aztiffer
Reviews.Content: We decided on Tuscany Suites because of it's price and it's location being close to the strip. The room was very spacious and clean and had a refridgerator which was convenient. The lobby, gift shop, restaurants and lounge were all very nice with friendly staff. Pool was well kept. My only complaint was the fitness center....there was only two treadmills, one was broke. One eliptical and three bikes. For the size of this property the fitness center should have more cardio machines and TV's would be nice. Use the 10.00 resort fee to spruce up the fitness center !!! Tuscany was a great place located around many very nice restaurants and just a short distance from the strip. I would definetely stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of security guards and prostitutes”
Reviews.Author: cosmogalanlasvegas
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel-casino because i wanted to be close to the strip but not in it, but big mistake from my part. Excalibur, flamingo, sahara and others are a much better deal than this corrupt and small hotel-casino. And visitors beware: There is a collussion between security guards and prostitutes The casino operator may not be aware of this situation, but I saw a couple of victims -one of them complaining about a girl asking for money from a client, the client complaining with the security guards and this guys letting the prostitutes go immediately when trouble arouse and blaming the client and covering the working girls. Shame on Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but they should include the resort fee in the room price”
Reviews.Author: bunegal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany Suites because I didn't care for the hotel where my conference was, and the rates were awesome. I was a bit disappointed by a $10 resort fee as they offered nothing out of the ordinary. Considering the rate was only $28, that increased the price significantly. The room was large and clean, and the grounds were safe and relatively well kept. I would stay there again if the rates were comparable. It was nothing out of the ordinary, but it was a good value for a clean, decent sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Dirty Place”
Reviews.Author: Indagroove001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in one week, so we had two different rooms. It was a stop over as we were traveling to Arizona. Both rooms were nasty dirty. The first room was a king with a sleeper sofa. They do NOT carry sheets and pillows for the sleeper sofa, I had to track down one of the maids to get some sheets and pillows for it. I asked her for a couple sheets and a pillow, she gave me a cup off her cart? I guess english is not a second language in this hotel. Second room I reserved a king again, got there and none were available so we ended up with 2 double beds. This room was even more dirty than the last, the carpet still had cigarette ashes all over the floor, they did not even vacuum the place UGH! The shower heads could peel paint off a car they were so strong, reminded me of the showers on the ship when I was in the Navy. The tub had black mold around the drain and it was quite a scary place to stay in. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jazzguy512
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Tuscany 3 nights, but after booking we noticed a few adverse comment and was a little apprehensive. None were true with us, our experience was great!!! There was a $10 per night fee for something (???) that was added, but still a bargain for $32 per night. Our room was clean, spacious, very comfortable beds, friendly staff, moderately priced menu with good food. There will be a "next time" for us. With all the plus's there were a few annoyances, like the guest above us walking his elephant at 5 AM, but it wasn't the Tuscany's fault. And I lost one dollar playing the slots...but I take full responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, great location, great facilities - HUGE tv!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ca52
Reviews.Content: Husband managed to leave all the passports in the airport taxi and the security man at the hotel was brilliant at getting us reunited with our paperwork. Facilities here are excellent, great restaurants - especially Marilyn's cafe which serves a wonderful breakfast! Our room was outstanding - HUGE - with cooking facilities, fridge dining table, comfy chairs and settee - did I mention the HUGE tv?! Bath and separate shower - everything spotlessly clean and maintained. The lap pool was great as was the big pool. You could always get a sunbed and table even on Memorial Day weekend when the hotel was full. About a 15 minute walk to the Strip although we generally used the hire car. We had a wonderful time here and will definitely come again. Highly recommended. Don't understand the facilities charge though - why don't they just put it on the price of the room?

Reviews.Title: “good option just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: If you you are after a nice room, but would like to save some dollars compared to the hotels on the Strip, this is a excellent option. With a 5 minutes walk, you are in front of the Bally's hotel, therefore in the middle of one of the liveliest spots in Vegas (Bellaggio, Cesar's, Flamingo). The hotel is spotless, nice big rooms with fairly new decor and all the facilities you may need. The pool is ok and the restaurant has good breakfast deals (the plates are huge). Mind you that it does not have a buffet. You have a parking in front and a casino if you do not fancy to walk at all.

Reviews.Title: “I liked that this was a small hotel with nice pool, restaurant, on site parking close to rooms.”
Reviews.Author: djfurlong
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this very affordable hotel with 2 pools and the Tuscany Restaurant which we received a discount on with coupons. It was a bit of a walk to the strip~15minutes but well worth the price and the smaller easier to navigate hotel environment. The furniture was a little dated but clean and the beds had been updated. It reminded me of an apartment complex. The rooms were large with couches, refrige sink with a dining table. Marilyns the 24hour restaurant was a little disappointing but would be fine in a pinch. Hoover Dam and Red Rock Canyon were nearby and great to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel One Bad Customer service experience.”
Reviews.Author: luvangel1883
Reviews.Content: It only takes one person to ruin a my 3 months stay great experience of this place. I have been staying here for a while and I have not had any complains after today. I had to switch the room I had because of remodeling last minute ok. Not fun but I did it. What was really not fun is that my new room has a TV with no DVD input and that ruins my movie rental nights. I tried to get some kind of service or consideration and I got nothing. EVA the supposed manager at the moment was NOT helpful in any way at ALL. Made me feel like I was bothering her. The only person that has not been friendly and the worst customer service I have had in the entire building. I should know because I have been staying in this hotel 3 months. This Hotel is pretty good if you are on a budget but please is 2010 all TV's should have DVD input and don't try to charge me $40 extra for this out of this world feature. She ruined my night and my stay here. Thanks Eva.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bww1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked here based on the reviews at tripadvisor and we were very pleased. We stayed 3 nights in building M 3rd floor (room 317). The room was spacious, clean, and everything worked (the furnishings were older but functional, clean and the bed was great). We could leave our room and walk to the corner of the strip in front of Bally's in about 10 min. We understood the $10 resort fee and with lack of wireless going in and the place still was very good. I am not sure why people are complaining about this place but if really met our needs and we would stay here again in a minute. Great Value. Although the strip is nice we had the best time hiking at Red Rock Canyon....Also liked the Atomic Testing Museum about 1/2 miles from our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: funnytraveler1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times and am always shocked at their low room rates. I have paid either $19.95 or $24.95 for each night of my visits. They do add a $10 resort fee, but their rooms are still cheaper than most Motel 6's. Every room is a 685 sq. ft. suite with fridge and coffee maker. Their casino is small but welcoming and their location is just two blocks off the strip by Bally's. Just being able to park by your room without having to walk through a smokey casino is worth the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with Good location - Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Wendy016
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Tuscany were very pleased. It was clean and the room was extremely large for a hotel room especially in Vegas. It was just off the strip but not really walking distance since you already have to walk a lot once you get to the strip. However if you are driving you can valet park in any of the hotels on the strip for free (of course tip the attendant). We are big coffee drinkers so the main amenity we were looking for was a coffee maker and fridge in the room, you won't find that on the strip... coffee maker was single cup only but worked out fine, they give you plenty of coffee - fridge was adequate size for soft drinks. We waited until our last day to visit their casino and restaurant area- found it very nice and cozy - wish we had gone earlier. Marilyns had great breakfast. My husband said if we go back he wants to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value is the name”
Reviews.Author: Raiderdad1345
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Tuscany on may 15 for 1 night. Had a good rate for a sat night 54 $ and already Booked Aria for the following three nights. We were looking for a nice place to stay for just one night. Found a good rate of 54 $ on Expedia. when most hotels were well over 150 just for a sat night. When we got to the hotel very nice outside with plenty of free parking. Walked right in checked in 1 hour early with very little wait. Our room was in building E which is on the side of the Grounds but does have close parking so we were able to park close to our building. We are not very big elevator people to begin with and the elevator here is very small and slow we held are breath the hole way up and after the door opened we decided that the stairs would be fine from now on. When we walked into the room we were pleasantly surprised we had ask for a king room ( Got 2 queens) not a big deal though kind of used to it most hotels do this and well it just gives us a place to put the luggage down. Room was nice and spacious had room to walk. It did have a little fridge and stove that we really didn't use but if i was coming with the family this would be to small for use. Had a nice couch to lay out on with a tv don't really remember how many channels it had we didn't come to las vegas to watch tv. Casino was average all the games your used to kind of quiet but that really doesn't bother me I did however place a bet on the preakness horse race and the sports book was great and very helpful treated me like a first timer. Even though I know what I am doing it was good to see them go out of there way so many cashiers at the sports books are very grumpy. Overall I would stay again on a budget trip or a last minute booking it is well worth the many. However if your looking to stay on the strip or have the vegas strip feel to your hotel you would want stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “It's so worth for the money”
Reviews.Author: PhyuPhyuThwe
Reviews.Content: This tuscany suites and casinos is great in terms of price, services, room and location. The entrances are separated for suites and casinos so that it's good for the family who visits with children. There is free wireless in the lobby. My brother booked it online with $ 45 per night which is totally worth it. The room is spacious and so clean even compared to big hotels in the strip like Excalibur. And also we can call the room services to get microwave for free of charge to our room (This is the first time I get experience a hotel provides the microwave). If you don't like the crowd, you should definitely stay in Tuscany which is quiet and peaceful. We get the $15 coupons for the casinos and we went there for the blackjack but unfortunately, I don't have a chance to look around in the casinos because I forgot my ID so they asked me to leave. The location is in the Flamingo Road which is near to the Strip so it's so convenient for us to go to the Strip and also UNLV. All in all, I would say you won't be regret to get a stay in Tuscany Suites and Casinos.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay well worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: jkbear911
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here May 2nd thru May 7th. The staff was friendly and attentive. Watch out for the rugs placed in front of the doors however, they hang up and trip you. My sister got a nasty couple of bruises and cut finger falling from tripping on one. Rooms were excellent except for the shower door in rm B-219. Door was warped out and the seal around the glass is damaged so it leaked alot. Told cleaning ladies but nothing done. Told check out staff and they said they would fix it immediately. This is close to everything downtown and made getting to shows very easy. Will stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Just like they said”
Reviews.Author: edw779
Reviews.Content: Others on here said Tuscany is their choice for value, location and comfort. We completely agree. Ask for a third floor room away from the pool (unless you like fairly loud music ALL day outside). The rooms are large, the bed comfortable and the location about 1/4 mile off of the strip is perfect. The grounds are well maintained and are patrolled at night. Yes it's not a 4 star resort but what you receive for your hard earned dollar is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: Julian&Moira
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights at the end of April and got a really good deal with Expedia. However, please remember that the hotel charges $10 per room per night Resort Tax (I guess all Vegas hotels do this). The bedroom we were allocated was huge, bigger than anything in UK/Europe. It was clean, well furnished and pretty quiet. The air con worked but even at its lowest setting would be too noisy to sleep through. Wifi is free in the public areas but seemed quite pricey for the privilege of having it in the room. The hotel restaurants are reasonably priced and a beer at the casino bar is $2. The pool area is pleasant and there was no shortage of sun loungers when we were there. The gym is adequate and there is a lengths pool next to it. It's about three quarters of a mile to Ballys at the Strip, where you can connect with the monorail to points north and south. Walking around was fine for us but could be difficult for older people or anyone with mobility problems. Don't underestimate the scale of Las Vegas, however, as it's pretty spread out and clearly designed for the car. For us the Tuscany represented really good value and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, should we ever go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Delta Dining for helping us find this jewel”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: April 29-May 3 for 4 nights We stayed in room M-316. There are 15 buildings, and this one is totally smoke free although I did smell smoke by the 3rd floor elevator once. Some idiots must think only their room was non smoking. The room was huge with 2 double beds, a tv with remote, a sofa (not a sofa bed), a chair and table along with a work desk. There was a dining table with 4 chairs, a small refrigerator (not a mini bar ripoff either), a microwave, coffee pot with supplies, a sink, and two stovetop burners. There was a closet with hangers and a safe which worked perfectly. The bathroom was great with a separate room with the toilet and privacy door. There was a shower and a separate tub across the bathroom and a large sink area with great amenities provided 3 our of 4 days. There was a loose tile once you walked in bathroom, and I noted this on my room survey card. One of the curtains didn't block out light so it could wake you up in the morning. The alarm clock went off 3 out of 4 mornings so I think the maid listened to the radio while cleaning. The beds were very comfortable with sheets and blanket but no duvet. All in all, a comfortable room with lots of space. We were almost as far as possible from the front desk/casino which was a plus in my opinion. Room M-320 would be the furthest from the casino. There was a $10 daily resort fee which I looked at as providing a safe. relaxing environment. Security was biking or driving around constantly. The fitness center was next to the small pool and looked inviting although we didn't use. The larger pool was very nice with a large hottub and towels and chairs. We just walked through. Another negaive: the resort fee should include free wifi in the room not just in the common areas. Back in December 2008. I walked here from the Paris to dine at Marilyn's which is in the Delta Dining guide so I receive SkyMiles. I did the same thing on my 2 visits in 2009 from the Imperial Palace and Flamingos. On the third visit in December 2009 I joined the Tuscany rewards program and received a special offer which I used for this stay. I am glad I did. It was so much better than staying at the mega hotels on the strip. It's also a better deal on the taxi ride to/from the airport. I did walk down and take advantage of the Harrah's group 24 hour buffet special (price increased from $29.95 to $34.95 the day before my arrival) but I got 2 dinner buffets, 1 breakfast, and 1 lunch with the deal. Caesar's was the best buffet; the others weren't much better than Golden Corral. I really like Marilyn's and ate there for my other 3 breakfasts, 1 pizza to go order, and a late dinner on our arrival at 11 pm. They provided some coupons which were useful. Tuscany Gardens wasn't that great, but I got $20 off wth coupon. I wish I had gone to the Mexican place instead. The Beachfront Cafe only does coffee and such now so you get your pizza at Marilyn's. I am not a big gambler so I don't expect to win or lose much. I lost about $80 a day but had a good time and drank lots of $1 (as my tip) beer. I would win and then lose but I just enjoy playing. I am not a gambler so the table games make me too nervous although I did roll two times at roulette with the coupons provided. I would have won $10 for a $5 even odds bet, but wouldn't you know, I lost both times. but it's just for fun anyway. The check in and check out staff were very friendly. I was worried about not getting a non smoking room so I called earlier on arrival day and was told it was first come first served, but I got a nonsmoking room so it all worked out. I would not have been happy in a stale smoky room so they should change that policy and let people reserve a room based on smoking preference. All in all, a great entertaining stay in a safe, comfortable environment. I hope they send me another special for this fall since I have 3 European trips planned between now and Labor Day and won't be albe to return until late 2010. Thanks to everyone at Tuscany for a great experience. To reiterate, much better than the megahotels on the strip with the low class handing our girlie cards and the rowdy drunks up and down Las Vegas Blvd. This place is like a fancy resort with a casino!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: love2travelPei
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Tuscany and it still offers excellent value for Las Vegas. The pool is quiet and you can get a chair. The casino is not located near the lobby so you can enter the hotel without going through it. The rewards and comp's are much better than other hotels. It is off the strip, by 2 blocks, so it is not as busy.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, so if you can afford it, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Rondeaufilet
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas often, on business and for fun, and have stayed in many hotels on and off the strip. While this isn't the worst place I've stayed it is close. First, the good: As mentioned in most reviews the rooms are big, they do have working refrigerators, a fairly comfortable couch and chair and the bed was okay. There is a decent work desk and a "kitchen table" with three chairs. There is also a good sized chest of drawers if you are staying for a few days. There is a lot of free parking. The soaps and lotions and shampoo were nice, and the towels weren't bad. The in-between: It did seem fairly safe, but I'm a fairly good sized guy who was traveling alone, if I had kids or my wife with me I'm not sure how I would have felt because there were a few somewhat questionable types hanging around and there were quite a few very obvious "Ladies of the Night" in the casino after about 10:00 p.m. It's not all that close to the strip, but it isn't all that far either. The hotel's casino is a dive, and while the bartenders I had were friendly, they weren't in a hurry to pour any free drinks either, and I always tip liberally and always play video poker. I ate breakfast in the coffee shop, it was okay, the service was okay. I ate all my other meals off the property. Now, the bad: My first impression was that the place stinks and I had a general feeling that it wasn't clean. I had a non-smoking room but it hasn't always been so, it smelled of stale smoke and had other, unidentifiable, odors as well. Also, on different days at different times of the day or night you are greeted by a variety of unpleasant odors when you enter the room; you do get used to it, I never was sickened or anything, but it is still unpleasant. The bedspread was not clean, it felt gritty and dirty, thankfully I didn't need it to keep me warm at night. The halls are filthy, it didn't look like anyone had run a vacuum down them in recent memory and there was a lot of litter in the hallways, stairwells and elevators; there are no garbage cans by the elevators or stairwells or exterior doors, however, which probably explains this. There was a safe in the room but it did not work. There are only a few channels on the old, small television, no ESPN2 and no movie channels. If you want the light on in the bathroom the fan is always on (maybe they're trying to get rid of the stink!), and the fans (there are two of them, again, trying to get rid of the stink I guess), are LOUD! The lighting is very dim, if you like to read in bed forget it. One of the most annoying things is the "high speed" internet is slow, sometimes non-existent, and they nick you for $12-to-$15 bucks a day for it, depending on the package you select (daily or multiple day packages are available). The free internet around the pool and in the lobby is slow and sporadic as well. Oh, and speaking of the pool, the one day I had the chance to log a little pool time it was semi-closed at 3:00 p.m. for a party that was being held there later that evening -- you could swim anywhere in the pool but half of the pool-deck area was closed off (the area in the sun) so it was a pretty lame experience at the pool for me. Whew!! I guess the bottom line is, if you are on a budget the Tuscany Suites Hotel is okay, but if you can afford it I would definitely advise staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe you get so much for such a low price.”
Reviews.Author: jeffrx42
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and the hotel is clean and the rooms are huge. We stayed at the pool and it was large and towels were available. Plenty of room around the pool to sit or lie in the sun. Drink service was available at a reasonal price. Casino was not crowded, but this is a sign of the economy. $ 10 dollar ride to the strip by taxi or a 15 min. walk. The hotel gave us 2 for 1 coupons for the restuarants. The best omlettes are at Marilyn's cafe. They need to get rid of resort fee ( $10) as this hotel really isn't a resort.

Reviews.Title: “beauty and comfort”
Reviews.Author: kiki369
Reviews.Content: its not too far from the las vegas strip. and it is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get the room I pre-paid for”
Reviews.Author: TheFixer_10
Reviews.Content: If a hotel guest pays for the first night in advance, one would expect the requested room would be available especially if the guest arrives at 2:00am after driving for 10 hours. We requested a non-smoking room with 2 double beds INSTEAD we got a smoking room, in a smoking only building with a king bed and pull out sofa bed! There was no bedding for the sofa bed! There were only a few sheets of toilet paper in the bathroom. The front desk said the hotel was sold out and gave me the impression we should be very grateful for what we got. I would have argued but I was bleary eyed from the long ride and it's 2am! They moved us to the room we wanted the next day but it was very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice as always.”
Reviews.Author: James-Anderson
Reviews.Content: This is my wife`s favorite Hotel for our spring break. She thinks the pool is nice, for older folks, like us. The rooms are big, you can have two queens or a king, it`s the same price. Nice bathrooms, the fan is a little to loud. Last year the floor tiles were loose, but they had fixed that. Easy to park your car outside your room, free parkingpermission provided on suite. Polite and nice staff everywhere at this place. Any questions or issues, don`t hesitate to get into touch with the reception. Lovely Tara and her staff, are always there to help us out, with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the BED BUGS!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: professor-sd619
Reviews.Content: Yes it may look nice but, it is definitely not worth the bug bites all over my body. I only stayed for one night but when I woke up the next morning I was very itchy. I looked under the matress and saw nothing and so I thought it was just from the cheap fiber blanket. Later when I returned home I was still itchy, so when took a shower I noticed the bites and also looked in the mirror and saw them on my back! I could not beleive it!!!!!!! was it worth it? HELL NO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Tuscany !”
Reviews.Author: bknight38
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for wall to wall people, crowded smoke filled casinos, and the hustle of Las Vegas, this hotel is NOT for you. But if you want a small, clean, quiet hotel, only a few blocks off the strip, this is a great deal. You won't find bigger rooms anywhere, in fact, my daughter commented that our room is bigger than her apartment in California. The food and service is excellent and the staff is friendly. I stayed two night here and two nights at Harrahs. At Harrahs, the pool closed promptly at 5:00 every night. They said it was a rule for hotels on the Strip. At the Tuscany, their hot tub/pool stayed open till 10:00 pm every night. I wish I had stayed all 4 nights at the Tuscany....I will next time. Harrahs was nice (it's hard to beat FREE) but I would have rather been at the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel122
Reviews.Content: First off..The service wasn't great. I called to confirm my reservation and I was on hold for over 20 minutes! They charge $10 plus tax every night, which includes the nasty coffee and use of the gym. The hotel itself feels more like apartments or condos. Make sure you ask for the 3rd floor, because I stayed on the first and kept hearing loud foot steps all night! What I liked about the room: the rooms are very spacious, and pretty clean. You can access your car in less than five minutes and don't have to walk through a casino. What I didn't like about room: The furniture needs updating, the TV is small. The bed was hard and looked old and wavy. There was a weird smell when you entered the room too. If you have a car, the strip is not too far. Its a couple of blocks away. Would I stay there again? ONLY if I could find a good deal like 30-50bucks a night. We were on a budget this time so the price was right. Advice... if you are not on a tight budget, and you want a soft comfortable bed, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Viva La - Tuscany - Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kittmikes
Reviews.Content: Basically the Tuscany is a well kept secret for Vegas! I stayed there for a full 9 nights in March and feel as though I could have stayed there a whole lot more, it was such a wonderful, relaxing place and very reasonably priced, so much so I intend to use it again. Firstly the location. It is exactly a 10 minute walk to the strip, coming out on the corner of the Bally’s Hotel, which also means you are only 10 minutes away from the monorail at the Bally’s. Going in the opposite direction you have a large Target supermarket less than a 15 minutes walks (behind Target a wee bit up the road you also have a decent sized Shopping Mall, with J C Penny’s and Macy’s on either end of it. Taxis are available 24/7 and their prices start at about $4 upwards (to the shopping mall it was about $9). The hotel complex itself is large, and very green which is lovely, there is plenty of parking too. My tip would be to ask for a building away from the pool, as they do have bands on at the weekends, and they obviously have children playing and and around the pool (very loudly). I was on the perimeter of the complex and it was just right. Unlike most of the other hotels in Vegas you do not have to walk through the casino to get to the reception or your room, infact you don’t have to step in the casino at all, it is on the side, and whilst a lot of fun it is very discreet compared to others. The several food outlets are all very good (tried them all). Marilyn’s Café, makes a mean stack of pancakes. The two Pools are wonderful. There is a coin operated laundrette, which is very handy – so keep those quarters (you can buy the soap from the wee gift shop). Check-in was quick and simple, the staff were very polite and helpful. Every member of staff I came in contact with throughout my stay was helpful, and if there was a problem they seemed to deal with it without a fuss once it was brought to their attention. I think it is easy to complain about things that are wrong on here after you get home, but unless you mention it to the staff whilst you are there, how do they know, it is no good to them or you, if the first they learn of problems is on Trip advisor etc! At the end of the day it should be their actions that get to be put on this type of site I think, surely that would be more helpful to fellow travellers. The room was huge and well equipped for all my needs. It was very clean and serviced each day. The wee kitchen space was handy, especially for the fridge. There is a Soda Machine and Ice Machine on the ground floor of each block next to entrance. (also if you ask reception, they will send a microwave up if you want one for free). The Beds were very comfortable, the blackout curtains did their job well, as did the air con. Towels were nice and fluffy and the toiletries were very nice. There is a free safe in the large wardrobe and also in there is an Iron and Ironing board. TV Channels were enough to entertain – pay on demand channels though were a bit pricey. Now here is the only ‘let down’ for the Tuscany for me; their FREE WIFI is only free in common area rooms such as reception, café, casino etc (very misleading on most Travel sites). You have to pay if you want it in your room, and it ain’t cheap – something like $11 per day on one laptop only. This is a shame, as people will remember this mostly about their stay here if they are having to hike over to reception to check their emails out (after all it is the 21st Century and most people either have a laptop or a Smartphone with them these days), There is a daily resort fee of $10 at the Tuscany, which seems to be a standard in all Vegas hotels now, but I think personally if they added the WiFi into this, they would get tons of praise instead of people grumbling in the reception area – just a thought. Just around the corner from Tuscany is Ellis Island Casino, please visit this place for their BBQ Rib’s the best I have ever tasted, you can sit out side and watch them been cooked the smell is lovely. The is a free bus from outside Bally’s reception (10 minutes away) to Liberace Museum which is fun. (also near a big Walmart store!) Freemont Street is a $25 taxi ride away, but well worth it, especially at night. There is a bus, but I wouldn’t recommend it, as it takes over an hour to cover one mile. As for Las Vegas, I just love it! The only thing to let it down is those annoying people trying give you flyers for girls on every corner – they become very tiresome – give it up people!!! One last thing, if you want to treat you yourself on your last day. I got a stretched limo at reception to the Airport for $15 (it is $12 in a normal taxi) I didn’t even have to haggle the doorman found him for me. Oh and the doorman will happily look after your luggage all day for you when you check out for free (well obviously for tips). Enjoy your stay in Vegas and I hope you enjoy the Tuscany as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back to the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: vacation065
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nites at the Tuscany. If you are looking for a quiet, well cared for hotel with spacious rooms stay at the Tuscany. If you are looking for excitement, noise and wall to wall people stay on the strip and pay twice as much for the rooms. The resturants were very good. I would highly recommend the Tuscany Garden Italian resturant . The food and service were excellent. Staff were all friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil, no thrills and falling apart”
Reviews.Author: europeanbunnytail
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal and so we think this was a great value for what it is. Is not worth the regular rate - would rather stay on the strip. We needed something away from the hustle and bustle and it delivers. No street noise and although really close to the strip - it is peaceful here. True the rooms are quite big, but as others have mentioned, there is no kitchenware and is useless unless you make a trip to the store. The room is not luxury. Very basic decor, but clean. If you are getting a handicaped room - beware. The handicaped bathroom accommodations seemed nice enough until shower time. The handle rail was loose and the shower is leaking at the connection. Side note: I love my lattes and their Beachfront cafe does a pretty good job. We had a difficult time finding a nice barista or any friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awasome place to stay in Vegas with small children”
Reviews.Author: uzcam
Reviews.Content: This place was awasome, cleaned and spacious. It had a kitchenette wich was great with little kids, large space for them to run around. The bathroom was big too, it was great to have a separate shower from the bath, the toilet its also separa from the rest of the bath. Front desk was nice. Internet is not free, unless you go to the front desk. You have to pay like $15 for 24 hours wich I think was the only thing bad with the hotel. Other then that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Shelly97060
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the large, clean rooms at the Tuscany Suites. It was nice to return to our quiet hotel after the chaos of the strip. The property is well maintained and clean. The rooms are large, but certainly nothing fancy. There is a small kitchenette type area with a sink, cabinets and a small fridge. Nice for storing snacks. Marilyn's cafe on site has very good food and when checking in they gave us buy one get one free meal coupons. Also there are magazines in the rooms that have more of the buy one get one coupons in them - for our family of four it was nice to have those. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, you don't have to leave the resort!!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyWI
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Tuscany, it is right off the strip, a long three blocks, but the value outweighs the short walk to the strip. There are three restaurants, entertainment and of course the casino. Nice big room with a couch, desk, kitchen table with chairs, fridge but no stove. The service was great and we had an awesome time, the hot tubs and pools were an added feature too.

Reviews.Title: “awesome tuscany suites”
Reviews.Author: suenell
Reviews.Content: this place has everything a casino , huge televisions in the room , a work out room 3 pools dining to die for and room service for the lazy lol

Reviews.Title: “Best value ever”
Reviews.Author: roxy1031
Reviews.Content: This hotel was inexpensive, so I thought that we might be giving up some luxuries, but no, everything was great. Large clean rooms, friendly staff, excellent hot tub and if you are lucky enough to get in a building near the pool area, you may benefit from free internet access on or near the patio. It is a bit of a walk from the strip, but when you've walked for 8 hours already, what's another 7 minutes. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Food Posioning at the Tuscany Gardens Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LOCKnLOADED
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ate at the Tuscany Gardens Restaurant on March 1, 2010. She ordered halibut with asparagus sauce and I ordered fettuccine alfredo with shrimp. We left early the next morining without breakfast heading to Phoenix. By 10:00 AM my stomach began feeling strange and by noon I thought I was going to vomit. It wasn't until an hour later that I began to vomit (along the side of the road). Finally make it to Phoenix, but continued to vomit on four different times over the next 3 hours. I have never been so sick from food in my life. My wife did not eat much of her halibut since it was over cooked ( lucky for her).

Reviews.Title: “Not too many negatives about Tuscany Suites”
Reviews.Author: carolart
Reviews.Content: A lot has already been written about this property; I can add some things that I disliked and some things that I liked. I disliked being nickeled and dim-ed to death on charges. There is a separate $10./night charge called a resort fee that is not included in the published price per night. Then there is a separate $20./night fee for an extra guest. And I checked in slightly before 3 PM and was charged an extra $12. fee. The hotel had not gotten my seven night reservation correct - they had to call Travelocity to confirm that I had paid for all seven nights (even though I carried the hard copy from Travelocity!). They seemed annoyed that they could not charge me another $50. booking fee for the seventh night. I've stayed in many strip hotels, but found Tuscany to be more relaxing and easy going than most. The property is spread out and none of it's buildings is over three stories high. It is clean and neat - the lawns are trimmed nicely and the walkways continually swept. The pool looked great but it was much too cold to enjoy it. Our room was great, too - squeaky clean and well maintained. We had a fridge, microwave, stove-top and sink in a mini-kitchen as well as a kitchen table and chairs The beds were comfortable and the linens soft. The maids in Building N were great! Marilyn's Cafe in the casino area was fantastic for any meal, any time of day. The food was delicious and the prices were quite reasonable. I would go back here again, even after considering all of the pile-on fees. Just remember, their advertised fees are not their REAL fees.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Las Vegas expierience”
Reviews.Author: Puggsley456
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel becasue of its room size and very good price that I got through expedia. Being that I was a Las Vegas regular, having stayed at many different hotels, I had very little trouble finding this Hotel. I will say that unless you have your own rental car getting to and from the strip can be a little but of a walk. I did have my own car so this wasnt an issue. Upon first arrival I had no wait in link to check in. There was a fellow being checked in beside me at the same time and the guy behind the counter was very courteous and informative to that person to the point to even ask if they wanted to pick which biuilding to stay in. For those interested bulding "J" is the closest to the parking area. The lady who checked me in did not ask me any questions, and checked me into a building on the far edge of the property. When I asked to be placed in a building closer to the parking area it seemed as if I really inconvenienced her. But got what I wanted. The Room: Getting to the room was very easy because my car was parked so close. I will note that elevator in the building is really odd. Its door is basically tucked away inside a regular door and is vewry small and SLOW! The room is extremely large by vegas standards and to be honest was a nice change. The room was very well made up and didnt have any nasty smells that alot of the lower star hotels tend to have. The bathroom was nice and big as well. The only knock against it was that it seemed that the shower stall door does not do a good job at keeping the water in the shower. As I always had water on the floor outside folowing my showers. The only issue I had during my entire stay was that for some reason they put double sheets on my king sized bed which needless to say didnt fit, They left the bottom 10 inched of the bed without any covering. I didnt complain as with the size of the bed I didnt really need it. I did raise it as a point at checkout and they didn't do anything for me or really seem to care. The bed was decently comfortable but was fairly old. Notes: - If you dont have a rental car stay away from the self park areas as they have some very loud inconsiderate drivers that dont care what times of the night they are playing their stereos or reveing their engines. -If you like busy vegas feel to your casinos this isnt the place for you. The most people I ever saw playing blackjack at one time is 2. Its a very small unpopulated casino. I actually didnt gamble here much as when signing up for the club card they didnt even ask for amy of my info, thereby saying to me that I will never receive any deals on staying there again. -If you do stay here, do youself a favor and request a 3rd story room. Because the bathrooms are tiled floors and when you get heavy walkers in the room above you you can hear every step in the bathrooms above you. Myself I prefer the vegas style hotels where you have to avoid teh masses of people, this hotel is for sure not that kind of enviroment. Possibly geared to a much older crowd perhaps I dont know, I for one will not return to this hotel eventhough my expierience wasnt that bad,

Reviews.Title: “vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: KathyC10
Reviews.Content: 1 block off the strip , behind Balley's, nice place

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Management Attitude Stinks on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Engineer_Lou
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights (Feb 12-15, 2010) at the Tuscany Suites in building C, at their raised price for Valentines Weekend prices. With the higher price, I was expecting at higher level of service. My mistake! After the first night (Saturday) we returned back to the room at 4:00pm to find the room was not made up after being out all day. I called housekeeping to get the room made up and waited by the pool area. At 4:45pm we returned and found the room was done. When we went out on Sunday morning at 11:30am and I called Housekeeping to ask that the room be done by 2:00pm and they said OK it wold be done. When we returned at 2:30pm, the maids cart was outside the room. I went to the front desk to speak with the hotel manager. After waiting 10 minutes in line (only 3 people ahead of me) I asked to speak with the Hotel Manager, she was busy on the phone. Once I got a hold of the Hotel Customer Service Manager, Tara Kiper, (after 15 minutes) I explained how I had to call housekeeping the day before and how I requested the room be make up by 2:00pm today. I said I wanted some compensation for the problems I was having. She went in the back for some time came out and said they had till 5:00pm to make up the rooms. She said I told them I didn’t want the room made up until 2:00pm and it was now done. She also stated she was not going to compensate me for anything. No I’m sorry for the problems given. That was not acceptable to me. On Monday morning, with the “Do Not Disturb” sign on the door and checkout is not until 11:00am, they knocked on the door and tried to enter the room at 10:17am. With the safety latch on the door, they could not enter and ran off. I was standing right by the door when this happened, and I yelled we were not ready when they said it was housekeeping and tried to come in. NO RESPECT FOR GUESTS and their privacy. There is also a hidden $10, plus Tax, “Resort Fee” charged to your room on top of the room charges. Keep that in mind when you looking at prices. The rooms are not bad, but the housekeeping service need attention, as well as the attitude of the hotel management staff at the hotel front desk. You would think they would treat "Locals" with more respect.

Reviews.Title: “All I was asking for”
Reviews.Author: PeachlandCalculator
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Large room, clean, comfortable, quiet at night. 3/4 mile from strip so one could walk to and from. Loads of room to park. Good food at a reasonable price. What I thought they needed to do was paint the elevators - the one in Bldg J had seen some tough wear and tear and looked terrible, However, our room was just fine. What we paid for 3 nights our friends staying at the Bellagio paid for one night. They had a fancier room but no larger than our room. Meals at the Bellagio were no better than at the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely resort with a holiday feel”
Reviews.Author: podla
Reviews.Content: it was super bowl week so was very suprised to see the price of a couple of hotels at around £20 a room per night for the days running upto the weekend! Tuscany was one of those and despite good reviews we were dubious upon booking because of how cheap it was, still, we were on a tight budget so book it we did. it wasnt until we'd stood in the room agog for 5 mins staring at all the lovely amenities did we realise we were onto a winner!! the room was huge, bigger than the last London flat i lived in and bigger than my 1 bedroomed flat i live in now! sofa area, dining table, kitchenette, large bathroom with a bath and seperate shower with handles for disabled folks if needed. big tv, giant bed, sparkly clean and a plethora of coupons to redeem around the casino and restaurants onsite. We worked out that what you paid to stay there they gave us back double in coupons (including a free drink each, $20 of the lovely italian restaurnt, free chips at the tables). You could live there and it would be cheaper than renting or owning your own abode! Lovely pool area, live entertainment every night, friendly staff, very excellent. I've worked out that we actually owe them money. Stay here, you will not be dissapointed. (and you'll find a lot of hotels in vegas charge extra site fees, unless its one of those giant ones that blow up every half hour or something, just check before booking.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kalayka
Reviews.Content: The last review stated the rate was $29 including the resort fee. I wish I also paid that amount although I am not complaining. I actually checked for their rates 2 days before check-in, it was $69 and I passed on it. The following day, the cheapest room was no longer available and the lowest rate was already over a hundred. At the last minute when I was in a rest area in San Bernardino, CA, I checked again with my smartphone and it was $38. I finally booked it. Since I only need a room to sleep, this hotel satisfied my requirement. I did not want to pay for internet connection that I used my computer in the lobby where it was free. The room was not bad although it was not fancy. The carpet looks old though. If you intend to cook, there is a stove, a small fridge and a microwave. Just bring your kitchen utensils because there is not even a teaspoon there. The price list of the linens and towels made me laugh. Why will you be interested in taking them when the amount they will charge you is even more than the price when they are new. The linens are the cheapest kind and the the blanket is vellux which you can get cheap from Wal-mart or Target (I just checked the blanket in Wal-mart is $12-20).

Reviews.Title: “more than expected”
Reviews.Author: offthebow
Reviews.Content: It's pretty dumb to complain about the "resort fee" when the overall expense of a stay is outstanding. To complain about the internet offered free in "public spaces" is absurd. Just try to find a hotel in Vegas with free internet anywhere. If you want internet in your room then pay for it like any other hotel! Considering the total cost per day of 29.00 (includes the "resort fee"), you will not find a better value. You also get a 2 for 1 meal in their excellent mexican restaurant or American cafe. You get two free drinks in a casino bar, and in a fine Italian restaurant you get 20.00 off a bill of more than 40.00. The grounds and the public spaces are clean and tidy as is the casino. The front desk was very pleasant. There is an early check in free. That is clear on their website and when you phone call--no surprises! You don't like--don't check in early! You are two blocks from the strip on Flamingo Road. I got more than I expected, and will absolutely do it again. We stayed two months ago at Wynn's. This is no Wynn's but when you consider the value that is a good thing. You stay here because of the value, and I noticed one or two still complain. If you want more than you pay for--stay here! Otherwise stay at Wynn's.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service what so ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lacasa_09
Reviews.Content: We were passing through so wanted to book a hotel off the strip because we had our son with us.We were checked in first they could not find our reservation then they put us in a room next to a lift and then at 2 am the housekeeping were pulling their laundry baskets(dirty linen) out of the on site laundry area which they forgot to tell us that was right beside out room!!!! So we asked to move!!!!!The next night the same thing happened again no elavator this time but housekeepers were moving things around again 2am in the morning .The next day tired as could be we tried to see the city My husband and I were so knackered it spolit the whole day.We got back to the hotel asked to move again they made out that we were compalining for nothing as they say they have never heard the noise ever!!!!!!!!!!! What a joke not one person said sorry they gave us $40 for dinner and basically thought we were a pain in the ar-------------Well never again and we have many people that always stay in vegas we will pass the message on ,Good luck Tuscany!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany for the first time January 16-19 as it was the host hotel for a softball tournament. Since there are so many other reviews I will list the pros and cons as it related to my stay. PROS- Very large room (over 600 sq feet), king bed, couch, refrigerator and sink. Good sized bathroom. Nothing fancy, but comfortable. The tournament rate was $89 for Friday and Saturday and $49 for Monday and Tuesday. The $10 resort fee (see CONS) was waived for us. Good value considering strip prices. Location is 1/2 mile from strip, not a bad walk, but far enough away from the traffic and noise. Parking is within steps of the room. Casino and restaurants on site. Nice pool, hot tub, and grounds CONS Resort fee of $10 a day is a joke. Internet is included in the fee but only in the lobby and a couple of other areas of the hotel. Internet in the room is $13.99 a day. Fitness center is large, but sparsely equipped with four older pieces of cardio equipment, some free weights, and a few machines. No TV. Fortunately, there is a Gold's Gym about 10 minutes away on Flamingo. Small TV, few channels. Previous reviewers have complained about the noise. I specifically requested and received a room farthest away from the casino and restaurants was given Building L, Room 320, top floor corner unit. Didn't hear a thing. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “Better than most hotels on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: WilliamHalverstadt
Reviews.Content: The Wife and I (Ages 35 and 36) have stayed at the Tuscany multiple times, so much now that we don't even bother with any other hotels & suites on or off the strip anymore. The Tuscany has the best rooms, beautifully landscaped grounds and pool area, a great cafe' and restaurants, and best of all the price was amazing. It's close enough to the strip that if we choose to go shopping; it's a really short walk and an even shorter drive. We recommend the Tuscany to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Off strip hotel away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: Only reason I ended up staying here is because on a previous trip to vegas I attended a Wyndham timeshare presentation and received a "free" 2nt 3 day stay to be used at various locations as a gift. I decided to use the voucher to come back to Vegas and this is the hotel they placed me in. It's several looong blocks from the main strip but walkable (about 10-15 min walk if i'm not mistaken) which may be an issue for some, especially in the heat. Also they are strict about 3:00 check in. If you come early around 1:00 like we did there is an extra fee to check-in. Of course after hearing that we checked our luggage and went to eat until 3 because I refuse to pay. I've stayed in many hotels in different parts of the world and have never been refused or charged an early check-in as long as the room was ready, and i'm talking about strolling in hotels as early as 9 am in some places! Despite the above I actually really enjoyed my stay. The rooms are extremely spacious suites that had a kitchen area, living area with couch, table and two double beds along with a separate bath tub and shower. One could easily fit a large group in the room if they chose and save money by cooking themselves. Got a coupon booklet with some great offers for free slot play, discount offers on restaurants on the property, free drinks etc. We ate at the Cantina restaurant which was pretty good and inexpensive. Didn't get to try the pool but it looked pretty decent. Also the area being off strip is quiet and peaceful which is good if you want to relax and get away from the action. Would I stay here again? yes if the price was right. I hear they recently started charging $10/nt resort fee to patrons, so i'd have to take that into consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms with fridge, great for kids”
Reviews.Author: BBHJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/26 - 12/30/09 and had two rooms overlooking the pool. My parents are in their 70's and our kids are ages 6 and 8. This was a GREAT hotel for us, we got it through orbitz for $35/night, but the hotel charges a separate $10/night per room fee for coffee/pool (outdoor only - too cold for us to use)/internet (which is only available in the lobby) so I guess it ends up being a $45 room. Pros: The rooms were huge with a kitchenette area with sink and mini-fridge, we asked for a microwave which we got at no extra charge. There are no utensils or plates, so you'll have to bring your own paper plates, etc if using a microwave. The bathroom was also large with a separate bath and shower, and a water closet. There was a 24-hour restaurant and several other dining options. Parking was never a problem. (I almost forgot, I thought the beds were very comfortable) Cons: We stayed on the second floor and could hear people walking around upstairs (all the buildings are 3-stories). This did not last too long, I suppose the upstairs guests were not often in their room. On Sat and Sun nights, we could hear the live band in the lobby (we were in building H facing the pool and back of the lobby) they started at 10:30 pm and played well into the early hours, we turned on the bathroom fan and this adequately covered the noise. Location: with the kids and seniors in our group, we drove everywhere (all casinos have free parking) but the hotel was only a few blocks off the main strip, and was centrally located on Flamingo Rd. There was a tram station between the hotel and the strip, also. Finally, the hotel itself had a free shuttle to three other areas along the strip, we never used this, but it ran from around 10:30 am to 10:30 pm so it seems it would have been really useful.

Reviews.Title: “I am very disappointed with their customer service”
Reviews.Author: yy15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany Suite with my husband for six days around Christmas. The size of the room was decent and the hotel is in a good location. The amentities was a bit outdated, such as the TV, there were very limited number of channels but that's not my major concern. The service was rather poor. There was an incident that I returned to the hotel at night and found my door open with the deadbolt on (which kept the door open). I called the hotel security and it took him 20 minutes to get to the room. Since we didn't miss anything, he concluded "people can forget to close the door behind them" and left. He could at least do a card scan to see if there are anyone else entered the room other than my husband and I! I asked him to file a report so that if anything is missing I can file for insurance. He refused and said his shft is about to end and I should probably talk to a hotel mananger instead. So I waited at the front desk for almost 30 minutes until the manager came out. His attitude was slightly better than the security guard but not much better. There was no apology what so ever. He just handed me the form and told me that the doors to the rooms automatically puts down the deadbolt when they are not closed properly. Well, if that's the case, I think their door has a very bad feature. I would give a B for the value of the hotel but a F for customer service. If I go to Las Vegas again, I will pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place and a Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: When I come to Las Vegas - which is usually twice a year - I generally don't care too much about the hotel I'm staying at: If it's clean, friendly, clean, well-kept, and CLEAN, I'm generally going to pretty satisfied. Did I mention that it has to be clean? :-) Tuscany Suites is all those things and more. The room - they call it a suite, but technically it isn't - is very large, complete with a kitchenette and a sofa and love seat. The bathroom was REALLY a cut above, complete with a separate shower and bathtub, and a door between the toilet and the rest of the bathroom. The whole bathroom was done in attractive ceramic tile.
