The whole complex is very large (and a bit confusing) and well-kept. It looks more like a modern apartment complex than a hotel. Each building has three floors. One positive thing about this hotel is you don't park in a giant garage like you do on the Strip or Downtown; rather, you park pretty much near the building where your room is located. Whether or not you like the location is dependent on your perspective. It's almost exactly a half-mile between Tuscany and Bally's, which is right at the heart of the Strip. I have no problem walking that, but many people might. Driving is always an option (really a necessity for Vegas in general), but note that the traffic between Flamingo and Las Vegas Blvd. can be maddening, even for that half mile. And there was construction on Flamingo when I was there, making it worse. Much has been said in other reviews of about the $10 a night (over $11 after taxes) resort fee, and those people have a legitimate point. My guess is that Vegas hotel competition is so fierce - especially in these tough times - that hotels have to do whatever is possible to make them - on the surface - appear to be the cheapest. It's a cheap shot for sure, but keep in mind you get some "free" goodies when you check in: a two-for-one coupon at the coffee shop and a coupon for $20 off their Italian restaurant. Does this make up for the resort fee? No, but it lessens the sting. Even with the fee, this place is a bargain, especially when compared to the big boys on the Strip. I booked my hotel as part of a package, but I think the cost came down to something like $70 for three nights. Let's call it $100 with the resort fee. For three nights at a place like this? I call that a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Cheap Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mrsshannalee
Reviews.Content: I came in November 2009 for my sisters birthday, we paid 45 bucks a night plus taxes and resort fees for a large room with a kitchenette, living room area and 2 large beds, more than enough room for 5 crazy girls. The beds are not the most comfortable but we didn't come to Vegas to sleep. The grounds of the hotel are nice, better than average and the walk or taxi ride to the strip are short. The restaurant was good serving a variety of foods, so there was something for everyone. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget, its clean and updated. If your wanting high class better stick to the strip or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: longday1
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we stayed here free after attending a time share presentation. I'm glad we didn't pay to be there (except the manditory "resort fee"), and especially glad we didn't sign on for the time share! The good - the room was HUGE. There are two pools, so we never had a problem with overcrowding, and the place was quiet. The bad - we arrived well after check in time, and then went for dinner. When we arrived back at the hotel with our very, very tired three-year-old child, we realized that the sofa bed hadn't been made up. We called to the front desk, and were told that they never make up a bed until they know someone's going to be sleeping in it. I explained that the booking was for three people, and she replied, "Yes, but we don't make up the bed until we know it will be used." (I guess what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas). I paused long enough for her to realize what she was saying then said politely, "She's three." She muttered but then said she'd send somebody to make up the bed. When the guy finally showed up with bedding, he shoved it at my husband, who indicated the sofa bed, thinking the guy would make up the bed. Instead, he walked over and dumped the bedding on the sofa bed & left. The whole "threesome" incident gave us a good giggle, but seriously... When we finally got settled, the air conditioner was so noisy when it was shutting off (which happens every 5-10 minutes) that it would wake us all up. This also gave us the giggles because it sounded like it was REALLY enjoying itself - very loud banging that got faster and faster until it ended with a sigh. The other downsides - the casino is old and shabby and stinks of cigarette smoke (I guess their air conditioning is old and shabby too) - fortunately, we don't gamble, so this didn't worry us too much, but it may be a problem for others. The location is not workable unless you have a car - way too far to walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!...Just one negative”
Reviews.Author: funnsunlady50
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value and walking distance to the strip - Rooms were spacious and clean, large bathroom, kitchenette, and sitting area. Some room decor is a bit dated but room was very clean. Lobby, casino, other common areas updated and nice. The casino is small but still adequate. Walked to the strip every day, the walk took about 10 mintues - in some places the sidewalk was a bit narrow and traffic goes pretty fast. We found walking on the opposite side of the street, same side at Bill's Gambling Hall, was a bit safer because of wider sidewalks. There are three restaurants at Tuscany and we were given BOGO coupons at check-in. Marilyn's Cafe and Tuscany Gardens were good but The Cantina was by far our favorite, the food, service and portions were excellent. There are also several nice restaurants, Lawry's, Morton's, PF Changs, etc in walking distance. The only negative we experienced was in the pool/hot tub area. We were looking forward to enjoying the hot tub. The pool area is lovely and on the first night, we swam in the pool and relaxed in the hot tub...apparently, the chemicals in the hot tub were so strong that it burned our skin (which lasted for several days) and ruined our swimsuits...completely bleached out all the color and they were not cheap suits. The chemicals didn't smell overly stong at the time. We showered off after using the hot tub but the burn started showing up about 30 mintues after we were back in our room and was very intense by the next morning. Had to visit Walgren's to get something to curb the burning and try to heal our skin. We would stay here again but check with the maintenance staff regarding the hot tub before jumping in.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Large and Beds are Comfy”
Reviews.Author: KenoshaKathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany for one night during our trip to Vegas. We wanted to try a different hotel. The reception area was quite nice, smaller than most Vegas hotels, cozy and tastefully decorated. The pool area looked awesome, however we staying in November and it was chilly. There is Free Hi- Speed Internet in the lobby and main areas, but not in the rooms. The room was large- it had a dinette area with a microwave and a mini-frig for your use. The bathrooms were also huge, with a separate shower. The room needed a little overhauling- the tile in the shower needed recaulking, and the sofa and chair were a little beat up. But the bed was VERY comfortable and a good nights sleep in Vegas is a must if you wish to play hard. I would recommend this to a family/group in need of a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff. Well kept grounds.”
Reviews.Author: bucks16
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Not very scenic of a walk...but can walk to the strip in less than 10 minutes. Big roooms. Lap pool back at fitness center no one will tell you about. Main pool is very nice and well kept. Casino is small but has what you need. Plenty of taxis out front most of the time. $10 resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest bang for your buck anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Rongie
Reviews.Content: Our Vegas Vacation was as cheap as chips. We spent two weeks at the Tuscany whereby simply signing up with a Players Card, we did not pay for one full meal, we purchased hundreds of dollars of merchandise at the Gift Shop for free and they still gave us $100 for the privelidge when we left. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The location is not far to The Strip and we walked through Bally's when about half way - which has shops, restaurants etc. The four restaurants at the Tuscany are all great and the service throughout the complex is overwhelming. Nothing is too much trouble. We loved our holiday and would book into the Tuscany if ever in this part of the World again.

Reviews.Title: “New home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Secondcrk
Reviews.Content: This is as nice of place to relax that you could find for the price. Every room a suite. Treed walkways troughout. Great Casino with very good rewards club. Resterauntes on site from cheap to Expensive. Nice pool and Exercise center. Quite off strip but close. Elevators were very slow , but no buildings over 3 stories. Rooms were 19.00 a night ( SUITES!) Found a new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to, budget friendly Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyrookie
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there four times in the past 3 years, the most recent being Thanksgiving weekend. Unless there is a special occasion warranting a better hotel, this is the only place I stay when I go to Vegas. The property is nice and the the rooms are huge, clean, relatively nice, and cheap. My only real complaint is with the separate $10 nightly resort fee they tack on once you check in. It covers free wi-fi in the public areas, pool and gym use, and parking. They should just include that fee in the rate like other hotels do (even if they have to bump the rate up) or make it optional for those who don't need to use those amenities. Seems kinda bait and switchy to me. Anyway, more good-to-know stuff: - If you join their free members club, they mail you coupons, which this time got us a $25 nightly rate at Thanksgiving as opposed to the $59 rate otherwise. Still had to pay the resort fee though! - The walls are thin. The first 2 times we stayed here, the people walking in the room above us kept us awake at night. Since then we have requested the top floor and noise hasn't been a problem. - Marilyn's Cafe is good. You have to walk through the small, smoke-filled casino to get to it though. The little pizza/hot dog place is decent, too. - The kitchen area has a sink, stove, and fridge. But without pots and pans, what good is a stove? They should provide microwaves instead. - Parking can be a challenge at night. You might have to park far away and walk through the dimly lit lot and/or pathways to get to your building (it never felt unsafe though). - Don't expect perfection. The old school televisions in the rooms have been slightly fuzzy every time we've stayed there. There has always been some manner of patchwork in the bathroom, like a poorly fixed tile, visible screws holding the vanity together, a loud vent, etc. This last time, we remarked on the lack of padding in the carpet (seriously, it was like walking on cement) and took offense to the sign in the bathroom warning us that we would be charged for taking towels (kinda low rent and tacky in my opinion). This may just be my thing, too, but the box springs looked like they had seen better days...and lots of travelers! - The rooms are laid out like a big open box. The sleeping, living, and kitchen areas are all together with only the bathroom being separate. I prefer suites where the sleeping area is separate for privacy and a more homey feel. All in all, Tuscany is still a good value though. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: talk2me33
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany suites is a large group of 3 storey units over a large gardened area just off the main strip with plenty of parking. The restaurants have a large selection of meals ranging from cafe style to high quality meals, in general service and food quality and quantity is of better standard. The rooms are very large and I was told they are 600 ft square, the bathroom/toilet area is in one quarter of the room. The room we had has 2 double beds in it which are of the smaller double bed size and being 6ft tall my feet hang out of the bed,with 2 adults or kids in the, due to the size you trend to have restless nights. Which is also not helped by the small sheets. The room we had was quiet though. The design of the room and having no internal walls it is not possible to have any lighting on when someone is trying to sleep as there is no way to block off any light. If you are here for a night I would recommend the Tuscany suites, but any more or you have kids look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Bogus charges in your bill”
Reviews.Author: spaintrip08
Reviews.Content: I had an overall ok stay. the rooms are huge but has a stale smell. The worst experience when checking out i had 3 bogus charges which they refunded one right away after some hassel and told me they would refund the other 2 (long distance calls which I never even made)! But just got my credit card bill and they never refunded the 2 charges... This is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skittino
Reviews.Content: A bit of a walk to the strip but it's centrally located and near the monorail. Marilyn's Cafe was excellent and had great service.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Gem”
Reviews.Author: kinzcan
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online at an excellent price and were more than satisfied with the value for the money. The room was huge and the grounds beautiful and well kept. It was 1 km from the strip yet hidden from the noise of the city. The pool area and patio were lovely for relaxing. We ate at the restaurants on site and the meals were reasonably priced with good food and service. There was ample free parking. It would have been nice to have free internet in our room but there was free wireless in the lobby and around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately go back there”
Reviews.Author: TSExpert
Reviews.Content: Great weekend price and a HUGE well maintained room. Fridge, sink, sofa bed, separate shower, tub and toilet in its own room make this perfect for families or even couples. Parking is a breeze, food in all of the resturants was above average and well priced. Casino was well laid out and very clean. All of the employees we encountered were polite and knowlegable. The walk to the Strip was not very long, but a bit perilous due to construction and a seedy bunch of locals. This is not unusual for off strip locals, and that is too bad. There are a lot of nice places to visit and eat within a few blocks of the strip. Vegas needs to improve the look and the safety of ALL the streets adjacent to the strip. Side walks, crosswalks and street lighting are a joke for a city this size and with that much tax revenue, but I think the big hotels fight this to keep people from wandering away and not spending every dime in their rip-off super hotels, home of the $13.00 hamburger.

Reviews.Title: “Training”
Reviews.Author: cjmullis
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, very large, good location, only a few blocks from the Strip

Reviews.Title: “New, spacious, gracious and QUIET”
Reviews.Author: lcleitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the best of both worlds. It's a block and a half from the strip on E. Flamingo, but an entire world away from the craziness. We paid $79 for a Saturday night and only $35 (!!!) for the Sunday night after fleeing from our pre-paid pigstye at the Imperial Dump (aka the Imperial Palace). Our SUITE at Tuscany was easily 3 times the size of the room at the Imperial Dump. It was huge, NEW, and blissfully quiet. The beds were luxury-hotel style and sheer heaven after the lumps of rocks that pass for beds at the Imperial Dump. We ate at Marilyn's at Tuscany - the food was excellent, nearly HALF the price of the Imperial Dump, and the service was fantastic. From the ladies at the front desk, to the concierge and everyone in between, the service at Tuscany was top notch. Even better, you didn't have to compete with cigarette-toking, half-drunk partygoers to get to where you wanted to go in the hotel. They have a great casino which hops at night, but the smoke-free guest rooms are situated well away from the noise. This hotel is walking distance (or a short cab ride) away from all the action, but heaven to come back to at night. Oh, and parking is easy, free and directly in front of the hotel (no walking miles to get your car or using a valet, although a valet is readily available at Tuscany). They also have free wi-fi, excellent conference and banquet facilities, as well as an absolutely beautiful wedding chapel. We paritcularly enjoyed the oasis of the centre-court garden and swimming pool - we felt like we'd arrived at some Caribbean resort, not a hotel in the middle of Vegas. We have made this hotel our absolute number one pick for the next time we're in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: Betsy Schill
Reviews.Content: This beats staying on the strip. It's about a 10 minute walk to the middle of the strip (Bellagio). The staff was wonderful. Really pleasant and ready to help. Always smiling and polite. The restaurants there are a great value with good food. It was exceptionally clean and the rooms are HUGE. The staff really worked hard to keep it clean. A quiet respite from the Strip. You can easily walk but we wouldn't walk late at night - street people. We walked back from shows at 10:00 with no problem. If you are driving and traveling, it's so convenient to have your car near your room, rather than walk to a parking structure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great price”
Reviews.Author: CarolynV4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonably priced. It has spacious clean rooms and very clean grounds/facilities/casino. My conference was held here and the room for the meeting was clean, food service was good, and was not too hot or too cold. The food at Marilynn's Cafe and the Cantina was excellent for the price, the Tuscany Garden's was a bit over rated. We were in walking distance of the strip and when we needed a cab, one was easily found.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden semi-emaculate Gem”
Reviews.Author: MrPrePaid
Reviews.Content: I booked the room a couple weeks before arrival, was searching online and found a decent deal. Upon arrival, since it was memorial day weekend a lot of people discovered the same deal i did. Checking in was a short wait, with a bland but helpful front desk associate. When I asked for a particular section, she made a great recommendation. The parking was easy, fairly close to the room, only problem was that there is no garage. In the summer months (10 mo out of the year) your car will be set to hell!! Upon entering the room, it was very clean with a crisp, just cleaned smell. My girlfriend noticed, that she would need more pillows. I called housekeeping and within 10 min, an abundance of pillows were brought to the room. Being the diva that she is, noticed that she needed more hangers as well. More then the 10 that are supplied for you. After my request was made, I couldn't hang up the phone before a knock was heard at the door. The housekeeper was there with a smile on his face and fist fulls of hangers. She was happy and he was happy with his tip. The bathroom counter space was large, with enough room for her bathroom nick-nacks, and my toothbrush. The shower and tub were separate a nice surprise, since most standard rooms on the strip have a shower/tub combo. There was also a water closet, that housed a toilet. Only problem is that our door was not properly aligned. Overall the size of the room, bathroom and bed, were great. The bed was very comfortable, could have stayed in it for hours and hours. Yes the t.v lacked the channels that we have at home. If you pay 200 for the weekend to watch tv, vegas is not for you. Our room was on the first floor, unlike everyone else our stay was extremely quiet, we made our own noise just to test out the thickness of the walls. Walking the grounds of the hotel was very relaxing, you did not feel the vegas nature. Had a resort like feel, with nice subtle earth tones, a nice quaint Italian feel. The casino was a short walk right off the main building. We got the free players club and fed the machines. our first meal was at the Mexican restaurant, the food was good at a nice cost. had enough to take back our room and fridge it for later. All n all we enjoyed our stay upon leaving the lady who assisted us with check out was extremely helpful and gave us great tips for next time. As we hopped back onto the strip my girlfriend noticed that she forgot her ipod and check book. we immediately called the hotel, and they confirmed that they found it and would have it waiting for us when we returned. Before heading back to cali, we made our stop back picked up the ipod and check book. I would recommend this to everyone! We loved it so much, I just made another reservation for next month. See you there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanucks2
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas, booked online so we were very skeptical because of the bargain price. It exceeded all of our expectations. Great location, food, staff, pool and casino. Very clean! Very friendly! We can't wait to go back. We have already recommended it to all of our family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: decommman
Reviews.Content: Great stay - close to Strip - yet far enough away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Sept 09”
Reviews.Author: SpartanMama
Reviews.Content: My experience with this property - it was very relaxing, great being off the strip and every staff person I encountered was very friendly and accommodating. I'm ready to go back and booking my next trip in December In reading the reviews, it sounds like the peple part of the 800 group were pretty upset, but it sounds like it was more that they were mad with their travel coordinator who charged them $99 a night when the current rate was much lower. Even if your travel coordinator booked it 11 months in advance, they should have followed up and negotiated a better rate when they started to drop. ere's an example from an earlier post from one of the 800 group upset and shows how they over exaggerage. "My assigned room was closer to Los Angeles than it was to the front desk and no amount of request or reminder that my pre-paid reservation had been made 11 months earlier would sway her in getting me moved to a room closer to the casino."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: wallydiver
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Tuscany Suites and if we return to Las Vegas we will stay there again. Check in was smooth and walking to our room we enjoyed the landscaping and fountains. The rooms are in three story buildings spread out through the property and are easy to get to. We were pleasantly surprised by the large size of the rooms and how quiet and comfortable they were. The restaurants and service was good but the casino kicked my butt. That is nothing new for me. I did not like that they charge so much for the Internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomAndKid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany in late January 2008 while I played in a women's hockey tournament. It was one of the three tournament hotels, and I think it cost me $60/night. Cheap! It was nice to have a fridge & micro, both of which worked just fine, and a table to eat at seemed absolutely lovely. The room was big and the furniture comfy. The bed was a bit firm. My only caveat is that the Internet connection is spendy ($12/night) and when we tried to use it through the TV, it was so slow (I'm talking you type one letter and wait 10 seconds for it to appear) that it was unusable. Thankfully, the front desk took the charges off our bill after we complained. It is like 2 blocks off the Strip, so it's quiet but totally doable if you want to walk the strip and play a few slots here and there. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience- Manager could give a hoot!!”
Reviews.Author: myview92688
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Tuscany. Upon entering out room we were taken aback by the musty smoky smell. The carpet was dirty and there were stains on the dinette table. I immediately needed to take a shower because we were meeting up with friends. When I tried to exit the shower stall , I realized something was wrong. The door wouldn't open, no matter how hard I pushed. I started calling for my husband, but realized he'd stepped out for coffee. I was stuck in there for close to 20 minutes!!! When my husband returned he had a hard time trying to open the door. Apparently they had replaced the stall door handle with one that did not fit. Now here comes the fun part....on the last night of our stay we had to end the night a bit early because we had a long drive home and wanted to get some much needed rest., but around 4 in the morning there was a pounding on our door and someone told us to evacuate. We exited our unit and stood outside with the other guests. Turns out it was a false alarm. We tried to fall back asleep, but it was a bit difficult after waking up under those circumstances and also the people in the unit over us sounded like they were coming through the ceiling. I called the front desk to ask if we could check out a bit later (in the morning) because Our sleep had been interrupted. I was transferred to the hotel mgr's ext and I left a voice mail. I never heard back. When my alarm went off in the morning I was exhausted due to the earlier fiasco so I called the front desk again and asked if it was possible for us to stay an extra hour so we could try to get some sleep. I was transferred to the hotel manager's ext, Again and I left a voice mail. I didn't hear back in an hour, and I called again. Finally we just showered and got dressed to assure that we checked out at the normal designated time. When we went to the front desk I asked to speak with the manager. She came out And told me she received my messages, but she didn't know if I wanted a call back...??????? I had been waiting to hear back from her. When I shared my aforementioned complaint s she didn't seem concerned. I even asked her to come to the room and check out the shower door because I was worried someone (possibly a child) could get trapped in there again. She gave me her card and said "I hope you'll try us again"...........Why would I????

Reviews.Title: “Great room and resort without casino hassles.”
Reviews.Author: Gregory H
Reviews.Content: The rooms are better than most casino properties with full living room area and wet bar, refrigerator. Liked that the rooms are separate from casino and you don't have to trek miles through casino and property to arrive at final room destination. Very amenable staff w/ can do attitudes. Great pool areas. Had a delicious dinner @ Tuscany Gardens. Friendly casino staff and service was quick. Really a gem of a property. Need to update furniture and put flat screen TV in room to make perfect, but pretty good as is.

Reviews.Title: “how could anyone complain”
Reviews.Author: willizannah
Reviews.Content: my brother and i stayed at the tuscany for six nights in september. the room was perfect--large, clean, comfortable, quiet, well lighted, convenient. four people could stay in one room very comfortably--if they get along! pool looked spacious and well kept. casino was small, but with a very friendly and helpful staff. restaurant off the casino served decent, reasonably priced food. we walked to the strip every afternoon "to see the sights." eight minute walk, tops. (unless you decided to stop at the hot dog and beer for 2.50 watering hole about halfway. ) final comment. my girlfriend is very, very picky about her hotel rooms, but i would take her here in a heartbeat. and at their prices, she could have her very own room.

Reviews.Title: “Big room small price”
Reviews.Author: bren321
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tuscany 2 months ago and cant say a bad word against the place. Got the room for a very cheap rate for two nights. the suite was MASSIVE with a shower and bathtub. the room was also air conditioned. there are many blocks of suites around the hotel grounds so it is advised to remember a trail to your particular door as its easy to get lost. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was great and plentiful. there is only a 5 to 10 mins walk to the main strip and for the price of the rooms it would be insane to splash out on a strip hotel rather than make the short walk. Perfect for a short stay in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and Dime in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sigmadelta
Reviews.Content: A mixed bag. They charge a compulsory 'resort fee' of $10 per night which 'covers the amenities offered by the hotel'. Why not just build this into the price structure instead of offering unrealistic prices as bait for the unwary? It is supposed to cover parking, etc but strangely doesn't cover wi-fi, which they say 'only costs $13.99 per day'! This was the only place we stayed on an 8 night trip to the US which didn't offer free wi-fi!! Surely a 'resort fee' should cover this. The guest laundry swallowed my coins and didn't work, and wouldn't return the coins. The front desk seemed reluctant to refund my money. The breakfast restaurant is separate from the hotel and you have to walk through the smoke-filled casino to get there. Staff there are inefficient and slow. On the plus side, the room was quiet, clean and spacious, and the location is convenient, just off the Strip and on a major road.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to like.”
Reviews.Author: R77556
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Tuscany Suites and the place has a lot going for it particularly if you are looking for a good value and want to be close to the Strip (without having to put up with the nonstop frenetic craziness). As others have said, the rooms are huge with a separate kitchen area and bathrooms with a separate water closet. The furnishings are functional and nothing fancy. My wife described them as "something you might find in a cottage." The TV was a standard screen with limited channels, but did you really come to Las Vegas to watch TV? My biggest room surprise was that this is the only Vegas hotel I've ever been in where you could open the windows all the way! Since it was in the low to mid 70's we kept the windows open the whole time we were there and didn't have to fuss with the AC. We had a king bed that was firm and comfortable. Unlike the high rise towers that dominate Vegas, Tuscany is made up of a compound of 16 three story buildings. The curvy pathways between are nicely landscaped so it's even fun to walk to the pool, casino, fitness center, etc. It's so peaceful that you could forget you're in Las Vegas until you look up and see the Strip hotels towering over you. Speaking of pools, there are two. The main one is a free form with a large jacuzzi. The second is a lap pool also with a jacuzzi. Both were very well maintained. In most other locations this property would likely be considered a 3-1/2 star place. Becuase it has to compete with likes of Wynn, Venetian, Mandalay Bay et al. it's tough to get that kind of rating. The casino is small and comfortably quiet. It had all the usual slots and table games. Drink service was very good and most of the staff was friendly. The one exception was the bartender who worked during the Monday Night Football party. He seemed to cater to his friends and ignore the rest of the bar. We didn't bother going to the lounge after that. We ate at the 24 hour coffe shop (Marilyn's Cafe) twice and the Mexican restaurant (Cantina) once. The staff was extremely pleasant and went out of their way to make sure everything was okay. The food was very good in both. There is also an upscale Italian restaurant which we didn't try. On check in we recieved a coupon book for BOGO at the restaurants along with a slot card incentive, free drink coupons and a few other goodies. Considering the extremely reasonble price of the rooms, the couplon book turned a good value into a great value. The Good: great location - 2 blocks from the strip Windows that open all the way Good water pressure in shower Pretty in a peaceful way. Free internet in the common areas. Mostly friendly staff The Not So Good - Our room in Building L overlooked a vacant lot.. Ambient noise from the street. (but I guess that's the . price you pay for leaving the windows open.) Charge for internet in the room. None of these were major issues, and the hotel had no control over the first two. We would (and probably will) stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cactus9309
Reviews.Content: Close enough to the Vegas action but far enough away to enjoy some quiet time. Nice amenities, clean, comfortable bed, but pillows to small and flat. Extra large bathroom with privacy toilet. Small kitchen w/table and chairs. Staff pleasant and helpful. Good food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: gazumi
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Tuscany twice now. The rooms are quiet and spacious with a mini kitchen. You don't have to go through the casino to get to your room so access is quick and easy. A small fixed charge per stay - $9 I think - allows you to enjoy the pool, free wireless around the pool and conference area and secure parking in the premises. The weekday rates are also ridiculously low. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I've had apartments that were smaller than these rooms!”
Reviews.Author: niceguyca73
Reviews.Content: I was also there with the large group of 800 people (as in many of the other reviews) and I am a little shocked by the reviews of the staff. We had nothing but pleasant, helpful people attending to us. From checking in, to maid service, to the door men, to all the employees at the on site restaurants and casino. The rooms were massive and extremely clean and the hotel was very close to the strip. Definitely worth the room rate per night of $99 our group arranged. Yes, there were no utensils, cookware, or dishes to go along with the electric stove. I bet if I needed them though, the front desk would have sent them right up! But you are in Vegas! What are you doing staying in your hotel room and cooking anyway? Stay home! And yes, I wouldn't walk to the strip from the hotel at night alone. It's just a couple of blocks, but yeah.. kinda creepy. But hey, i wouldn't walk alone ANYWHERE in Vegas! hehehe

Reviews.Title: “Incredible facility for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Principal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany for 2 nights. The rooms are HUGE! More like a small apartment. The pool was beautiful and grounds well kept. All staff was incredibly friendly and helpful! Casino staff made playing there fun! Food was very good and not expensive. It was close enough to the strip to walk, but far enough away to enjoy the facility when resting from the chaos of the strip. I can't say enough good things about this place and the price was more than right!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably quiet, but drop breadcrumbs to your room.”
Reviews.Author: SineNomine69
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Tuscany Suites and Casino as part of an event of about 800 people. The property is fairly new and, unlike many Vegas headliner hotels, is on the small side. It's conveniently located just east of The Strip on Flamingo, behind the Paris, Planet Hollywood and next to the Platinum, all of which loom over it. One of the Tuscany's draws for me was that its Casino is in a separate, but adjoining building. Therefore one is spared the cacaphonous ringing racket of slot machines, etc. encountered at most Vegas properties. There is a "main" building where one registers and finds several meeting rooms, a bar, and a high-end Italian restaurant of fairly good quality (the osso bucco was enormous and tasty as were the accompanying appetizers, bread, etc.). The rooms themselves are in 15 smaller, outlying buildings of 2-3 floors each identified by a letter. Herein lies the rub. The signage at the hotel is not particularly helpful, nor is the front desk staff because they are obviously familiar with the lay-out of the place and give superficial, fast directions. The xeroxed map is of little help either. For a first-timer, it can be confusing and vexing to find not only your building but the entrance closest to its elevator. The rooms are very spacious. My bathroom had loose faux-Tuscan tiles on the floor, a separate bath and shower, and a plentitude of towels, good toiletries, etc. The room's art work was neither Tuscan nor Vegas themed. It might have been the Amalfi coast, but that's only a stab. There's a sink, 2 electric burners, a mini-fridge and some rooms have microwaves (not mine). However they are of little use since there isn't one piece of cutlery, plates, cups, nor glasses (unless you count the - groan! - flimsy plastic ones) provided. There was a couch and easy chair but both are so low that it practically takes a crane to get you out. And, as with many hotels, there is woefully inadequate lighting by which to do any work or reading after sundown. Key cards are only good for one's own building and room. Therefore, if you invite someone from another building to your room, you were obligated to meet them at the building's (correct) entrance. The housekeeping staff were exemplary. The patio outside the main building is "misted" and the pool is good-sized. There's a good snack shop adjacent to the pool and the Casino has an adequate 24 hour restaurant. I was dismayed to learn that the hotel's on-line rate during my event was significantly lower than the convention rate I paid. That may have been the fault of the envent organizers. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service overides all the good points!”
Reviews.Author: estutseobserver
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel staff, especially the front desk to be rude, spiteful, and lacking in BASIC customer service skills. I was with a large group staying at the hotel and if I owned this hotel i would be grateful that a convention of over 800 people wanted to stay in my hotel and I would make sure they knew how happy I was to accommodate them. Our group rate of $99. per night wasn't a bargain by any stretch but lets do the math...99.00 multiplied by 800 = 79,200.00 multiplied by 5 nights = $396,000.00 and of course there is no accounting for money spent at the casino, restaurants, bar, etc. If I could go back in time I would stop my group from going there! The front desk staff at this hotel is a good lesson in how NOT to treat customers. Any good things are simply outweighed by the staff's horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Rates But Lacking Previous Luster”
Reviews.Author: kudo
Reviews.Content: Spent a nite at the Tuscany on Sun of Labor Day weekend since the rate was much better than we could get on the strip. We've been there before but this time we thought the rooms were showing their age. They are very large with a kitchenette and huge bathroom but our carpet was frayed and not as clean as we would have liked. When we tried to check in at 2:00 (check-in is advertised as 3:00) we were told that we could have an early check-in for $12 extra. We said we would wait. The woman at the front desk said she would take care of all of the paperwork since we were there but we had to come back at 3:00 to pick up our key which didn't seem to make much sense but then neither did the early check-in fee. We also had to pay an additional $10 "resort fee" when we checked out - we were told it was for the use of the pool, fitness center, etc, none of which we used. Can't figure out why that wasn't just included in the price of the room since it didn't appear to be optional. The hotel is located a couple blocks off the strip. Parking is free and convenient if you have a car. It's not a bad walk during the day but wouldn't have wanted to walk it without my husband in the evening. One very bright spot at the Tuscany is the Tuscan Garden Restaurant. They have very good and reasonably price Italian food. We've eaten there even when we aren't staying in the hotel and have always been pleased. As a hotel guest, we got a coupon for $20 off a bill of $40 or more in the restaurant which we were happy to use. All in all, the Tuscany is not a bad place to stay if you're looking for an inexpensive hotel, want a kitchenette, and don't mind being off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean ...perfect”
Reviews.Author: goskiing
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas on a two day solo business trip and did not want to spend the $200.00 per night to sleep at the conference hotel. Saw this for $19.00 per night, plus taxes and a few other fees which make it about $35.00 per night. I asked for a quite roon and was given one of the rooms in a out building was was very quite. For that price I had a clean, very large studio apartment with microwave, stovetop, refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer, ironing board and shampoo. Fitness center and pool were also excellent. Ate in two of the restaurants and the food was very good and reasonable. I would hightly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “the best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelengland
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the tuscany suites. we had the best stay ever we have never been to vegas before but on this visit would return to vegas and ost definitely to the tuscany. the hotel was exactly what we needed the room was perfect and all the facilities were exactely what were expecting. we booked a tour with the hotel everything was spot on we booked show tickets with the hotel up to half price booth and were amazed with what we got (front row jersey boys tickets for saturday night amazing} we did have a minor problem and the hotel sorted it straight away thank you you made my 50 th birthday the best we ate in the hotel on a number of occasions used our coupons and we had excellent meals and service well done

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER stay here again. EVER EVER EVER”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager, Tricia Johnson, is the the most inhospitable, inflexible, unwaivering, unhelpful, passive aggressive hotel manager i have ever encountered in my 55 years of life. My assigned room was closer to Los Angeles than it was to the front desk and no amount of request or reminder that my pre-paid reservation had been made 11 months earlier would sway her in getting me moved to a room closer to the casino. Finally, after working with our group executive, I was allowed to move to a more acceptable room location. This was in spite of this awful woman and not because of her. The hotel is generally ok, rooms are big and the food is good. It is sad that these positive attributes are overwhelmingly overshadowed by this awful, awful woman. Avoid this place and stay somewhere that values customer service and has a hotel manager that gives a darn about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “If you're not easily offended, you will receive twice as much as you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: savvytravelerr
Reviews.Content: This is not quite a vacationer's review of this hotel, but I spent 2 weeks here so I figured I'd be able to write a justified review. I just moved to Las Vegas, and the apartment I live in was not ready for me to move in until 2 weeks after I had already moved ( I had to come down in time for school ) so I needed a low budget place to stay. I thought, the price of the rooms were unfair. I booked this place for $39 a night, and it easily was an $80 or $90/night place in this day and age of everyone trying to make a buck, ESPECIALLY Las Vegas. I got coupons for no-strings-attached free food and drinks the day I checked in. The grounds are tidy and serene, the rooms are huge, the pool is great; I felt like I was getting more than I paid for the whole time. Here's the thing, pretty much the entire hotel staff is not the friendliest in Vegas and has a " with the littlest effort possible" approach to pretty much everything except Marilyn's cafe, their staff is awesome. Honestly, I really couldn't have cared less, I'm 21 and really didn't need anyone for anything as long as I wasn't inconvenienced in any way, and I wasn't. Guests I saw during my 2 week stay were mostly couples and families with young children, no rowdy drunk kids or anyone like that. Another review mentioned something about lack of security, I never pulled in or out without seeing security on bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Serene”
Reviews.Author: GalaxygalOhio
Reviews.Content: Having stayed on the Strip, we looked for an alternative place that would offer a more relaxed atmosphere, yet be close enough to all the action on the strip... Tuscany Suites was a great choice. Rooms were clean, spacious and extremely reasonable! $39 a night (Sunday through Friday) The palm trees and greenery gave it a tropical feel. It was close to Terribles and Ellis Island-- two great places to eat and "play". Terribles offers many freebies(breakfast buffets, dinner deals and midnight steak and eggs), t shirts, hats, etc. for spending even a small amount of time at their machines. Many other great deals (food coupons and free play) can be had by purchasing the American Casinos book . We truly enjoyed a week at Vegas on a shoe string budget!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: donaldgregoryBelfast
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Tuscany before and are always impressed by the quality of the hotel. Rooms are huge. Parking outside the room is such a perk. The grounds are very well maintained. For value this hotel can't be beat and so near the strip. Food in their restaurants excellent and really good value. Staff very friendly and helpful. Watch out for cab drivers they all try to long haul taking the longest route. To the airport a cab should cost about £14 inc tip.

Reviews.Title: “POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE AND ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: JJ507
Reviews.Content: I got injured at the hotel due to their negligence no one followed up if you are not under 30 I would not reccomend staying at the hotel, lack of security lots of yound drunk people

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has what it takes but service can't walk the walk”
Reviews.Author: Stymie
Reviews.Content: I made our reservations online a month before arriving. The Tuscany web page had a deal too good to pass up, around $20 a night. We checked in at the reservation desk and the lady took my credit card for incidentals, but charged me for a night's stay and a $100 deposit without informing me of the charges before hand. I wanted the option of paying cash or use a different credit card or both. I had to use two different credit cards. This also caused my wife to stress out about what these other charges were about. In my opinion this could have been avoided by breaking down the charges BEFORE they charge me. Strike one. The room was above average. Small suite size. mini kitchen and clean. We were waiting for our luggage that we sent via fed ex. We called the bell desk and they told us the box did not arrive. I call fed ex and it was confirmed delivered and signed 5 hours earlier. After notifying the bell desk that it was delivered, they found it and brought it to our room. Why do I have to hunt this box down when I'm trying to enjoy my vacation? Strike two. My wife and I were hungry and decided to go to Tuscany's 'The Cantina' Mexican restaurant. The hostess told us we would we be seated soon. We sat looking at 5 empty tables with half eaten food. After 10 minutes I had to pull aside the bus boy to have him clean one of the filthy tables. We sat and waited another 15 minutes before we received water and menus. As we ate our food, we wondered why the waitress disappeared. I paid for the bill using a 2 for 1 coupon (thankfully), and was asked by the hostess why I left no tip. I told her the service was embarrassing. Strike three !! The next night I played in the nightly Tuscany poker tournament and won it. Richard runs a nice friendly room. He treats everyone there as a friend. Classy guy. After the tournament I took my wife to Marilyn's Cafe inside the casino. It was a simple meal and tasty but we were made to wait over 10 minutes to pay our bill due to the cashier was the only one on staff who knew how to make a milk shake. Strike four. Oh yeah, the pool had enough chlorine fumes to remove your eye brows. Strike Five !!

Reviews.Title: “Some Room Renovations Were Better Than Others”
Reviews.Author: tony5969
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of ten, count ‘em,* ten* nights at the Tuscany, primarily for the same annual convention we attended last year. (See previous review.) Not much had changed in the casino, besides swapping out a few slots, or elsewhere on the common grounds. However, there were some updates in the room that left us with some mixed feelings. The sofa, chair and bedding had all been replaced which was fine. However, the kitchen area renovations were hit or miss. There was a faux marble countertop installed which was good. However, it came at the cost of the formerly full-sized refrigerator which was replaced by a smaller version that fit under the countertop. Also, the microwave that used to be there was now only available by request. Fortunately, it was not a problem to acquire one. My only complaint would be regarding the fitness center which I discovered on this trip. Besides the fact it’s a large, underutilized space, many of the moderate-sized dumbbells – 20 to 35 lbs. – were missing, which effectively cut my workout options. However, the laundry room, located in the same building, was a nice convenience. If you like the idea of the space of the Venetian but don’t want to pay the premium, then you’ll find the Tuscany to be a low-key alternative whose off-Strip location is closer to many Strip properties than its upscale Italian “sister”.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - Style Without Substance”
Reviews.Author: worldfusionradio
Reviews.Content: Lots of glitz and sparkle but beneath the surface this is not a nice hotel. The staff is spectacularly unhelpful and rude. The rooms themselves look pretty but aren't clean, the furniture is worn, the mattress is thin, the sheets are thinner, the bathroom fixtures flimsy, and the walls and ceilings so thin you can hear the ceiling creak with every step of the person upstairs. Also beware of hidden fees and charges that the hotel hits you with once you are checked in. Internet access is $14 a day!!! Plus they charge a $11 "resort" fee PER DAY whether you use their services or not!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kimshi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and both my boyfriend and I really like this place. The room is huge and spacious. Parking is convenient and check-in is easy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice secret in vegas...”
Reviews.Author: love2escapeaway
Reviews.Content: I stayed in building A room 102 and was very pleased with the large suite. The room was clean, smelled nice, had a very comfotable bed with nice linens and a large bathroom. We arrived early and checked in at 8am for only $13.00 more. I was impressed on how nice this place was for the price. Really a great value compared to the hotels on the strip. Its located around the corner from the Paris hotel just a short walk to strip if you dont mind the heat. but also plenty of taxis available outside of lobby. Cant comment on the casino because i dont gamble. I went for the nightlife, Jet, Tao and for Rehab on Sunday. Very good location for all of these. Staff very nice, beautiful lobby and the grounds are kept very green . I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “TSC: Such a deal”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Vegas, usually during the week, when hotel rates are much cheaper. My brother had recommended the Tuscany Suites and Casino (TSC) to me; it's where he usually stays in Vegas, and when Expedia came up with a $22/night rate for my dates (20 to 23 July), I decided to book it. I generally prefer the glitz, glitter, and buzz of the Strip hotels, but I'm always willing to give a recommended place a try, especially at a bargain price. In this case, I'm glad I did. TSC is an excellent value, with comfortable rooms, friendly staff, user-friendly layout, and easy parking. I was given a nonsmoking king room on the second floor of the "I" building. The room was decent, with a separate sitting area and, as other TA reviewers have noted, a minifridge and coffee maker. I found the room to be similar to but larger than rooms I've seen at various Holiday Inns, Comfort Inns, etc. over the years. The furnishings were a bit worn and not high quality, but at $22/night, I have no real complaint. The A/C was an older-style floor unit but worked well. The bathroom was the most pleasant surprise: large, with a separate shower stall and bathtub. Fancy -- sort of. I had trouble sleeping my first night, after getting in late and hearing my upstairs neighbors thumping and bumping around -- not unusual for a motel- or garden apartment- style "resort". The noises resumed fairly early in the morning, and when I called the front desk to ask about a possible room change (to something on the third, or top, floor of TSC), the operator abruptly said, "I'll have security check it out." Maybe 10 minutes later, I had a call, and "Security" said they'd visited the room above mine and found it empty (speculating, as I did, that the party had stayed up late and then checked out early). I slept for a couple more hours and then called the front desk again to ask about a room change. The woman who answered said, "No problem; we'll hold another unit for you on the 3rd floor of the H Building." I went down to reception, and I received my new room keys. The new room was an improvement in several ways: newer A/C; recently renovated furnishings -- including a smart new bed treatment with a duvet and even accent pillows worthy of the MGM Grand's West Wing rooms -- and...quieter than my first room. I called the front desk to thank them again. TSC's location and parking are also strong points. It's on E. Flamingo, a few blocks from the Strip. One problem -- nothing to do with TSC per se -- is that E. Flamingo, like many of Vegas's busier roads, is undergoing major repairs, which makes access to the hotel a bit more difficult than usual, especially at night. But once at TSC, parking is free, easy, and plentiful, with no long walks to your room. The "Beach Cafe" -- located next to the pool and adjacent to the casino and hotel reception -- is convenient for snacks and drinks and not too expensive. Their personal pizzas are a true Vegas dining bargain, tasty and cheap -- especially the meat lover's, with more meat than one should eat, for $4.50. I didn't use the pool at the TSC -- I rarely do at Vegas hotels; too hot and crowded, and I prefer the ocean for swimming -- but it was fairly big and looked alright. The internet, as other reviewers have noted, is free in wifi form in some areas of the hotel (lobby, Beach Cafe, around the pool) but costs pretty much the same as other Vegas hotels for in-room connection via wifi or cable. Again, given the room rate I was paying, I can't complain. I used the free wifi in the available areas; it worked pretty well most but not all of the time. I gamed some in the TSC's casino; it was alright. The slots were neither the loosest nor tightest I've experienced in Vegas. If nothing else, the casino here was a good adult respite from all the kids elsewhere on the property. Conclusion: TSC is a great value, and for the most part, it's a fairly nice property. It's neither luxurious nor peaceful, but there are scores of other hotels and resorts to fill those needs. TSC is very kid- and family-friendly while at the same time providing good, solid, and reasonably quiet accommodations for solo travelers like me. I'd recommend staying here and spending the savings on wining, dining, and gambling on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vegas Experience Yet”
Reviews.Author: sparklesalt
Reviews.Content: Upside: The rooms are very spacious. The furnishings are getting a little worn, but it's acceptable. The dining facilities are ranged and value priced. Downside: It's off-strip. Not too far, but off-strip. Expect a very low winnings rate from the casino's machines (slots, video gaming). Avoid them. The tables, however, are nice. The staff is horrendous. Contrary to what was advertised on the website that attracted me to the hotel, there is a $13.99 per day Internet access fee (one of my pet peeves for Vegas strip hotels). When I called to inquire about this, the front desk told me that there were areas of the hotel where Internet access was free, but that didn't include the rooms. I said, "That's bulls**t" and got hung up on. This led me to complain to the managment, I found callous and unconcerned to the degree that I checked out of the hotel the same day I checked in, and went down the street. There are plenty of other places in Vegas which are happy to have your business. Don't bother with Tuscany. They are not in the hospitality business, and consider you to be their revenue source, not their guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for off-strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCB_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice if you don't mind staying off the strip. Keep in mind it's not an extravagant resort. It's above a budget hotel/motel. The rooms were large. It had a mini-fridge and coffee maker. The pool was nice but can get busy. It was a decent size but not large. Dining was inexpensive at Marilyn's Cafe (look for 2 for 1 coupons in the tourist book in your room or the coupon book they provide you upon check-in). The food was above average. I prefer to stay on the strip; therefore, would probably not come back; but, there is nothing wrong with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “I was shocked by how amazing my stay was..”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaLea
Reviews.Content: Not only was the room huge at a great price, the amenities were quality, the service was quick, I booked my room last minute and didn't actually finish the reservation, and when I called on the drive down there they went ahead and honored the rate I had tried to book for, which was 20 dollars cheaper than the rate I should have had. When I asked for a razor, tooth brush and tooth paste, they had it to my room before I could return back from the front desk, they sent up 2 of each and shave gel. Everything they had brought up were name brand, not the usual cheap and cheesy hotel items. You do have to walk to your room, which could be across a large parking lot, no biggie (unless you are a lazy fatty!) The pool was amazing at 7 am, very few people, clean and it was nice and hot out side. Room service was ok priced, but we just took the food to go to save money. The casino was not trying to pay out.. I spent more money in the casino than I did for the room.. Oh well I had fun and other casinos were about a block away. They even let me have a late check out with out a charge.. Overall I was very happy and I would have paid more and still been happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Decent”
Reviews.Author: CTJP2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany resort in Las Vegas for football over Thanksgiving weekend. The room was nice and it was very clean. The casino was fun . The food was great since there was 3 different restaurants. The lobby was very elegant.The only thing was I expected it to be a little bit better. I walked to the strip every day.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Ziggyncali
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Tuscany based on the very low rate for the days I was traveling. Overall not a bad place if you don't mind staying off the strip an not really having a full hotel casino experience. The front desk was my only problem, first off you cannot check in until 3pm, most hotels post a certain time but will always let you check in a couple hours early, not the Tuscany. I have stayed in Vegas over 15 times in atleast 10 different hotels an was never denied checking in early. Now they will tell you you have the option to pay a extra fee to check in early, I believe it was around 13 dollars, which is clearly a way for them to make more money off their guests, very bad move. Okay so when you decide you don't want to pay the extra fee to check in early the extra charges do not stop there. When I went back at 3pm to check in I was told there is a 11.20 a day resort fee, what are you kidding me, so the cheap room you thought you booked just went up a extra 11.20 per night, another very bad move by the Tuscany, I will not stay there again due to those extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Decor little dated, but great value and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelbug821
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tuscany several times and feel that I need to give a review. I usually stay in the King size suite that has a sitting area and a small dinette area (only sink, cabinets and fridge. No ability to cook). The room is big and roomy where you could probably fit another king size bed in there with no problem. The decoration is a little dated with brown/tan fabric and old TV. But you didn't go to Vegas to stay in your room. The bathroom is also huge with the toilet, tub, and shower all separated. The only complaint that I have is there is limited cable. I was only able to watch TNT, USA, and MTV. Don't know what happened to FoodNetwork and HGTV. But again, you don't go to Vegas to stay in your room so get out and play!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Aussie61
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 303 on the top floor of building B for 3 nights in June. My husband booked online after much research using Trip Advisor. We were really happy with our room which was large with a kitchenette and had a big bathroom and separate toilet. The furnishings seemed quite new. We walked each night to the strip which was about 10 minutes away and had dinner at the mexican restaurant twice because the food was very good and very reasonably priced. We don't gamble so can't comment on the casino and didn't spend any time in the pool. We had a very comfortable stay at the Tuscany Suites and Casino and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to stay away from the hassle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: QenTerra
Reviews.Content: During May and June I stayed at several places in Las Vegas and Tuscany Suites was one of the best in it's price range. There are two pools and two spas here. The spa behind the fitness center seems to get less traffic and was my choice. The 3 story buildings are easy to get in and out of quickly if you need to go somewhere. The room was large, well furnished, in very good condition and clean. Tv service was basic and the internet service was very fast. There is a fee of internet use in most rooms though in the lobby and back patio Tuscany Suites offers free internet dervice. I was able to have lunch and diner here at what I feel were reasonable prices. The casino appeared well layed out with good service. I found my stay here to be very comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMaloney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We chose it based on an exceptionally low price with some very good TA reviews. Reception: You are number x. Forget about a personal welcome etc. you are cargo with a credit card. Room: Excellent. Room was large with kitchenette. We were right beside the pool which was convenient. The room was spotless also. Pool: There are two pools. We used both. The main pool gets busy early (9am) and overall the area is quite small. We used the second pool which was pretty quiet. Location: It is about a 10 minute walk to the main strip (Ballys Intersection). Parking is also free at the hotel Considering the price I would highly recommend this hotel. It is not overly luxurious but if you can live without that then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: amandall24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Tuscany Suites this past weekend with my boyfriend, cousin & her boyfriend. I wasnt trying to spend a crazy amount of money on a hotel room in Las Vegas so I found The Tuscany Suites online and the rooms looked good and had everything we needed and were somewhat close to the strip. We checked in at the front desk and within the first 5 minutes my boyfriend and I werent very happy about it. The staff was extremly rude, they failed to mention at the time of booking my room, there would be a $200 security deposit that we would get back at check out as long as we didnt order any movies, room service, etc. So we paid that out of our spending money, got into our room, there were broken tiles in the bathroom, the mini fridge didnt work the entire first day we were there, and there were cigarette holes burnt into the comforters. Of course those things were minimal b/c we wouldnt be spending much time in the room in the first place. At the time of our checking out of the hotel, they send house keeping to check out your room -which i have never had happen, even in the very nice hotels- this took about 15 minutes, house keeping called back to the front desk & told them we had smoked in the room. I had reserved a non-smoking room b/c my boyfriend has asthma and no one in our room smokes, so of course we didnt want to smell that. So they proceeded to charge us $50 for smoking in the room, the manager wouldnt even listen to us when we explained to her that no one smokes cigarettes, she then said, well they said it wasnt cigarettes and insinuated that we had smoked something else in the room, and if we wanted to dispute the charge we could wait another 30 minutes and security would check out the room. By this point we were so frustrated with the rude manager and the woman at the front desk that was trying to check us out of our room- which by the way had no idea what she was doing- that we just said forget it and got our $150 back from them and left. It was by far the worst experience Ive had with a hotel in Vegas and I have definetly learned my lesson staying in a "cheap" hotel to save some money for going out more.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Stoppelgroppen
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here a couple years ago, but I never got around to reviewing it, and I don't want my review to get buried. Stayed there as part of a promotion being put on by Pacific Monarch for their timeshares in Las Vegas. Everything was clean, well maintained, almost like new. The room was large, the casino small, but it's not really the place to go for gaming anyway. Restaurant staff was very friendly. One bad thing was if you decided to drive up to the Strip it was almost always gridlock getting there. Faster to walk. But being off the strip has it's advantages. I think it attracts a better clientele than the usual riff-raff and low lifes you find on the Strip. I especially liked the pool and veranda area where you could sit in the shade under misters and enjoy the morning paper and a cup of coffee. It definitely should be ranked higher than 43.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal for a very nice room”
Reviews.Author: SprintSTrider
Reviews.Content: I found this room very large and comfortable with a big comfortable bed, nice living room area and even a small kitchen area. Couldn't beat that for 50 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, big, cheap, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: merryd
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Tuscany from the fast check-in to the huge standard room to the pretty pool and affordable restaurants inside the casino. The walk to the strip takes about 12 - 15 minutes depending on your speed. This was fine for us as that intersection has so much going on anyway. The room was even larger than our room at the Trump (we splurged later). It was about half price compared to anything else and everything worked great - minimal noise, got a microwave, no smoke smell, room service on request, etc. Another bonus - the cabbies know the hotel because it is so big (I was surprised) even though it's not on the strip. We ate at Marilyn's (good breakfast!) and the Cantina (not that great). A few too many kids at the pool, but the music was mellow and relaxing and there is even affordable drink service! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: EE1210
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany was a fabulous hotel and the customer service was excellent. The room was large enough for my 2 year old to run and play. Very beautiful pool area and hotel grounds were clean and well maintained. There is free internet access in certain areas of the hotel or you can pay a small fee to have internet access in your room. This is a great hotel for families, couples or singles that is located very close to the Strip with various restaurants located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel. Refused to pay 50% resort fee.”
Reviews.Author: roughnready68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was worth a lot more than worth the $23/night rate I got. The room was huge, with a stove and a microwave. It also had a great air conditioning. There was free internet in the lobby too. Among the other hotels in this price range, the Tuscany wins by far. However, the 50% "RESORT FEE" they tried to tack on to my price is OUTRAGEOUS. This needs to be disclosed by the hotel and hotels.com ahead of time in LARGE PRINT. I refused to pay it when I checked out of the Tuscany, and a sarcastic nasty clerk removed it from my bill. I acquiesced to the charge when checking in because it was midnight and I was tired. It is a dirty trick for them to spring this on people when checking in. It is not legal for them to bury stuff like this in the fine print either.

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 !!!”
Reviews.Author: stockmktgenius
Reviews.Content: We're staying at Tuscany now, and couldn't be happier. Our room - like all rooms here - is a suite, and a very fine one. All the buildings, all the pools, all the grounds, are first rate. And the price... I looked this hotel up at www.expedia-aarp.com and got a price of $23! Then called them up to be sure there's no construction going on (there isn't) - and they were happy to give me that same price, instead of what the lady said was her usual $25 charge! I wrote my friends in O.C.- and now they all want to come here too! Told my editor in N.Y., and she wrote back: "Tuscany Suites is where we stayed in Las Vegas the last two times we were there. We like it because the rooms are big and it’s easy to get in and out of by car (unlike staying on the Strip where the traffic is just as bad as NY)." The catch? I guess they're hoping we'll gamble away our savings at their casino. Not to worry- I'm just enjoying my fine $23 suite, and feeling very smart about it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value & serivice for our 3 day stay!”
Reviews.Author: jomel147
Reviews.Content: I just returned from taking my daughter to Vegas for her 21st Birthday. I actually let her decide where she wanted to stay and gave her a choice of a couple big name hotels on the strip and of course the Tuscany. Having never been to Vegas before and not knowing one Hotel from the next, she chose the Tuscany because of the ambiance and homey feel of the Tuscany. We were not dissapointed. The staff was VERY helpful and friendly and the room was very spacious and comfortable. We loved the pool area and the surrounding grounds. The prices there are very affordable($40 per night) and the food was excellent quality. I was shocked when we ordered a couple of frozen drinks to celebrate her turning 21 and couldn't believe they were only $5 each- in Vegas! Of course this is an "off-strip" hotel and there was a short walk up to Bally's to catch the monorail to get to the rest of the strip. We decided that the walk was OK during the daylight hours but didnt feel comfortable walking back to the hotel late at night, so we just grabbed a cab from the strip for under $10. There are very few downfalls to the Tuscany except that I think they should invest in their own shuttle to take people back and forth to the strip. Also the elevator in the building that we were in was painfully slow. Other than that, I would definitely reccomend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again-especially if you're looking for a a great value and an alternative to the hustle and bustle of the strip. After all, you don't go to Vegas to spend all your time in a hotel room. Put that extra savings into gambling, dining or shopping.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location & price”
Reviews.Author: Pacman1854
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks here, and cannot fault it. Reception staff very helpful. Booked a king-size but they had none available. They offered us a room, and if we wanted to move to a king-size when one became available they would move us, no problem. Also asked for decaff coffee for the in-room coffee maker and within minutes we had a pile delivered to the room. Room large and clean. Asked for a no-smoking room and got one. Maid service every day so had fresh towels daily. Perfect location for the Vegas Strip as only 10 minutes walk away, so away from all the hustle/bustle but close enough if you want it. Would recommend getting a 24hour or 3 day ticket for the Deuce bus. Can then hop on & off as needed. Also, join the Players Clubs at the casinos for plenty of freebies, free play at the casinos etc.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right . The room was large.”
Reviews.Author: susiecolette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany Suites & Suites . It wasn't a planned stay. We were coming back from Sedonna and it was late and we had decided to stay off the strip to save money and the driving hassle. It was too late to shop around. My husband said the lobby looked good. It smelled of cigarettes, because it was close to the casino,too bad it really invaded the place. Apparently not a high quality ventillation system. This is one of my biggest priorities when looking for a place. The casino had a resturaunt but I personally won't eat anywhere if there is the smell of cigarette smoke. There was another resturant outside the casino, but it was the same issue with smoke smell. The room was very large. The carpets were a little soiled, but not awful. Otherwise the room was clean . We had a fridge and could buy some things at the store. The beds and pillows could have been softer, but still I did not lose any sleep. It was very quiet. We stayed mid-week so the pool was not crowded and warm.It was nice to not have to fight for a chaise lounge. Enjoyed my time out there. The casino was not the best. We spent minimal time there. Stayed two nights. They kept spraying the room with this horrible spray after cleaning. Recommend Blueberry Hill Restaurant a short drive away on the same street for a huge breakfast variety served all day. Under $10.00 , worth the price. Excellent food , coffee and service. I'd recommend the Tuscany if you want to have some room , a fridge, and be away from the strip and just drive to it when needed. Try the Whole Foods store at the end of Las Vegas Blvd. for a great selection of pre-prepared fresh salads, entrees, and fruit, smoothies. They have a good produce section and the price was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “stay far away from the casino”
Reviews.Author: idahotrix
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice, pretty landscape, not a far walk from the strip.rooms were very nice and clean. the casino was dead most of the time, never heard a bell or whistle go off in two days, the casino atmosphere was awful, the bartenders could care less, the dealers were all dead in personality, had a few rude, some tired, most in wrinkled old white shirts.besides that i had two very bad and wierd things happen on the roulette table, too much detail to go into here, but stay away,,far away !!! i have also e-mailed the head of the casino to inform him i am very suspicious of the activities that took place. if you want a nice hotel and the casino doesnt matter, then this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price makes the Tuscany a good value! A good way to not get burnt out on Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: traveldevas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tuscany on several different occassions for Conferences and for Family Reunions and I chose it because we decided to get married at the Flamingo and have our dinner at Bouchon (Venetian) as well as seeing Phantom of the Opera--and I the Flamingo charges an insane deposit for rooms and the Venetian was way overpriced for our group. The Tuscany had the location and the incredible prices so we all stayed there! The Tuscany is down the street from the Flamingo/Ballys-a quick ten minute walk to all of the action. This three story hotel comprises of a dozen buildings surrounding the main building. The main building includes a small casino-where the slots seem to be pretty loose-An upscale Italian restaurant, a Mexican Restaurant, a 24 restaurant, a Bar inside of the Casino, a coffee shop, a gift shop and a Lobby bar and Front Desk/Concierge. Upstairs are the conference rooms. We have stayed at this hotel before and prerequested that everyone stay in the same building-and they were able to accomodate us with that. The front lobby staff was great. We had used online websites for the best deals and that was great. I have stayed there in the past and at other hotels around the world, and the less complicated you make it, the less errors there will be. If I am splitting a room with someone I pay for it and they pay for the car or something else. (Just a traveldeva tip!) The spacious rooms have either a King or two double beds, a smallish tv on top of a dresser, a round table and four chairs, fridge and microwave and couch/Chair with table. These rooms are perfect for gathering everyone together, having a late night snack or waiting for everyone to get together. The rooms are clean, have windows that can open, have a Tuscan "theme" with the watercolors on the wall and the bedspread, and pale furniture. The bathroom has a shower (yes it is low, European style) as well as separate tub and toilet with a separate door. These rooms are more than functional and although not as luxurious as some hotels, this would be a Superior First class room in NYC! I would equate the rooms to be like a Country Inns and Suites or a Holiday Inn or better quality Best Western. What I love about this hotel is the ease from going from your room to the car-maybe three minutes, versus other hotels on the strip, which take a good ten minutes to get to the car park and then maneuver around the ramp to get out to the street. This is very convenient. We never ate at the Mexican or Italian restaurant, but we did eat at the 24 hour cafe, which features really reasonable prices and good solid food. This is not like eating at Mario Batali's restaurant, but the food is good and the price is great. (I am trying to set up expectations here! :)) Breakfast was tasty and one night, my brother got a chicken sandwich and he said it was tasty. The pool is not huge by any standards, but it is a pleasant pool area and we loved the coziness of it all. I never felt unsafe there, but like anywhere, in the evening, always walk outside with someone else. I did notice across the street, some homeless guys walking around. Traveling can provide false security and it is a good idea to not walk alone at night. As we had stayed in Vegas for a week, which is unusual and frankly too long, but necessary in our case, I liked that the Tuscany is away from the total Vegas insantity. When we wanted to be part of that..we headed out to the strip, but at the end of the day, it was nice to be back at our quiet, relaxing hotel.
