Reviews.Title: “excellant bell desk service”
Reviews.Author: HannaI
Reviews.Content: These comments are centered on Sonny S. @ the Bell Desk. My company was on site for a tradeshow that ended on a late Sunday afternoon. Sonny helped with the outbound shipment of our tradeshow items. Because of his patience, willingness to be of service and general all around pleasant attitude, we got our 3 items shipped from the hotel. Even though it didn't all happen on the same day, the shipments did take happen and it's all because of the excellant customer service Sonny provided. I hope his boss reads this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LAPhil13
Reviews.Content: Large, clean rooms. Good location (unless you insist on being on the Strip), good service at the front desk. You can generally get really good rates at the Tuscany, which can be a welcome relief from the overpriced hotels on the Strip. This is a good place to stay for people who are not asking too much from their lodgings, but who want something reliable. I read an earlier review that said that the maids steal -- to those young people, I would suggest that they left the money in a location that is where courteous guests might leave a tip. Perhaps they should take a hint.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: LvnLaVidaLoca
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge and very nice. Great for a family. Rooms are very spacious and some have 2 burner stoves, small fridges. The first night I was there the airconditioner was not working. After 2 calls to the front desk it was replaced. I was in building C. The walls were paper thin. I could hear EVERYTHING! The upstairs in building C are conference rooms and apparently they were setting up all night. I hardly slept even with earplugs on. I left for a conference and came back to the Tuscany for a flight out of Las Vegas. I was in building M. The room was the same siR huge! There were no problems with him walls. I never heard a peep except for an occasional door slam. The pool is very nice. Very suitable for kids. The Italian food is wonderful. The casino is clean and up kept. Not very happening. The entire staff is very friendly and helpful. I did not pass an employee of any type here that did not ask me how my stay was or if I needed anything. Very easy walk to the strip. The gym is very nice and has just about everyhing you need. There is a lap pool and a hot tub in the gym area, away from the childrens pool. Not many people in there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: swuzyg
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Tuscany. It was only a 10 minute walk to the main part of the strip. (One straight road leading to Bally's) Being so near the strip we didn't expect it to be so quiet but it truly was. Room were nice and big. The bed really comfortable and the bathroom superb (shower was very powerful). Only bad thing I will say is try and get a room on the third floor, as people we traveled with were on the second and found people above them a bit noisey. Would defiently stay at the tuscany again

Reviews.Title: “GEM”
Reviews.Author: KEVALBION
Reviews.Content: After several stays on the strip we decided to have a change and find somewhere different. What a great place The Tuscany Suites turned out to be.Very spacious 2 bedded suites with seperated bathroom and toilet,kitchenette with microwave and comfortable lounge chairs.The suites are grouped in 3 storey blocks of about 50 units and are spread around grounds leading to a small but very adequate pool with an adjacent heated spa pool.The casino is in the main reception building, so unlike many Vegas hotels you don`t have to walk thru to get to the outside world.There are several places to eat,a good value 24hr cafe called Marilyns and an upmarket restaurant called The Tuscany Gardens.We found the prices for breakfast,dinner and drinks to be very reasonable.This may be due to the fact that the hotel lies about 400/600 metres off the strip and doesn`t cater for the masses passing by. We found the staff to be polite and very proffesional and the whole experience to be a good one.I think we will be returning there on our next trip to Vegas funds permitting!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Big Suites, Not Far Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: Auf Wiedersehen
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to Tuscany after 4 or 5 years, and it is still my choice in Vegas. Suites are Huge, Clean, and Quiet. Grounds are very nice. Service seemed improved from last visit, staff much friendlier. Casino is still a favorite, well-ventilated, comfortable, and plenty of cheaper machines. Breakfast at Marilyn's was phenomenal, food, quantity, service, price, and we used the BOGO free coupon given at check-in with no hassle. Absolutely no hassle with Expedia reservation at check-in. A two block walk to strip, using Bally's monorail entrance. Only improvement needed would be bedding---bed was firm and comfortable, bedding was clean, but cover looked it's age, and blanket was not high quality. Let me reiterate though, that it was all clean and not stained or ragged. If you are able to walk this is a fine choice--it is closer to strip than most off-strip locations. If walking is difficult you, there is a shuttle, but did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: exotik
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the size of suites. The pros: 1. The prices are cheap now and equivalent for the value of the room. 2. On Flamingo not too far from Vegas strip or McCarran Airport. 3. Refrigerator and coffee pot included in room. Large enough bathroom with separate shower and tub. 4. Room is large enough to put luggage anywhere and the luggage will not be in your way. 5. The staff seem nice and helpful. 6. The security patrol grounds continuously by vehicle. Ok now the cons: 1. You can hear the people walking above you if you are not on top floor. 2. The doors are hard to open/unlock to your room and sometimes to the hallway of hotel. They need to fix their key card systems as it attempts to unlock but doesn't...you have to keep trying. 3. Cafe/deli food is not too tasty, maybe only try the restaurants. 4. Tv is old and so is the furniture. 5. Valet is not 24 hours, see hotel for times. The security can retrieve your car after hours though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: BorninVegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights, and we would definitely return. We had a nice room, very large, with a good size bathroom. True, there was a "kitchen" area with no stove, microwave, dishes, or silverware. There was a small fridge. We had no problems with nightclub noise at all, even though we were in the exact same location as a previous poster who did. We both slept well. The pool area is pleasant to look at, and gets good sun, but the pool itself is curvy (i.e., not good for lap swimming.) There is a hot tub next to the pool. What we liked most about this place is it was not crowded at all. We were on a bottom floor, with no elevator to wait for. Walking to the casino, coffee shop, or restaurant took one minute. Also, you do not have to walk through the casino to get to your room (as is the case with almost every strip hotel.) We found the staff very helpful and friendly. The poker room manager was especially nice, calling us by our first names by the end of our short stay. The main disadvantage to this place is the location. It takes about ten minutes to walk to the nearest Strip hotel (Bally's). If you want to walk up and down the Strip, you need to take this into account. Twice we decided to get a cab, and both times we had wait times of less than five minutes. We paid $85 for two nights. This was a special rate through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “This is my 4th visit to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: khahn767
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with the size and location of the Tuscany. I am planning another stay for my son's 21st birthday. This will be trip 5 to Vegas and this hotel. The first time I stayed at this hotel was for a cheerleeding competition for my daughter, let me tell you...... teen ager's sure like to spread out their belongings and pretend they are at home, with this hotel she was able to do this. The cleaniness of the rooms are great. There was a mini stove top in there our first and second visit, but they removed them. There is a kitchen sink and table, almost like a studio apartment. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Maid's Steal Money”
Reviews.Author: poisonivy097
Reviews.Content: We Purposely left money on the table by the beds in the morning (just a few bucks) because i want to know if the maid steals if they do i know not to go back and what else might they steal. so we left to grab something to eat, went to the hoover dam and when we came back money was gone and room was cleaned. so then we checked our luggage and our other stuff but luckly we took the stuff the was Valuable with us. there was a safe in the room but you have to pay 25 bucks a day.. the location was great near all kind of fast food places and banks, we were a couple a blocks away from paris so we would just park in there parking lot and just walk around, it was great. the room was a nice space it had a mini Refrigerator that worked great, and a stove and microwave. The beds sucked we both had bad backs for 3 days. they have a lap pool and a regular pool, they also have a place to do laundry and it is 1.00 for washing and .45 cents for drying. they place was well maintained on the outside. staff was nice except the check in people there were rude.

Reviews.Title: “Found Tuscany OK”
Reviews.Author: CatLadyUk
Reviews.Content: Room was large, I think they used to be self catering studios but now you only get a fridge, sink, coffee machine and plastic cups. The room was clean and we couldnt fault housekeeping. My husband didnt like the shower, the shower head was too low and the controls werent that good. Pool area looked nice although not the weather to use it! I would recommend going in March as the sun was out but the temperature ranged from warm to cool which was good for the walking up and down the strip between hotels. The walk from the hotel to the strip takes 5-10mins and puts you in the centre of the strip. We didnt mind the walk but after a while it became tedious to have to walk back and forth. A free shuttle would have been good. Also I would recommend they put more people on reception cos there was always a queue. A tip - If you dont like taking your passport with you when you are out for a drink, make sure you take your photo driving licence to Vegas. Most bars in Vegas ask everyone for ID, even those over 60!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine by us!”
Reviews.Author: derrickonline
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious, clean, and the grounds are garden style apartment style. We're not the type to spend a lot of money on hotel accomodations. When we travel, our intent is not to stay in the room all day, but to be out and about enjoying the area we're visiting. Because of this we found the Tuscany Suites great. Pros: Clean, quiet, great location, helpful and pleasant staff., large rooms and large bathroom with separate shower, tub, and toilet. The toilet in the bathroom actually has it's own door. So your wife can be in the shower while you stink up the toilet area without disturbing her. :) Cons: The kitchenette is really just a sink, cabinets and a fridge. No stove (no biggie, we don't go on vacation to cook) but we were hoping for at least a microwave to reheat leftovers from a dinner/lunch out. There was also no silverware (plastic or otherwise), no plates etc. Overall we had an enjoyable stay. Here's a tip... They say check-in is at 4PM. But you can actually check-in by 2PM at no charge. Or you can check-in as early as 12 noon for a $12.00 early check-in fee.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, probably stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: jjp644
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany Suites from Feb 22 to Feb 27, 2009. Check in is quick if you can avoid off-peak check in/out times. If checking in/out during peak times it was not uncommon to see 6-10 people waiting in line. Rooms were very large. Kitchen in the room had a mini frig, sink, and stove. No silverware, pots, pans, or dishes. What is that all about? TV had like 10 channels, (no HBO) but I did not spend a lot of time watching TV anyways. The dining options at the hotel were very good. I had some very good meals at the Catina and the hotel diner. I used the fitness center and the hotel and was suprised that is was pretty well equiped and large. The location is OK. It was a couple of blocks walk to the strip. My bed was very comfortable. I did have issues with noise from the room above me, (kids jumping around for hours at a time). I did some additional checking on prices when I got back home. Prices on the strip hotels have really come down a lot lately. I found a stay at the New York or Paris hotels would have actually been cheaper. I would only stay here again if I was doing a budget trip and it was WAY cheaper then the strip hotels. If not, you are much better off being on the strip at the newer hotels. The walk to the strip is not a big deal but you end up walking so much while you are there it just makes sense to be on the strip. One other thing, they really nickel and dime you on the extras at this hotel. They charge $14 dollars a day for internet use. If you want to use their business center it was $.69 a minute to use their computer. They also charge for all local calls and wanted $25 extra for a late. checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Nasty smell.”
Reviews.Author: BillyJoeMaguffie
Reviews.Content: Room was fine for the very low price we got. About 10 min walk from the center strip in LV. The room stank of cheep disinfectant. If they could get the housekeeping staff to ease up on the chemicals this place would be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, huge rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bunnybutter
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. Stayed there with my parents the night before my wedding! Absolutely great value! I was just online looking to book my next stay as my husband and I are going back to vacation in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: utahMAX
Reviews.Content: When it is time to sleep, I want to be able to sleep. I don't smoke, and need a smoke free room. What I got as Tuscany was an enormous clean room that was quiet and smoke free. There must be at least 12-13 buildings (I stayed in building L - I think is was a smoke free building.) So, instead of a mega-resort hotel, it felt more like a campus with nice landscaping, smaller 2-story buildings and convenient free parking. It is located a couple of blocks from the Strip on Flamingo Drive, so you are just a brisk walk from the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace and the new City Center project.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany the Terrible”
Reviews.Author: bdl092265
Reviews.Content: short and sweet because Tuscany aready wasted enough of my time standing at the front desk trying to explain and re-explain my group reservations to these people. Even after giving my Itinerary to them that was perfectly laid out as i wanted it by expedia, they managed to fowl it up and cancel my room twice causing me to be locked out and twice return to the front desk for myself. I also had to straiten out things for others in our group. needless to say the front desk manager and I got well aquainted. Among other things I had mold and rot in the bathroom of room 112 bldg D (disgusting) Oh but they did offer to comp me for my five or six trips to the front desk over a three day period. how about a free meal...NO THANKS KEEP IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ctplucker
Reviews.Content: Wow. I HIGHLY recommend the Tuscany. I won't go on and on, because no one wants to read all that...however...I will just say that I'd DEFINATLY stay there again!! The room was HUGE! It was QUIET! The staff was ATTENTIVE! We enjoyed everything!! The ONLY thing I would change would be to have more TV stations. I know. We're weird. We should hav been out gambling or doing shows or something, but hubby and I were in bed about 11:00 every night and really wanted to watch some of our favorites to fall asleep by and the selection wasn't that great. Other than that...YES! Tuscany is a hut!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised by the Tuscany Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildlotus2482
Reviews.Content: We had two free nights at the Tuscany Suites, so we decided to go for our 1yr anniversary. My husband has been to Las Vegas numerous times and had never heard of the Tuscany. I read some reviews here and was a little worried because we normally stay at 4 star hotels or better. But since it was free, we were going to take advantage of it. I have to say that we were both pleasantly surprised! First of all, the staff was very nice. Every time we arrived at or left the hotel, there was always someone to open the door for us. The people at the front desk were very kind and welcoming. We arrived early, so we paid $11 for early check in. Even though the lobby smelled like smoke due to the nearby bar, it was very clean and not bad looking at all. Once we left the lobby and headed outside to our room, we were surprised at how quite the outside walkways were. In fact, it was serene. It reminded me of a tropical escape. The room was very large---the largest hotel room I’ve ever seen, and very clean. It was not as fancy as other hotel rooms, but the largeness of the room and the quietness made up for that. As many other people have mentioned, the little kitchen didn’t have silverware but that was no big deal. The bed and pillows were on the firm side, but comfortable enough for us to sleep well. The TV only has about 7 channels--- news, Steve Wilkos was on a lot, a channel that shows the Marilyn’s Cafe menu, but it didn’t matter because we didn’t sit in the room and watch TV all day. The bathroom was very spacious and there was plenty of room for me to set all my makeup and girly stuff on the sink. There was even a medicine cabinet behind the side wall mirror. There is a separate tub and shower. The tub is not a whirlpool or spa tub---just a regular bath tub, but we just used the shower. It had really good water pressure. When inside the shower, trying to get out, the handle was a little tough, so we just pushed on the glass door instead of using the handle. No big deal. The toilet had it’s own door so I was able to take a shower or use the sink when my husband was using the bathroom. It’s true that when you turn the bathroom lights on, the loud fan also comes on, but if you look at the light switch, there is also a timed light you can turn on. The light is a littler dimmer, but it has no fan. So just use that one. In the bathroom there was a good hair dryer I used every day and in the closet there was a good iron and ironing board. They also have a laundry service and a safe that you can put your own code into. The toilet paper and tissues were soft, and the towels smelled clean are were of adequate size. Each day we found clean towels nicely folded in the bathroom and the room was tidied up. I have to say how impressed I was at how quiet it was in the room and on the grounds at night and into the early morning.. After a loud and crazy day in Vegas, it was absolutely wonderful to get back to the hotel grounds where I immediately felt relaxed because it was sooooo quiet there! We ate at Marilyn’s café (open 24 hrs) for lunch two days in a row. It was about the equivalent of Denny’s or IHOP. You have to go through the casino to get to the café, but it is a small casino so a short walk. Even though the café smelled like smoke because of the casino, we sat in the very back and it smelled just fine. They had a huge selection of breakfast, lunch, dinner, desserts, etc. The prices were normal, the service was good, and the food came out in about 10 minutes. The portions were big and both days I couldn’t finish my meal. We ordered the philly cheese steak with hashed browns (you can pick your side---they have a lot to choose from), the grilled cheese with applesauce, the Marilyn’s Sampler which had big mozzarella sticks, chicken fingers, and cheese fries, and the beef French dip with fries. All of it was very tasty. The pool area was beautiful. There was a large outdoor heated pool and hot tub. There was a high of 60 degrees when we were there and people were still hanging out at the pool. There were lots of chairs, large trees, pool towels, music. It was really nice. In the hotel, next to the pool there was a little mini café with drinks and snacks. Near that was a little gift shop with all kinds of cute things and next to that there was a concierge service. They even had an area where they sell half priced show tickets. There was a fitness center and a nice Italian restaurant, but we didn’t try those. I read in some reviews that the walk from the hotel to the strip was long and scary, but I would have to disagree. When you check in, ask to stay near the front of the hotel, close to flamingo street. From the front of the hotel, you just walk 5 minutes down Flamingo directly to Bally’s. It was completely safe. We walked it several times, including at night. I took pictures along the walk so everyone can see it’s short and not scary. Along the walk, there were several nice high rise hotels, normal people walking, and lots of cars driving, so it’s not like anything bad would happen. Once you get to Bally’s you go into the sports book/shops entrance which are the first doors you see (again, only a 5 minute walk from the hotel) and once in there, you can either jump right on the monorail which will take you anywhere for $5 a person (they also have 1 day and 3 day tickets) or walk through the Bally’s shops and the casino and it will put you right on the strip, or instead of walking through the Bally’s casino, walk through Paris which is awesome (shops, restaurants, and the casino) and that will put you on the strip too. It’s all connected so it’s really simple. We mostly walked everywhere we were going except for the nights when we got dressed up for fancy dinners. On those nights, the bellman got us a taxi or nice car quickly. You have to pay for wireless internet in your room--$10 for 24hrs, but it’s free in the lobby and the pool café. One night when we got back to the Tuscany, there was a live band playing that was pretty good in the bar area and people were dancing and having a good time. On the day we checked out of the Tuscany, we were able to check our bags with the bellman because our flight out of Vegas wasn’t until several hours later. When we came back later to pick them up, the bellman retrieved out luggage from behind locked doors and put them into the taxi for us. The service at the Tuscany front door was very good. My husband and I were very pleased with the Tuscany suites. Because it was my first time to Vegas, I’d probably like stay at a few hotels on the strip to see what it’s like, but after that I’d probably return to the Tuscany because of how quiet, relaxing, clean, convenient it is and how large the rooms were.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: 1funsize
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany from Dec. 31 throught Jan. 4th and loved it. Everything was perfect from the great room that was wonderfully clean on arrival and throughout our stay to the very friendly staff. The location is close enough to the strip that you can walk any casino you want to visit. We would recommend the Tuscany to anyone who wants to go to Vegas! We will stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for disabled travelers”
Reviews.Author: daisies17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the restaurants are great - good food and wonderful service. The rooms are fantastic, but if you are a disabled traveler, these are a few things you should know. I called the hotel several times to make sure our room was accessible for my son. They assured me we would have an accessible room, with roll in shower and bath chairs are provided. Upon our arrival, the room I reserved was not available. All rooms are accessible as being large with grab bars. However, the grab bars and hand held shower were in th tub, which my son cannot use. They have roll in showers, but there are no grab bars in them and no hand held showers. Also, when I asked for the bath chair they said they had, I was told that they only have one and would see if it was available. They did find one, but it is not very stable so I would suggest bringing your own or renting one. Also, you have to go outside to get to your rooms and some are quite far away from the casino. So overall, if you are a disabled traveler, I would be very specific about your accomodations before booking a room. In the end, they did accomodate us with a wonderful two bedroom suite with a roll in shower. However, as I stated before, there were no grab bars or hand held shower in it, so we still had to punt. Even though we had a few problems, I would still highly recommend this hotel, but be very specific about your needs.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: maboscel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany for 4 weeks in the same room, I301. It was great! We loved the room. You can see the from the pictures the layout. I'm going to comment on things I read in these reviews from my perspective. Our comments: The pillows, bed was super comfortable (we got a king) - but the sheets are not fitted. While this did not prove a problem to me, as I don't move around much while sleeping, my husband didn't like the sheets pulling out from the foot of the bed. The towels were nice and plush - not the cheapo white stiff variety, but plush. We got plenty of them. The bathroom had 3 lights - only one is connected to the fan - so, come on people, use the other two lights if you don't want the fan on! There is a very bright light over the sink area (which had a medicine cabinet for storage) and also a heat lamp-type light between the tub and shower area. The one thing I didn't like about the shower area is that is had no shelf space for shampoo/conditioner, etc. It only had a soap dish, but no place to store your razor etc. And the bottom was angled toward the drain in the center, so no flat area either. The shampoo was great; the conditioner was not something I could use on my long hair (I've learned to bring my own from home). The toilet paper was 2-ply quilted - so not the cheapee stuff some people complained about. Yes, the TV had 14 channels and three were casino oriented - but it also had CNN, the 4 major networks, TNT movie channel, a Spanish channel, PBS, ESPN, and two others. Not bad. The kitchen was great. We got a microwave first thing (just ask for one when you check in and it'll be delivered right away), coffeemaker, decent sized frig and two burners. Plenty of cabinet space. But, of course, you have to bring your own dishes, utensils, etc. Noone in these reviews commented on the fitness center much - I can see why because its rarely used. We used it 20 of 28 days on our trip and rarely saw anyone else in there. It also was great. It's its own separate building and has two areas - the cardio and weights. The cardio area had two treadmills, two or three bikes and one stairstepper. The TV and one stairstepper machine were broken. In the other area, there were three leg machines (curl, press and extension) and 5 other upper body machines plus an ab cruncher machine. In addition, there were two benches and free weights (no bars). Dumbbells started at 5' and went to 50'. Alas, the common weights, the 15', 20' and one 40' were missing. It provided us with great workouts. I took some photos and plan to download them to here, so look for those soon. There is a lap pool and a regular pool. plus two jacuzzis. Too cool to swim in Nov/dec, but we had 72-77 degree weather, so hung out and read there. Oh, they provide a complimentary USA Today newspaper at the front desk. Just get there before 9:30am, otherwise the supply is gone. Restaurants were okay. We mainly ate at Marilyns - they have a $3.99 steak and eggs b'fast from 12-5am - and it was massive, but the steaks were marginal. Other food was okay. Nothing great. Ate at the Mex restaurant twice - had these fish tacos which were fabulous. Also a steak burrito that was just okay. Never ate at the Italian restaurant. Looked rather pricey to me. The walk - yes, its about a 10 min walk to the Strip. We did it numerous times. One block off the Strip up and down it, you find trash, the low-life, beggars, racks of girlie magazines, etc. So, this area is no exception. So, if you don't mind the hike (bring good shoes) - you get to the real heart of the Strip in 10 min. I just wouldn't do it alone. We had a car - and this was both a plus and minus. You got wheels so can travel, but oftentimes the traffic is so thick and drivers are so crazy, that you could almost walk faster and prefer not to go anywhere because the driving is so hazardous. Vegas is laid out well, but each light takes so long to get thru because you have to wait for each set of turn lanes to go. Anyways, after midnight the roads are good. and better between 9am and 3pm. If you are into dancing and are of the 40+ crowd or would rather not stand around in a 20+ crowd listening to ear-deafening rap and hiphop or have to buy $400 bottle-service VIP areas, write me and I'll give you some good locations to go. Overall, we'd definately stay there again. We loved not having to eat out all the time, having our car right outside our door, and having a short walk to our room. Also, you never had to set foot in a smokey casino if you didn't want to. The lobby is outside the casino area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Sp0rty
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Tuscany for 11 nights. We were very comfortable for such a long visit as the rooms is very large and extremely clean. The furniture is dated and the walls and carpets are very dark, but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom is very large with separate tub and shower in one area and a private area with toilet. There were tons of towels and shampoo and soap. The hotel needs to be remodeled, but the price would not have been as reasonable. We paid $422 total for 11 nights! The casino is pretty bad -- smoky, not many machines. Marilyn's Cafe has consistently good food. We ate there about four times, and each time the food was well made. The driveways and parking lots are well lit - and the pool was open in November. Most of the pools in other hotels were closed for the season. I used the weight room and it was okay. The staff was very friendly, and I don't think you can beat the location. I have been to Las Vegas about 15 times in the last six years, and I don't remember ever being in such a convenient location -- if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews said”
Reviews.Author: sonya
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go to Vegas for his birthday. We stayed at the Tuscany Suites from June 6th - June 9th. We rented a car at the airport. It was a last minute decision and instead of paying the full rate, I had someone at home reserve a car for us through hotwire, saving us about 65%. Anyhow, the car ended up being a great idea as the hotel is about 3 loooooooong blocks from the strip. When we wanted to go to the strip we would park in the Hurrahs parking lot, its free. We picked up our rental and after a brief look at the strip, we went to the hotel. We were an hour early, but our room was ready. As far as the hotel in general, it was clean and spacious, yes the funiture needs to be updated and the tv could use more channels but overall, I enjoyed the space. We ate at the hotel everyday, mostly for breakfast, but we did do mexican for lunch one day and the pizza place for a late night snack. The food was really good, make sure you take advantage of the coupons that you are given at check-in. We didn't use the pool so I can comment. The hotel was quiet at night and even though parking is scarce at night, I didn't feel unsafe at any time. We did enjoy the casino, the day before we left the dealers gave my boyfriend a full lesson step by step on how to play at the craps table. He enjoyed the lesson and now feels comfortable playing. Check-out was easy, yes we had to pay some kind of nominal fee but our room was a comp from Wyndham so I couldn't complain. When I go back I will probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Good as Expected”
Reviews.Author: yakijy
Reviews.Content: Not good. No ambience whatsoever, much less Italian. Like a mediocre casino placed amid a sprawling apartment complex. Room reminded me of a studio apartment I rented in the 1970's. The heater produced a foul odor when I turmed it on. Cheap furniture, 3rd floor overlooked parking lot and some forgotten construction project. Bathroom large, but cheap decor, single sink, shower head kept moving - possible scald issue, toilet roll holder kept falling out. Initially i was given a room that was not clean, had to lug all suitcases to another room, with the dark brown 'mystery' carpet, and bad odor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and large room”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirl_mv
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with this hotel! We got a very good deal during October. The room was big and comfortable. The pool area was very nice and not too crowded. We ate breakfast in the casino twice, and it was pretty good. The location is good, though it is a bit farther to the Strip than we expected. It looks so close since the hotels over there are so giant! We walked to the strip a few times and took taxis most of the time. It is about 3 blocks from Bally's, but one of the blocks is very long. The nice thing is we never got stuck in traffic like you do on the strip. The taxis can take the back roads to get to almost any casino. Also, you don't have to walk 10 minutes through the casino to get to your room like at the big casino hotels. We wouuld definitely stay again if we could get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: forbedo1
Reviews.Content: A great value for the money, rooms were clean and large. If you are looking for a quiet casino to learn at , this is your place. The walk from the strip to your room at 2pm is a little spooky but was safe , the area needs more lighting on the roadway, but over all we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: olive697
Reviews.Content: I am a resident of Las Vegas and recently had my wedding at the Tuscany Chapel and reception dinner at Tuscany Gardens. Everything, EVERYTHING, was gorgeous and wonderful! The staff at the chapel really know how to coordinate a beautiful wedding - totally worry free. Not the cheesy "Vegas style" you hear about, but a beautiful, classy wedding. As for the restaurant - Tuscany Gardens - my guests - all of whom were from out of state - are still RAVING a month later about the food, service and atmosphere. The manager of the restaurant was so very accommodating, patient and just first class in everything. Also, most of my guests stayed at the Tuscany Hotel and everyone gave it a great approval rating. The rooms are spacious (like little apartments) and since it's a bit off the beaten path, you feel like you are at a resort and can get away from the 24 hour noise of the strip. If you are thinking of getting married in Las Vegas, I highly suggest you take a look at the Tuscany. First Class all the way. Signed: Happy Bride =)

Reviews.Title: “hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: maddogff
Reviews.Content: Where as most basic hotels these days will provide free internet in the rooms, the Tucany will charge you 13.95 for 24 hrs of time. This is absurd if you just wanted to say, check on a flight or such. I also used the biz center to print boarding passes, There is a per minute charge for this after finding one computor that would not work while the clock was running ,it cost me 7 bucks to print a couple of passes. When checking out the next morning I found out that they charge 20 per night extra for 3 people in the room. When I asked for a supervisor they said that none where on duty, they finally called a Pit boss who was not aware how the hotel was run. He said sorry to bad,The internet and biz center are run by and outside company so if somthing goes wrong Tucany is no help. I would not recommend the Tucany

Reviews.Title: “once again another great stay”
Reviews.Author: MOVEDAWAY
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in the Tuscany and once again we were not dissapointed. The room was great, serviced every day with loads of clean towels and plenty tolietries. Staff very friendly and helpful. Booked via Expedia and got a great rate, it may be a 5-10 min walk to the strip but with the amount of money you save on the rooms you can take the odd taxi now and again!! Food in Marylyns was good, steak and eggs for $4.00 and it was lovely Was also lucky in the casino and the cocktail girls were great, sometimes too good if you know what i mean..........too much Johnnie Walker one night. My friends stayed there the week before and couldn't believe how good the accom was. Great pool area also. Wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: vancwa78
Reviews.Content: Stayed there while in Vegas last week. Reasonable price and close enough to the strip. We actually had a great time there. We stayed at Ballys last year, and Ballys bed was more comfy, had room service, etc...but we also paid a whole lot more for Ballys. Our room at Tuscany was good size, the AC worked almost too well, I liked the tub and seperate shower. We ate at Marilyns Cafe and the Mexican cantina, and loved them both. We had great service, the prices are reasonable and the food was better than the cafe at Bally's!! We ate at Marilyn 3 times and at the mexican cafe twice. We really liked the slot selections, didn't win a whole lot but didn't lose it quickly either. The only drawbacks that we found were the very loud bathroom fan that has to be on when you're in the bathroom. (The toilet is in a seperate room off of where the tub and shower are, and the fan is in the toilet room). And we only got 4 or 5 channels on TV, but that wasn't too bad since we only watched before going to sleep. I'd stay here again, and would prefer it more than any of the huge hotels on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Tuscanny suites was great”
Reviews.Author: jeannie53
Reviews.Content: We really loved Tuscanny Suites and would definatley book again. The rooms were large clean and comfortable. AC was good and kept the room cool, as the temperature was over 110 degree's some days. We were in block B wich was just near the front rd, handy to get to as it was right near reception and all the other facilitys. Tuscanny gardens restaurant was fantastic and i would really recommend it, we went a couple of times, their steak and Lobster tail was fantastic, also i had the lamb chop's another night they were lovely. The restaurant is beautifully decorated ,very elegant and the staff were really nice. For a top class restaurant the prices were quite reasonable Marilyns cafe was great to, we had breakfast there nearly every morning, we thought it was really good value for money plenty to choose from, and the portions were quite big, there pancakes and maple syrup were yummy all the staff were lovely. There is a take away place there which sells nice sandwiches we had a beef sandwich one day with salad, and the pizza's were good to. If you join the players club in the casino and get some points on your card, you can get free meals, or money of, at any of there restaurants, take away or even use it to to pay for a late check out, so make enquirys about joining, they will give you instructions when you join,and give you more info ( you can join a players club in every casino) so it's worth while joining it's free and some casino's you get free T shirt, key ring, or a free Buffy meal Theres a 7/11 just round the corner you can stock your fridge with water ,wine, beer etc, it's quite cheap there as well, just go out main reception turn left then left at main entrance ,walk to the petrol station cross the forecourt and it's just at the back of the garage, not far to walk at all. Theres a bus stop outside tuscanny suites and one of the waitresses in Marilyn's told us you can get an all day pass if you get on there for $2.5 instead of $5.00 on the strip, handy to know, but we didn't take advantage of it because we got told on our last day there and for the nine days we were there we took taxis, but hey we will next time,hopefully there will be a next time, as we enjoyed it so much. Myself and my long term partner got married while we were there, we didn't use tuscanny chapel all though it did look beautiful, we used little chapel of the flowers it was brilliant, We had the most fantastic holiday ,also there was some of my family with us, they all loved Tuscanny suites and we all loved Las vegas

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: melfarinha
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! It was my first time in Vegas, and this hotel was perfect for my family. The building is very pretty! The only part my family didn't like was the fact that we had to take a taxi everywhere. It's a little more than a mile from the strip.. and with the Vegas weather.. that would be a long walk! On my first day I was invited to Rehab at Hard Rock. My luggage was with the bell hop while we waited for our room.. the staff was great.. I was able to dig through my luggage for a bikini while they got me a taxi to Hard Rock. I had a towncar within a couple of minutes. We were ALWAYS able to get a taxi within 5 minutes to take us wherever. The rooms were HUGE and the maids were there to clean everyday. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: twinsljo
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Tuscany Suites and Casino last week and really enjoyed my stay. This place may have once been an apartment complex or a timeshare. There were many buildings with walkways (3 stories high with elevators). The room was incredibly enormous and clean and the king bed was extremely comfortable. Our safe and hairdryer were both broken, but maintenance came immediately and replaced both of them. The A/C worked just fine. The bathroom was HUGE and also very clean. There was a large room with a vanity/sink area, separate shower stall and separate bathtub..then another door where the toilet was. Our room was at the end of the hallway.. right near the doorway of the building and also the elevator, but it was still very quiet there even though the hotel was full. We had a fridge and a microwave, which came in handy when we brought home some leftovers from our meals. We were in Building O which was a very short walk to the main pool and casino and main building. What we liked best was the size of the room, comfortable bed, cleanliness and the fact that it was nice and quiet (away from all the hustle and bustle of the strip). It is located right behind Bally's about two blocks down (may be a little bit of a walk for some to get to the strip, but it could be done easily for others). We needed handicap parking, but sometimes those spots were taken some times, and we had to park a little further away from our building, but still not very far. Having a car rental was great because we could go anywhere..and used many of the side streets and back roads to get to the main hotels on the strip..many of which do have a back entrance. We didn't eat there, but we did like Terribles..one block down, which had great deals on their buffets ($4.99 breakfast..$9.99 or 12.99 for dinner). There's also tons of other places to eat on this street (Flamingo Road) and in walking distance to the hotel. Pool area was lovely and also very quiet and met up with some nice poeple. There were plenty of towels and lounge chairs..and also plenty of palm trees with shade if the sun was too much (temps were 103 degrees). Also, we booked via their website and received great deal for under $50/night plus tax. We couldn't figure out what all the negativity on this place was about.. Lovely hotel and grounds...we had no complaints at all and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSiciliana
Reviews.Content: The room was huge, clean and comfy. Had all the amenities. Great location near the Strip, but in a quiet spot. The only thing missing for us was a kiddie pool. The pool was too deep for my 3 year old to play in. But we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: familyoutdoors
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to Las Vegas, staying Sunday thru Thursday at the Tuscany Suites. We booked through tripres.com. Not sure I'd use them again. Would probably go right through hotel. The hotel puts a $60- deposit on each room on your credit card for incidentals, etc. We did get it all back later. This hotel is located on Flamingo Rd about 1- 1/2 blocks from the strip. Tuscany is an all Suites hotel. But when you book, make sure and tell them exactly what you want. If you want a king size bed, or two doubles. Also specify if you need a microwave/cook top or not. I believe each room comes with a coffee maker and small refrigerator though. We had two double suites. I wanted a kind and a double, but apparently they are not located near one another, so I settled for doubles. I was told by (tripres) that 6 people could fit into suite. This is only correct if you get a king suite with a pull out couch and order for an additional fee a roll away. Roll-aways are not allowed in rooms that have 2 beds per NV law (?) Check in/out was rather quick as the desk has several agents working. Your room key gets you into the buildings and the pool area. Towels are provided. The rooms were both clean and contained 2 double beds, small breakfast table, refrigerator, sink, coffee maker. The toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom. The bathroom has stand up shower. Soaking tub. (nothing fancy, just a normal tub by itself. ) Nice size sink and vanity combo. Suite is somewhere around 500 sq feet. We were in bldg D the closest to strip. Parking was a breeze and not far to walk from your vehicle unlike many Las Vegas hotels. The pool was any easy walk and by the way was open until 10pm. I have been told that most LV hotel pools are only open until 7pm. You can only enter from Flamingo Rd, so do not try and get in from the street behind as you will be able to squeeze in between fence if you are walking. There is a nice little casino here as well as 3 restaurants. We signed up for the players club. We spent very little honestly, but were able to get most of it back in either restaurant or gift shop comps! The kids ate pizza from the pizza restaurant. They weren't impressed, but I think it was more of a thin Italian style pizza than what they were used to. Check out is btwn 11am-12 unless prior arrangements are made. We ended up getting stuck at a time share presentation, but had left our teen age kids the credit card and all keys. Sadly, they had to wait over 2 hrs in the lobby, but were able to check out with no problems. This hotel is the perfect location for checking out all sorts of locations around the town. Caesars and the Flamingo are within 10 minutes. There is both a AM /PM and 7/11 right around the block. Another sleeper of a casino just a little further up Flamingo is Terrible 's Casino. Sign up for their players card. It's a good deal! Had both the breakfast and dinner buffets there. Not bad at all. General tips about travel here. Bring bottled water. The hottest it got was 121 deg. It was 90deg at 0700. Stopped at a shop in Cesar's for bottled water (2 water +1 Gatorade= $14.50) NO I did not pay such a price. Went to McDonald's and got one there. You can also buy from the locals for $1 bottle. Fremont area gift shops you can get for up to 3 for a buck! Don't try and see everything in one day/night. Space it out. Most of the strip hotels you can park in the valet parking and just tip a couple/few dollars. So much easier than 'self parking'! Wish we would have tried this sooner in the trip! Time shares: We did two. first one got 6 tickets to the Secret Garden and $20 match play at Tropicana. Not bad. Second place got $200. Was quite a bit longer than the first and more of a hard sell. Everywhere you see free info on tours, discounted tours, etc, read timeshare! This is fine if you have the time and either could possibly be interested in timeshares or just want the gifts. Haggle with them for better stuff. And when they say it's just a few blocks away, just laugh. They will all be way down past the airport, "which will some day be the center of the strip"! Ate at several buffets, but might be worth reviewing separately!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel outside the strip!”
Reviews.Author: appelmamma
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in July at Tuscany. Loved the hotel ! Yes its a few blocks away from the strip but this hotel is very friendly (loved the friendly atmosphere...) The rooms where BIG ,clean and nice. Pools are OK (free towels) I tryed out the lap pool for the morningswim- it was nice with cool water and yacuzzi afterwards. Tryed the Mexican Cantina one night- didnt like it, Marilyns was great! friendly,nice simple food at the right price. (the salad was great!!) If you want to eat little better try out italian "Tuscany Gardens" they had very nice food!! the price level at this hotel is much lower then at the strip (stayed on the strip after this stay) we payed 6 dollars for 2 GT at Tuscany !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: UScardinal
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel from Check-in to Check-out. We booked 2 rooms and arrived late at night. The hotel clerk made sure we received adjoining rooms. We reserved a King Suite and a Double Suite. The rooms were clean; comfortable, and very large. The only things I didn't like was, there was no microwave oven, and the sliding closet door kept falling off its track, in both rooms. The bathroom was average, but it came with a bathtub, and the water pressure was good, which is really important to me. The pool was very nice, with lots of towels available. We only ate at Marilyn's Cafe, which had good food at a good price, so I can't speak for the other dining establishments at the hotel. We were very pleased with our choice of Tuscany Suites. Please review the pictures I took, and I hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: dperky77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscany for 9 days. We were attending a convention there. The Tuscany has many different buildings, We had arrived a few days before the convention started so that we could get a good room/building. We were in building C, I had asked for the closest to the pool without paying the extra premium 40 dollars a nite for a patio. Room was a handicapped room, which was fine. Large with sitting area and small dining room table. It had a small dorm fridge and coffee maker. I had heard that they had stovetops and/or microwaves. We had neither but when I asked at the desk for a microwave, I had one when we got back from dinner. Be advised, that this is not a condo.,,I t does NOT have plates, silverware, pots or ANY type of cooking utensils. We did a quick trip to superWalmart down on Boulder Highway. I bought a toaster for $6, and a blender for $13 along with paper plates,plastic silverware and food. We saved a tremendous amount of money by having breakfast and some lunches by the pool. Housekeeping was spotty, We always had our beds made and towels. But weekday housekeeping staff cleaned up more than the weekend staff. No matter, it was clean. We had a first floor room, I had read that the ceiling/floors were not soundproof. Yes, we heard the people above us, but we werent in the room long enough for it to be an issue. Limited TV stations, maybe 10-13 or so,,,but had all the basic channels, but no premium ones, not a problem for us, We were out every night anyhow. The doors were a bit weird. The handles worked better pulling them up instead of pushing down. Had to wiggle the cards a few times to get it to unlock, and they demagnetized very easy. Had to have ours replaced once, others had theirs replaced a dozen times. Slots were tight, didnt see many people winning but with the slow economic times, I figured they wouldnt be loose anyway. They could have had more chairs around the pool. Our group had 800+ people, maybe only less than 100 chairs. The mexican restaurant was great, Large portions,Good food! Marilyns Cafe,,,not good. We went in once , waiting almost a half hour and we didnt even get a wait staff to even acknowledge we were there, so we left. Another time we went there with friends, I got the meatloaf, It was inediblle. Others liked the wings and pancakes, we didnt give them another chance. We had a car so we could leave hotel for dinner. All in all, intimate setting for a large group. Places to sit in the lobby as a meet up location. Large stuffed chairs. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Tuscany!”
Reviews.Author: kathincali
Reviews.Content: We loved the Tuscany.The rooms are large and the staff was great.I need an Accessible room and found it to be one of the largest I have stayed at.For the convention that we attend- it was the perfect size.We practically took over the hotel .Lots of sofas and room to hang out and visit.The Restaurants were all good.Marilyn's is open 24 hours- which is great for our group(with lots of late nighters)Had the best Chicken Fettucini Alfredo that I have ever had at the Tuscany Gardens.The Cantina Had great Tacos and Beachfront Pizza was super yummy too. The only thing I can complain about is that I wish they had a bigger menu for their room service Breakfast- that was very limited.But otherwise the Tuscany gets an 'A' in my book! Katherine in Cali

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel GREAT Coffee shop”
Reviews.Author: bigblkdisme
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for the first few days of the BBW bash and for a friends wedding. The room was nice and spacious, the pool area nice, but the most pleasant surprise was "Marilyn's" the coffee shop, excellent food and service and very fair pricing. I lost in the Casino, but if they held the Bash there next year, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarlingtonPhill
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days here in july arrived early hours of the morning and checked in ok , i had previously asked for a pool view but was disappointed to have view of main road , once i had complained i was given a upgraded room that was much better, the rooms are on the large side and was kept clean , the pool area is peaceful and well maintained, the strip is a short 10 min walk down a main road , i would definately stop here again as it gets you away from the hussle and bussle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy...all the Way Around!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling23
Reviews.Content: If you go in with low expectations...you'll be fine. To be honest, this property should be in downtown Las Vegas. There is nothing glamorous about this hotel / casino. The A/C unit in the room did not cool at all and room reeked of a fishy odor. The cashier in the coffee shop didn't even know how to charge my breakfast to my room and the bar wouldn't even serve coffee drinks. However, the fact that Lawry's is directly across the street is a plus. If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the strip, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: FWA2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany Suites and Casino for a conference and was quite satisfied. I was in building E which was a little walk to the main building but manageable, even with a heavy suitcase. The room was large, the A/C unit was loud, and frig was VERY cold. The bathroom was clean and roomy with good shower water pressure. The conference rooms were nice with classroom seating, water in the back, and moderate room temperatures. The women's bathroom was usually crowded, mainly due to an odd arrangement of sinks and towel dispensers. We had continental breakfast (bagels, muffins, and breads) and lunch both days (one day cold sandwiches and salads, and the next day pasta and salads). Everything was tasty and temperature appropriate. Service was efficient and pleasant. The walk to the strip wasn't bad but on my shuttle ride back to the airport I saw several good looking restaurants in the opposite direction (away from the strip). These were within walking distance too and might be a nice alternative. Overall I had a good experience and even won $50 in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: slappinpauly
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is not Paris, Mandalay Bay, or the Mirage. My wife, daughter and myself went on family business and found this place to be charming and worth every dime of the inexpensive rate we recieved. The pool was the best part, shaded on a part of the pool at all times throughout the hot day. The rooms were very large, and here's a tip: If you have a toddler it is very easy to baby-proof the room! Some sockets were already out of reach, and the others could easily be hidden with the furniture! The meals at the cafe were excellent, and previous reviewers say expensive, but I dont think so (and I am cheap!). Some long walks to the room, but the air conditioners worked great for us, and the room was a constant 68 degrees. Everyone was nice and friendly. If you are going to Vegas and want a cheaper way to go you will not be dissapointed! Want the glitz and glamour? Go to the Mandalay bay and pay 5X as much. ONE BAD PART: The casino and the dealers/bar tenders are jerks! Worst casino I have been at. Want to play a little? Go down the street 3 blocks and play at Ballys!

Reviews.Title: “Has been better”
Reviews.Author: HLacey
Reviews.Content: having previously stayed at the tuscany I knew what to expect. It is a good off strip location, relatively quiet at night with little disturbance from traffic or passing noise. It is set in relaxing supposedly tuscan vegetation. This trip I was pleased to see both pools cleaned every day as on previous trips both the pools and hot tubs had been grubby. However, the music by the pool was very monotonous. Every day the same CD comprising the beach boys, Kentucky woman and other such classics was churned out hour after hour. Security was slack which for an off strip venue which allows public access to the room blocks was unacceptable. On arrival our block N front door was unsecured. The door handle wasnt working and was jammed in the down position disengaging the locking mechanism. I reported this to security who assured me a mechanic would look at the lock. This same complaint was made at least 3 times during my stay and nothing was done. In addition my room door was almost impossible to open and lock and I returned to my room once to find the maid has not closed the door properly. the hotel didnt see this as a problem! The fixtures in the room, taps in the bath and kitchen were loose and the TV wouldnt turn off. Again these were reported to the hotel who did nothing about these problems. I have reported these problems to the casino and have yet to receive even an acknowledgement of their failings. I doubt if I could be persuaded to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NOW I know better.”
Reviews.Author: TipSnip
Reviews.Content: Most of the negative reviews turned out to be accurate. The people behind the counter in the one restaurant by the pool would fight over who was to do what and our waitress in another restaurant was rude. We would note a towel laying on the floor by the elevator doors over a couple of days, nobody would pick it up... and inside the elevator, someone inscribed the words "DIE" ( building C ) - Nice way to feel welcomed. The Refrigerator in room went into de-frost mode. ( yes, it's not a frost-free ) The result, I opened the fridge door and water came pouring out over my milk container. Oh, As far as walking to the strip. In the history of walking, yes it not that far.. about 20min - BUT... Would you want to in 100 degree heat? To waste time & dehydrate before getting to a real attraction?

Reviews.Title: “Next Time, Someplace Else”
Reviews.Author: CactusLizCowboyKeith
Reviews.Content: Checked out yesterday. I noticed the mixed reviews ahead of time, and in general I agree with the accuracy of remarks, both good and bad. I accompanied my husband to a 3 day convention here. The hotel would not allow coffee urns in the meeting rooms; they wanted people to leave (therefore missing part of) their workshops to go elsewhere to buy coffees. Tuscan Gardens restaurant is okay, and pricey: no modest sized side salads included; we had to pay about 7 bucks a la carte for an unnecessarily generous salad to accompany our platters. We stayed in Building L. Upon arriving we got maintenance to come immediately to replace the smoke detector battery, which was chirping. He also did something right away about the stall shower door, which kept popping ajar. Near the end of our 5 night stay, it was popping open again. We did not rest well. We could hear people "stomping" around on the 3rd floor above us early in the morning and also late at night. The bed was soft and saggy, made up with thin bed sheets. After awhile I got used to the sound of the jet planes taking off from the airport, but if I woke up too early, between the saggy bed, foot-stomping coming from above, and the jets taking off every few minutes, I couldn't fall back to sleep. Our a/c unit was quiet enough, but when walking outside we noticed another unit whining away in an irritating fashion. Both our bath fans whined at a very high pitch that made us feel frazzled - the one in the water closet and the other in the main bathroom. The coarseness of our first roll of no-frills, unbleached toilet paper in our room had us making jokes about planing logs; all the public rest rooms on The Strip used a better quality. Fortunately our 2nd roll of white paper was a little bit better. If you are reasonably physically fit, dress cool, and can take some heat for a short walk, it's not far to the rear of air-conditioned Bally's Hotel and Casino, where you can hop on the air-conditioned Monorail. That has 7 stations, from the MGM Grand at the south end, to the Sahara Hotel and Casino, up north by the Stratosphere. The Monorail isn't cheap but it saves you a huge amount of time getting around. And you'll have more energy to enjoy your day or evening longer.

Reviews.Title: “For an off-strip hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: CuriousExploreTravel
Reviews.Content: On a midweek stay in the summer, the big-name hotels on the strip offer prices comparable to the Tuscany. I'd rather stay in one of those. But for much of the year, and on weekends, Tuscany would be a great value. ASSETS: Rooms are huge. In addition to size of room, mine had both a bath and shower, and toilet behind a separate door. Clean, with good housekeeping staff. Good refrigerator, with ice machine down the hall that worked. You can park near your building, which is impossible on the Strip, and nice if you're traveling with lots of gear. Nice pool area without crowds. A very friendly and helpful staff. Very nice landscaped grounds. 24 hour restaurant in the casino with tasty but not fancy food. Unexpectedly, a gorgeous wedding chapel. WEAKNESSES: Two stove burners, but NO MICROWAVE, and not so much as a spoon. Very limited room service menu. Limited cable had only CNN, WGN, TBS, and local stations. Wi-Fi is available only by paying an extra daily charge. These may be minor considerations to some travelers, but may be significant to others who might deliberately choose a suite hotel. LOCATION: This was very important to me. It's about a ten minute walk to the Strip and to the Monorail. And at the Strip, you're at the convergence of Bally's, Paris, Bellagio, Caesar's, and the Flamingo. A great location. You can do a lot within walking distance. Flamingo Road has a sidewalk, and pedestrian crossings, but it is basically a concrete canyon with a six-lane highway and car exhaust running through it. You may encounter a panhandler or a drunk or prostitute on your walk over to the Strip. For a big city person, this is nothing, but it may frighten someone from a more sheltered background. You can always take a cab. Not far from the airport, either. My cab to the hotel from the airport was $13.50 plus tip. My shuttle back to the airport was $5.00 plus tip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: USCtraveler9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a conference for 3 nights. The rooms are VERY large, and could easily fit a huge group of people (for a college group). Although there's a small fridge and stove, there are no pans/pots/plates in the room, and no microwave which is a definite downside. Limited tv channels and old tv, but it works fine. There's a nice lounge area/ couch on one side of the room, and a dining set near the kitchen. The rooms are divided into different buildings (A,B,C, etc), so your room key allows entry into your building, and then into your room. However, a big concern about safety was that it apparently is easy to get into the building without a key, since during the time we were there multiple restaurants managed to sneak in and leave their menus under the door to our room. Called hotel security about this, but apparently it happens all the time so be wary. About a 10-15 minute walk to the strip. The location is fine, near the Westin and Bally's, and around the corner there's a 7-11. If you plan on gambling at the hotel, join the Player's Club, since you'll get about $5 free slot play to pass the time. There are A LOT of penny slot machines, and it seemed a pretty popular place for the older crowds. Decent selection of places to eat, including Mexican food at The Cantina. The hotel had a buy-one-get-one-free coupon, which made the cost of dinner for two fajitas about $12. There's also a Lawry's directly across the street, and more restaurants eastt of the strip on Flamingo (Roy's, Morton's), which is great if you want to eat elsewhere and avoid the strip traffic. Overall, a decent experience (especially for the price), and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Suite Review”
Reviews.Author: greg_blick
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights for my daughters wedding. The wedding chapel was wonderful. Everything else leaves something to be desired. The staff isn't very friendly or helpful. No one takes accountability for anything. Security staff could use a Dale Carneighe course. Room service missed our room 2 of the 5 nights. We heard numerous other guests expressing their displeasure with the Tuscany suites, anything from billing issues to poor TV service to lack of tack from the security staff. I would recommend staying elsewhere. If you want to stay off strip and price is an issue, the Gold Coast would be a MUCH better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jennann429
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscany for my company's annual sales meeting, and if I had a choice I would not stay here again. While the pricing appears to be reasonable, and my first impression wasn't so bad, that didn't last very long. The lobby area smelled of mildew and water damage, the food in the restaurant (Tuscan Gardens) was below average(two members of my group had to return their overcooked steaks), the a/c unit in my suite was miniscule and did nothing to cool the room, the layout of the property was confusing and too spread out, and the distance to the strip was a little too far to walk and through a questionable neighborhood. The conference rooms were laid out nicely (we used one large room and 4 adjacent small ones), however they seemed to be on the same air vent system as the casino, and the smoky air was drawn into the conference rooms all day. The bright side through all of this were the people... the front desk clerks were friendly and helpful, the doormen outside were quick to assist, the catering staff were great and the gentleman who helped us set up our meeting was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to the larger hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: amz1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Tuscany Hotel recently and had no complaints. The room was clean and unbelievably big. The pool area is nice with an amazingly warm jacuzzi. It's only a 7 minute walk to the centre of the strip and in my opinion is better located than hotels like Mandalay Bay and the Egyptian as its close to the Bellagio and Caesars Palace. The hotel will give you a booklet of vouchers which are worth using in the hotels Restaurants. We ate out in Marilyns Cafe, The Mexican and the Tuscany Restaurant. All 3 are very nice and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to drive around the city, but want to be close the strip...”
Reviews.Author: Quaker74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed to stay in Vegas for 6 nights the week of our wedding. Because we'd be driving around town picking up things for the wedding and sometimes ferrying people around, the Tuscany was a good choice. The rooms were large, so perfect for a stay of 6 nights. The parking is very convenient to the rooms too, so it was easy to get in and out. The downside is that it's not a trivial distance from the Strip, but there's nothing to be done about that. Their on-site restaurants and casino are rather nice though, so that made up for it a little bit

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mikko77
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The rooms are giantic! The hotel is located just 1.5 blocks from the main strip near Paris, Bellagio, Cesar's Palace, and the Wynn. The room was clean with lots of space. I felt like I was staying in an apartment complex instead of a hotel which I really enjoyed plus the parking lot was much closer than those large garage complexes the hotel has. I will return to this hotel next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a group”
Reviews.Author: EGF
Reviews.Content: 6 of us booked to stay for 6 nights. Having read the reviews our main concern was that it would be a long way from the Strip. However, at a reasonably brisk pace Ballys, which is mid way on the strip was a 10-15 minute walk. From here, the main resorts were mostly within a 15 minute walk. Ideal if you want a walk home after the huge American portions of food. Rooms are a little dark and the air conditioner slightly noisy but other than that they were great. Two huge double beds and a large sofa bed which we requested. Small kitchen area with a hob and fridge. Cafe in casino area served big cheap breakfasts and the restaurant looked nice although we did not use it. Bar very reasonably priced, about $2-3 dollars for a beer. Although not that big, the pool area was nicely set out with towels available. The gym area was huge but could do with some more machines for busy times. Overall we were happy with the Tuscany resort. Probably wouldn't recommend for couples looking for romance. Mandalay seemed to be the nicest in that respect but a suitable place for a group stay.

Reviews.Title: “like a sunny resort inside big city lights”
Reviews.Author: MrsLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Tuscany Suites and Casino in Las Vegas This hotel is just like staying at a resort in the Caribbean. you would never know you were a 10 minute walk from the strip, just down the Street and in between the Flamingo and the Hard Rock Hotel. it was absolutely beautiful. the rooms are huge, and the biulding are no more than 3 stories, which means that you can be in and out of your room in seconds. the pool area is beautiful, the casino is actually clean and not run down like at Caesar's Palace . It has new machines and tables and 2 restaurants inside. if you are thinking of getting married in Vegas - do it here. I did and it was way better than having to work my way around a huge hotel. And our pictures turned out beaultiful. Only complaint - the customer service. Being from Canada I have high expectations, but from what I understand some areas of the USA is not known for their manners.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to give a better review, but.........”
Reviews.Author: jimsgirlsandiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany this past weekend (03/28 thru 03/30), the grounds were pretty decent, as we enjoyed staying in a complex vs. a high rise situation. I would like to see more sitting areas on the grounds, (little benches) scattered around would be nice. The casino, workout room and the casino cafe (for breakfast) were enjoyed by our group of 6. Our rooms were in the "D" building, rooms 118 & 119, beds were in need of new mattresses, a box spring cover of some kind would have been nice as exposed box springs usually have all sorts of "leftovers" of all kinds attached. Also new carpeting is desparately needed in both of those rooms as well as newer televisions would be nice as both of ours in those rooms were older and did not have clear pictures. They both smelled musty and smokey if the air conditioner wasn't cranking full blast. Also, found food under the beds upon check in, and our one bathroom had not been cleaned very well and had to call housekeeping. My son put a few almonds on the floor the next day to see if housekeeping would find them or vacuum them during their cleaning rounds, and they were STILL there after they cleaned. I will return to this complex only if they have replaced the carpet, bedspreads, cover the boxsprings, and remove the smoke and must smell. If they did this, I would stay there again. Until then, I will continue my search for a decent priced room near the strip, or just may give in and stay only at Lake Las Vegas where the rooms are sooooooo much better.

Reviews.Title: “quiet near the strip”
Reviews.Author: earing
Reviews.Content: Tuscany is a nice place, several blocks from the strip. I really enjoyed the lack of zooyness in the evenings, we went up to the strip all we wanted to. Tuscany is a bit of a different flavor, family oriented without the hype. We don't have kids, and I am not wild about seeing toddlers in the hot tub, but it all seemed to work out. The rooms are big, maybe on their next update they can lighten them up a little bit. The grounds are wonderful, nicely kept up. We ate at Marylins (sp) and the Cantina. The food at the Cantina was very good, Marylins, was fine, a little strange, but the server was nice and funny. I swam in the pool this morning all by myself, nice pool. Would we go back, of course in a heartbeat, I think we paid around $130 a night. The only thing that you should be aware of is the cigarette smell in the lobby. Everything in the restaurant is non smoking, but there is the Piazza bar right next to where you check in, and even though it was closed, it still smelled. Sorry you smokers, but MGG! We had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Azzraelus
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay. The room was big and nicely decorated, the staff was friendly and the location is nice: Close to the strip but quiet. The restaurant in the hotel is rather good, too and offers great value, just like the hotel. The only critizim I have: 15$ for 24 hours of internet access is close to blackmailing.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: HammerLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We met my daughter for her birthday in Vegas. The hotel rooms were large (although the furniture could use some upgrading), nice pool and workout room and the facility pretty much a multi-unit townhouse style hotel. The staff was pleasant, attentive and very responsive during our five day stay. It is only three blocks at best from the strip, so if you want the bright lights, hustle bustle and exotic, all you have to do is walk down the street. If you want to gamble, relax, enjoy a great bite to eat without the glitz, this is an awesome place to do it. The young ladies that come around with the drinks were far and away some of the best I have met anywhere! They have a high end restaurant (Tuscany Gardens) where the service and food quality were excellent! I don't thiknk I had a minute where if my water was low, wine was low, or anything that there wasn't someone there within seconds. The great part was there were not hovering over you. They just knew what to do. Great for couples, families, whoever. I would absolutely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for 15 min. walk to strip.”
Reviews.Author: Jantastic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tuscany for three nights because this was the hotel selected for a work conference. I stayed one additional night at my own expense at fairly low rate. Nice property and meeting rooms. Supply of light refreshments was appreciated at conference. My one room service food delivery took about 40 minutes, but the manager delivered my food himself and explained about staffing issues. Beds and furniture in my room seemed dated, circa 1978. TV had about 10 channels. Huge bathroom with shower and separate tub. Concierge was helpful, but price was incorrect for sedan she arranged - about $5 more than what I was told. Walking to the strip took longer than I had expected, but if you walk in almost the opposite direction, you can get to Hard Rock and the Haufbrau House for excellent beer and German food - worth the 20 minute walk. Overall pleasant experience for work conference, but if I were vacationing in Las Veags, I would probably stay on the strip. This is a good place for someone who does not want to be in the center of all the action and wants to spend less on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surfing for another hotel at 1:00 a.m”
Reviews.Author: okaugust
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year I've stayed here during a convention. I'm in town on business and LV really likes to get you if you have to be here. The owner of the company likes the large rooms, but that is about all I can say for the place. For $115 a night EACH for four rooms...a dump. The carpet is old and thread bare. When I checked in I had two coffee makers. One didn't work at all and the other's basket didn't fit. The shower door didn't close. I called to the desk (the guest services button on the phone doesn't work) and they asked me if I wanted the shower door fixed? Well, I said, don't you? The fan sounds like a Boeing 747 but at least drowns out the noise of the guy walking in the room above me. The pillows are lumpy (hence I'm up at 1:00 after working a trade show booth for two days wondering why one of the travel sites can book me in a 4 star hotel for less than here). The breakfast is usually okay but today was dreadful. Filled with convention goers, the waiter brought two of our party of five what they ordered. One person didn't get milk with their cereal. Another didn't get his cereal at all, or coffee, we kept trying to flag him back unsuccessfully, though he acknowledged the short order then spent 15 minutes waiting other tables. Oh, except the table next to us who didn't even get to order for half an hour. So the restaurant seemed to be filled with frazzled, late business people. Last year we ate at the Cantina and I've had better tv dinners. Tonight we did eat at the Italian restaurant and the food was better than average and the service was nice.
