I just went down to get a soda out of the machine and it wouldn't take bills. I went up to the 2nd floor and there is no machine at all. The pillows are lumpy (did I mention that?) and don't have anything put a pillow case on them, no protective case. The beds are small and the spreads are a 1970 throwback design. You can't help but wonder between this and the nasty carpet what all has gone on here. Oh, and let me tell you, they have some real John Wayne TP. Rough and tough and doesn't take...anything off anybody. Cheapest toilet paper money can buy. There is a kitchenette with a small fridge, and two stove burners. No microwave, no pots, pans, plates, silverware. You will save no money by thinking you can cook in here. The couch and chair are uncomfortable. The casino is small and I've never seen more than a handful of people in there at any time of day. It isn't welcoming at all. The front desk staff is pretty ho hum in general, you don't really feel a welcome environment. About 13 tv channels (is it 1978 again?) and $15 for internet, well, the least I could do for this rate is get on line and write a review of this place. If you like this place, you need to set your standards a little higher, because you can get a really nice room on or off the strip for the same or less with better ameneties any day of the week through the on-line travel services. You deserve better, trust me. And I'm a pretty generally happy traveler, but the underlying current of "we don't really care" that runs through this place two years in a row just drains the good feelings out of you about being in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Hotel and Casino ***********”
Reviews.Author: JuJoHa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vega, NV and stayed at Tuscany Hotel & Casino weekend of 01-19-2008 to 01-21-2008. My family and I have nothing but glowing marks for this hotel. I read others comments on the hotel before we went,and, I thank those that commented. We had a great time the hotel rooms were cleaned, we had no problems. For those who posted prior comments regarding the security cards for rooms, the reason that they stopped working was because you placed them next to other credit cards, or cell phones, which will demagnitize the cards. We experience this problem and that is what happened,but, we had no problems getting the issue resolved. The furniture in the spacious rooms have ben updated and very very clean. The food at the Marilyn's cafe located in the casino of the hotel was the bomb. The prices were excellent and the food was excellent. We had a fabulous time and highly recommend it to others. JL

Reviews.Title: “Even Steven”
Reviews.Author: bmfc1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Tuscany for work during the week of January 16th. This hotel is a good 20 minute walk from the Strip. At night, you might look over your shoulder during the walk as parts of Flamingo are quiet. If you want to see Vegas and want to save money, then this is the place for you. If you want to be in the midst of the Vegas action, then it's not. The hotel is outdated despite a recent renovation. The casino is old fashioned and depressing. After walking though at least 10 others on the strip, this one was sad. There were many senior citizens parked at the slots, a few businessmen there for work, and that was about it. The sportsbook is just two guys behind a counter with a white board. The food was above average. The "basic breakfast" at the cafe is adequate. It costs $4.99 but it doesn't include coffee ($1.50). They give you a 2 for 1 coupon when you check in. The Mexican restaurant got good comments from my co-workers. The rooms are old fashioned but big and include a kitchen so you can save money and eat in. The TV only had 7 or 8 channels. They also charge $10 for early check in. Internet access is an absurd $14.99 a day. If you want a hotel in Vegas to save some money, drop your bags, and hit the town, then this is acceptable if you don't mind the long walk. If you want a hotel to relax in, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious. Great Pool for kids”
Reviews.Author: suemagoonz
Reviews.Content: Spacious room for 2 adults and I 9 yr old. Great pool set up for everyone. Watch the drink dispensing machines - they swallow your money and you don't get it back. Short walk to the Strip ie Paris, Bellagio Fountains etc. Tip - if in a hire car you can drive to another hotel and park in the Self Park areas for Free. This way you don't have to walk so far with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dukegreg
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany Suites and Casino 255 East Flamingo Rd. – Be sure to get a package price from Hotels.com or Expedia [ same thing? ] or other on-line package seller. Book Monday to Friday for fantastic low cost! [ the Tuesday walk-in rate was $35.00, truly a give-away! ] You probably won’t find low-costs Friday and Saturday nights. The rental car is virtually free [ in a package ] except for the extraordinary fees and gas! You don’t need a car, but it is cheaper to book a car and save shuttle bus, cab and tram costs. You can walk from Tuscany to the Strip, but get a cab at night. -- Tuscany is clean & convenient, not really full-service, but a good price for a large room. -- Tuscany has double-size rooms with fridge. Ask for a room in building “G” or “H” to be close to lobby. Ask for Third floor to avoid noise. Drive around property if you can before check-in and pick a building you like, some near a pool [ two pools, one for laps only ] -- Tuscany has a Casino, but it is humble and plain as plain can be. -- The 24 hour restaurant will serve fresh food with friendly staff. Not fancy, but it’s OK. -- Avoid the “Lodge Net” TV internet, it is a joke. Check your bill 24 hours before leaving to erase phony charges.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Ok”
Reviews.Author: pitias
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, safe and clean environment. Had room on third floor, didn't hear a thing even though there were other guests around, no parking nor street around. We were on the third floor of building C, next to the main building. Got a room for $63 a night including tax. HUGE room with two double beds, huge bathroom with shower AND tub, separate toilet 'room'. Coffee maker, small fridge and sink in room, no microwave. We took napkins, forks, etc from the snack shop. Toiletries (replaced every day), safe, hairdryer, iron, iron table, opening windows, good climate control, clean carpets, sheets and plenty of towels; not worn nor stained. Apparently the whole building is non-smoking, which was nice -no tobacco odor whatsoever. Good snack bar for a quick eat, coffee; didn't use other facilities nor saw the casino: it was on the other side of the premises. Well maintained surroundings, good security, each building has own door which you open with your room card key. Felt safe. Rented a car for one day and found plenty of parking. The place is huge, with lots of 3 floor buildings. Looks like a time-share to me. Snack and refreshment machines in every building. Good sized pool, which obviously nobody used because of the cold. Found strange that stairs had no indoor access, only way to go up was via the elevator, which was only one for the whole building. Let's ask the architect... Didn't like: 1) We had an early check-in, and the hotel has the policy to charge $10 for this. This was annoying, but found out too late-after the 20 min walk with our bags trailing. 2) Very bad painting job in ceiling of room. 3) Toilet seat in very bad condition, screaming to be replaced. Clean but very worn. 4) Stained sofa; didn't go near it after seeing the stains for fear they would be urine stains... Some people wouldn't like: 1) The Tuscany is a good, cold, 20 min walk from The Strip down Flamingo Road. A little solitary at night, but enough traffic to make you feel confident. By the way, no 'ugly or seedy neighborhood' as some reviews say. Just lots of parking and a closed gas station, which is being renovated. Saw one homeless sleeping on one of the bus stops, but you see these in any city and he was sleeping, anyway. It takes months for the traffic light to change, but very dangerous to cross the street with traffic. There is a bus along Flamingo Rd, with a stops very close to the hotel, and there are plenty of taxis waiting around the lobby building. 2) Limited tv channels, but we didn't come to LV to watch tv. Definitely would stay there again; if you don't mind the distance to The Strip and want a little peace and quiet, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Take Ear Plugs! Noisy Air Vents. Long walk to Strip”
Reviews.Author: Fast_Eddy33
Reviews.Content: Each of the property's buildings has noisy air exhaust vents at ground level on one corner and they seem to produce noise around-the-clock. As the buildings are close together, it's hard to escape the noise. Take ear plugs to help you sleep. I attended a conference at Ceasar's Palace and walked back and forth. It was a relatively long way. I felt safe, but it was an ugly neighborhood to be walking through. Not recommended for families. Take comfortable walking shoes. Everything else was acceptable. Didn't try any of the on-site restaurants or bars.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained hotel resort”
Reviews.Author: MOTHERLOAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tuscany for 4 nites over Thanksgiving 2007. We had reserved the King room for 2 adults, 2 kids -- the sofabed wasn't made up -- the mattress was really stained. We called the front desk for bedding & were told the staff had gone home. After calling back again, we were offered to move upstairs & were assured the sofabed in that room was made up. We moved up & found that sofabed was not made up with sheets, etc. either. I called the front desk again & after another 30 minutes+, security brought me 1 sheet, 1 mattress pad, and a bedspread for a king bed that didn't fit the queen sofabed. The maid kept forgetting to change the sheets and I had to keep asking her again to change them. The room had a large crack in the ceiling & wall, like it wasn't structurally sound. Outside the pool was open, but too cold to use, and the concrete walkways were always dirty. I was locked out one evening late at night after I went to the car for more blankets & pillows because the exterior door on the building (G) wouldn't open with my card key. Another couple arrived about 10 min. later & also could not get in. Eventually, an employee came out of the elevator & I flagged him to let me in. (I had forgotten I could walk down the parking lot & try to get in at the end of the other building & I had left my cell phone in the room). My daughter (age 20) described the rooms as very "Ghetto". The only thing that I can recommend is having the parking so close & accessible to the rooms, although the good spots usually fill up early & if you drive for a show, you will end up parking on the outside loop. I almost forgot, one night we ordered a large pizza from the pizza snack bar/pizza spot they have that services the pool, sells coffee drinks, and more and we got major diarreah after eating the pizza. We ate some meals in the Coffee Shop inside, like breakfast and late night snacks, and they were pretty good. One more comment, for families, the rooms usually have two double beds -- we think they are way too small for adults to be comfortable, and this is really unnecessary since the rooms are large enough to accomodate two Queens. This is a major complaint for us. That is why we booked the King room with the Queen sofa sleeper for the kids. They normally don't put mattress pads on the sofa bed mattresses & they are all stained up & gross. I wouldn't ever go back. Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Budget Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: DarioLA
Reviews.Content: This place is a GREAT value. We paid $35/night for mid-week. The room was very large, w/coffee maker, fridge, microwave & stove. Bath was big, with separate bath, shower, & toilet "room". Nothing fancy, but clean and in working order. Great place for an extended stay. The place was much nicer than we expected for the price. Some reviewers had complained about "smell" but we didn't notice any problems there. Our interactions with the staff were all good. The place is very nicely landscaped, some good food bargains (2.99 steak & eggs and .99 pancakes from midnight to 5 am!), and an adequate casino. It even has a good exercise room and lap pool. And it's only a long block from the strip. There were some small problems--only one elevator per building, and ours was at the other end of the building. Would rather take the stairs, but there was no outside entrance for either stairwell. The construction of the buildings seems shoddy--kind of looks like a cheaply made group of college dorm buildings: Think Best Western meets faux-Tuscan villa. But for that price, this place is a find. If you'd rather spend your travel money on something other than a room--how much time do you spend in it anyway?--this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: The-lady-is-a-pilot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at the Tuscany (5 nights), and it was a pleasant experience. We had requested a 3rd floor suite, because, as with any multi-level hotel, we didn't want the risk of heavy-footed noise above us. The room was in Bldg "B" which faces Flamingo Rd. For those sensitive to traffic noise, you may want to consider another building. Being city folks, we are immune to it :-) The room was convenient and clean; I believe it was a recently renovated one. We had a small stove top and micro-wave. The refrigerator seemed to be working overtime, as it froze our beverages no matter what setting we had it on. Because my husband takes insulin (requiring refrigeration), we called the front desk to inquire about the settings. When informed of the problem, a maintenance man showed up immediately, and they were so kind as to completely change out the unit. The pool area remains closed for repairs right now. Not much luck playing slots, but the casino is always fun. As always, Marilyn's cafe offered decent food at reasonable prices; and the Mexican cantina offered same. Did not visit Tuscany Gardens this time. We would like to thank: Alina at the front desk, Ruth, the concierge, and the lovely Suzanne who served cocktails, for their gracious and kind service. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Accessible room, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gospodarich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tuscany 12-11 thru 12-15 in a wheelchair accessible room. I booked directly because the various travel websites cannot guarantee me an accessible room The bathroom was roomy and had both a seperate shower (without access) and a tub with an attached flip up bath bench. No curtain on the tub but there is a handheld shower. Be aware that the bath bench is somewhat low and there is no mechanism to make it higher so if bad hips are a problem that could be too low. Sink is open at the bottom (no vanity to block a wheelchair) and the toilet is standard height but has wall bars as usual. I still needed to assist my mother to go to the bathroom but I expect that when away from home. The room itself was spacious and clean. Request a microwave on arrival and you can get some things from a grocery store (about a mile down Flamingo there is an Albertsons) to make quick breakfasts and late nite snacks! Buy water too since a bottle in the machine was 1.50. My refrigerator was missing a leg and so it rocked a little--I suppose they would have brought a new one but I did not ask. My hair dryer in the bathroom was shorting out and was replaced that day. There are no kitchen supplies except some cups so plan on getting or bringing some flatware and paper plates if you plan to eat in the room. Cups are foam and plastic (for all of you who have recently seen news reports of hotels using glass and improperly cleaning them). Coffee makers in room are 4 cuppers and the coffee pods were tasty. Beds: Comfy and clean. Mom's was a little short sheeted- maybe an inch or two but no big deal. Pillow were fluffy. The only thing I will say about the bed are is that since this was an accessible room, it would have been nice to have a rail on the wall by the bed to hold on for balance--the hanger rack was there and is not a secure device to hold onto (never is--don't try it at home either!). Service was about average. No rudeness but I didn't see anyone going out of the way for us either. Our flight was cancelled so they did give me an extra hour grace on checkout. Maids respected the do not disturb signs. Several did not speak English but we got along with hand signs and motions. Coupon wise, at check-in, you get a packet and also one when you sign up in the casino. Our free souvenir was dice. Casino was smaller but adequate and they were kind enough to wait until after midnite to keep the player club open so my niece who turned 21 could get her card. This hotel in relation to the strip is a bit long if you are disabled but if you can handle the 3 block walk it is fine. It was just a little long to do in a chair so we took the car place to place. Be aware that the hotel is actually several buildings on the land which are connected by cement paths but are outdoors. To get to the main desk and casino/restaurants, you need to go outside. Security is maintained in the indiviual buildings by use of your room card to gain access. We only sampled Marilyns Cafe for food but it was good. Steak and lobster was 10.99 on Tuesday--lobster small but very sweet. Anyways, for us the main things are cleanliness, good disabled accessiblity and a comfy bed. Tuscany has all 3.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: zipee1
Reviews.Content: Booked through a package. Room was very adequate, spacious even. Television got about 7 free channels. Very disappointed that the pool was under major construction, which we were told would be finished in Dec. Couldn't even enjoy the patio because of the noise of the jackhammer, and all the dust. Tuscany Gardens Restaurant had excellent food, you gotta try the stuffed mushroom caps! Waitress was very snooty, didn't even give us our guest discount! Casino staff very pleasant, drink service adequate. Advertise loose slots, but saw no big winners during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Suites - Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GoodTimesRoll
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights (11/18-21) at the Tuscany Suites & Casino and were thoroughly delighted. The wheelchair accessible room was great, as was the room our friends had. We really enjoyed the sofa and chairs, which gave us the perfect place to relax and visit. The service was excellent; everyone seemed genuinely interested in ensuring our visit was a success. We liked the location, just off the Strip, and the super-low price was a bonus. We look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: XMKid75
Reviews.Content: I was able to book a suite at the Tuscany for a bargain $45. This was my first time staying here and didn’t know what to expect. But it worked out great for us. The suite was very large and seemed remodeled recently. I was very happy with the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: jbmoney22
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and need updating. Bartender is on the prowl for females. He will ask your last name and make obscene phone calls to your room. Security is very lax and doesn't follow up when reported. I would never recomend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: tirelady
Reviews.Content: We found the Tuscany to be a nice place to stay. Rooms are large which we like and very clean. We had no problem with check in. We were staying only one night so didn't care about being a few blocks from the strip. Marilyn's Cafe had delicious food and the service was great. Enjoyed the two guys that played the guitar and sax. They were very entertaining. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: WC1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided the absolute worst service I have ever experienced at a hotel. It started with waiting almost 30 minutes in line just to check in. My room was reserved and paid for in advance (Credit Card charged right after making the reservation) Upon arriving at the hotel, the two double bed room, I paid for was not available so I was stuck with a fold out couch for my son to sleep on. Just because you pay for the room in advance does not guarantee anything (even getting a room according to the manager). The maids arrived about an hour after we requested the fold out couch to be made up. They would not even make the bed; instead they just dropped off the linens! There was always a line at the front desk, as they were clearly understaffed! Other than the location I could not find anything positive about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Good Stay at the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: Wincherr
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at the Tuscany Las Vegas was fine. I give it an "Above Average" because of the generous comp plan and the property (grounds) itself. Here's the deal on this place: (a) It is a 10-minute walk up Flamingo Blvd to get the back of Bally's. It is certainly not a getto, but you will pass a few "characters" at the bus stop. (b) We paid about $100 night weeknights, $200 weekend. (c) The grounds are very well-kept and it is a nice property. (d) We will probably stay here again next year. As many reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are larger than average including the bathroom. The rooms (and public areas) were very clean. It would have been nice if the kitchenette had at least some basic supplies, but there is nothing provided at all. Nothing. I have absolutely no idea if the pictures in the rooms were duplicates or not - and could care less. In fact, I don't even remember any pictures. I find it hard to believe that someone included a comment about the art work in a mid-priced Vegas room. We actually used the pull out sofa and it wasn't that bad. Also ate at the Italian Place and it was very good. There was some noise from the rooms above, but nothing a few cocktails didn't drown out. We had no service issues at all - everyone from the front desk crew, the maids, and the casino staff were very nice and service-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Forget this place! Overpriced and rude.”
Reviews.Author: LeVagabonde
Reviews.Content: I came in with a soccer team. We had confirmed reservations for over 6 weeks. When we arrived our rooms weren't there. They had smoking rooms, when we reserved non-smoking rooms. They had a single king bed, when we reserved two beds. When we asked to speak to the manager, the desk clerk said he was the manager. When a roll away appeared, it didn't have sheets on it, they wanted the guest to make it. Outrageous. That's one thing if this was a youth hostel, but we booked this room on a busy weekend and paid $250 a night! The one 24 hour restaurant was having all you can eat Crab legs. These crab legs were old and dried out. I'm an easy customer, but these were by far the worst crab legs I've ever eaten. The staff is untrained, the management rude and the service lousy. Any other questions?

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: roccgt
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual hotel about 1/2 mile from the Strip. For us, this was a positive, as you are well removed from all the crush, yet only a short walk away. If you can't walk 1/2 mile, you won't be able to handle Vegas very well--lots of walking involved, as traffic is bad everywhere, and driving on the Strip?? "Forgetaboutit" We had very little wait to check in/out and dealt with 4-5 different clerks over the course of our stay, who were all polite and helpful. It was unusual in that it consisted of 6-8 seperate buildings, of 3 floors each. Grounds and pool were well kept, and security appeared to be on the ball (patrolled parking lots in golf carts). Our room was huge, maybe 5-600 sq. ft., but more like an efficiency apartment-one big room, except for the bathroom, which had seperate tub and shower and comode. Room was clean and well furnished. Many reviewers noted that rooms had 2 identical paintings- I didn't notice, as I don't dwell on the artwork in my hotel room when I'm on vacation. To those of you who do, my advice is to get a life. Another plus was the parking, which was near all of the buildings. No waiting, tipping and hassles with valets. For you bargain seekers, the Tuscany is right around the corner from Ellis Island, and their famous $ 4.99 steak dinner, which is better than you'd think. There was some floor noise from the room above us, but it wasn't bad, as this is not a hotel that attracts the late-night party crowd. On-site Mexican restuarant was, good, not great. My wife did complain about the odor (cleaning fluid?), but it didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Registration service terrible”
Reviews.Author: HMcOakville_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I visited the Tuscany Suites and Casino for a 5 day business conference last week. I arrived at 2:30pm to register after a 9 hour trip. My room mate was not arriving until 11:30pm. The Tuscany would not let me have my room because my name was not on the original reservation when my colleague phoned it in. I had several people with me that could vouch for who I was and that I was with the conference. I offered several suggestions like giving me another room and cancelling hers when she arrived. They could, but they would not offer me the original rate and if I took another room and my roomate cancelled hers, they would have to cancel the rest of our 5 day reservation at the discounted rate and rebook for the higher rate. What kind of customer service is this? They did not even offer to keep my luggage - I had to ask. The only way they would give me my room is if my collegue phoned in with her visa number. She was already on route to Las Vegas and I had no way of reaching her. I asked if this sort of thing has happened before. They said yes. I suggested they inform people when they register that they must give both names of the guests in the room, especially if they are not checking in at the same time. Their response was "that would take too much time on the phone". As I was checking out after the 5 days, I over heard a gentleman standing beside me - he was facing the same issue as his wife was checking in later. Although this incident gave me a bad flavour for this place, I will say that the rooms were acceptable, clean and large for the discounted cost.

Reviews.Title: “Can do better in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Riverfrog
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Tuscany today, after staying there for 4 days/3 nights. Like my title says, you can do better in Vegas. The Tuscany is a so-so hotel off the strip. Fine if you have no expectations, but disappointing if you are hoping for a nice hotel. Pros: Each room is a suite, so you can sleep a family comfortably (there's also a couch). Rooms are very large; the bathroom has a separate tub and shower. There is also a kitchenette with empty fridge (no mini-bar so you can store your leftovers), microwave, and double burners. You can park close to your room as the hotel is made up of numerous small buildings, named alphabetically (A, B, C etc.), and parking is on the periphery. The hotel offers video checkout. I never felt unsafe on the property. Cons: Everything else. Hotel is off the strip (not far, but not walking distance). Hotel is loud. These rooms have the thinnest walls and floors. There are 3 floors in each building, so tell the front desk when you check in that you want a room on the third floor. Trust me, you can hear everything on the first floor, which was where we were first assigned. Let's see, what else... You get a kitchenette, but no pots, pan, plates, or silverware. Basically, you can't use it; it's just for show. Call down to the front desk and they won't provide you with anything. We asked for a fork to eat the leftovers we had brought home from their restaurant. The front desk transferred us to room service who told us they could not provide us with silverware unless we ordered room service. What's the point of providing a kitchenette if you won't let guests use it? Case in point: Our double burners were brand new. In-room coffee is terrible, it tastes like coffee-flavored water - no exaggeration! FYI: There is a Starbucks at Flamingo and Paradise. Housekeeping is also terrible. We returned the first day to find our paper cups with coffee still sitting out on the table, coffee maker unemptied, etc. Hotel restaurants: We tried to have lunch on a Friday at the hotel, and their Italian restaurant, Tuscany, is only open for dinner. The sports bar was not open either. We ended up going to Marilyn's Cafe for slow service and an incompetent waitress. Food was fine but skip it if you want decent service. We tried dropping by the coffee shop, Beachfront Coffee, to grab a quick sandwich but the meats in the sandwiches were indecipherable in the display case. Not a good sign! Our deadbolt popped out and we couldn't close the door to leave. Apparently, this happens a lot, in other guestrooms too. You have to twist the handles this way or that way - try twisting both the indoor and outdoor handles at the same time (that worked for us; other people had different techniques). Our door handles were about ready to fall off too. Wake up call line doesn't work. You're put on hold forever to get to the front desk. Our phone started acting funny and all the front desk people could say was, "Your phone isn't working, I can't hear you. I can't hear you!" No offer to send someone to fix our phone. Just "I can't hear you." On a side note, take a look at the paintings in the room. Our room had 4 paintings, 2 of which were the exact same print. Who decorated these rooms?? All in all, the hotel is adequate if you're on a budget and really don't care where you lay your head at night. We didn't see any insects and our toilet flushed fine and we had hot water, heating, and AC. But if you're looking for a comfortable place to stay, look elsewhere because the Tuscany is just "so-so". Take a look at the reviews on Tripadvisor, most echo my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelGurl77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Tuscany for 4 days during the week of October 8. We had a great time. We stayed in unit B first floor. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. We did not have any problems. We barely stayed in the room during our stay. Each day that we were there our room was cleaned when we placed the sign out for cleaning. We did not have to wait very long for check-in. I was somewhat nervous about the stay since it was off the strip. We walked each day to the strip and walked back at night. No one bothered us. I would stay again. I had a great time and would recommend the Tuscany!!

Reviews.Title: “Jewelry Stolen by Cleaning Staff”
Reviews.Author: kmmoody
Reviews.Content: Several family members met up in Vegas and stayed at this hotel. During one of the morning cleanings, a necklace and earrings stolen right off the table. This was not costume jewelry, it was the real deal. We were told to file a report with the security booth. The first security personnel we approached was extremely rude and was talking to us as though they were the victims when I asked him what his procedure was for taking this issue up with their cleaning crew. His rude response was "there's theft at all Vegas hotels." Shortly into filing the theft report, we were approached by another security guard who was much more pleasant to deal with and did feel bad about the situation. Obviously we will not see this jewelry again, however, we plan on following the progress of our theft report to be sure that someone is held accountable. As far as the rooms are concerned, they are not what I consider suites; they are just larger rooms with a very small sink and table. The carpet was nasty, the comforters were nasty and the bathroom floors were filthy. We had a 1st floor room and it sounded like the folks in the room above us were going to come through the ceiling as they walked around. Also, it was a nightmare trying to close the room to the door. For some reason the deadbolt lock kept getting stuck in the lock position, so closing the door took quite a while to figure out. Other family that stayed here had the exact same problem with their lock – the only way they were able to figure it out was due to some hotel staff walking by. Really, the only good thing I can say about this hotel was that the service at the cafe was good and the hotel is in a good location. Because of all the Vegas options for rooms, I would NOT recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye2002
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days/six nights in Vegas in the middle of August. First time at the Tuscany and we loved it. Arrived Saturday afternoon and had a 20 minute line at the front desk. I hate waiting, but this wasn't too long compared to some of the hotels on the strip. Huge room and very quiet, We thought we were the only guests on the floor. They must be remodeling the rooms because every morning they were unloading a new delivery of furniture in the parking lot in front of the fitness center. Both of the pools were nice, and the lap pool was ours alone most of the time. The table games in the casino were a little slow, not a lot of play. But with the strip a few blocks away, we didn't mind. We tried all of the restuarants with the exception of the Mexican one. Good food with large servings. And the Tuscan themed restuarant was staffed by actual Italians, didn't expect that. And around the corner is the Ellis Island restuarant with very good $4.99 steak dinners. While the walk to the strip isn't too bad, we did have a car and used it to get to the far end of the strip, downtown and up the the mountains. I plan on staying at the Tuscany Suites my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: leandraweb
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC HOTEL We booked the Tuscany as it seemed great value and just far enough from strip to reduce noise! and boy were we right absolutely beautiful, well set out foyer no queuing to book in, lots of help from friendly efficient staff. Rooms were huge and clean fantastic seperate shower and bath. We were both impressed with the air conditioning as needed it 112degrees at midnight and room was nice and cool. Pool area clean and well managed plenty of seating although too hot during day to take full advantage. Restaurants fantastic and bars good. Cant rate this hotel high enough would definately stay again, but maybe not take too much money for gambling next time lol

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip property”
Reviews.Author: D0nna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany for two weeks from 19th Sept. We chose this hotel due to the lower prices than the Strip and because we were staying 2 weeks, and reviews being quite positive. We arrived mid afternoon and check in was swift. We stayed in block L which is a couple of minutes walk to reception. The room was large and clean and we received numerous fresh towels per day. They are upgrading the rooms as we had a new sofa and chair. We seen sofa's being removed from other blocks by the dozen. During our stay the pool was closed for two days without much explanation. As a result the lap pool was overcrowded and no sun beds for us to use. We went to the Platinum Hotel next door and asked if we could use their pool, which they kindly agreed to. What a difference to see a beautiful chic pool area with a seriously heated pool which was both indoors and outdoors and the most comfortable sun beds. Anyway back to the Tuscany. The pool area was OK with small towels provided: sun beds easily available at all times of the day although busier at weekends. The pool bar has been closed down and I seen people measuring the pool area which is due to be refurbished. We had no complaints about the hotel or the restaurants. There is one bar with live music in the evening (same every night), but the female clientèle at the weekends is somewhat questionable. Please note that the prices at the bars in the Tuscany were almost half the price of bars on the Strip, except if you are gambling then the drinks are free. We only walked to the Strip once as we had just missed the bus and would not recommend the walk as we felt safety was an issue late at night. We bought a 30 day unlimited pass for the CAT/Deuce buses for 40 dollars at the Moneytree on E Flamingo Road which meant that we did not have to buy a daily pass at 5 dollars. We used the concierge at the hotel 3 times and found them to be informative and helpful. On our last day when we went to shower before leaving there was no water. We contacted reception who said there had been an emergency and they had to shut off the water. They phoned back within 2 minutes and offered us another room in another block and a member of staff brought the key to us within 5 minutes. Overall we had a fantastic holiday and there are unlimited things to do in Vegas even for 2 weeks. I would recommend the Tuscany for the budget minded traveler who is prepared to stay off the Strip which is a few minutes on the bus compared to others on the South Strip which would take a long time on the Deuce to the main part of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Better Values Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: westnw
Reviews.Content: Rough around the edges, not particularly clean, front desk understaffed, unfriendly bar tenders in the casino, cold bacon and eggs for breakfast in the coffee shop after long wait for service. This on top of listening to the screaming room air conditioner all night. Thought about asking for a different room when I realized while walking by other rooms outside that a lot of the air conditioners were in "howl mode". No microwave in room (double burner stove is included, not sure what you'd do with it though). 8 TV Channels on a tiny 25" set. Grossly overpriced at $79 on a week night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: ozcouple2608
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany for 3 nights during our honeymoon in September 06. After some initial confusion with checking in (They sent us to a room with two double beds). My husband went back to the check-in and this was quickly rectified, and we were given a king bed room. We loved this hotel. The rooms were huge and comfy, as was the bathroom. There was a little kitchen and lounge area. We also enjoyed the Tuscany casino, restaurant and little diner, it was a relaxing alternative to the busy strip after a big night out. We had no problems with cleanliness or noise and would definately stay here again on our return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Standard Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BMCNI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tuscany Sept 7 & 8 2007. The Hotel is nice and the rooms are good. The complex is laid out in approx 10 appartment style blocks. My room was in block H at the rear of the complex, about a 2 minute walk through the car park. The rooms are large with cooking facilities, coffee maker, & fridge. Fridge was useful for storing drinks which can be brought to the pool. There is a store within 5 mins walk. Pool area is very nice with lots of beds, towels are provided. The restaurants are great. Italian was especially good, large portions, use the 30% off copon you are given at check in for even better value. Meal for 2 was $20. The cafe in the casino had a great selection & massive portions, also cheap prices. The casino seemed good however I did not gamble here. Downside Not as classy as hotels on strip, which is a good 20-25 min walk, contrary to other reports saying 10mins. Air con in my room was very noisy and could not be turned off. Overall a good stay and good value. Im glad I stayed here as opposed to Stratosphere or Circus Circus which came recommended, they are miles away from all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a suite alternative to hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nevada2007
Reviews.Content: We loved the Tuscany. The rooms are so huge! Because we were meeting up with family, we wanted space to sit and chat, share a coffee and so on, without people having to stand or sit on the hotel bed. And the Tuscany was trumps for this - sofa, comfy chair, and 3 dining chairs. Plus plenty of room to spread out the suitcases rather than unpack fully. The wee kitchen was useful, mainly the coffee pot and (particularly) the fridge. One coffee filter per day, the pot would make four cups, but only one creamer supplied? Odd. Bathroom is large. The bath appears to only be a half-size, but this didn't bother me because at least it didn't have an over-bath shower - there was a separate shower cubicle. Toiletries nice but no brand names. Outside, we could park right by the entrance door to our block, which was down the back of the complex - but previous vacationers had carved a nice dirt path thru to Flamingo so exiting on foot was quick, 10 minutes walk to Ballys/Bills corner. The main pool was busy mid-afternoon, the lap pool was empty. Fitness room looked good (didn't use it); laundry room was unused and cheap (dollar each time). No problems with reception staff, always courteous. And no problem with housekeeping (daily tip), they always left the extra coffee & soaps that we requested. If you are happy to consider staying off-strip, then I'd recommend the Tuscany. And we'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “what a place, what a room!!”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Las Vegas and looked for a good, affordable place. What we found is the Tuscany: a GREAT place for a very good price! You don't need to go to one of these big, fat Strip-Hotels. Just a 15 min walk from the Strip on Flamingo road you find this wonderful Hotel. Firstly, the rooms: Huge, nicely set, with TV, fridge, kitchenette, closet, a couch, 2 extra tabels w/ chairs! Great! Room was clean too, beds are comfortable. In the later evening you easily can relax a little on the couch before you go to bed...nice. Bathroom was very big and very clean too! The pool area is very nice too, lots of palm trees, a pool bar, a nicely shaped pool and a jacuzzi. But the pool area is not that big. So come early for a good seat....or just trust your luck...and you still can get a good spot! Check-In was normal. But too bad you can't check-in before 3pm. Except you pay extra. But you can enjoy the town until then or hang around the pool or the Casino! There is a lot of parking lots. All around the Hotel. If you look around carefully, you could catch a shady space for you beloved car (because Nevada is hot in Summer!!!). We never really ate at the Hotel. Just one time we cought some salad and Burger in Marilyn's Restaurant in the Hotel. Salad was alright. But my Burger! Fries have been hotter than the meat. But both Burger and Fries way too soft! You better catch some food at the close Gas Station or something.. But still, this Hotel is a great place. And comes at good rates. We would definetly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrified by the customer service at the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: MOPPready
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the Tuscany, from 19-30 August, the following problems were encountered: * When I made my reservation, I informed Tuscany that my sister would be joining me for my trip in a nanny capacity, to watch the children, since the purpose of my trip was for government business. My reservation was for two adults and two toddlers. I also informed the Tuscany of the number of occupants in the room when I checked in, because my sister was arriving later than me and was going to be checking in separately. o When I checked into the room, I had to request extra towels, because there were not enough towels for the room occupants. o Each day, after housekeeping serviced the room (with inadequate cleaning), we had to call the front desk to request more towels. Consistently, each day, there were not enough towels for the room occupants. o When more towels were delivered, often the gentleman would wait awkwardly for a tip. Since I consider this a basic service of the room, not an added luxury or special request, I found this to be rude. * When I checked in, I requested two cribs. The cribs were initially delivered and set-up with sheets very promptly and the sheets were put on the foam mattress so the children could sleep on the sheets. After the first day, housekeeping would strip the crib foam mattress and would not replace the sheets. This would cause us to call the front desk to request sheets for the crib each time that housekeeping visited the room and cleaned, inadequately. o When the sheets were brought to the room, I had to insist that the staff put them on the crib. This should be standard practice. Again, the staff waited for a tip. * On Wednesday the 22nd, I went to dinner at Marilyn’s Café. The meal was good; however, when I tried to pay, the server was not able to charge my card. He informed me that I needed to pay at the front of the restaurant because his machine was down. I waited at the front of the restaurant for 30 minutes trying to pay for my meal because the staff was unable to get the machines working and didn’t start charging the meals to the room for almost half an hour. This was unacceptable. The restaurant should be prepared for simple things like credit card machine malfunctions. * I checked in on Sunday the 19th and my room was not vacuumed until the following Sunday, the 26th. o I complained to the housekeeper in building C on Friday the 23th, and the room was not vacuumed. o I complained again to the housekeeper in building C on the morning of the 24th and informed her that we would be gone until the evening and requested that the room be vacuumed. When we returned at 10pm that evening; the room had not been vacuumed. o I immediately complained to Vic at the front desk. I also informed Vic about my dissatisfaction with Marilyn’s Café and about my further dissatisfaction with housekeeping for the towels and sheets. Vic gave me a $40 comp to return to Marilyn’s and requested that I wait until the next morning to have to room vacuumed. Vic was concerned about the late hour and disturbing other guests with the noise from the vacuum. I understood his concern and agreed. Vic put in a notice to housekeeping to have the room vacuumed first thing on Sunday morning. (Vic’s customer service was the best in the hotel.) o At about noon on Sunday, I informed the housekeeper in building C that I would be taking the boys to the pool and would return in approximately 2 hours. I requested that she vacuum the room while I was gone. When I returned at 2:45 pm, my room had not been vacuumed. My sister complained to Tara in the Concierge office and Tara informed her that there was nothing she could do except try to get housekeeping to vacuum. At this time, I joined my sister in Tara’s office, with the boys in a stroller. When I initially attempted to talk to Tara, she rolled her eye at me as if I were just another customer trying to get a discount by complaining. Each time I tried to explain my concerns to Tara, she interrupted me. I found it extremely rude that she continued to interrupt me and both of our voices elevated during the discussion. She stated that if I didn’t lower my voice she would call security because customers could hear us in the lobby. I told her it wasn’t my intent to yell, but that I didn’t care about the customer service for the other guests anymore, because the hotel hadn’t showed any customer service for me yet. As Tara called security, she stated, “What kind of parent would bring her child down here to complain? What kind of parenting skills are you teaching your child?” I found this comment to be a personal attack on me and extremely inappropriate. My husband is currently serving on active duty in the Army and is deployed. My son stays with me, even when I travel, because I try to be the best Mom that I can be. Her comment was completely offensive to me. No manager, in any profession, should personally attack a customer or question their parenting skills as an easy way to abort a conflict. * Before I arrived at the Tuscany, I coordinate to have a package shipped to meet me at the hotel. I called ahead to the front desk before I departed for Las Vegas and the front desk said that it would not be a problem to receive and hold a package for a guest. When I checked in, I was told that the bell desk receives and holds all packages. I informed the bell desk of the pending arrival of my package and continued to call each day until my package arrived on Tuesday the 21st. On Saturday the 25th, I finally received the message that my package had arrived. When I returned from my day trip that day, the message light on the phone was blinking and when I called to get instructions on checking the voice mail, I was informed of the message for the package. Now, this incident was relatively harmless, because I was diligent about tracking my package. However, this is not a timely or functional service for guests!

Reviews.Title: “I'm Glad I Found This Place...”
Reviews.Author: jedivader
Reviews.Content: Was looking into all the cheapest places on Fremont when someone on Fodor's told me to check Expedia and look at Tuscany. Expedia was having a sale and the deal came with 2 for 1 dinner at their cantina. The place was very nice, room was huge. Location fantastic! Staff was great, concierge was very helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You've been warned.”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: My review of TUSCANY SUITES CASINO HOTEL/Las Vegas: The very bad: 1) Bed sheets are so old and flimsy - you should take a sleeping bag. For some reason, lots of hotels no longer have fitted sheets. So anyone over 5'9 will not be able to sleep well here. 2) Door handles stick - I seriously sprained my wrist trying to open both the outside door and inside room door. This has been an ongoing problem with Tuscany Suites. The bad: 1) Housekeeping staff is too loud and noisy in the mornings; 2) Swimming pool closes at 10 pm and they literally kick you out. It makes no sense to have a swimming pool close in Las Vegas at 10 pm. Almost everyone complains about this. 3) Smokey casino The good: 1) Nothing except the price. If you stay here at more than $35 a night, you paid too much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: lubywhit
Reviews.Content: Because we won a two night stay at the Tuscany, I was expecting the hotel to be of two star quality. I was wrong. The room was very spacious and clean and the staff was very accomodating. I would recommend Tuscany to my friends and family and when I am in Vegas again, I will most likely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KayrisMac
Reviews.Content: I chose Tuscany Suites because I got a great deal through Expedia - about $40 per night - and we don't mind being off the strip. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and we'd stay here again. The upsides: The room was cheap, yet clean, large, quiet, and comfortable. The bathroom was nicely designed (very large with tub and separate shower). The restaurants were good and affordable - my husband especially liked the Mexican. The gift shop is open all hours and was very handy for forgotten toothpaste, magazines, booze, souvenirs, etc. The pool and hottub were very clean, plenty of chairs, radio music playing, open long hours (7am-10pm) and hardly any children at this time of year, thankfully. We purchased beers/coolers at a local mart (2 blocks away), kept them cold in our fridge, and brought them down to the pool area in a bag with ice. We walked to and from the closest strip hotels (3 long blocks) - to Caesar's, Flamingo, Bally's, Bellagio. We walked to and from NY, NY and MGM but I wouldn't recommend this to everyone (about 2 miles). Lawry's Steak house is across the street. Tuscany is fairly close to the Hard Rock Hotel (about 3 blocks), which has great casino/lounge/nightclub/rock memorabilia/Nobu restaurant to check out. The Planet Hollywood buffet (Spice Market Buffet) is killer and highly recommended (voted best buffet for 2007). Cab fares to Treasure Island, Wynn: $8, Fremont St. (downtown): $15, Premium outlet mall (downtown): $17. The downsides: slow check-in, no shuttle to the strip so you must be able to trek fair distances. I would have liked a room with a balcony or patio - I suggest you request this if you'd like.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump!”
Reviews.Author: Coloradoan44
Reviews.Content: No hot water. No room service...told to pick it up myself. Stained sheets. Loud AC. And no one at front desk "authorized" to do anything about adjusting the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyJetLag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights ago, and found it to be a very comfortable and clean hotel at a great price (especially as it was a Saturday night). Room was huge, and very clean. We didn't have a chance to try either of the pools or restaurants but they looked nice. Did try room service, which was very fast! The only negative is that if you picked this hotel to be close to the Strip it's a good 15 minute walk, which is harder than it sounds in the 40+ degree heat. Overall though, a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: droach3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days 2 nights and it was just wonderful. A little further off the strip than I would have liked but the valet had a cab there with in 15 min every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Hadassah28
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany Suites and Casino on Flamingo Road is a great place to stay if you want to avoid the Vegas Strip, the crowds, and the traffic. Located right next door to Terribles Casino, it's a short walk to the Hard Rock Casino, and an even shorter walk to one of the best museums I've ever seen, the Nuclear Testing Museum. In addition, the Suites are only about 10 mins away from the McCarran airport. This property is both comfortable and accommodating. Our room was not fancy, but very large with a kitchenette, sofabed, and sleeper chair. View was terrible, but we didn't care. We were on the bottom floor, and we weren't there for the view anyway. Front desk staff was outstanding in speed and courtesy. Check-in was smooth, directions to our suite were clear, and any further services were prompt and friendly. LOTS of parking spaces with easy access to our room. The suites are old but not unattractive. We had a run-on toilet, a light fixture hanging from the ceiling, and a TV remote that wouldn't work (all fixed as soon as we complained). The kitchenette does NOT come equipped with any supplies except the fridge, the hotplate, and the sink. Bring or buy something to cook in, utensils, and anything else you will need for your stay. Crank up the fridge coolness as soon as you arrive to ensure cold drinks. The grounds are well kept, and the pool area is attractive. The lap pool is functional, but one BIG complaint was the green slimy fungus growing on the tile in the hot tub. I mentioned this to the staff when we checked out; the front desk person seemed to take it seriously and promised to do something to correct this health issue. It was strange to see the hot tub in such bad shape since the pool and lap pool are tidy and cleaned regularly. I spoke to the pool boy who was friendly and forthcoming. He pointed out the filtering system and how it worked. I asked because of the strange salty taste in the pool water. I surmised it was water softening salts -- but that's a guess. My husband and I are not hard to please, but we are fussy about cleanliness and smells. Our room was impeccably clean and was clear of any odors. We love the casino here, too. It is small and smoky but the Players' loyalty card results in a whack of freebies. We never had to pay for a meal. The Mexican restaurant on-site is terrific. We had the Taco Burgers, the Chicken Quesdillas, and Cheese Enchilladas. All delicious, as are their fresh tortilla chips and fresh salsa served with the meals. Service is quick and friendly throughout this establishment. In addition, if you do want to do the strip, it is a short bus ride, walk, cab ride, or rental car ride up to the Strip (Flamingo runs alongside Bally's). We will stay here again in a heartbeat. We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary here and hope to celebrate many more anniversaries here in years to come. Hint #1: Get a Players Club Card immediately. You are going to probably gamble anyway, so why not earn points towards food. We did that here...and we did it down the road at Terribles. Hint #2: Go, go, go to the Atomic Testing Museum (just walk up the street). With or without kids, this is amazing. We loved the interactive stations. Extremely well-maintained and you simply must try the Ground Zero Theatre (beginning is a little scary). Excellent value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel but not a great location!”
Reviews.Author: prettypink21
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on 20th July 2007. Easy to get to from the airport, $11usd for 2 people in a taxi. Quick check in. Some rooms are a long way away from reception - ours was in block L as we requested a smoking room - don't think they could have put us any further away from the main building! Room was ok, a bit dated but large and clean. The location is ok if you don't mind walking on a street that is a bit dodgy. It's about a block and a half from the strip but you can cut through Bally's or Bill's to shorten this or get out of the heat. On our way to the airport when we were leaving our taxi driver told us we should not have walked from the strip to the hotel late at night or in the early hours of the morning! My husband left his phone behind him in the hotel when we were leaving and we realised when we were at the airport. We rang the hotel straight away but they said they never found it and he has not got it back. Overall, if you are not fussy about location the hotel is good value for money but if you can afford to pay a little more I would go for somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: img1972
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Tuscany suites hotel & casino. This is a decent value for the cost. The room was nice sized and clean, and although I didn't go in the pool, there seemed to be lots of people enjoying it. The hotel is off the strip, a short walk to Bally's, and about a 15 minute drive to the airport without traffic. The breakfast at Marilyn's was good, didn't eat at any of the other restaurants. The casino was ok - we nicknamed it the "Clark Grizwald casino". It's not the Wynn, but its ok for what it is. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but a couple of drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Dolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany with friends the week of July 16th. Rates were good as we stayed during the week...had a flyer in the mail due to having a Players Card and got $49 a night. This facility is off Strip, which affords a little more quiet. if you want continuous action, then this would not be your first choice in resorts. Room.. was wonderful, large, king sized bed, hot plate, microwave, little fridge, sink..etc. You can keep a stock of snacks and drinks if you choose, but aware you need your own untensils and cookware, plates...they provide none of these. The bathroom was immaculate, nicely arranged so two people could comfortably move around. separate shower, soaking tub and separate toilet was nice. This property was obviously from the looks to have once been apartments, converted to hotel rooms. Pools...they have a lap pool, which when I called was told it was the "adult" pool and the other was more the "family" pool. I ended up not using either of the pools because they both almost had families with kids in them. This is not the atmosphere I enjoy. The main pool had a cute thatched roof pool bar, and the website advertises pool side drinks brought to you, but the entire week we were there, we nary saw one person out there making or serving drinks. Casino...was nice...slight smokey smell, but we understood that the casino was non-smoking entirely, and from what I had read on this site, but we did encounter several people at slots smoking and no one said or did anything, so is it non or not? The slots paid nothing...so very little of our play was in there. we are not big gamblers anyway, so no loss there anyway. and we had the Casino waitresses walk so fast past us, we could not even get a drink while we were playing. I guess they really didn't need those extra $$$ from tips. Restuarants...Marilyn's Cafe was excellent for breakfasts and lunches. well prepared food and a lot of it. Good service also. Tuscany Gardens, the Italian place near the front of the lobby ,was also excellent and excellent service. also good amount of food and well prepared. I would highly recommend it whether you stay at the resort or not. we did not try the "Cantina", so cannot comment on that one. also use the coupons you get on check in...they cut the price of meals 10 to 30%, depending on the coupon. The Bar near the Slots was awful. although wonderful bartender, talkative and fun, the drinks tasted like nothing more than water. I had a margarita and it was just water....there was no flavor at all. we did not use the other bars or night club across from the restuarant so can't remark on that either. All in all, I would stay there again, but not in summer when kids are out of school and likely to be vacationing there with mom and dad. We don't go to Vegas to be surrounded with kids.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: laitis
Reviews.Content: this was my first time booking a place to stay that was not on the strip. I was pleasantly surprise with the room. I did book the place with i4vegas.com in which I payed about $55/per night but I had book the reservation about 3 weeks in advance. I did notice that the closer to my actual arrival date the price was almost reduce by half. The walk to the STRIP took my husband and I 15 minutes which was not too bad considering we would be walking anyway. The room was a nice size and really enjoyed the separate toilet from the shower and vanity area. The casino was a nice size considering the hotel. I did 2 loads of clothes while we were there and the price was about $1 each plus drying. All in all in was an very inexpensive place to stay that was not a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: smileytech
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany at the beginning of July. I was not disappointed. It's close enough to the strip and perfect if you have a vehicle to get to places and still park nice and close to where your room is. The rooms are huge and look exactly how the hotel website portrays them. The room was clean and the maids kept it that way. We were in building C and although it says there are cooktops in the room, ours had been taken out (fine by me as we had young children with us) we did have the fridge, sink, table etc. My only real complaint with the room is the sheets on the bed. They really should use a fitted sheet on the bottom instead of a flat one. We found it really quiet and peaceful as long as you stayed out of the main building or the pool area which is where you want it to have action. The landscaping was so beautiful. We especially enjoyed the pool area. We didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurants but I did visit the gift shop for snacks and it was nice that it was open late. I played some of the slots in the casino and more than doubled my money so that was a plus too. As for check in and check out, it was slow because only 2 people were handling the desk and one of them was a trainee...they could use more people at the desk in my opinion. All in all we had a great stay and we will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Various Buildings - Maybe we got bad one?”
Reviews.Author: GregPayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tuscany Suites on 07/08/07 because NWA cancelled our flight and we needed a place to stay. Our neighbors had stayed here before and claimed it was very nice. I booked the night for $35.85 via some Vegas website. Great deal no matter what. Upon arrival, there were 2 people working to handle a line of about 20 parties trying to check in. A little slow - but a waitress did bring out bottled water while we waited. The room we were given was on the side (building D) near the Platinum hotel. The room was large, but it was very aged. The bathroom was very nice - bed was okay (but sheets sucked). Overall, for the money it was a good deal. However, I am not sure I would want to spend a week at this location - even at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Large suites”
Reviews.Author: Rx1987
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Tuscany for our 20th wedding anniversary trip to Vegas. We chose the Tuscany because of the central location and larger sized rooms. The grounds were very well kept and our room was HUGE...plus extremely clean. I'm a very light sleeper so upon check- in... I asked for a room that was located in a quiet section of the resort. Honestly....we never heard a "peep" the 4 nights we stayed in the room. The Tuscany is just 2 long blocks behind the Bally's Resort on the strip...which takes about 10 minutes to walk. If you buy the deuce bus ticket it also covers the #202 line going East and West in front of the Tuscany...so we walked out front to the bus stop then over to the strip. Don't make the same mistake we made by thinking the bus going East somehow turns around and then goes West. If you're going West to the strip you need to leave the Tuscany...cross the street and get on that bus #202 going west to the strip. In other words...each bus is like a one way going in the direction you want to go. The Tuscany has a nice pool and we had an amazing Italian dinner at the nicer restaurant by the front lobby. We enjoyed the clean casino, too. I watched the travel clubs and I got our room for $56.00 a night....what a bargain!!!! If we go back to Vegas...we would stay at the Tuscany without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Miggs
Reviews.Content: Room The Tuscany is an all suites hotel, converted from apartments. As a result the rooms have consistent style and are equipped with 2-ring hob, fridge/freezer, sink, coffee machine. However, crockery, cooking utensils etc are not supplied - if you wish to use the kitchenette, bring your own! Large comfortable and clean king bed, with 2 sofas and coffee table in addition to a dining table. More than big enough for two adults! Air-conditioning appears to be an after thought with a wall attached A/C unit. Although very effective, ours was very noisy - it's a fairly consistent drone, so its easy enough to sleep through overnight. Maids cleaned rooms daily making beds, replacing towels etc and arrived at a reasonable time which was nice so we weren't disturbed early! Bathroom Bath, separate shower, separate toilet were all spotless and modern. Shower was hot when required. Large bathroom with large wall mirror. Again, noisy extraction fans, but no big deal as they only come on when you turn the lights on. Location 2 blocks from the strip. Safe 10 minute walk to/from strip along busy Flamingo road. No shade makes for a hot walk during the day. Staff I get the impression that staff are friendly and approachable for "run of the mill" enquiries, however when asking for advice and help over and above normal duties, I encountered attitude. Not a problem as long as you stick to your guns. The concierge will help you with attractions and bookings for shows etc. We enquired about a Grand Canyon helicopter flight. My advice is use them for the information, but book direct with the company rather than through the hotel, we saved $70 on our trip. Facilities Pool large, good jaccuzi. Clean towels are provided. They seem to leave the radio on all day, which can be annoying if you are right by the speaker! Very clean and plenty of sun loungers and space. Even at "93%" occupancy, the pool was never busy. Seem to have good facilities for conferences, meetings and weddings. Restaurants Mexican restaurant looks good on paper, but is disappointing. Not recommended. The Tuscany Gardens Italian has a good atmosphere, food is good with good service. Use the 30% off voucher they offer on arrival and the price becomes reasonable also. Cafe does a good breakfast 24/7, with quick and friendly service. It seemed popular with gamers and guests alike. Casino We didn't visit for the casino and had no intention of gambling. Smells slightly smoky, although the whole hotel is now non smoking (apart from the bar), it was clear it wasn't always that way. Overall Cheaper, good value off-the strip hotel. For first time in Vegas we were happy with our stay. Nice to be away from the strip to get some peace and quiet - the hotel is nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Aprill20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tuscany with about 30 of our friends and family due to my wedding being held at the Tuscany Chapel on April 28, 2007. We had such a great stay. It is so quiet and relaxing, but yet we were able to have our fun as well. The slots in the casino seemed pretty loose, a lot of us won some money there. I loved the restaurant Tuscany Gardens where we held our reception dinner, the service was great and the food was phenomenal. The strip was a little ways away, but we didn't mind walking it - it sure was good excercise. Oh and the size of the rooms - they are the size of a small apartment. I had such a fabulous time, I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us-Comfortable & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: BertaMay
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place that is exciting with lots of action, then this is not the place for you. However, if you want a comfortable room in a quiet area with nice grounds and pool, and a low-key casino, but is within walking distance to the action and good restaurants, then this just might be right for you. We knew we didn't want to be constantly surrounded by people and the noise of the strip, so after reading the reviews on this site we chose the Tuscany Suites. We found it was perfect for what we wanted. We could walk to the strip (about 1/2 mile, but get a taxi if you don't want to walk in the heat) and if we didn't want to eat in one of the restaurants in the complex (there were 3), we could walk across the street to Lawry's, McCormick & Schmicks, or Gordon Biersch (?); go around the corner to Ellis Island for their excellent BBQ joint; or walk a block to an old-school Italian restaurant. We arrived at 1:30 and were told checking in early would require an additional $10 fee, so we elected to wait until 3:00. The desk clerk graciously offered to pre-check us in and assign us a room and we could return at 2:30 for the keys. In the meantime we drove about a mile east to an Albertson's market and stocked up on groceries. Our room was on the 3rd floor of building C, away from the main street. It overlooked the building next door but that was OK. As mentioned before, the room was huge with king bed, a dining table, couch, chair, desk, and a small kitchen area with sink and refrigerator (no microwave but someone mentioned in an earlier post that one could be requested but we didn't ask). Our only issue with the room was that the bed was short-sheeted and I found myself remaking it every night (why don't all hotels use fitted sheets??). The bathroom was very large with a tub, separate shower, large vanity area, and the toilet was in a separate room (I loved this). There was also an ironing board and iron in the ample closet. The grounds were very pretty with lush plants and trees and the pool area was relaxing on a warm day with shade under the palm trees, and the large spa was just the right temperature. I especially loved the winding paths as I could take my early morning walks around the grounds without venturing on the street. There is also a fitness center with a lap pool and in the same building is a laundromat, which was handy since we were midtrip and I needed to wash a few things. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel and my husband I agree that we would stay there again when we return to LV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: go_flames
Reviews.Content: I really like the Tuscany. It is a like a quiet Las Vegas secret. The food and drinks are cheap ($2.00 New Castle during the day). The pool is smallish, but never crowded. The rooms are really quite big and we always have four people and last time had more than enough room to inflate two airmattresses. The only downside is that there is no temp control in teh room that i could find. It is only ten minute walk to the strip and i just enter Bally's from the back and enjoy the aircon from there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: flamingos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in Vegas at the Tuscany Hotel. We found it to be quiet, with very large rooms, a friendly staff, and a place we would definitly return to. The only thing the room lacked was a microwave. It has a small fridge,sink and cooktop. The beds were comfortable and aside from the higher prices on Friday and Saturday, this is a nice place to stay and I thought a good value.. We especially enjoyed the penny slots in the casino. We even won a few bucks !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Point2point
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of April. Although the hotel looks nice at first, the rooms have a motel feel. Check-in was easy, as we arrived late on a Friday. The complex is large with multiple buildings. We stayed at the northernmost end (D)? Clientele in this hotel mostly appeared to be 50+ years, although we did see some college/high school sports teams at the hotel. The room was on the bottom floor, and smelled slightly musty. It was large, with king size bed and scant pillows. Not the most comfortable sleep (but then who's sleeping in Vegas?) The TV had about six channels, no cable or satellite, and at least two channels dedicated to gambling or the hotel. Not much to watch. Also, there was no hotel guide in our room, so we had no idea of the amenities, closing times, or if room service existed. Bathroom: separate toilet/ sink room. Noisy ventilation & plumbing. Our toilet was plugged before we got there. The problem was fixed the next day (we didn't feel like hanging around all night). The shower was okay, but the shower head is too short for 6' tall people. Toiletries are minimal and very basic. Kitchenette: Coffee machine WOULD have been great had they actually put enough creamer packages for two people. I even left a note requesting an additional creamer, but this request was ignored. So we decided to skip the coffee the second day. Pool: big, inviting, very busy early on Saturday morning. Didn't actually swim, but plenty of other guests did. Food: Tuscany Gardens Italian: The veal with mushroom sauce was saltier than I normally like. Otherwise the food was good. Ambience was not very romantic, since right across the hall, the bar was really rocking. Beachfront Coffee has hardly anything to accompany a cup of coffee for breakfast. Go elsewhere. Location: yes, it is 2 LONG blocks from the strip. Realize that walking the strip is something that most people spend the day doing and know that you will be tired. A day pass for the monorail is useful to go back and forth. Discount coupons are in many of the Las Vegas guides you pick up. However, there will still be more walking from the station/to the station - there's always a casino you will have to go through. The walk along Flamingo from the strip is not very pretty (empty lots, a little rundown), but was safe enough. Bottom Line: We will try a hotel on the southern strip next time. The price is right, but if you're spending all your time on the strip, staying there will save you time. The quality at Bally's (previous visit) was much better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: banana23
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany would be a beautiful and wonderful place to stay if the customer service were better. I have never dealt with people so rude. You would think that they would want repeat customers however that is not apparant in the way your treated. I had several problems even trying to book a room and after that it only got worse. To tell you the truth I would have changed my reservation to a differetn casion however any other casino I wanted to stay in was booked. I will never return and I was disguisted and disappointed by the staff of the Tuscany who seemed to not care about anything at all but themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasant pool, clean”
Reviews.Author: timtx01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room I-202 from May 21st thru 24th. The hotel is just minutes from the airport, cab fare was about $13 incl tip. Total price was through a very reasonable package on a major travel website. After netting out airfare, the hotel portion of the package equated to about $350 for three nights. Location is convenient at about 2 full blocks from the Strip, an easy walk for anyone in reasonable physical condition. Bally's and the Flamingo are the closest major casinos at about a 5min walk away, but Tuscany has quite a decent sized casino of its own (we didn't win anything at Tuscany's machines, though). The Cantina Mexican restaurant in the casino had good TexMex at a reasonable price and a nice strong premium margarita for under $6. Marilyn's Cafe in the casino offers food well into the wee hours for late-night gamers. Our room was clean & oversized. Bed was comfortable but could have used better sheets and plumper pillows. The rooms have a small kitchenette, including sink and mini fridge. However one word of warning on the kitchenette--there was no microwave which is a big deficiency for this type of property. There was also no cookware, no utensils nor dishes. So the kitchenette is useless without your own equipment in tow. We would highly recommend this property. It was much cheaper than the large strip hotels, the pool/grounds are attractive and the property was not crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paramedic143
Reviews.Content: The room was one of the largest I have had, and bested only by a five star Spa hotel in Ireland. There was a fridge and cooker but no utensils/cutlery. The room was clean but we did arrive back one evening to find it had not been made up. As it was after 4PM we were only offered clean towels. We ate a couple of times in the Casino grill and found the service and food both good. The atmosphere in the casino itself seemed muted but we are not gamblers so it might just be us. We liked the location being only about 10 minutes stroll to the middle of strip. Terribles Casino is only a few minutes in the other direction and serves a nice breakfast buffet for 5 dollars. If we go back to Vegas we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: albertutz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany in April 07 and it was just great. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms are super. They are huge and have a nice size bathroom.
