Everything was clean. The restaurants in the hotel have some of the best food we ate during our stay.The casino was great, from cheap drinks if you are not gambling to helpful dealers. The guy's at the craps table were the best.I wouldnt stay anywhere else next time I come to town.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Ambberrama
Reviews.Content: Service was a problem throughout our stay. The keys constantly malfunctioned and the staff were not helpful at all about correcting the problem. Despite repeated requests, there were never enough towels in the room. The hotel is inexpensive, but it's a $12 cab ride to get to the strip. Overall a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit”
Reviews.Author: westie2
Reviews.Content: Check-in went smoothly and we were soon on our way to room 302 on the third floor of building E. I initially thought this was too far from the casino, but it turned out to be a perfect location. The room itself was quite large with excellent soundproofing, but furnished with castoffs from one of those rustic lodges found in the Adirondacks. No big plasma TV for us, but at least all 6 channels were in living color. We got a king size bed, we got a kitchen with both a refrigerator and stove top, we got a couch, chair and kitchen table with 2 matching chairs, who could ask for anything more? The bathroom was large and featured both a tub and separate shower unit and enclosed toilet. The Tuscany complex includes guest washer/dryers, a well equipped exercise room with outside lap pool and nice size pool with Jacuzzi

Reviews.Title: “Older property but nice”
Reviews.Author: Marie752
Reviews.Content: This was a girl's getaway. The property was about 2 blocks from the Strip on Flamingo. It is an older property but very nice. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The property has several buildings and you can be in a bldg. that is a little walk from the lobby. This was a minor problem the first night as we arrived late and it was rather cold. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: PortlandJenny
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying there as part of a timeshare deal, and were very satisfied. It was an easy and safe walk to the middle of the strip. There were multiple affordable restaurants at Tuscany. We ate at the cafe most of the time and really enjoyed our food. The casino is fairly small, but we didn't find it too smoky. They made it very easy to check in early (for an extra $10) and check-out late. Our room did have a few fairly minor problems. The sheets aren't fitted to the bed, which is inconvenient. Our fan squealed off and on, which I found annoying, though the temperature was very easily regulated. Also, there was a cockroach running around in the bathroom light. These were all minor issues though, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel could cost more and we'd still stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Kansas_City
Reviews.Content: We came to Las Vegas to get married by Elvis. We got a room for 3 nights, 2 people each got a room for 2 nights and another couple got a room for one night. i was able to get all the rooms on the same floor of the same building (except the other couple checked in early and since they were cleaning our floor at the time, ended up in a building that had already been cleaned. This was not a problem, it was kind of expected because of the early check-in. My new wife and I loved our suite, it was so large the king-size bed looked small! It was clean and maintained. When we got into the building, there was an odor which we have decided must have been air freshener (hopefully the hotel will use a less-intrusive brand in the future), but inside the rooms was fine, you couldn't smell it. We called down to the desk about 8:30 p.m. and asked for a microwave and it was delivered within an hour. The bed was very comfortable, but they did not use fitted sheets. The bathroom area was quite large, having the toilet separate from the rest was a plus. Nice sized-shower. As large as the room was, the bathroom area could have been a little larger in order to have a double sink and more countertop space, although it was adequate. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful, but they need to give more information to the front desk staff. They didn't seem to know as much as we felt they should have. A leisurely walk to the strip was about 10 minutes, which is just far enough off the strip that we din't have to deal with the crowds and noise near the hotel. It probably would take 7 to 8 minutes if you pick up the pace a little. If you are planning on walking the strip, that extra time does not take much time away from that. The loveseat and chair in the room were OK, not the most comfortable but not too bad. The lunch specials were cheap and HUGE! They definitely give you good sized portions. We will definitely stay here again unless we decide that we HAVE to be on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: grannydoll
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a hectic week in Las Vegas and stayed at the Tuscany. Excellent location, quick check in and check out( someof the hotels had queues a mile long) large clean room, pool clean and grounds well kept, peaceful away from the busy strip. Marilyn's cafe open 24hours, food ok and the food in the Tuscany Garden was excellent and good value for money but couldnt eat there every night as it was very rich and filling but nice for a treat! This location was perfect as it was walking distance to the strip ( about 10-15 minutes) and safe to walk. You can get a bus to the top of the strip ( Bally's or beyond) if you feel the need. The staff at the hotel were helpful and friendly . Would definately recommend this property to anyone going to Vegas who want to walk away from the busy strip and have a calmer environment to enjoy. It also has a casino as all places do but it does not hit you when you walk in the door and has its own seperate entrance, giving a very relaxing calming feeling to the place when arriving. Would definately go back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HRGArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family vacation. We booked a standard room, and to our surprise the room more then your average sized hotel room. We had enough room to put a air mattress in the room, and still not trip on anything. The best thing about this hotel is that the only time you HAVE to go near the gaming is when you check in or check out or go to one of the dining rooms. The rooms are in separate towers. When we stayed at the Luxor before it was a pain to go through the Casino to get to our room. The hotel has several dining options available, and the prices are average (more expensive then some, but not over priced like other hotels on the strip). There are several places to go if you don't want to go there, including the strip. Another great thing was the location. It is right behind another hotel. That hotel was right behind Bally's.... so you were within walking distance of the strip. The location says off strip, but this is just about on the strip without having all the hassle of being there. The hotel was very clean, we had to ask for some extra towels, but house keeping brought them quickly. The bathroom was clean and had a separate tub and shower (the bathroom was huge too). We are planning another trip to Vegas in May. We will definitely stay here again for the value and the location. Everything else that is comparable to this place has had terrible reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: samandToronto
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with many aspects-from the friendliness of the staff from Ken at the reception desk to wait staff in Marilyn's, gift shop and other restaurants and the valet staff. Rooms were very large, pool was nice and the grounds well looked after. The walk to the strip a nice 10-15 minute walk. You were away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Good deals were the $ 5.00 bus ticket for 24-hour use(good on the Deuce along the strip and other buses), the $4.95 steak dinner at Ellis Island just around the corner from the hotel and meals at Marilyn's (Wed. pm surf n turf plus veg and potato $11.95). Car discount through the hotel with Dollar rent a car was good and they picked you up at the hotel. Great stay-will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Huge & Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: VivaDiva9696
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge (I was with 2 girls and we had more than enough room in a standard, two bed room) and practically on the strip (literally blocks away). It's nothing fancy but excellent for the Las Vegas traveler who doesn't plan to be in their room too much (or if they do, don't mind a simple layout). We went when it was too cold to go into the pool but the pool area looked beautiful. There are plenty of restaurants around open convenient hours and a casino with a bar open all night within the hotel. The room was clean and the service excellent If you're on a budget but want to stay as close to the strip as possible, this place is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChuckLu
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, (stayed there a few times). Big rooms, Clean, Nice surroundings. Close to the strip. (Walking distance) a very reasonable alternative to a big strip hotel especially when the price is 50%-75% from strip-hotel prices

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid to gamble on this Las Vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chrisgene
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for someone who doesn't want to be right on the Las Vegas strip but you have easy access if you want to have that experience. I was there on business and my husband was there for gambling. He could walk to the strip easily. I liked the fact that I didn't have to walk for miles to get to my room, the parking right outside your building was a plus for me. The rooms are huge and everything was very clean. Re: the kitchenette, the stovetop had been covered over with countertop. The refrigerator is there but don't you couldn't do any food preparation there, which was fine. Carpet looked new and also very clean. Another thing that you usually don't see in a hotel room in Vegas is screened windows that open - it's great to get fresh air in. The grounds around the property are very nice and there were security people all around the property at night. The only restarant we ate at was Marilyn's Cafe for breakfast and it was fine. All hotel staff personnel we came in contact with were very pleasant. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pickem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I lodged at the Tuscany during NBA All Star Weekend. We were very impressed with the large sized room and the friendliness of the staff. We also liked the fact that there were not large crowds in front of our hotel and it was easy to get in and out by taxi. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!! Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Javalu
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh. It was like a bad TV show. Booked a King, got two doubles. Someone left food in the "kitchenette", which had electric burners that looked like they belonged in a motel along the highway that rents by the week. The closet door was broken. We asked for a different room on an upper floor. We were offered a smoking room or the disabilities room. I honestly don't remember which we took but the bathroom sink was permanently in the "closed" position so the water would not drain out and there was really no way to unstop it. The carpet was stained. Suites were remote and isolated as was the parking. I felt like I was a million miles from civilization and very vulnerable. It was just creepy!!! We checked out, paid a little more, stayed at Mandalay Bay on the strip and had a beautiful time!

Reviews.Title: “Go For It!!”
Reviews.Author: mciufalo
Reviews.Content: I gotta say...the hotel exceeded our expectations. I was worried when I booked the room because it was more than half the price of the big "strip" hotels. We say....GO FOR IT!! The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Our room was very BIG and comfortable. My fiance and I came out to Vegas to plan our wedding, and our stay at the Tuscany started, and ended, the weekend right.

Reviews.Title: “not the same anymore!”
Reviews.Author: vegazgurlz
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and all but the front desk staff was the WORST!!! The girl that checked us in could barely understand what i was trying to tell her. And to top it off she does not even speak english!! I mean she should not be at the front desk if she barely knows english. Why would they put someone that doesnt know how to communicate? Another thing i noticed was that all front desk staff looked so unhappy they dont even smile. Just unbelievable..the girls before were a lot better. I was hoping to see hot asian girls from before but i learned that they dont work there anymore. Those girls were a lot way prettier and very friendly. To the management bring back some hot asian girls!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Enebingo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. It is a little off the strip so we payed quite a bit for cabs. Nice and cheap tables. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The pool was OK. I wish it was heated more. Loved the mexican restaurant. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: AF-Trip
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during X-Mas holiday based on previous reviews. The hotel itself is off the Strip (2 big blocks), but we didn't mind coz we're driving our cars anyway. We found the room to be clean & huge (by regular hotel standard - I guess that's why they're called suites instead) with sofas, kitchen table & sink. Bathroom has it's own bathtub AND shower area with tile floors. The only thing that kinda bugs us is the lighting.. it seemed a bit dark. And the fan inside the toilet is very loud. But other than that, we really enjoyed it & will definitely come back, especially for the price we're paying!! :)

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: robinvn
Reviews.Content: Bit of a walk to start with, to the strip but you get used to it. Our room was massive! We loved it and the shower and bathroom were great too. We had a little problem with some noisy partying guests next to us on one day but the hotel dealt with it immediately. We only ate there once but no complaints, the food and service was excellent. The Casino is small but with so many Casinos to visit, it's not like you would spend your whole time there. The great thing was...my wife was asked to leave the casino because they said she didn't look over 21. That was a nice compliment, as she's 42!! I would go there again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Above average and large rooms. But they stick it to you for early check-in”
Reviews.Author: 66dude
Reviews.Content: I like this place, nice rooms, large and clean. They have a nice place for breakfast and is open 24 hours. Nice location and quiet. A lillte pricey but we like it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: TrippedOut72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only because my business colleague had booked here first- we had a conference off the strip. I think if you book carefully, you can stay at a premium property instead for not much more money. The villa setting isn't so great, especially on the first floor, you get noise. The air conditioning units are old and extremely noisy. The Mexican restaurant (La Cantina) is slow and mediocre. The crowd is a bit lower-rent, the casino somewhat rinky-dink. Also, it's really hard to get cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Room was as dark as a cave”
Reviews.Author: Carlton's Mom
Reviews.Content: Even with all the lights on inside our room, the room was so dark it was like a cave. Pool area is nice but there were lots of roudy young-adults there, smoking and cursing. Not a good environment for children to be around. We almost left to change hotels but did not have time. We would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place, practically on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: PlantGeek
Reviews.Content: This review is for my husband's business trip from Oct 15-19. This his review, not mine. I had a one bedroom suite. It had a king size bed, small sitting area, small dining table, work desk, and a small kitchenette. THERE WAS A COFFEE POT IN THE ROOM. The bathroom had seperate bath tub and stand alone shower. Everything was clean. Air conditioning worked very well. Hot water takes a minute to kick in. No complaints. Over the hotel was very quiet, clean, and relaxing. It is 2 blocks off the strip. The walk to the strip was about 8 minutes. I did not go into the pool, I felt it was too cold but it was open. It looked nice. There were not a lot of children here. The casino was small. I finally learned to play roulette here because of the low minimums. There goes 3 hours of my life. The roulette dealer was quite helpful in explaining the rules of the game to me. If you are new to gambling, definately start out in a smaller casino like this and go early in the morning. I was the only one at the table and gained valuable knowledge from this. Drinks at the casino bar are only $2.50-3.50 so it is really reasonable if you don't want to wait for the waitress to bring you one. Marilynn's Cafe is what I ate for breakfast twice. I got the contential breakfast one morning and some type of standard breakfast with fruit plate. Both were good. Decent price for breakfast in Vegas. The Tuscany Gardens was very pricey. Nice atmosphere, just expensive. I got the chicken fettichini alfredo for $15 and a salad was not even included. Overall I really enjoyed my stay there and would recommend it to others. Its good for romantics/couples. The location is ideal for business travelers who may need to go into Vegas or surrounding cities easily because Flamingo Rd is easily accessible from the interstate/highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with one minor exception”
Reviews.Author: Perrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany from Oct 19-22. Its a newer hotel with a small casino. It is about 1 1/2 Las Vegas blocks from the strip. The rooms a huge and the cleaning staff friendly. But be prepared for one unexpected expense. Here it is: Hotel check in for the Tuscany is 3pm. If you arrive earlier than that time you can get your room - for a price. The Tuscany charges 10$ for 'early' check in. Even though your room is ready, they still will charge you. Our flight arrived earlier than expected and we land at 1030am. We reluctantly paid the fee and got to our room to freshen up from the long flight. That is the only problem with the hotel. Everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: amurphy777
Reviews.Content: The concierge, Tara, is the Tuscany's shining star! She printed our boarding passes and is a genuinely delightful person. She does not need customer service training unlike the front desk staff --one in particular was quite rude perhaps due to limited communication and customer service skills. Rooms are large and clean however the walk to the strip is long--20 mins--you definitely want to take a cab at night for safety. The sports bar was good with friendly staff. In general it was a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Recon71
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in room N103 as I write this, very disappointed. This is a very big room. Almost the biggest hotel room I’ve ever been in. The bathroom is also very large with a separate toilet, a tub and a shower. This room also has a kitchenette. The facilities, pool, restaurants, and casino are all very good. Tuscany is very well located, just a couple of blocks away from “The Strip,” on East Flamingo Road. Regretfully, if I come to Las Vegas again, I will look for another hotel. To start with, the door to the toilet room doesn’t close and in fact must be held (with a knee, no less!) against the jam, if you want privacy. There is a large tile missing (6 x 6) on the baseboard. It’s hard to figure how a supposedly good hotel would allow that to just slide. The shower head is placed for midgets but that’s not unusual. The closet sliding door is off its track and although I put it back on to some extent, the problem is that the track is bent and loose making it unserviceable. The ice machines on all three floors of this building were not working when I arrived. Room service offered to send up ice for a charge. Guest services sent a maintenance man and sent me a plastic bag of ice. The first floor (my floor) ice maker is still not working but the second floor machine is, now. The furniture is really cheap to begin with and in my room, it is dirty and stained. I was in a friend’s room and it’s identical except it wasn’t dirty so that I noticed. The TV is a standard 19” with only 12 cable channels, and 2 more for the hotel’s use. It does have pay-for-view, however. The bottom sheets are not fitted, they are flat sheets tucked in. I tend to rate a motel on this. A fitted sheet stays on the bed without shifting better but is more expensive and less versatile to the motel, only being a bottom sheet. This is really sub-par for a hotel of this supposed level. Last night’s dinner in the Tuscany Gardens, the hotels main restaurant was very good. It gets busy so make reservations. This mornings Sunday Brunch Buffet in the Cantina was also very good with an accomplished omelet chef on station. A I said, I am sitting here disgruntled because I wanted a dish sent to my room from Tuscany Gardens but room service will only send food from the snack bar! That menu is exactly that – snacks! As I’ve been typing this, a menu for a pizza place was shoved under my door and they do deliver! How they’ll get into the building without a key is questionable but they got in to shove their menu under the door, didn’t they. Disgruntled has gone to furious! I tried to call the pizza place and I can’t get an outside line. It’s unbelievable. The operator comes on and says she’ll get me an outside line but when I try the local call, I get an error sound – NOT a busy sound. This place is down the street. I call back and tell her but she doesn’t want to listen and hangs up on me! I spoke with the manager at the front desk and she offers to send a repair man to my room. Clearly, the problem isn’t in my room. This is hopeless. I had to go out to my car to get my cell phone (I seldom use it). Of course it’s roaming. I must be fair and admit that having once been a Marine Officer, my voice can be somewhat “forceful.” Still, the issues that brought me to be “forceful” should have never occurred. As I said, it is regretful that I cannot recommend this hotel because it could be a great facility. On a positive note, last night we took in “Folies Bergere” at the Tropicana. This is one of the oldest original shows in Vegas. It was great. Funny thing, a lot of people seemed to be sitting on theirs hands. These performers danced their hearts out. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Customer Service Problems”
Reviews.Author: lewisbunch
Reviews.Content: We booked and prepaid for our reservation with an online agency for Las Vegas (IforVegas.com). When arriving at the Tuscany, our reservations had been canceled. (so they said) We stood at the check-in counter for over an hour requesting to see the manager and never once did he/she come out to talk to us. Instead, we were humuiliated in front of other guests and told that our reservation had been canceled per fax and the only room they had was for $239 per night if we wanted to pay that amount. As I mentioned, we had prepaid for 2 nights in advance at a considerably lower rate. I pulled out our reservation confirmation and the girl at the counter still insisted that we had no room unless we paid an additional $239 per night. After 2 phone calls to our booking agency, and still no manager to talk to in person, over an hour later, we got room keys handed over to us with no explanation of the problem or any apology for the time it took to straighten the mess out. The room was fine, once we got it, but we have never been treated so poorly by any hotel personnel in the past. It was clearly a mistake made by the hotel and in the very least, we should have received an apology for the unprofessional mannor in which we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but Slip Ups”
Reviews.Author: PFouc
Reviews.Content: I chose the Tuscany after doing a lot of reasearch and weighing the minuses and pluses. Let me state that I temporarily live internationally and have stayed at a lot of U.S. and abroad hotels. From past experiences I confirmed our reservation days before arriving to avoid any unwanted surprises. This was my sister's first visit, and I wanted it to be really special, but at a hotel she and I would be comfortable with. Not overly priced like the strip hotels, in my opinion. Unfortunately, upon arrival we were told the room assigned to us was now occupied. Instead of the poolside one were were looking forward to, we were told only A, M and N were available. Went into N and now had further to walk, and only another building to look at which was disappointing. The first thing we noticed was the a/c and bathroom fans were extremely noisy. Good tip: Bring a flashlight so you won't wake anyone when you use it at night...very annoying! Good sized room with microwave and refrigerator which was nice. Queen beds, dishes and utensils would have been even better. Odd thing-our room was on one end of the building, and we could exit the end closest to the street and pool, but not enter and get up to our third floor on that side. So we made many back and forths the length of the building upon coming back to our room. Very slow service at Marilyn's Cafe when we ate there, with just okay food. Pizza place pizza was so-so...very cheesey, rather bland and luke warm. Gift shop necessities forgotten are expensive. AM/PM and 7-11 are also next door for odds and ends. We enjoyed the pool area immensely most every day; warm water and not too busy. Another snufoo was cocktail waitress never asked if we wanted something to drink at the pool, and we weren't sleeping with our eyes closed either! Someone else didn't do their job, because one morning the gates were still locked at the pool at 10 a.m. It took quite awhile for someone to get on it and let all of us waiting in. Sun time was on the clock for us. The grounds and parking lot at times had some trash and broken glass not picked up. Our building had a huge pile of torn out carpeting sitting for the five days we were there at the bottom of the stairs right before where we'd exit....very tacky. I always had hopes it would be picked up before we left, but it unfortunately never was. The vending machine dispensed bottled water, when we tried to get pop twice. Getting a taxi to and from the airport and to Ceasar's colliseum ran approximately $10-$15. Otherwise, we didn't find the walk to the strip overwhelming, we're use to walking when traveling, and we women luckily weren't bothered at 2 a.m. We only got asked for change and saw a homeless person sleeping once. Celine Dion's show was totally awesome, but on the pricey like most of the higher end venues. Tip: There's really not a bad seat in the house, however a typical nosebleed section for the cheaper priced seats. To sum it up I'd say the grounds are very nice and rooms easy to get to from the parking lot. The price is affortable. I'm leaning towards trying another hotel next time I go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a great decision to stay at The Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: BigAnne
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Tuscany. As this was quite a long stay we were looking for accomodation that was not so expensive as some of the Strip hotels, and we had already stayed on the Strip for 4 previous trips and that was no longer important. plus it would give us more gambling (I mean spending money, just in case husband reads this). Read all the reviews good and bad on TA and decided to book here. What a great decision it was. We were all delighted with it. There was one small hitch, in that we had booked a room with poolview and balcony and we had no balcony. To be fair they did offer to move us to one with a balcony after 5 days, but when we saw which one it was to be we decided to stay put. The balcony was obscured by tree branches, and thought maybe it would be of no benefit. Anyway for 4 ladies to pack, move a couple of blocks and then unpack seemed to be too much of an upheaval. It took me long enough to pack my suitcase anyway! The room was great. Overlooking the pool, near to all the bars and restaurants and casino and only a short walk away from the road that takes you straight up to the Strip, which was only and 8-10 minute walk. As everyone had said before the rooms are huge! Plenty of room for all our things and still loads of space. Everything was really clean. There was a really relaxed atmosphere coming from the pool area everyday. When we were all getting ready each day we would have the windows open listening to the great music that was coming from the pool area. Relaxed around the pool only a couple of times during our stay, but that was because we had so much to do and also because it was so hot. All the staff were really friendly and it just seemed to be that much more personal than the hotels on the strip. Compared to most of the other hotels the casino was small (not tiny though) but I have to say that we did most of our winning here! So to me it is a great casino. Cocktail waitresses were really attentive and ffriendly, so were the waitresses in Marilyns Cafe, especially Maureen, she was great. All the guys on the bell desk were great, especially once they got to know us. Even though the hotel suites were running at full capacity most of the time we were there it was never crowded. We all had a fabulous holiday, and will definitely stay at the Tuscany Suites when we visit again next year. Cant wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: badhotel
Reviews.Content: 1. I found fecal matter in my bathtub after checking in - not very clean. 2. Package (flowers) delivered could not be found by the front desk and were actually with the bellhop. I need to call FTD to have FTD tell the front desk that the flowers were really there! 3. The battery on the lock failed. We had to walk to the front desk twice and call once after that to have someone come out and break into the room via a wire.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Eione
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in the Tuscany Suites for 2 nights, but found it quite satisfactory. The "new starter" on the check-in desk was a nightmare - she took a long time to book us in - we wanted to pay cash - she charged it to our credit card. Very inefficient and not customer friendly (attitude problem) - however the bellman and all the other staff we came across were very friendly and helpful. The suite in BlockB, ground floor, was spacious and clean. The location of Tuscany Suites is only a couple of blocks from the strip and near to Ballys, the Westin etc. We paid approx $183 (inc tax) for the 2 nights and consider this quite good value. The mexican restaurant La Cantina provided us with an excellent (very, very reasonable) meal and the Margaritas were good too. The waiter and the service were first class. We would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: QuiltingLindaK
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Tuscany Suites. We like the quiet compared to hearing people going in and out of the rooms all night at the strip hotels. We paid $49.00 per night which is an awesome deal! We stayed 4 nights. The beds are very comfortable, the room very large, and the kitchenette/refrigerator is great. It is also in a great location if you have a car. Parking is convenient and it's easy to drive to the parking lots of the major hotels ie Aladdin, Paris, Flamingo, MGM, etc. It is also across the street from some great restauants such as Bahama Breeze! The pool area is opening longer than the strip hotels so it makes it a great location if you want to get some nighttime pool time in which you can't get at the strip hotels. The casino is nice and clean and entertaining, the sports bar is very nice (not big) but cozy the staff in the sports bar are friendly. Front desk staff could be more friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A Value to be Treasured”
Reviews.Author: CCcoach
Reviews.Content: We "discovered" the Tuscany after several days of reading websites, reviews, etc. We could not be more pleased with the results of our seach. The rooms are large and well kept. The staff was friendly and efficient. The pool area was quiet and relaxing, a break from the hustle of the strip. We were in nonsmoking unit "J." It was quiet, convenient, and free of any smoke smell. Some who may have physical problems may feel that the less-than-ten-minute walk is demanding; however, we walked back and forth with absolutely no problems and did actually like the chance to get away from the strip. I even had a degree of success in the casino. At less than $90 a night with all taxes and fees, we found it to be a real value. We will book again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: rachel2006
Reviews.Content: We booked it from Vegas for 1 week stay in Aug. Average daily rate is about $80. Our room is in building H (or maybe I) on 1st floor. The room was nice and big, clean. Room service is standard. Separate toilet and bathroom is great since we have small kids and they always wanted to come in when you're there too :-)). We went to the pool almost everyday during our 1 wk stay. The pool is a nice size, plenty of laungers/chairs/tables which is a surprise----I had to tip to get a chair when I stayed at the much higher end Mandalay Bay/The Hotel. Never gambled in the hotel's casino but did take a look there. It's small but not so smokey. Pool side cafe is nice and clean with large tables. Location of the hotel is why it's much cheaper. It's about 2 blocks off the strip. We walked everywhere to the north and south of strip with no problems. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes. We stocked our fridge with beer, water, juice, yogurt, milk ... from the 7-11 store next to the corner gas station. 7-11 store's coffee is much better than the one from the hotel though, and cheaper. For food we ate at Ellis Island for 3 nights--great food at unbelievably low prices. Don't miss their $4.95 steak dinner with soup/salad every night. Their fried fish (cod filet) and fries basket is huge--enough for two for around $6.75. Ellis Island is next to the 7-11 store. these are all within a block. Free parking. For other nights we ate at: the World Buffet at Rio ($27.99/pp. $21/child), good food but a bit over priced. RedHotBlue restaurant at the Mandalay Bay is standard, don't try their baked chicken it's just too bad. Their spaghetti with meatball is excellent for about $15. Make sure you have breakfast at Mandalay's Bayside Buffet at least once--great food, large varieties, quick service, smoked salmon every day ....hmmmmmm yummy. We pretty much used the Tuscany hotel as a base and ventured out during the day, only go back to sleep at Tuscany at night. Who wants to stay in a hotel all day in Vegas anyway? All in all, the Tuscany is a good value. Check in check out is quick and smooth. Only down side to us is that there's not enough big trash cans in the rooms. I recommend Tuscany to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our new hotel of choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: carolwen
Reviews.Content: All the pluses of this property outweighed any disappointments we may have had. Things we liked: Moderate price; a well maintained pool area with warm water and all the towels one could want; a short walk to the pool, casino or anything on the property from our non-smoking first floor unit in "F" with "no search" parking spots right outside the door; easy auto access to Flamingo Road both directions making it very easy to drive to any of the dozen other casinos we visited; very easy access to airport or downtown from Paradise Road, walking distance to Bally's corner; walking distance to Terribles 2 for 1 $5.38 breakfast buffet; friendly poker room with two tournaments daily; late night bargain breakfast at Marilyn's Cafe; fitness center with lap pool; good Mexican food with 2 for one welcome meal; huge suite rooms with table and chairs, microwave, frig, couch, walk-in shower; separate tub, separate stool. Battery was low in the safe and repair was there almost before I got back to the room. Disappointments: Wi-fi is overly expensive at $10 per day, but dial-up is still available at $1 per connection; door lock occasionally stuck and had to be retried; ice machine on our floor was not working (other two floors had ice); phone jack at desk did not work. (We didn't request repair for any of these items before checkout.) Unless you are used to the concierge level of the Wynn or Venetian, you will be well satisfied with the Tuscany. Given availability and competitive prices we wil probably make this our base hotel in Las Vegas from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: lisaanddenny
Reviews.Content: booked through expedia.com, GREAT PRICE. This hotel was VERY clean, the restaurants were very clean and nice, especially the restaurant in the lobby, Tuscany Gardens. As for the slots, well, if you put money into the slots and expect to win, your in fantasy land, I am not a gambler, I think any slot machine is rip off, not one is better than the other. I would definately recommend this hotel, rooms are very large and very clean, we were in room B219, I booked 3 rooms and the others with me were very satisfied, the desk people were not rude, very professional. Parking is great, the place is off the strip, if your healthy and can walk you can walk to Ballys but if your older with any ailment, it would be a long walk, we rented a van, so we were fine. For those who complain about pincher bugs and spiders, COME ONE, you have got to be kidding me, that made me laugh. Anyway , feel free to email me with questions, I travel a lot and this place would definately be on my list to go again!! I have an income that could easliy afford Bellagio/Ceasers, but why on earth would you pay $300+ per night and all you get is a bed????????????????????????????????????

Reviews.Title: “Good deal off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: lilandyprods
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this suite hotel over Labor Day weekend and was pleasantly surprised. We were allowed to check-in one hour early and it went smoothly and quickly. The rooms are very large and sparsely decorated. They could use some color on the walls and some better quality furniture. The bathroom was especially boring, although large with a separate bathtub and shower. Shower had little water pressure and was cheaply made. Beds were comfortable. Ate at Marilyn's and the staff was pleasant with adequate food for the price. Was able to walk to the strip from the hotel. Only gambled a little at the Tuscany Casino because several reviews on this site indicated the slots were tight. I immediately lost the money put into one machine and decided to heed reviewers reports. The place was definitely worth the price and I would stay again. I would make sure to stay again on the 3rd floor. Have a feeling other floors would hear footsteps above. Air conditioner worked well, however, kept turning on and off during the evening and was extremely loud as it did so. WAs a motel air conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: poohpooh
Reviews.Content: There was absolutely nothing I liked about this hotel. The check in was quick but the worker was rude. The picture on the website was accurate but very deceptive. The beds were uncomfortable and falling apart. I killed a spider and pincher bug during my stay. The buildings were not secure at all on Saturday night when I got the feeling there was a party in every building. I would consider this a motel not a hotel. You won't see me back here and I will not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “las vegas hidden secret gem”
Reviews.Author: KENKIM
Reviews.Content: just returned from spending a week in Las vegas staying at the Tuscany suites after researching customer reviews on Tripadvisor. The complex was easy to navigate with more than adequate facilities ,nice pool area ,rooms were clean and tidy and some of the largest we have stayed in,Not like most strip hotels staff were more than helpful , would almost have no problem staying there again ,thouroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family”
Reviews.Author: Jetset8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Tuscany 8-15-06. I had been there last year for a convention with 2 friends. I had originally picked this hotel, because it wasn't a high rise. One friend can't ride elevators. Three levels is the highest each building has. She could still climb the stairs! We weren't in the room much , but it definitly was a great roomy room, with a big bathroom. So I decided to try it again with my family (6 & 10 yr old). My husband actually liked it. The pool had plenty of lounge chairs, you didn't have to go and try and reserve one like other big hotels. Great pool side bar service, I think only on weekends. You can park your car right outside the building. Nice if you have lots to take to the room. (especially with kids) Nice big roomy gym, with a lap pool behind it. And a 5-8 min walk to strip.You are then at the corner of Ballys, Bellagio, Ceaser Palace & Flamingo Hotels. We walked to Bellagio to see "O" (A must SEE!) You're definitely right by everything. Across the street from the Tuscany is Lawrys Restaurant.(our favorite) And quite a few more nice restaurants that you could easily drive or take alittle walk to. I think the best thing about the Tuscany is , you just don't have the hassle of a huge hotel. (pool area, parking, casino, crowds) They have a nice Casino adjacent, but you never have to walk through it to get some where like most hotels. The only down falls is as stated before, the room is huge & they have 2 DOUBLE beds(not queens)or 1 king & they don't tell you that there are no utensils, plates or pans for the kitchenette.( I didn't notice last year) Doesn't make sense? How can you utilize the stove top?(with kids hungry all the time this is a plus) There are cups for the coffee machine & the microwave is good & a good size refrig. Plenty of cabinet space.(for food items) With a nice eating (kitchen) table. They need to inform people so they can take advantage of what's being offered. (but then maybe they want you to have to eat at their restaurants, hummm makes sense now!) We walked around the corner to am/pm and got a box of spoons & forks, drinks etc. We definitely will go back, and I have already recommeded Tuscany. ( I'll be prepared with all my supplies next time!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ARTravelers
Reviews.Content: Because it was not on the Strip, we tried hard to find something wrong with this place. Nope, it is great. Will definitely stay there again. The room was huge, clean and well stocked. Ate a couple of times on site at Tuscany Gardens and Marilyn's Place, both were good, good service, reasonable prices. Casino was down the hall from hotel but you do not have to go there or even through there if you don't want. Pool is large and cool even though the outside temps were 106. Bus stops right in front provided easy access to the Strip, Fremont and Outlet Mall. ONLY weak spot we found was the concierge. Read any of the tourist magazines and you will get more information.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: naper1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in June and found the experience to be pleasant. The good: The rooms are huge and clean. Great for a family. We could also park our car near the building. It was easy to get in and out of our rooms. We did not have to cut through the casino to do this. The pool wasn't the biggest but it was nice. The not so good: The rooms only have double beds (no queen beds). I can't figure this out because the rooms are huge. You can request a room with a fold out sofa bed though. Also, the location is not right on the strip. That is ok though, just drive and park in one of the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lioness64
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed 5 nights at the Tuscany. The rooms are huge, and with two children with us, it was great. The staff at the front desk were prompt and the bell staff helped us with Taxi's or Limo's efficiently. We basically used the hotel to sleep and relax in, and were out and about most of the day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: powdahsdad
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand some of the bad reviews of The Tuscany that I have read. We arrived at 10 am. on a Saturday and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, they got us a room within minutes. When we arrived in our room we found that the beds had not been made and that the refrigerator was not working, there also was no microwave. I made a call to the frontdesk during what I'm sure is a very busy time of the day and it seemed like as soon as i hung up the phone the head housekeeper was at our door with a maitanence guy and they were very apologetic and fixed everything promptly. We stayed for 7 days and that was the only thing i could possibly complain about. Everything was very clean and we could not find a single cockroach, I was looking after reading a previous review! The food and service in the restaurants was GREAT! We ate at Ellis Island the 1st day and the food was not that good and the service was beyond terrible, however the beer was great. The casino is nice in the way that it is not even close to crowded and if you join the players club the points are very generous and add up VERY FAST! We had a room in the back of the property in L block and it was extremely quiet. over all I would strongly recomend The Tuscany you cant beat the value and if you do encounter problems you just deal with the staff in a civilized manner and they are very helpful and simpathetic to your needs. Bravo Tuscany!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: magsw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 adult daughters for 4 nights in July we arrived late at night and the staff were great we had a 1 bedroom suite at the front of the property it was huge and had a huge bathroom also just what you need for 3 ladies there was avery nice pool area with towels provided always plenty of sunbeds there was abit of a mixup with our check out date but the duty manager sorted it out and gave us complimentary breakfast for the inconvenience was just 5 mins walk to the strip opposite Caesars Palace ....would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: mrssweets
Reviews.Content: my husband and i went to vegas to get married. we wanted to make it as special and memorable as possible( it was). neither of us have ever been to las vegas before, but we knew we didn't want to stay at a mega property. we wanted something small, low-key, with grounds to walk...we like to walk holding hands( aahhh). we didn't want alot of noise, lights and glitz.... we wanted tranquil, elegant and peaceful...we got that and a reggae band by the pool. the room over looked the pool, it was spacious and very clean. the resturant's where good, the front desk very helpful ( i needed help with my veil... 10 minutes to the limo, i'm not ready , I scream down stairs for help and this wonderful girl came to the door, fixed my veil, told me i looked beautiful and sent me on my way . don't know her name but she's fifty bucks richer......) as for the casino...my only complaint is that the bartender that night almost ruined my dress by spilling my drink...very lucky man. he bought us around of drinks to apoligize and to congratulate us. the only gambling we did was on the roulette table, we played 24.....8/24/05 is our wedding day..i guess you could say we gambled on each other and a hotel we never saw....THE BEST TWO BETS I EVER MADE..AMB

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: jcmh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at start of holiday and loved it so much stayed again at the end of it. Rooms were really big, we heard no noise and slept like babies. Room clean, bathroom had bath and shower and was really good size. Towels were perfectly fine. Hotel staff were friendly. pool area was great always clean and tidy, and always a sun bed if you could stand the heat. Would definately stay again and would recommend to friends for its convenience to the strip. Much better here than getting lost in the massive hotels on the strip and lots cheaper. Had its own casino but we did not use it. Also Grand Canyon is a must do and so is visit to the ranch and horse ride.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: egremont
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from 22 June to 25 June 2006. Hotel was better than we thought it would be.Check in went smoothly and our room was very big! No complaints at all about it,we were in Block C. Bar in hotel was very good and we also ate in the restaurant which was good too.Breakfast in Marilyn's was very good too! Pool and its area was nicely done with trees and grass and we had no trouble getting a lounger and it was great having a pool bar..Can't comment on casino although we did go in and have a look,always busy! Ideal location off Strip even though there was an excessive heat warning whilst we were there! Can also recommend Olives at the Ballagio for a meal which was superb! Hotel was good value for money,all staff were friendly,no complaints.Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Attention Cheap Rooms With Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Tuscany for 3 nights. The rooms are huge and a very reasonable price. They have a pool, a gym, and a casino, but who wants to use there casino when there are about 50 other casinos that are much better. We arrived kind of late around 9pm which was okay with the hotel staff. Check-in was a breeze, although the staff isn't very friendly. We were given a room in the D building which was like walking through a maze to get from the hotel lobby to your room. Once we finally made it to the room we walked and my first thought was OH MY GOD THIS ROOM IS HUGE!. My room however did not have a microwave, just a fridge with no utensils. It's about a 10 minutes to the strip, but when it's 100 degrees outside it kind of feels like a 30 minute walk. Of course you can cut through ballys to get to the north side of the strip, but if you want to go to the southside you have to bare the heat. We went to the pizza restaurant once and the staff was not very polite. No thank you no nothing. So after that one incident we decided to eat outside of the hotel. When it was time to check out we decided to keep the room until 6pm because our plane wasn't leaving until 10pm. So that cost us a extra 30 bucks, which isn't that bad. So we went to walk the strip and came back around 4pm and the key wouldn't work. So I had to go stand in the long line to get the situation straightened out. I would never stay at this hotel again. If your really broke and looking for a extra cheap hotel then stay here but other then that I would recommend a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the budget traveler but be wary”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg-1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 2-3 star hotel - a budget hotel with spacious grounds. The rooms are large. The grounds immense. Decorations are simple and the grounds manicured. Though both are showing signs of wear. The resort is just a short walk to the strip - Bally's. For the price, it could be a nice stay for the budget traveler especially those with a family or looking to stay out of the casino/hotels. Free parking close to your room is a plus compared to the distance you have to walk in the large hotels. (As posted earlier - leave your stuff in the car, go check-in, then drive to the parking area near your room.) Our stay was filled with problems. First we were sent to a room that was locked or would not open - right next to the elevator. You could feel the floor rumbling as the elevator moved. We trucked all our stuff back to the lobby (thank goodness we were traveling light) and were told they would send someone up to see why we could not get in - it might take a while. I asked for another room instead of waiting - away from the elevator (I remember reading someone else's review about the noise residing next to the elevator). We were able to get in to our room (not in the same building as before but not near the elevator) but it was not made up. A call to guest services - we could either change rooms again or housekeeping would be sent. We opted for the former - housekeeping was completed within the hour. The rooms are large including the bathroom. It was nice to have a separate shower and tub. There is a kitchenette but no supplies - sort of defeats the purpose of having a stove in the room but the fridge, microwave and coffee pot ( there were no cups other than plastic cups in the bathroom) could be helpful to most travelers. Although neat, the place needs a deep cleaning and maintenance. My feet were black from walking barefoot on the carpet and things like hooks to hang towels were loose. Some of the towels were stained and had hair stuck to them -though you could tell they had been washed. The lampshades kept falling down when we touched the lamps but they were quickly righted - held on with magnets. The TV has very few channels (about 6) so traveling with kids could be a problem. We did have a non-smoking room which really was smoke-free. The walls were thin - you could here surrounding noise but luckily the buildings are small and there is not a lot of traffic in the hall or outside between the buildings. The lobby is smokey since the bar is right night to the entrance and reception desk. We did not use the restaurants, the pool or the gym. The casino was not crowded and we were able to pay a long time on the machines on the initial wagers with little money lost. I cashed out at around my initial wager from boredom after nearly 1/2-1 hour of playing on the same machine (a few times). On checkout my bill contained a charge that we did not make. The rep who initially "helped" me indicated it would take about 20+ minutes to sort out and did I still want to dispute it (and wait). That answer was completely unacceptable to me and I asked to speak with the manager. The supervisor quickly zeroed out my account indicating accounting would pull the receipt to match the signature and sort it out - I did not have to wait. Unknown if this will be a problem - too soon to tell. We will not be staying here again. However for those who want a motel near the strip at a very affordable price for Vegas - this is a good deal with all the budget motels and hotels disappearing - especially such a close walk to the center of the strip. There are many people who have had great vacations here from the reviews and they did address our problem with check-in however they should not have occurred in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel Depends on What you Want”
Reviews.Author: PBLiving
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Tuscany Suite on 7/2/06 because the other hotel we had was booked. Tuscany Suites is 2 long blocks from the Strip...not far walking distance but could be miserable if it is very hot. The rooms are huge, in fact I think they are unnecessarily big. There is alot of unused space in the main living area and in the bathroom. If you are travelling with children or alot of luggage the space will be good. The rooms have a coffee maker, a small fridge and a microwave. But there are no utencils or glasses, just 2 plastic cups. The rooms are the linens in the room are plain, think HoJo. But for the price, it is what I expected. The pool is smaller than the picture looked. There were not enough seats or lounge chairs at the pool. I had asked the front desk for one, but they said all of them where already out. So my husband and I could not lay by the pool. There where alot of splashing children in the pool too, so we did not want to sit in it and relax. There is a bar by the pool, but it was not open, which suprised me since it was a holiday weekend. The room was fine for one night. I would not want to stay there for any extended period of time, but for a night or 2 it was OK. There was wireless internet access in the rooms, but you had to pay 9.95 for 24 hours. There is a rather large gym, which I used and a lap pool. We ate at the pizza place for lunch, and it was not very good. We gambled at the casino (Played craps) and won some money. The casino is nice in that it is cheap and not crowded. So in summary, if you need an economical and clean place to stay, this hotel is good. If you are looking for a resort type atmosphere, this is not the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “good stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2camp
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Tuscany and I can say that I would recommend it to those who want to stay “off the strip” for a great price. The room was HUGE! The photos on the home page of this site are accurate of the room’s size. As far as checking in, we arrived on a Sunday afternoon. There was no line or any problems. However, we were given a handicap accessible room. There were no signs on the door, but it had a fold-up seat and hand shower in the tub. It also had a walk-in shower. The toilet was in the open in the bathroom, not in a separate room as described by others. BUT, the room was clean and nice. We were in Building “A” which is the closest to the corner of the property by the roadway. Our walk to the strip took 15 minutes. That was to the corner of Flamingo & L.V. Blvd. It took 11 minutes to get to the rear doors of Bally’s and walk thru their air conditioned casino. Bally’s is also connected to the Paris casino and you can use their a/c to get a little further down the strip. The sidewalk between the Tuscany and Koval is closed due the construction of the Platinum, but there is space to safely walk along the roadway behind the large orange cones. We did it over & over. I missed the bus stop across the street, but there is one between Koval & Bally’s coming back toward the Tuscany. The casino at the Tuscany is not recommended. The waitress service in non-existent. I had to stage a “sit-in” at the roulette table to get a drink. I was the only one there! I told the dealer that I wasn't playing until the waitress came by and brought me a drink. The casino floor manager came over after the dealer called him, and he got a waitress from another station to bring me a drink after I threatened to cash out and go elsewhere. As others have said, don’t miss the Ellis Island Casino next door on Koval. They have their own brewery and their beers are great. I liked the light beer the best; however the amber ale was very good. And, they have their own brewed Root Beer. I know, you didn’t go to Vegas to drink a Root Beer, but it’s good anyway. The waitresses at Ellis Island make a pass about every 5 minutes, so order a light and a root beer! Be sure to tip her! You can belly up to the bar and get the same beers for only $1 anytime. Their steak special (10 oz sirloin $4.95) is really good. We were in town 6 days and ate it 3 times! Get there before 6pm or the wait is very long. We waited 1 hour & 15 mins once, 30 mins, then went for lunch and was seated immediately. I won at their video blackjack machine every time we went there (while waiting & drinking their great beer) and basically ate free! I didn’t try their BBQ, but it sure smelled good and the line was long. Others complained about the service at the Tuscany. I had to get security to come open the safe so that I could use it. It took them about 5 minutes to get to the room from the time I called. We also had a problem with the door entering the bldg. We walked to the front desk and by the time we made it back to the room, security was there resetting the door lock. I have no complaints about their service. My wife is very cold natured. We would at times turn the room a/c off to get the room to warm up. We were on the 1st floor and that may have contributed to that. We would turn it on after she was comfortable and it would cool the room down very fast. We ate the after midnight special at Marilyn’s. The waitress wasn’t a happy camper and was fairly grumpy. She walked up to the table and sarcastically said “I guess you want the special”. The food was ok. We got a 6oz steak, 2 eggs & hash browns for $2.99. We didn’t make it to the workout room (HA!) so I didn’t see the lap pool. We did go to the outside pool one day and it was nice. The “hot tub” next to it had powerful jets and the water was hot. We did not eat at any of the other restaurants at the Tuscany, nor did we go to the bar, so I can't comment on them. I would probably return to the Tuscany if I go back to Vegas. It was a good stay for a great price. Mark S. Baton Rouge, LA

Reviews.Title: “Like cockroaches and unhelpful staff?”
Reviews.Author: Sn0wh1te
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the tuscany. The first couple of times we had no problems since the hotel was new and they were trying to get established and develop a good reputation. This third visit was a major disappointment. Our first night's stay, after coming back from a night out in Vegas, we saw a disease infested cockroach running around in the livingroom area. We called the front desk to notify of our concerns and request to change rooms, however, only got the operator who said would relay the message to the front desk and send someone out. Never got a call back nor did anyone come to our suite. Since it was late, the front desk was a far walk from our suite and we were so tired, we decided to just wait until the morning. I took a shower the next morning and what do you know? I've got company! Another cockroach that was even bigger than the one I saw the night before. It was crawling all over my toiletries and luckily I saw it before picking it up. Ok, so now I was grossed out, upset that they have no cares about their guests, and had to complain again...My friend called the front desk 3 times to complain, spoke with the lady who would speak with the manager onsite named Juan, but each time they would have to call us back. The manager did not want to speak with us at all. No progress was being made, we're supposed to be on vacation, can't go about our day because of this issue, and 2 hours have passed. I finally called a fourth time, got Juan the manager, and he didn't seem to want to attend to our concerns. I insisted that we be compensated somehow for the inconvenience and he said he would just transfer me back to the front desk to change rooms, but instead hung up on me! That was really unprofessional and rude of him! Never even got an apology! A good reputation is very important especially when it comes to business and customer service. Tuscany has such a bad reputation now, they don't care about their customers if there are any concerns or problems and the rooms are not as clean as they used to be. They will be hearing from the department of health soon. Just read some of the past complaints and the one I've written and hope you'd reconsider about staying here. If you're on vacation, you expect at least decent service. I just takes one wrong thing to happen and if they don't even want to be of help, you're vacation is ruined! All I can say is that when I complained at check out, one of the employees, who was the only one I could really get to comprehend us, agreed with me that we should have been compensated well, most other hotels would just comp. you for the evening as well as change rooms ASAP for the inconvenience. He thinks the manager was poor in his dealings with our concerns. That tells me alot about the management there. Tuscany won't last if they keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bearhug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nts and loved it. Huge room with refridgerator and coffee maker (unusual for Las Vegas). Short walk to the Strip or use the CAT bus.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Tamaria
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Tuscany to a front desk with 2 people working and a line. Was informed no more non smoking rooms were available (which we booked a month in advance) and was given a handicaped non-smoking room. Did not have microwave or stove as stated so we had to request a microwave. The room overall was okay, carpet a bit stained and a ring around the tub, but otherwise good. The cable .... leaves a lot to be desired...maybe 10 channels and no HBO. The carry out was very reasonable and the food was tasty. Casino workers were friendly for the most part, especially the ones behind the bar. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just return from a fantastic week at the Tuscany Suites. As everybody indicated, it is the best secret in Vegas. The hotel is close to the Strip so you can walk but it also has a bus stop in front of the hotel for those who prefered transportation. The rooms are huge and the hotel has all the facilities. My only complaint is for the Marylin's Cafe (the only 24 hrs dinner at the hotel) that did not have enough people to support the mid-night crowd. Other than that the place is excellent for those who wants to be close enough to the srtrip without the crowds, noise, etc. that the strip has.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hide Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a party of about 30 people. I could not ask for a nicer place. You don't even have to leave the Tuscany everything is right there. Good food, clean pools,nice casino,bars,exercise building and lap pool.Parking was a breeze ,no long walks to get to your room.Beautiful landscapeing lots of trees. Everything was clean. The rooms are large enough to live in. Its more like staying at a condo.I will never stay anywhere else unless I win a free trip. One tip do not place your Key card near your cell phone or any other card it will erase ,They need to hand out plastic covers to keep them in. Mine erased 3 times and it was embarressing trying to get into the building and my room at 3am.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a non smoking 2 double beds room and altough we were amomng the first ones to check in, we ended up with a smoking King bed. The worst part is that the staff at the front desk would lie to you boldly and tell you thatt these rooms are non smoking. They wait till you check the room and then agree that this is a smoking room. We were a party of four families and they played that game with all of us. We all ended up in different corners of the hotel in spite of being the first ones in line. It was very disappointing and we had paid over $200 a nite which is pricey for this hotel. (This was Memorial Weekend). We would never stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: redsquirrel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany Suites for a week (30th April) with a group of 13. It was ideal for our group as the hotel is small compared to most in Vegas which meant that it was easy for us to meet up and bump into each other. For those on a budget its a great choice, unlike most hotels you don't have to go through the Casino to get to your room which is a definite plus. 10 min alk to the strip. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable - our wardrobe doors were broke but we didn't bother to report it, rooms which are nearest the road can be noisy - especially if you are trying to catch up on sleep!Theres a small but attractive pool and Marilyns cafe was a godsend - open 24hrs and reasonably priced. Concierge was very helpful when booking Grand Canyon trips and got us a good discount. Grand Canyon is a must - we were recommended a company called Maverick - we were told safety is high on their list so we decided to go with them - you can get cheaper but it was worth the extra money. We went for the trip that lands in the canyon then brings you back over the strip at sunset fabulous!!!! Another great venue is the Voodoo lounge 51 floors up 0 an open air club on top of the Rio Hotel well worth a visit! If you want to blow the budget book a table at The Mix at Mandalay Bay - ask for a table outside and be there for sunset - amazing food, service and venue(but not cheap - about $120 each)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: marysmith1
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Tuscany. Big room with a fridge and microwave & stove There are no utensils or cutlery in the room so come prepared. Stayed in N block which is right at the back of the complex. Top floor room got very warm and airconditioner was too noisy to have on while sleeping. That for me was the only negative. There is a 7/11 around the corner, a grocery store down the block and Ellis Island casino next door does a great steak deal for $4.95 that is not on the menu.. just ask. I didnt try any of the restaurants at Tuscany. The walk to the block is no big deal. Its one block to the back of Ballys, to either walk through the casino in the airconditioning to the strip or to catch the Monorail. To me it felt the same distance as walking to my room from the front desk. The latest I walked back from the strip was 10pm but there were alot of people around and I felt safe. Front desk helpful and there is Internet access on site in the business centre although it may be cheaper to go to a Internet cafe it was handy to have there. It was nice to get away from the masses of people on the strip. The hotel hosts alot of meetings and conventions. Would stay there again next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive hotel room near the strip and Tuscany Suites proved to be an excellent choice. The resort is only a few years old and the rooms are huge. I would classify Tuscany Suites as a high class budget property. There are about 10 buildings within the complex, each three floors, looks similar to a nice condo complex. For those with a car, you can park near your room without having to walk through the casino. The room I stayed in had a small fridge, microwave, sink, and grill. The only drawback to Tuscany Suites is that the walls are rather thin. If you are a light sleeper you might want to sleep on the top floor. And its too far to walk from Tuscany to the strip during the hot summer months. But overall, if you don't need to be on the strip at one of the megaresorts, Tuscany Suites is an excellent alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: jodi090801
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas about once a month and love the Tuscany. The rooms are large, the pool is great and it's easy to get to. The strip is only about a mile away. Great restraunts across the street (Try Bahama Breeze). Definately a great price and a great casino. They just put in a poker room too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany as part of a large group. Upon arrival at around 7PM we were told that we had no reservation. After supplying a valid confirmation number I was told that their computers crashed the day I made the reservation and they had no record of it. They did give us a room at the group rate we had been promised, but when I made the original reservation I requested two double beds because we had four people staying. The room they gave us was a king room and had a single bed. This is when the problems started. My wife called the front desk, was told that rooms are on a first come first served basis and there were no double rooms left. Although we had reserved two double beds we had not previously been "assigned" a room and therefore could not have a double room. They say this is standard practice; however others in our group that came after us were given double bed rooms. My wife then requested to talk to the night manager and was transferred to his voicemail. She hung up, called the front desk again and was greeted by the same employee who was laughing and carrying on a separate conversation. She explained that she was trying to contact the night manager and had just been transferred to his voicemail. The employee laughed and told her that the manager was right there and gave the phone to him. After some pressure the night manager said he would send us a rollaway bed. We complained that one rollaway would still leave one of our daughters to sleep on the floor. After he refused to do anything else for us and hung up I walked to the front desk (we were in one of the remote buildings, it was a long walk) to talk to the manager face to face. He then told us he'd be sending a "full size rollaway" but could not send two; it would be against fire code. When the rollaway arrived it was a twin size bed. When I called the front desk to complain they refused to answer the phone, I left it ringing for 10 minutes and no answer. I called from my cell phone, one ring to an operator, two rings to the front desk. Apparently they didn't care to talk to us. I was told that another bed would be sent immediately and would be in our room in 15 minutes. By this time it was after 8:30PM and my children were hungry. We waited 25 minutes then went to dinner. Upon returning from dinner around 10PM we found no bed had been delivered. Again I called the front desk, no answer. I walked to the front desk and was told that the bed was requested and would be requested again. At 10:30PM we received the second bed (and apparently violated fire code for the rest of our stay). The morning we checked out I voiced my concerns to the person checking us out; she didn't seem to care and told me to fill out a comment card. She would not give me information regarding the hotel owner/operator, only the name of the front desk manager and a flyer with the address where I should send the comment card. This is a nice hotel, big spacious rooms, nice facilities and the Mexican restaurant has good food and an excellent staff. It's unfortunate that the employees at the hotel do not care to help their guests and go out of their way to cause problems. I thought for sure the day staff would be concerned at the behavior of their night staff but they seemed to think it was business as usual. In a place like Vegas where there are so many places to stay you'd think service would be important to them but apparently it's not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: SandraP3
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a week and the worst thing I can say is that the pillows were uncomfortable. The room was great-very large-2 doubles, kitchenette w/eating area/couch and chairs/very large bathroom w/separate tub/shower/toilet area. Had our choice of floors-we took 2nd-Bldg C. Cleaning staff was very good, desk people very helpful, the guys ourside the front door almost too helpful as they take your bags as soon as you hit the door or get in the car. Good answering questions. It's about a 15 minute walk to the strip but bus from Bally's ($1.25) to the hotel. From the hotel to strip little trickier as the bus picks up on opposite side of highway and to get across at a crosswalk (a must do) you have to walk up or down a block. Not a bad walk though you do have to cross 2 very busy roads-just use the crosswalk and go with the lights. Monorail stop at strip straight up from the hotel. Ate here a couple of times and food was average but acceptable. Won big at the casino but person I was with only won small. Luck of the draw. Lots of tables and slots. Good coupon book when you sign up for players card. Would highly recommend unless you want to be right on the strip. The walk up from the hotel puts you right in the middle of the strip action. Would gladly answer questions about Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Understand the Hype”
Reviews.Author: chheal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscany during President's weekend. We did get a great rate of $89 per night. (Sunday - Monday nights.) But, while we got a great rate, the room was just OK. The bed was worn, the bathroom had loose floor tiles, and the bathtub had seen better days. Overall, the room was what I would call mostly clean. There was a refrigerator and a hot plate. But, there were no dishes, pans, or utensils of any type. The location is a comfortable ten minute walk to the strip. With a major construction project going on next door, the street feels less safe than it probably is. It has been years since I stayed at a hotel on the strip, so maybe my perspective is different than many of the other reviewers. But, I think the hotel is a great deal when the strip is crowded and expensive and a no so great deal when you can get a reasonable price right on the strip. The room was quiet, despite seeing a large number of teens running around the halls. We would stay at the Tuscany again, but as a bargain, not as a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “tuscany was tops!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i wanted to stay in a hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and the tuscany was the best priced hotel the room was huge had everything we needed the bathroom facilities were great and the room was nice and clean everyday went into the casino a couple of times but we aren't big gamblers the concierge was lovely she helped us with our trip to the grand canyon was real helpful i'd recommend this place to everyone real nice place

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Tuscany from 2/4/06 through 2/8/06. We enjoyed every minute. It was superbowl weekend and the Strip was PACKED.It was very nice to be able to get away from the conjested feeling of the Strip. The Tuscany is close enough to walk to the Strip yet far enough away to be comfortable. We ate at the Steakhouse at Camelot in Excalibur, Smith and Wollensky and the Tuscany Gardens Restaurant (inside the Tuscany) and both my husband and I agreed that Tuscany Gardens had the best steak and the best prices! A couple of travelers commented that they couldn't understand the workers at the Tuscany and although alot of their accents are "thick" they were all EXTREMELY nice to us and went out of their ways to accomodate our needs. We will definately stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: 40something2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort, 2/3 - 2/5/06. Picked this place because I was staying with my mother and soon to be sister-in-law. Came up for the weekend to make wedding reception arrangements at Excalibur and to have a little fun. Didn't realize until after booking that it was Superbowl weekend....strip very crowded. This is a nice place, more resort looking with individual 3 story buildings. Reminded me of a timeshare. We arrived early from our flight about 9:30 am....asked if a room was available but fully expected to just check our stuff with valet until after 2pm. They had a room available.
