Unfortunately, it was in the "south 40" as the farthest building from the lobby, pool, casino... We didn't really care but when we got to the room the door wouldn't open. The light was green but no matter how hard we pushed it was like it was dead bolted from the inside. So we decided to hoof it back to the lobby. We told the front desk lady that the door wasn't opening and told her it was like someone might still be in there. She said that she would send security with us back to the room?!!!!!??? I told her that "no I dont' think so and that I shouldn't be subjected to confronting someone who might still be in the room"! In any case, we asked to be moved up closer to the lobby and that we would be back in the afternoon to check it. We walked to Ballys (strip)...not too bad for 2 blocks. Ballys had pretty loose slots. I hit $260 quarter jackpot...not too bad for the first 10 minutes I was there. After Bally's, Paris and Excalibur, we made our way back to the Tuscany to try and get our room. They were able to accomodate us in the "H" building, which is the one directly behind the pool and closest to lobby, resturants, bar and casino. We had a good view of the pool and grounds. Rooms very spacious. The room had 2 queens and was supposed to be a couch bed but wasn't so they sent up a roll away at no charge. There was a refrigerator and coffee maker but no microwave. I'm sure they would of sent one up if we asked because I think the rooms are supposed to have them. Since we only were here for 2 days, didn't bother asking. All in all, I would stay here again. Everyone very friendly except one of the girls at front desk and the lady working in gift shop. Oh, special mention to the two guys working the bar Friday night, you both were the best and we had fun sitting there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Casino Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this casino/hotel January 2006. Casino staff were very friendly, especially at the black jack tables. Price of food in the 24 hour cafe was very reasonable. Rooms were large and clean except the shower had mold in the tile grout. There is no shuttle to the strip. Best to have a rental car. You could walk to the strip but it is two very long blocks away. We were on the first floor; could hear people walking and moving about on second floor. Suggest you request top floor so you won't have to deal with the noise. Reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Camping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Finally got around to writing the review now that it's post holiday. Accommodations were very nice. Staff try and make an effort to accommodate. Can't give excellent rating since this is not a full service hotel but it is well above average expectations for an extended stay type of hotel. Thanks to reviews on Trip Advisor, we were prepared for our stay. Brought a messkit for easy cooking in the kitchen. Hopped over to the corner gas/marts for snacks and easy cook stuff. Brought own hot drink mixes and "add water" breakfast kits so getting a quick breakfast in the morning made things fast and easy. Got convenient bus pass ($5? buy on board) and hopped aboard across the street. I agree with other reviewers that food at the resort is not something I want to spend money on. One crusty dry dinner at $30 each person was enough money wasted. Service was excellent but it doesn't satisfy hunger. Nor can I recommend the less than average packaged lunches from the breakfast shop. First bus stop at the Flamingo down the road and Caeser's are way better food options plus they have very pretty exotic birds to look at. The Paris casino seemed most moderate and convenient for an insomniac like me to get excellent crepes and french fare at any hour. Bus passes are good for 24 hours. If you eat at their streetside restaurant, outdoor seating gets you a front row view of the Bellagio fountains which was fantastic at night. Only 2-3 repeats of the same song during the company's 4 hour french dinner. Plus the human wildlife parading past on the sidewalks once nightlife starts kicking in is fairly interesting. Enjoyed the large suite and kitchenette. Pool was fine and jacuzii had wide range of jets and plenty of room. I recommend sport towels. Pool towels were quite rough and thin. Rooms are spacious, separate bath areas convenient and well lit. Having an upstairs apt/suite was great except for some construction for the first day in the hallway. The adjacent building under construction started their workday at 4am. After the first time, attitude was if you can't beat them, join them. Hence early morning exploration of the Paris casino since sleeping was out of the question. Since many of the casinos have a virtual outdoor theme, one can always pretend to be in some other country while taking in the amusement factor. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Overheard many guests note one or two things that needed fixing which the staff took care of although some required 2-3 attempts like keys in our building. Got to know neighbors since we had to help each other get into the building when keys didn't work.:+) hahahha. Only people who were actually rude were other guests trying to market their products while I was waiting in the lobby. This is not the Ritz, it's an extended stay hotel so guests should be able to manage for themselves to a certain extent. If you have a problem, then at least let staff know how they can help you resolve the problem. Bring a mess kit $5 to $10 or a microwavable kit $2 if you want to use the kitchenette. It can always be disposed or donated to a friend at the end of your stay. Note to Newbies, never use styrofoam to heat food in the microwave. Our stay here was for business with a little time off. I'd like to return and use this as a base of exploration. There is beatiful canyon country to explore within 20-45 minutes drive, tons of virtual exploration adventures within the city and other entertainment. One place close by lets people experience parachuting without having to jump out of a plane. Basically, a guest hovers over a jet engine so it feels like falling but it's safe. If you just want to experience dizziness, take in the 3D movies (10 min) at the M&M Factory/Store Museum. Their rolling barrel of M&Ms that you walk through to get to the theater is loads of tizzy dizzy fun. There were three very more than happy ladies singing and having a great time during my visit. It was a nice stop before returning to the hotel on the bus. Next time, an internet car rental will be taken care of first. During our stay here, a city event jacked up car rentals to 300% of normal pricing. That made us change plans to explore the canyon country since car rental was not practical. The hotel has a direct line to an airport rental agency which will pick up guests. Prices changed hourly. Alternatives are to hop over to the Flamingo down the very long block and rent a car directly from them and avoid airport tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ragjunk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Dec. 2005. We stayed in a room with a kitchenette. The rooms are twice as big as rooms in other hotels. The bathroom had a separate shower room. The facility looks more like an apartment complex and may be a couple of years old. It is about a mile from the strip and behind Bally's, so it is conveniently located. The staff were OK -- not very friendly, but they get you in and out with no hassles. The facility has 24 hour room service, a restaurant and a swimming pool. We used none of them. The pool might get busy in summer months. If you want to gamble, the casino is right downstairs. There were some small problems in our room. First, the burners in the kitchen didn't work. But, someone was sent quickly and he fixed it. The TV remote had dead batteries, so remote didn't work. The wardrobe sliding door came out of the railing, when I tried to close it. All these in a relatively new facility :-) Its spaciousness and proximity to the strip are unbeatable. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany - LV Best Kept Secret, 15 Min Walk from Strip”
Reviews.Author: johnnyq1964
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is a great place to stay if you want Excellent Accomodations and are willing to walk 15 minutes to the Strip along a busy and well lit road ( Flamingo Blvd ). All the rooms are suites and are huge. Room rates are usually reasonable. Check-in has always been easy, no mile long lines. They have a fitness building, not just a room with some exercise equipment stuffed in it. I saw people swimming in the outdoor pool in December, although I didn't bother checking the water temp. The Casino is large and generally less busy than the major strip properties. So if you want to have a chance of finding a $ 5 Blackjack table at night, this is a good place to look. They also have good rules for BJ ( 4 deck shoe, Surrender available ). The food at the Mexican Cantina inside the Casino is good. But if you want a great steak, Ellis Island is a short walk away and they have the best steak special in town ( EI is a locals casino, so don't expect fancy there ).

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, Nice location, Close to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: callmemochelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a block and a half from the strip. Not quite walking distance but a quick drive down Flamingo Drive. Pros: HUGE rooms! It was a nice suite with a eating area, a wet bar and coffee maker, sofa area to sit and read/relax, a huge bathroom with a separate tub/shower/toilet area... even a medicine cabinet next to the sink to "hide" your toiletries, and ample dresser, closet area. Located across the hotel is the famous Lawry's prime rib restaurant and a bunch of other fine dining places. Plenty of parking, and even many close to your room. Cons: Ok, here's the reason why I didn't give it an "excellent". The front desk staff was rather clueless, but found out from another staff member that their turnover rate is quite high. Most staff members stay around 1 to 2 years, then leave. So to get accurate information is a 50-50 chance. Thin walls! I was in room 103 near the front entrance. I could hear people running up and down the hall, the people upstairs walking (Sounded like they were jumping) and even the people getting ice from the machine. When people opened the door to get into the building, you can hear the door slaming. If you get a ground floor, ask for either upstairs. Lucky, I am a sound sleeper. Even though the suite had a "kitchen" area, the cupboards were bare. If you wanted a plate or cutlery, stop at the market and buy some disposable ones. It was a waste to give such a big kitchen cabinet but nothing to offer but 2 foam cups and 2 water cups, and a bucket for ice. The fridge was nice to store things but again, no utensils to eat with, so if you had "Take out" food, you could store it but not heat or eat it. Misc: Housekeeping: We were in the room when the maid knocked; NOrmally if they see you in the room, they'd come back. NOt this girl. She walked in and started cleaning, as we were trying to escape. I dont think she noticed we were in the room! Bathroom: They provided a medley of towels but they are tiny. Mind the tile in the morning... brrr! They are cold to walk on. Marilyn's Cafe: Whatever you do, do not eat the buffet! Order off the menu! Overall a great price and nice hotel. Rooms were great, and they now offer room service. Even if they did not, their cafe is right inside the casino and its opened 24-7

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eHsia
Reviews.Content: I am writing this to warn others who are contemplating about staying at this hotel to please reconsider. I booked a suite in this hotel through a third party, and it looked like a great deal. Once I flew out there, though, the Tuscany desk people tried to tell me they ran out of rooms, even though I had made reservations a MONTH ahead, had my confirmation record, and everything -- and they had it on record, too! I made quite a fit, and they somehow found a vacant room, the exact size I wanted (even though they kept emphasizing that they had no rooms)! The service (if you can call it that) was horrible -- the staff were SO unfriendly and SO unprofessional and very indifferent about what they were doing to me! Anyway, after several DAILY calls and confrontations with the hotel people, they finally got things straightened out. Or so I thought! It is almost Christmas right now, so over 6 months since my horrible Vegas hotel experience, and they just placed a $370.00 fraudulent charge on my card. I paid my May bill in full and got a receipt for that, and I received no other contact from them, so I know I don't owe them money. I've tried contacting them, and you know what!?!? These people don't like picking up the phone, and they certainly won't do it if there is an issue. They haven't gotten back to me when I leave messages, either. This is just simply fraud! And moreover, I am surprised they kept my card on record all these months. That is scary! I've never heard of such bogus behavior before. I'd advise people to save your nerves and save your money; trust me, this was NO deal! ANd learn from what they did to me: DO NOT give them your credit card number!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with the Tuscany Cantina”
Reviews.Author: redvelvet
Reviews.Content: On Thanksgiving Day we ate at the Cantina at the Tuscany on Flamingo Road. The food was so-so, but the service was horrible. There were only a few customers in the restaurant yet the service was very slow and unfriendly. No one smiled or greeted us. It was like we were an unwelcome interruption. We had to wait a long time to be seated, for drink service, delivery of the meal, and refills. We had to go ask for additional services such as refills, more chips, etc. On the positive side the appetizer bean dip and salsa were delicious as was the fried ice cream. The food was hot when served but nothing to write home about (tacos, flautas, enchiladas, chile rellenos, rice, beans, burritos, etc.). All in all we were disappointed in the Cantina and do not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: shelbymom
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms, good food in 24 hour cafe, Mexican rest: food fair, place was packed and noisy but we were right under PA so other table may not have been so bad - would try again. Room service lunch was deliverd promptly and food was fresh and good (not cheap! $16.00 for sandwich and soda). Itailian Rest. looked nice but didn't try it. Nice clean casino, moderate walk to the Strip (Bellagio on first corner)- excellent value for $60 per weekday night price including tax found on web. $100-120 or more may still be good value depending on availability at other hotels. Rooms are detached from casino with adjacent parking so not necessary to go through casino everytime you leave premises.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not very "Vegas", but Good”
Reviews.Author: ShoelessJeff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tuscany for the SEMA show held earlier this month. For those who have never been, The Tuscany is a very clean, manageable, hotel that is situated on a property with a 'main' building that features registration and a bar / restaurant area, and several straight-line two-story guestroom buildings that are efficient albeit not very spectacular. The advantage with this lay-out is not having a ten mile walk from your room to the lobby as is the case in most Vegas properties. The Tuscany features clean and spacious rooms and one can still smell fresh paint and new carpeting. There is a lot to like about the Tuscany. I have stayed there before and probably would stay there again, but . . . What I DISLIKE about The Tuscany: At no point during your stay will you feel like you are in Las Vegas!! The Tuscany is as boring as it is efficient. Aside from the army barrack-styled guest buildings, Tuscany features the most unimaginitive casino I have ever been to outside of an Indian reservation. It is really like a rectangular white-walled gymnasium that has been carpeted and filled with slot machines. Tuscany does not - however - force you to walk across the casino floor to get to your room: a Vegas first for me. When my friend 'Vegas' Jenny from San Luis Obispo, CA told me she'd never heard of it, I knew I was in trouble. When you stay at Tuscany you might even forget you are in Vegas. When I was there, it felt like being at a Golf resort in Tampa or Palm Springs. A little escapism from Vegas can be a good thing after a few days though. There was one creepy thing that happened to me during my stay: I walked out of the shower in my room to see a brown roach-looking bug looking back up at me, but . . . I do not blame the hotel. There is little doubt of their cleanliness and one should not forget Vegas is in a desert! Besides, I felt bad for the bug - after seeing me naked, seeing any other nude male guests will just be a disappointment. Bottom line: I recommend the Tuscany as a BASE, but your Vegas fun will be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “UK VISITOR TO TUSCANY”
Reviews.Author: GLOPURPLE
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here from 24th Oct for 7 nights. We were looking for a place between a motel and strip hotel that we had stayed in before. This was a great find. Great location even without a car 7 min walk to strip well lit at night. Very peaceful setting, nice pool area. The staff were very nice and dealt with our request for a change of room with balcony in a very efficent manner. The rooms were a great size and bathroom was bliss ( even if bath was low to get in and out of) The kitchen area was a added bonus with fridge and coffee maker, lacked utencils. The Italian restauran was very good,service,food and price was well worth a visit as was breakfast buffet. The only down was the building works going on next door for 24 hours and this was a factor when trying to sleep. But I would recommend this to readers of the review and my friends

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Oasis of calm close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: p.m.s.norton
Reviews.Content: Guiided as always by the other reviews we were delighted with the room so large for us Europeans with Coffee maker and fridge though no other cooking facilities but we had no plans to cook in a City full of cheap eats. The location was fine for us only a few minutes walk from Ballys and either a monorail from there up or down the strip or walk through to Paris my favourite the Buffet amazing value. Ellis Casino just around the corner more old Las Vegas as was Freemont Street a Must do at night. The rooms were well maintained and the pool area lovely quiet relaxing and a good pool service . We ate in the hotel a few times breakfast buffet good value though no doubt better options on the strip. Good parking facilities and supermarkets close by for water and soda. Cannot understand how anyone can complain about this hotel for the price that you pay. The strip is an experience and yes some of the hotels amazing but some so large and impersonal with so many non guests trawling the corridors!! The Tuscany provided us with access to the strip in minutes in an ideal central position so could do either end of the strip in a day but more importantly for us it provided us with a relaxing holiday too as we could escape the crowds and the noise and swim sunbathe or snooze . For the price we got on Expedia October less than £60 a night a real bargain. Hired a car and found driving around easy and allowed direct access to Hover Dam at our pace a great sight and other odd trips out to Henderson Boulder City and Galleria shopping Mall and others and Golf .

Reviews.Title: “60th Wedding Anniversary at the Tuscany Suites”
Reviews.Author: NCW
Reviews.Content: I booked a group of 34 relatives at the Tuscany Suites for my parent's 60th wedding anniversary. The hotel is a few blocks from the Strip. There was adequate parking with good security. My mother and a couple of other family members had limited mobility. They were all able to walk to the pool, the restaurants, the bar, and the casino. Younger family members could easily walk to the Strip. The rooms are very large and quite comfortable. We booked one two bedroom suite with a very large livingroom to use as a gathering place. The breakfast buffet was most adequate. Other meals were mediocre. We had a professional jazz pianist in our group who played in the bar for our dancing and listening pleasure before the anniversary party. We had a private banquet room for cocktails and a catered dinner. The casino was always quite smoky. Otherwise, it was all in all a fine experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Las Vegas for my wedding. We needed a location for many friends and family with a lot of rooms and a lot of space. This was the perfect place. The rooms were huge and the hotel very accommodating. The restaurants and bar were great too. The only complaint I have is the difficulty in getting a taxi to go anywhere, which unfortunately cannot be controlled much by the hotel staff. I would highly recommend staying here for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms resonable rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am from UK but live in Ohio now. Last September our friends from UK came ove to USA for a months stay with us, we booked a trip to Las Vegas for four nights for the four of us. I looked at prices for a couple of weeks before deciding on the Tuscany, as it was a very large room and I didnt know how much cash our friends would have to spend for the month they were in the USA for. I booked the Tuscany as it was a bit cheper than most. WOW were we suprised at the room size and how nice the place was.The food was about average for Vegas but the servings were quite large.We did,nt win any $$$$$$ but I have found that all the casino,s are getting more stingy these day.All in all our friends and us really liked the Tuscany , we will book to stay there another time.We are all in the 60yr age group and found it was an easy walk to the strip.The only complaint I had was in the 4 nights we spent in the Tuscany we had to buy every drink from the bar as we never got one from the girls walking around in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany - Value, location, pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I been to Vegas, The first two times involved my wife and Family, the selection of the hotels were more discrimate because of the special occasions involved(marriage and Christmas) so for those occasions we stayed at the Belagio and Venetian.While those were beautiful hotels to stay at- I could not help feel at times overwhelmed by the racket, people and eye candy. This time it was with the guys and I chose the Tuscany because of the price, location and basic services. We were three and we were comfortable with the room layout, the design of the bathroom and the fridge. Although we wished we had more channels on the basic free cable service- We found the Tuscany a pleasant no frills venue. Its not too far from the strip and you have access to all the notorious hotels (Bally's, Bellagios, Caesars, Paris, etc) as well as the Tram. Be sure to visit the Voodoo lounge at Rio's and check out the outdoor decks. It has a breathtaking night time view of Vegas especially with the gogo girls dancing the night away within the sparkling lights of the city. I recommend the Tuscany to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - infant friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kobe Nai
Reviews.Content: I thought my husband was crazy to take our 4 month old infant to Vegas. Tuscany was a good choice and the crib was free. Frig and microwave were definite plus. Room was clean and roomy. Shower glass sparkled. Parking not a problem. Definitely close to airport and walking distance to strip. Cafe food was not bad for the price. Highly recommend if you have kids. The pool was hopping! Casino was not that busy but there were definitely bells going off!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: barbiem
Reviews.Content: Found this gem after reading reviews on trip advisor. We spent four nights here and found it brilliant. Large spacious rooms at very reasonable rates. We paid £37.00 a night plus tax for our room booking through expedia. The inn is about a 7minute walk from the strip. If you walk straight up the road you come out right opposite Cesears Palace so it is very central. You also pass Ballys and the entrance to the metro link should you want to get on it. The area seemed very safe and we walked back quite late at night with no hassles at all. The inn has an all night restuarant with very average food but hey when your starving its better than nothing!!! There is an excellent bar though with entertainment some nights of the week and a small dance floor. All in all as Brits we could not fault the place and loved Vegas and our stay at the Tuscanny

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet and clean room. Beautiful pool area & garden . We would stay there again. We recommend it. 15 minutes walk to strip. Central location (corner of Bellagio & Bally’s).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JnetCa7
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, lovely large, clean rooms, good restaurant. 10 minutes walk from strip, can be a bit hot for a walk, would recommend gettin a taxi, as the walk is not very nice, past building sites and 'whino' hangouts. Also not very child friendly, as they have a pool party on a thursday night,which you must be over 21 to join in, so you are left without a pool for the night. Apart from this would highly recommend, you get more than you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very quiet, large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: GMStiles
Reviews.Content: Very clean, large rooms, and quiet. Having stayed in Vegas several times a year ( for 15 years), and in many of the "strip" hotels, this is now my favorite. Prices for mid week are as low as $39 and I rarely pay over $80 on the weekends (using the flyers I get from them all the time). The best off the strip (by two blocks) hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at Tuscany and found it very nice. The rooms are big and quite. The casino staff is nice. The Italian resteraunt is very good. The only thing that really could be improved is better quality bath towels. But when I was only paying $69 a night -- you can live with that. Make sure you check out their prices on their website -- they usually are the same if not lower than the other travel websites.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidnicholsonshawca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany on the weekend of August 26th. The room was clean, very large and all facilities worked correctly. Some of the extras our room had was a stove, fridge and a microwave. This hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Strip on Flamingo which gave us plenty of time to heat up. It was a hot hot 41C every day. The casino is very small compared to the Strip but it is friendly. Everything is secure and you feel very safe in the hotel and in the area. The staff was very friendly. However, Las Vegas itself could use a good clean up. The garbage every where there is an eyesore. Most of the garbage is advertising for girl shows, but the beer and pop bottles were not far behind in volume. We don't think Las Vegas has any kind of recylcing or bottle return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: merscooter
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive of this property given the price. Boy, was that unjustified! I'm glad that I chose this hotel! The room was huge. We noticed a bus stop in front of the hotel and decided to give the bus system a try... we found that for $5 per person, we could go just about anywhere in Vegas for 24 hrs... in air conditioning! We even took the bus back to the airport when we left. The only part of this hotel that we didn't like was the quantity of towels in the room (we needed to ask for more every day) and that the front desk and housekeeping staff were a little slow to respond. All in all, a nice hotel at a nice price. I would not hesitate to stay at the Tuscany again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: grindergal
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Tuscany. My friend and I had a fabulous time. I prefer it's small cozy atmosphere far more than I like the huge ritzy hotels. The grounds are very pretty as is the lobby. The casino is small, but the dealers are very friendly. The entire staff was very friendly and spoke english just fine, contrary to what others have reviewed. We have eaten at all three restaurants and loved them all. The rooms are big and clean. The cocktail servers were very fast and friendly. The only problem we encountered was that the battery to our key card lock died and we had to wait quite a while to get it fixed (and we were in our pj's), but we saw the humor in it. Tuscany is my hotel of choice in Vegas and we are already planning our second trip.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: XXLoveLondonXX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I could only get out of Las Vegas on Virgin to London since SFO and LAX were full. We elected to spend the night before our flight from LAS since it had been years since we had been there. Not gamblers, we didn't care if we were on the strip or not and Hotels.com had a really great rate of $60 for the night (all included in that price). We were so very surprised at the hotel. You can turn cartwheels in the room it is so big. The bathroom was huge too and the seperate shower great. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. We had a glass of wine at the bar. Wow, cheap prices! We had a car for the less than 24 hours we spent there but we wanted to see what had been built since we were last there (for a friend's wedding), so drove along the strip. We didn't mind the crowds crossing the street, we were just taking it all in. Free parking at the Tuscany. It is a long, long block to Bally's where you could finally duck in to air conditioning but it looks like Bally's is building out along Flamingo towards the Tuscany so the walk won't be so long in the future. The pool was smaller than the pictures, the casino not very busy but a fair amount of business. If you want an inexpensive place to stay that is really comfortable, this is your place. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Tuscany (three nights too much). It's nice that they have kitchens in room but not a glass, plate or fork to be found. I called downstairs (very rude) and they said they don't supply any of those items. No problem, we will just order room service so I make a call down stairs. I'm told they don't have room service, I was then hung up on. I now want to order some chocolate covered strawberries for my wife. I go down stairs and checked two restaurants, the "check in" desk and the "Guest relations" person. You would think I was the first person to ever want something as crazy as that. They didn't serve them, didn't know where to get them and never offered to help find some. To there credit the rooms were clean and were good sized but were nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Just off the strip and great value”
Reviews.Author: 3hour_tourguide
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 day/2 night stay at Tuscany. We got a great rate and stayed Sunday through Tuesday. Hotel is just a little off the strip (but within reasonable walking distance) and is easily accessible. The room we had was very large, and the pictures on their website show an accurate example of what the rooms look like. There was a small refrigerator, microwave, sink, and even a 2-burner stove (though what you'd use to cook with, I don't know) in the kitchen area, including a small table with chairs. There was also a "living room" area with a couch and 1 chair, a desk (there is wireless internet available, but you have to pay for it), a dresser and TV. The bed was comfortable, and even had extra pillows. The bathroom was quite large, with a separate shower and tub, and the toilet was located in its own "room" allowing for greater privacy. We ate at both restaurants onsite (there is a Mexican restaurant and a 24 hour "coffee shop"); both meals were reasonably priced and quite good. The restaurant staff was very efficient and friendly. We would definitely stay here again; the rates were reasonable for such a large room and it is close enough to the strip to walk if you wanted. The rooms were quiet, and it was nice to be able to go to your room without having to walk through the smoky casino.

Reviews.Title: “Ver Good Indeed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some good reviews on the Tuscany on this site I decided to book a room for my wife and I and a separate room for my sister who was vacationing with us. Both the rooms were excellent. They were spacious, clean and had very large bathrooms. The casino itself is small and may disappoint serious gamblers but for the tourists like us it was excellent giving good value just off the strip. Across the road (E Flamingo Blvd) is a couple of excellent restaurants (Italian and Mexican) and far better value than the big hotels a few blocks away on the strip. If I return to Vegas I will definitely be back at the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location just off the strip 5 minutes walk to monorail station at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaPeople
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel June 30 - July 3, 2005. It was a great place to stay and we'd stay there again. Best part: close to the stip (half a mile walk) so it's nice and quiet and not crowded with people and lineups Worst part: I wouldn't eat there if you are looking for fabulous cuisine, but it's food at a reasonable price. The room was clean and really big and came with a fridge, sink, kitchen table and chairs, sofa, TV, king bed, bathroom with a separate room for the toilet. The stopper in the sink in the bathroom was either open or closed manually and the shower door didn't shut properly, but that made no difference to us at all. Airconditioning worked very well but was a bit noisy. The noise actually made it easier to sleep as it was like a white noise machine! I was sick on day from a bumpy airplane ride and the kitchen in the restaurant was kind enough to give my husband four fresh baked buns for me at no charge. It was the only thing I could eat and they were delicious! The hotel pool is great, get there early for a lounge chair (as seems to be the case at most places). There is an outdoor bar in a hut next to the pool and the bartender is great :) Drinks were cheap and very good. The only problem (which wasn't really the hotel's fault) was that Conquest Vacations did not actually book the rooms at the hotel for us (although they DID give is a confirmation number). This also happened to another person staying there that was on the same flight. The night staff were totally in the dark about what to do, but quickly gave us a room with our credit card as a guarantee. The day staff is much better, but really there was nothing they could do until Conquest sent them the proper paperwork. It took 7 phone calls to Conquest Vacations Las Vegas office to get it resolved and it only got resolved 15 minutes before noon on the day we checked out. It was a bit of a worry for us the entire trip that although we paid for the hotel in our package, we'd have to pay for it again and then try to recover the money later from Conquest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great price and perfect for what we needed! The pool was a nice size, never got too crowded and had a sufficient amount of towels, chairs and was close to the bar! The walk to the strip was a little far but taxis were almost always available and not too pricey if you didn't want to take the walk The rooms are all very large and clean. They had a fridge which was perfect for bringing bottles of water and some snacks. The casino is a great place to learn some games before venturing into the larger casinos and the drink specials are sweet! I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but stay now, because it will fall down soon”
Reviews.Author: Ceallaigh
Reviews.Content: HUGE room with full kitchen--range, microwave and half-refrigerator--no oven. But they're not into upkeep. It's a property made up of several three-story buildings with nice landscaping in between. It's only three years old and there were several things that should have been fixed in the room that weren't. When we mentioned the loose shower head and the backspash separating from the wall, the front desk wasn't really interested. It's not on the strip, but in the morning or evening, it's not a bad walk--about two long blocks. In the heat of a summer day, you'll want to take a cab--and they're expensive. The casino is boring and smoke-filled, but since we didn't go to Vegas to gamble, it wasn't a big problem for us. There were ants in our kitchen--just one or two every morning--and since we were on the third floor, we assume there are ants all over that building. We got our room for $50 a night through Travelocity and it was definitely the best deal of the whole trip. Oh, did I mention the rooms are gigantic? One caveat--there is construction going on next door. Don't let them put you in building A on the construction side. They start working as early as 3:45 AM, but most mornings around 5:00.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy, comfortable, close to the Strip..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and days in the Tuscany during the 1st week of May 2005. It's location is great because the Strip is only 6/10 of a mile away. The price for a room is much more affordable than the major hotels on the Strip. My room was very big, comfortable, has a/c, a big tv, a fridge and a big bathroom. The food was very affordable and the service was great. I did not use the pool because I did not have the time but will use it next time. My only complaint was in using the pc's in the business center. It was a bit confusing and too expensive for using it such a short time. If the hotel makes it more user friendly and affordable I would use it again. I love to use the internet but I would like to see a better system. Trying to figure out what printer to use was confusing. I think each pc and printer should have a letter on it to identify it -> A, B, C, D... etc. Overall, I would stay again at Tuscany. The grounds are beautiful...sort of like a botanical garden look!!! Very nice!! The service at the front entrance is exceptional...there is always someone there to help you fast. It's also nice how the casino blends in next to the eating area. I like that a lot. I recommend this hotel to all Las Vegas visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Tuscany was one of the most comfortable and relaxing we have had during any our of many visits to Las Vegas. It was my first time to stay at an off-strip, not well-known facility, so I was a little nervous at first. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly staff member, and from this point forward, everything fell into place. Our room was gorgeous. It was surprisingly large and beautifully furnished. Everything looked new and was very clean; it was as if we were the first people to have ever stayed in the room. The kitchenette was a huge plus, especially when it came to keeping drinks cold on a hot summer day. The hotel is a few short blocks from the strip. For someone not used to walking much, it could be too far for comfort, but for us, it was perfect as the hotel was close enough to the strip to enjoy the excitment of Las Vegas but far enough away to escape the omnipresent "ding-ding-ding" of slot machines. We could walk directly to the unit (through secured doors) without having to walk 10-15 minutes through a typical casino just to get to the guest elevators. A little secret is that you can enter the back of Bally's and then, in the comfort of air-conditioning, walk from Bally's to Paris (they connect) to get to the Aladdin and the strip. Moreover, you can catch the monorail, conveniently located at the back of Bally's, that will quickly take you to other parts of the strip. (The monorail runs every 5 minutes.) We were very happy with our experience at the Tuscany. I have a rule that I stay at a different hotel during every visit to Las Vegas, simply for the sake of having a new experience. In the case of the Tuscany, however, I am willing to let that rule slide and to book a room again. The Tuscany provided luxury and comfort for a reasonable price. If you're looking for a pleasant trip to Las Vegas without getting caught up in the hustle'n bustle of the strip, the Tuscany is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: CletusSquatford
Reviews.Content: We encountered no rude people, the casino was active but not obnoxiously loud or crowded; quiet enough that a friendly table guy explained some of the game rules to us (we're newbies). We ate in their gourmet restaurant one night and it was FABULOUS. All staff we dealt with was very helpful and friendly, and the pool even had a waitress taking orders for drinks. Mix of people poolside (some kids on occasion), nice and relaxing, a good place for base camp for time on the strip (though if you walk to the strip ONCE you'll be ready to take cabs there and back the rest of the time)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent sized room”
Reviews.Author: SingyCumbria
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany suites are well positoned for a stroll to the 'strip'. Our room was really large and clean - with fridge and kitchenette. We enjoyed the pool and surroundings, very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Sleep - Just don't expect all the frills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany May 20 - 23, 2005. The location is pretty good for an off-the-strip hotel. About a block and a half from Las Vegas Blvd. and Flamingo. Pretty much right behind Bally's. The grounds are kept up pretty nicely. They do have a casino, but I would avoid it other than the bar for a quick drink before you go out. The casino is frequented by locals, so its not very exciting. The pool area is awesome - nice, clean pool, and poolside bar service. For 3 guys on a gambling trip, this pool was a welcome distraction. Plenty of drinks, girls in bikinis, and not too many kids. The only letdown was that there are not enough lounge chairs. You must get to the pool very early if you want to get a chair at all. The rooms themselves are very large suites. The one we had included two double beds, table and chairs, a couch, club chair, end tables, TV, and dresser. Very spacious and clean. The bathroom is nice as it has a separate room for the toilet while the shower, tub, and sink can be assessable to others. Everything was in good condition and in working order. The hallway of the building and the room itself did have a slightly unpleasant odor. Sort of like a strong orange chemical smell. The cleaning staff does not speak English well. I have stayed at strip hotels (Paris, NYNY, MGM) and found this hotel to be more relaxed and spacious... but remember, you ARE away from the action. If you want to be in the thick of things, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. I also would not recommend it if you do not have a car. Although only a block and a half from the Strip, IT IS A HIKE!! You do not want to do this walk several time per day. All in all, if you want a roomy place to relax between gambling and clubbing, and you have a car, this is the place. If you are looking for more excitement or to be where there is non-stop action, stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay at The Tuscany. This was my fifth time in Vegas, having stayed downtown and at Bally's. By far Tuscany is my favorite place to stay. We found it to be like two vacations in one. While at the pool area, you have absolutely no idea that you are just a few blocks from the strip. We only had one breakfast buffet there, which was not award winning, but very acceptable, espescially for under $6. We found the staff to be fine, the room was huge and clean!!! It is a few blocks from the strip, and although there is a bit of a wait at times for a taxi, it is still much easier to get one then at some of the larger casinos right on the strip. The grounds are well landscaped and cared for...very attractive!!! We will be going back, and will definitely recommend to friends. If you are looking for value, I can't imagine there is a better deal out there..oh yeah, if you are new to Vegas, keep your gambling downtown!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscany!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here twice last year--first for her birthday, then for our wedding day. We loved it. We were new to Vegas, and the Tuscany was a perfect off-the-strip hotel. Quiet, secluded, with a nice pool, comfortable rooms and a very friendly staff. We were surrounded by European travelers, which gave an added dimension to the Mediterranean theme. Our first night, we ate at Marilyn's cafe (in the casino downstairs, open 24 hours) and, even though the service was absolutely terrible--we waited about half an hour before being greeted--it was still charming, and the collection of rangy Vegas "types" at nearby tables was definitely worth seeing. For the price, the Tuscany is great. If you're a high-rolling Vince Vaughn wannabe, stay at the Bellagio. But if you're looking for something inexpensive, quiet and clean, go to the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Too far, and Too rude”
Reviews.Author: MontanaGo
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Tuscany May 8-14 while at a conference. We were a bit dissappointed when we arrived. Although the Strip looks close, it is a bit of a walk - about 15 minutes. That gets you to Bally's or the Flamingo and then it's farther to anywhere else. The first guy that took our bags when we arrived in a taxi didn't offer to help and was rude when we asked him to take them. The front desk was cold and didn't seem too enthused that we were there - it may have been because we were at a reduced rate but that is no reason to treat us poorly. When we tried to get our bags brought to the room (all of the rooms are in separate buildings that you have to walk outside to get to), we called the bell desk 3 times and no one answered. We finally called the front desk and received our bags about 45 minutes after we had checked in. We ate in the cafe the first evening, and although the waiter was nice, the food was anything but. But I guess that's what you can expect from a 24 hour cafe. Maid service was good, but a little pushy to get the room cleaned. Very few of the staff spoke English which made it that much more difficult to communicate with them what we needed. Also, we are pretty sure someone entered our room on the first day we were out after it had been cleaned. We had come back in the morning after it was cleaned and left a light on. When we returned in the evening the light was off and the sink was partially filled with water. It cost about $10 to take a Taxi to and from the strip (Mirage, Mandalay Bay, Wynn). No shuttle service offered and they have to call for taxis. The players club is ok. It takes a few bucks to cash in for anything (at least over $150). The free souvenier was a deck of used playing cards from the casino. The slots were NOT loose! No one that I saw was winning. The slots at the airport are the best. Overall it was just ok. At least the rooms are big and very clean. Although there is a refrigerator and a stove, there is no microwave and no pots/pans/utensils to cook with. We tried heating up leftovers in metal containers on the stove but it started to smell like it would set off the fire alarm so we ate it cold. On checkout we were charged $10 extra for Friday night because the hotel was sold out - we tried to dispute this with the front desk but they said they couldn't help and we had to call the sales department - we are working on getting it straightened out with the conference people's help. The conference is moving to the Flamingo next time - we are really looking forward to that since it is on the strip. If you have a car and want a cheap rate at a clean hotel that is good for families this will work for you. If you want to mostly be on the strip and don't have a car I would suggest paying a little more to stay right on the strip - you'll save the money in taxi costs. Walking to the strip in daylight was fine, at night, not so much. I do have to add though, that there was a very polite and helpful Oriental man that made our vacation a little more enjoyable. He was the best staff person at the Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet, 2 Blocks away from the Strip (near Bellagio/Caesar's)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 2 suites at Tuscany Suites, May 4-7, 2005. This hotel was recommended by a co-worker and I read the reviews off this website re: this hotel. So I was 95% comfortable booking it, but I was more anxious about check in times and room quality (quiet, clean etc). Check-in is at 3pm and we arrived at 230pm. Check-in was fast, there were about 2 ppl in front of me and 3 girls at the reception counter. We got the 3rd floor (very top floor) in a rear unit, facing away from the street. They don't have any adjoining suites, so we got ours right next to each other. The room was clean and huge. The bathroom was literally oversized..full bathtub and shower + toilet in diff. room w/ door. There was a total of 4 adults.. 2 in each room, so it was nice to have our space. I got these 2 suites thru expedia, their website indicated the rooms were sold out these dates. I requested 2 doubles in each room and got my request. I was worried they wouldn't fufill my request, but they did! The kitchnette had a mini fridge, table w/ 2 chairs, microwave, sink and plenty of cabinet space and a coffee maker w/ free coffee pouches. The TV was nice cuz we could turn it according to where we were in the room, we could watch tv from bed or from the sofa and chair/table they had. The other suite had a broken shower door, I called housekeeping and they told me to wait until a repairman showed up. We were on our way out and after waiting 10 mins, we just left. Turns out they did fix it when we got home. In our room, one of the lamps bulb's needed to be changed, but I didn't call for that since there was enough light. The AC is a bit noisy, wouldn't turn it on when we sleep, but we had it on low while we were out and about. The hotel is located about .5 miles from the strip, but I liked the location of the strip from us. we were on the end of teh strip that was closest to bellagion, caesar's, bally, wynn hotels. They are huge blocks, flat to walk on, but a trek, depending on what kind of shape you are in/heat factor. We did walk to the Wynn hotel and it took tops 25 mins. it was a good walk just to get some excercise in. across from the hotel was a Lawry's, and a japanese restaurant, Hamada of Tokyo, down the other street was PF Changs.. so they had good restaurants near by. I couldn't find a starbucks near there, but later heard there was one nearby, but kind of hidden. Oh wells, I still survived. I would definitely stay there again, since the property looked like it was no more than 3-5 yrs old. I didn't see any bugs. the parking was nice cuz you can park and walk right up to the bldg entrance, put your hotel card key in and enter. It was annoying to visit some of the casinos on the strip, but just to get 'thru' them, it would take at leaset 15-30 mins. that got old fast. Check out was 12, checked out by 11:30am. There were 3-4 ppl ahead of us, but no more than a 5 min wait. it was faster for us since we had pre-paid on the rooms. So overall, checkin-out was really fast. The casino/restaurants are in the next bldg over from the hotel. So its nice to not have that foot traffic thru the hotel. we did not eat at the hotel (thank god) We tried once to go eat there, but thought the Chinese dinner advertisement (thought it was a buffet) for $5.95 was poorly written. Instead it was $5.95 for 1 chinese entree. The staff there didn't care to explain after we had questioned the signs. I guess what you pay is what you get. So we left and went to PF Changs. That is the only negative experience I would report is with the casino restaurant (marilyn's).

Reviews.Title: “Adequate facilities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscany April 17-19,2005. Suite was OK, however, the people staying in the room above me were noisy. Could hear them walking around their room. The double bed in my room was soft and uncomfortable. Hotel employees were courteous. Overall impression was adequate. Would consider staying there again but next time I will ask for a room on the third floor with a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: capecodhunts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last night of our Grand Canyon vacation at the Tuscany. We booked the room online directly with the hotel and found our room facing an electrical substation. It did not overlook the lush grounds advertised online. This was a disappointment. The ceiling had some cracks and there was a loose tile in our bathroom. The room itself was large and clean. Dinner at the Tuscany Gardens was tasty but the service was not up to par for a nicer restaurant. The breakfast buffet at Marilyn’s Café was horrible. I have never had powdered eggs before but I am guessing I have now. The hash browns were drowning in grease. The fresh fruit was tasteless. Overall we found the Tuscany an acceptable place to spend the night and convenient to the airport but would not return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElGuapo49
Reviews.Content: The Tuscany is not the typical Vegas Hotel. Instead of a huge tower where you have to walk miles from the parking lot, through the casino and then up elevators to the 17th floor--rather the Tuscany is spread out in many small buildings with a sprawling ground level parking lot (not a huge cement multi-level like on the strip). The rooms are clean, large, with a little kitchenette and sparsely decorated. They are certainly decent, but not elegant. Expect no marbel, granite or glitter. The sheets and towels are little better than Motel 6 quality. Prices vary wildly depending on occupancy. I have paid as little as $35.00 and as much as $135.00. All room rates in Vegas vary due to occupancy and what conventions are in town--sometimes this is a great deal. The hotel is about 2 long ugly blocks east of the main tourist attractions on the strip. The strong could walk and avoid the traffic jam, but most would feel physically or mentally more comfortable with a cheap cab ride. The casino, bar and restaurants are ok but not as glamourous as the big places on the strip. As a business traveler I like this place. I can go direct to my clean affordable room and avoid the grind that is most casinos so I keep returning. On the other hand I have heard female travelers state they feel safer in the confines of a tower casino where they are not walking outside away from crowds and security. Overall not a bad place, but not great either. If you want to walk to everything, eat and drink in excess and stagger back to your hotel spend the couple extra bucks to be on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to kick back”
Reviews.Author: Roskolnikov
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and enjoyed it thoroughly: large, well-kept room in 3-story unit; attractive grounds and pool; good quality gym and lap pool. Casino large enough to have full variety of games but not overwhelming. Enough people to be lively but not overcrowded. Strip is two blocks away--easy walking distance. On-site comedy club of good quality. Don't come here if you want marble, glitz, and room service; if you like tile, large rooms, and relaxation, it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: oree
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 night/3 day vacation in Las Vegas where we stayed in the Tuscany Suites. They are as they sound, a large suite. We were able to obtain a King bed and suite has both tub and shower and rooms were clean and maintained. These are not on the strip but at least 1/4 mile from Bally's heading down Flamingo Rd. It is a long walk at the end of a day if you are walking down the strip. The blocks in Vegas are not the normal length of a city block so dont be deceived with what appears to be a short distance. By the fourth day we were taking taxi back and forth as just tired of walking everywhere. The monorail is accessible from Balley's as is the Trolley. The buses do not come off strip and do not stop at Bally's either so again a walk at end of day if you are bagged and want to just head home via transit etc. We ate only in the cafe for breakfasts as we were out and about on the strip with many awesome choices of dinner spots. The breakfast buffet is small but works. For dinners I would recommend P.F. Changs which is walking distance from Tuscany as is Battisto (Hole in Wall) Italian food. Both are wonderful venues and reasonable. All in all the staff are friendly and accomodation was good. The coffee could be better as is poor quality but with coffee shops everywhere on the strip not necessary to make in room...the cafe coffee is same. There is microwave and minifridge however as mentioned in other reviews no utensils therefore you must have your own or bring disposable if needed. If you join the Players club you receive a free gift (large souvenir mug) and booklet of useful coupons. We did not join till day before last and could not use all the coupons, but we did use the free drinks!!!! If going again I would stay there again and do the walk however would also better know the transit system and maximize all free trolley's and rides on the strip that you can. The monorail passes are worth the money and save your legs for the walk home at the end of a very hectic day. The above average rating is for the size of room and when travelling with another couple as we did the space is nice for visiting in each others rooms without feeling cramped. The option of both tub/shower is also very nice in spacious bathroom. For the time you are in the room the price was right and the walk was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PabloPicasso3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night (3/20). I paid $79 for the night (Sunday) by booking through the hotel's website. Beautiful grounds and facilities. Free parking. The room was large with a sofa and chair, small kitchen table, kitchenette, and nice size bathroom. Nice casino. Only a short walk to the strip and very convenient. Only complaint is a rather long wait to check in at 2:00pm - about 20 minute wait in line. Definitely recommend for the budget minded - a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chaoticport
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tuscany Suites and Casino the weekend of 3/25/05. The hotels grounds were beautiful with plants, trees, and flowers throughout all the walkways. Our room was huge and meticulously clean! It was about a 3 block walk to Bally's. We will definitley stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk off the strip situated close to Bally's, Bellagio, Paris and all the other hotels. The rooms are a superb base, very large, clean and quiet. Very good value at the bar and in the grills and cantinas!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: vtowngirl
Reviews.Content: I had reserved 2 double beds, but when we arrived it was not available so we got a king and a pull out bed. We had a 3 night stay, and needless to say that pull out bed got pretty uncomfortable by then. That, however was not the worst of it. We arrived very tired about 11:30 pm. When we got to the room, there was no bedding for the pull out. We called and they brought sheets and a bedspread because there "were no more blankets". They brought pillows later. We started to make the bed, but the sheets were stained and dirty. My daughter slept in just the bedspread that night. In the morning, I requested clean sheets and blankets. The bed was made up when we returned, but again, no blanket. I went the following morning and again requested a blanket which was promptly delivered, but I won't bother booking here again. The service was extremely poor, the food not very good (we ate one breakfast there and decided to eat elsewhere), and overall, not a good value for the price. I recommend you look around. There are much better deals out there. Vegas has a LOT of rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: nocturnalgirl72
Reviews.Content: We booked Tuscany during a very busy NASCAR weekend and strip hotels were so expensive. I booked off of hotels for $149/night. Room was huge and has cable TV and kitchenette (no dishes though.) 2 double beds, non smoking room. Bathroom was big and roomy. Breakfast was at Marilyns Cafe in the Casino. Buffet was only $5.99 6-11am with good selection of food. Our check-in was ok-the staff is definitely not overly friendly. I have seen posts about the less than accomodating staff. The bell man kind of gave me an attitude when I asked him when cabs would be coming. The hotel is located behind Bally's, only about a 15 minute walk to the strip. I would stay here again. For the price and room size it is an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscany!”
Reviews.Author: ana101876
Reviews.Content: The place was great. Spacious room. Great service. Overrall a great experience. It was also very close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “dont eat there!”
Reviews.Author: ebenezer57
Reviews.Content: Whilst the rooms claim to be 600 sq ft whoever did this calculation I wouldn't like to measure my house for anything. Furthermore the "kitchen" does not afford any utensils or cooking facilities. Therefore we were not able to "self cater". On the first morning I went to view the buffet breakfast and was surprised at that which they consider food was on offer. Locally there are far superior buffets with more reasonable prices. Staff generally were invisible! My best experience of this hotel was the nearby location of the 24/7 store......who looked after us!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Rendvs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have visited Vegas often and stumbled upon the Tuscany on our way back home one trip and I decided to look it up. We booked it for our next trip and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very big, almost like having your own apartment! The refrigerator, microwave and stove are all handy for leftovers and keeping liquids cold (we usually travel with a cooler and it was nice not to have to worry about ice). We're low maintenance travelers, so I couldn't tell you about the hotel staff - besides, you get to park near your unit, so there's really no need to use valet. It's a short walk to the strip. I did get a great winter special deal through their website, it's usually much pricier the rest of the year. I would definitely stay here again, but only at a discount (no hotel is worthy paying too much money, especially if you're not spending that much time in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscany Sep 18 - 21, 2004. We found the property to be well maintained and attractive. It is, by no means, a luxurious resort but adequate and relaxing. Our room was clean and we did not see any insects. The property is located a couple of long blocks from the strip, so wear comfortable walking shoes. It is convenient to Bally's and Flamingo. We liked the large rooms, however if you have kids, be aware that the suite is an open area. There are no utensils in the room for eating or cooking, but we did have a fridge and microwave. If you don't mind walking, like a quiet retreat after the hustle and bustle of the strip this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back Dec. 21, spending three days at the hotel I got a great deal from one of the popular internet travel companies. For the price I was very happy. We had a large room, the double beds were a little light weight but clean. The bathroom is large and imaculate. I love that the casino is in another building, we brought our children so it was great that they did not have to walk through a smoke filled room to go to our room or leave the hotel. Parking was right outside our building and my kids had a great time at the pool. It's a quiet place if you like solace from the strip, and the restaurants especially the Cantina was great. Again, if you are looking for a decent place that is roomy, good parking, a casino that is hardly ever crowded, near everything and very safe this is a great place on a budget. We would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the Worst”
Reviews.Author: carollm
Reviews.Content: I just came back from this hotel on December 17th, 2004. I stayed at this hotel for 5 days, 4 of which I needed the plumber to unclog the toilets. I resorted to using the casino to go to the bathroom. The people that work there are clueless. They look at you like big deal, what's the problem. no one speaks a word of english so communicating is almost impossible. The hotel is pretty, no doubt about it. The rooms are spacious. I'm very tolerant as I go to Vegas three times a year and decided to try somewhere new. Let me sum it up for you, I'd rather sleep in the street than EVER stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Cabomiamor
Reviews.Content: Just returned form a 3 night stay at this hotel which is about 3/4 mile off the strip which made it very close to everything. The rooms were very large and extremely clean, as was the entire premises. The staff was very helpful, the casino itself was small but that was made up for by the friendliness of all the game attendants. Being the opening weekend of the NFR, I wasn't too sure about this property, but th security staff kept everyone quiet and in check, which is more than I can say for a few of the large hotels we visited during the weekend. I would recommend this place to any of my friends in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay, probably the best we have stayed in. Only one small point 1 member of the Waiting Staff could have been more polite, otherwise no problems, Clean, good size rooms, good small Casino, and the Staff very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I rented 2 rooms at the Tuscany. When we checked in the staff was not very helpful...they seemed very rushed and in a hurry to have us out of their way. When we got in the rooms (late at night) we found that there were ants all over. We tried to call the font desk but could not get a hold of them. So we went back to the front desk and asked them why we could not get a hold of them....they didn't have a reply. We told them about the ant problem and said they would get someone up there to spray. By this time we all just wanted to go to bed, so I asked them if they had another room. They finally gave us another room but it was in another building. I would not recommend staying in this hotel. Front desk is non-existant and very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: tech3
Reviews.Content: I found that the Rooms were very acessible, quiet, and, most of all, very large. For less that i would have paid on the strip, i had a room with couches , kitchenette, etc... The food at the hotel is awful, the service is so-so. The hotel is generally boring, or quiet for some of you! The hotel has this weird smell that you will get used to. Oh and the guys that call the cabs are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany - it was ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 26-30, 2004 The Tuscany was the only last-minute, good deal package I could find and I went for it..was VERY WORRIED about the two July posts re roaches...there were NO roaches, but a few weird things I can verify from other posts: -the room was never vaccuumed, before we arrived until we left. I know this becuase there were bits of things (hair elastic, fluff, few crumbs) that remained (no roaches or the crumbs would be gone!) -yes, duplicate prints hung right beside each other -BAD SERVICE!! do not rely on the bell boy to hold a cab for you, you arrive and it is gone. Two taxi drivers told us that drivers do not like to go there due to poor hotel service, and unlike large hotels, there is no taxi stand. NOTE taxis are not legally allowed to pull over for tourists so go to a hotel somewhere along the way to wherever you are going. cab to the closet end of the strip costs $8-10 -hotel staff is quite apathetic, to mirror other posts here. really lacks the service of a large hotel. -the phone system sucks - found it nearly impossible to use our canadian calling card to surpass the hotel system. better off using the lobby payphone for quick calls -movies are $13.95 US we found out upon check out!! wow $$ good stuff/other: -for people that like to feel apart from the chaos this is your place. 10+ min walk to Bally's, 15 to strip, at least. -the pool area is verrry mellow and quiet same with the casino (nice staff, not a fancy experience) -cheap eats: load up on teh salad bar and get a sandwich to eat by the pool -get the What's On magazine..went to Tropicana comedy club 2 for 1 (25.00 total) - it was a blast! -the rooms are HUGE, yet the area is so boring we didn't want to stay around. only the hotel restraunts and a sketchy 7-11 nearby. -great having a micro and a fridge if you bring leftovers from Bellagio buffet ha.

Reviews.Title: “Little Italy in the desert”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great 2 weeks at the Tuscany Hotel. When reading some reviews we were a little apprehensive about whether we had made the right decision...we did. The Tuscany was a breath of fresh air in a 100+degree desert. Are you looking for a friendly, quiet (not in your face like other large hotels),very large and clean rooms, low rise buildings in a beautiful palm tree setting and a swimming pool that you can actually sit around without being bombarded by screaming teens and also being provided with plenty shade if the sun becomes too much for you? If the above is for you then Tuscany is your ideal location. The Tuscany is only a 5 minute walk from the strip, (1 1/2 blocks for all you Americans), on a well lit main road and gives you the chance to experience all the bright lights but with a good nights sleep at the end of a busy day. This is our 3rd visit to Las Vegas where before we stayed at Bally's and Monte Carlo and although both hotels were excellent the Tuscany definately had the edge for us. You are away from the biz...you meet people from all over the world and because the hotel ambiance is peaceful and friendly people take the time to talk. Service at reception was friendly and the bell porters could not have been more helpful...maid service was second to none with towels and bedding changed daily....the 24 hour security of this hotel was obvious and the guards (both women & men) were friendly and for anyone (young or elderly) who like a nice walk in the evening without going to the strip the Tuscany's 2 1/2 acres makes a lovely night stroll and gives plenty of photo opportunities.

HotelInfo.Name: Tuscany Suites & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 255 East Flamingo Road, Las Vegas, NV 89107
